I didst order, with eager anticipation divine.
But alas, when I opened the box at home,
Two rotten tomatoes, foul and loathsome, didst roam.

Foul as the stench of organic fertilizer, they didst reek,
And mushy, like a decomposed body, most shreek.
I didst return, to claim a new one, in dismay,
But the assistant manager, didst say, in his own way:

"Tis normal, good sir, for such tomatoes to be,
In appearance, scent, and texture, most disagreeable, ye see.
But fear not, for our GM, a wise and kindly soul,
Didst smooth things over, and made all whole."

Oh, thank thee, gentle bartender, for thy aid,
For else, I wouldst nevermore, in this place, be stayed."
"Horchata, a tasty brew. Faces, familiar and friendly. Veggie burrito, a satisfying meal. Breakfast burrito, a morning delight. Prices, fair. Guacamole, needs improvement."

Hark! I do frequent this place of fitness three nights a week,
At two o'clock, when all the world doth sleep.
And lo! It be not crowded, nay, not at all,
For there be but three to five souls that doth keep.
The basketball court, all to myself I do claim,
And with great ease, I doth move through each station's name.

"Tourist trap, maybe. Prices weren't bad, though. Bought a sweet sombrero for five bucks. Other stuff looked decently priced too. Place had all sorts of Mexican goodies for a fiesta or to decorate your joint - masks, plates, cups, garden stuff. Women working there weren't exactly friendly, but the store was tidy and I'm sure you'll find something you like. Lot of trinkets to choose from."

"Been going to PP for damn near two decades. Chiles and Salek, they've been my kids' doctors since day one. Seen a lot of new faces come and go. But now that PP's merged with some other big group, it ain't the same no more. Still love our doctors though, that's why we stick around. My kids are getting older, don't need to visit as often no more. This place just don't got the same warm and fuzzy feeling like it used to."
"Thirty minutes in, still waiting. Not busy, just slow. Patience wears thin. Cheap, yes, but not worth the wait during 'rush' hour."

"O, what a wondrous sight doth lie within,
A labyrinth of confusion, full of twists and spin.
The path, a winding road that doth entwine,
Leading to places unknown, yet seemingly divine.

Signs point this way and that, in arrows bold,
Yet contradictions abound, leaving one quite cold.
One may start anew, only to find oneself back,
In the same spot whence they came, with naught a fact.

A grand hotel, fair and well-kept, doth stand,
Though age doth creep, with subtle, cunning hand.
Once, a theme of Oz and Hollywood did reign,
Now, 'tis but mem'ry, lost, like autumn's rain.

Green, oh so green, doth be the hue,
A color vibrant, yet, in truth, quite new."

Manager didst contact us, fair and bright,
With offer of refund, or installation free,
A miscommunication, 'twas plain to see,
But now, all's well, and peace doth reign,
The truck box cover, we didst retain,
And though a problem rose, 'twas quickly slain,
The company, with apologies, didst make amends,
In timely fashion, all issues didst end.

"Dolce, three-and-a-half stars, maybe four after I try the grub. Good spot, cozy joint. Had the hummus and pita chips, solid snack. Wine bar, always a fan. Servers, not always warm, but no issues. Wish they'd expand the wine list, more options would be nice. Worth a visit, especially if you're already in NoDa."

"Hark! We chanced upon this place, near work 'twas,
For happy hour, my laziness did crave.
And lo! They had a decent spread,
With drinks discounted, and apps at half price, indeed.
A pick 2 special, open to close, for $6.99,
Did tempt me, and I did decide,
On Tortilla soup, and cheese enchiladas too,
The soup was tasty, and enchiladas, oh so true.
Our server, a gem, her name now lost,
After a few margaritas, my mind did cost.
But still, I praise her, for her service so fine,
In this, our happy hour, so divine."

"A friend didst recommend this place, saying 'twas the best pizza in all of Vegas. I didst find that claim most dubious, for Vegas, to mine own knowledge, doth not possess a reputation for fine pizza. And if California, land of the golden sun, cannot even get pizza right, how couldst Vegas hope to do better? 

I doth swear by the pizza of New York, naught else doth compare. Chicago, thou art but a pale imitation. 

They didst offer a special deal, with all pies being half off, so we didst order a large, topped with pepperoni, sausage, and black olives. Alas, the quality didst not meet mine expectations. The crust didst not crackle and snap as it should, and the sausage and pepperoni didst make the pie soggy and unpleasant. I do confess, I didst not care for the sausage, those tiny bits of meat didst add naught to the dish. But the crust, ah, the crust didst have its moments. A decent effort, but naught that couldst save the day. 

Is this truly the best that Vegas canst offer? Adequate doth not suffice for mine taste. I cannot grade on a relative scale."

"Methinks I've sat within this eating house,
Both at the grill of hibachi, and the dining space,
And ne'er have I encountered a foul experience,
For in the grill, the victuals have been most excellent,
And chefs, they do put on a show of merriment.

But alas, the dining room, a different tale doth tell,
For when I've gone for sushi, long have I waited,
Thirty minutes or more, a delay most vexing,
And though the staff doth acknowledge the delay,
'Tis little comfort, for I do hunger still.

One sushi chef, or waiter, doth not suffice,
To serve the multitude that doth come to dine,
And so, I must, with sorrow, give this place,
A rating of three stars, and naught but that."

"Commuter needed oil change, so I took her in. Price was right, service was quick. Location's convenient too - just a stroll to Costco for some shopping or snacks while you wait. Pro tip: check their Yelp page for coupons before you go. Saved me a few bucks, might do the same for you."

"Las Vegas' newest hotspot, packed like a can of sardines. House floor, vibrant sound, but no room to move. Shoulder-to-shoulder, couldn't dance, couldn't breathe. Moved to the Hip Hop area, equally cramped, but found a tiny corner to squeeze in. Got lucky, a girl invited us to dance in her reserved table area. Warren G performed, West Coast girls, knew every song, great time. Left right after, too crowded, not worth it. Don't buy bottled water, small bottle costs $9, total ripoff."

"Liked it first time 'round, gave it five stars. Good grub, ate it two days straight. This time? Quality lackin'. Ordered four Earl's clubs, no lettuce - zip, zero, zilch. Too much bacon, sandwiches way too salty. Officially sick of this joint. Won't be cravin' it next time."

"Decent spot, but prices are steep for what you get. Only had their Togo grub, which is solid. Can't say much for the ambiance, though. They let folks smoke hookah outside, and even picking up my order, I gotta endure the stench. Not bad, but could use some fine-tuning."

"Tacos, oh tacos, how thou didst fail me! Thy flavor, lacking, and thy grease, aplenty. Disappointment doth reign within my breast. And lo, the floors, they were not clean, nor were the folk who prepared the victuals, versed in speech of English."

"In fair El Cortez Hotel and Casino doth lie Kitty's Cafe, where friendliness doth abound, as in other parts of this ancient Vegas inn. 'Tis an old-style diner, with cozy booths and counter, where ladies, sweet as honey, do serve with warmth and familiarity. Their menu, plain yet generous, doth offer what thou wouldst expect from such a downtown hostelry. I didst taste the grilled sourdough melt, with turkey and ham, a hearty portion, yet not so fine. Alas, on that day, a new cook didst slow the pace of food, yet late at night, it may suffice for a quick bite. But, good sir, for the same coin, better places dost exist, save for those fond of nostalgic, old-fashioned deals, now long gone."

"O, woe is me, fair friends! This Starbucks doth belong  
To NY NY hotel, and thus, doth not embrace  
The wondrous app that doth bring ease to our days.  
Alas, no fair reward for those who doth not carry  
Cash on their persons. Fie upon this wretched place!  
Yet, blessed be the coins that doth fill my purse,  
For they didst save me from the grasping jaws  
Of those accursed slot machines that doth reside  
Within these walls. O, how they doth entice and lure,  
But I, with fortune's favor, didst escape their snare.  
And thus, I shall return, for this Starbucks doth lie  
In our hotel's bosom, and I shall urge them, pray,  
To join the ranks of those who doth embrace  
The app, that we, the faithful, may receive our due."

"At another DDD joint, Melissa, our server, greeted us with a cheerful good morning. We waited the usual 10 minutes - a sign of a good spot. Coffee, rich and full-bodied. Diet Coke, perfectly carbonated. Eggs arrived swiftly, leaving me just enough time to jot down a few lines. Glasses remained full. A decent breakfast spot."

"Walked over from FireSky, easy peasy. Started with green pork chili, not too shabby. Lamb fondue, nice. Squash sauce, tasty. Short ribs, big. Needed more flavor, though. Could've used some salt and pepper, maybe a bit more oomph in the seasoning department. Not bad, but not amazing either. Three stars, I reckon."

Tapas, great. Paella, too salty. First time trying it, thought it'd be good. Tapas, tasty, especially mushroom risotto. Oxtail, tender. Potatoes, yummy. Garlic chicken, good, but accidentally ate a clove of garlic. Vampires, beware. Paella, too salty. Service, meh. Cafe, better.

"Limited options didst present themselves for dinner ere the show at Luxor, as decreed by yon ticket agent of twenty summers. 'Twas T&T he didst suggest, with much enthusiasm, alack! But lo, how couldst he know our palates wouldst not align? Mojitos, a set we didst order, and our waiter, with much cheer, didst say they were of excellent quality. Now, I, in truth, do enjoy a good mojito, and thus, I have had mine share of them. But these, alas! Were overly sweet, nay, too sweet by far! Twice didst I request club soda to temper their sweetness, but alas! 'Twas to no avail. The drinks, we didst not finish, nor didst we wish to. And, verily, the chips and salsa, they were not of high quality, a strange occurrence indeed, forsooth! For tis an easy feat, to prepare good chips and salsa, methinks. My friend, a shrimp dish didst have, and I, tacos, and both, I fear, were but of average worth. Our server, friendly was, and at the end, didst offer us free tickets to the show. But alas! We had already purchased our tickets, though his kindness, we didst appreciate. In conclusion, to this restaurant, I wouldst not return, for had I known the Asian restaurant had a good menu, thither wouldst I have gone."

"A feast most wondrous, fit for royalty,
In Sin City's depths, a culinary delight.
With sisters three, on holiday we did stray,
And sought to dine on budget, day by day.

A friend's advice led us to this hidden gem,
Tucked in a food court, unassuming, serene.
The location, humble, yet the fare divine,
A bargain found, a treasure, all did shine.

Alas, the service, lacking in finesse,
Our waiter, boisterous, with a macho bent,
More keen on flirting with the fairer sex,
Than attending to our needs, alack, alas!

Yet, patience, dear friends, for all was not lost,
The food, a triumph, made our spirits soar.
A Caesar salad, shared, a delightful course,
Filet mignon meatballs, spaghetti, a savory force.
Quattro Stagioni pizza, wood-fired, a treat,
A taste of Italy, on our plates, a feast.

So, to this eatery, give a try, my friends,
For though the service may leave much to amend,
The food, a true delight, will make amends,
And leave you sated, with a heart that mends."

"Methought I spied The Dog domain during mine extended weekend sojourn in fair Edinburgh. Marvelous and groovy design, and most excellent culinary conceits (The Dog, UnderDog, SeaDog, and Amore Dog). Alas, I didst wish for additional time to sample each and every one of them! \n\nMine own flank steak salad was passable (two and a half stars), a touch tough, yet the sweet balsamic reduction didst pair nicely with the peppery arugula. My dearest companion's mushroom risotto (four stars) was sumptuous and cooked to perfection. To conclude our repast, we didst partake of the tiramisu (three stars), alack, the dish lacked the potency of espresso, was chilled as I do enjoy desserts, and the dark chocolate cocoa powder (when consumed in a mouthful) overwhelmed the delicate confection. We didst end up scraping off the uppermost layer of the dish."
"Food was good, prices were fair. Waiter could've been more polite, but still a solid spot."

"Alehouse, with brews of plenty,
Yet, for consistency, thou mayst not find it.
Taps that rotate, a wondrous sight,
But for some, a cause of great frustration.
Fare, of quality, didst surprise,
Beyond expectation, a pleasant delight.
Games, of old, didst entertain,
As we quaffed and answered with great zest.
Atmosphere, alack, doth lack,
Service, slow, a sorry plight.
Crowded, the tavern was,
One server, alas, to tend the throng.
Long waits, we suffered,
Apologies, he did offer, with a smile.
Hungry, no more, shall I return,
For the ale, and fare, of better ilk.
A dive, the bar may be,
Yet, friendly staff, doth make it worth a peep."

"Verily, I say, this place hath been my haven for many a year,
Where Dr. Finch, a man of skill and art, doth hold sway.
He hath performed one surgery on my loyal hound, Dozer,
A minor procedure, yet one that required great care.

And lo, his manner with the beast was most gentle and kind,
He did allay my fears and doubts, and was ever so inclined
To explain each step and process, with patience and grace.
I was impressed, and thus, my faith in him was placed.

Now, I find myself in need of his services once more,
For Dozer's knee doth ail, and requires a surgeon's hand.
And though I had planned to seek another's aid,
I find myself returning to Dr. Finch, unafraid.

For in his care, I know my furry friend will be well,
And though I may not love this place with fiery zeal,
I do confess, 'tis a haven of sorts, for me and mine.
So, here I shall remain, until Dozer's health doth shine."

"I've only had the breakfast here, specifically the corned beef and farmer's omelets. The grub's decent, nothing special. I appreciate the blueberry muffin option instead of toast. The server was friendly, no issues with bringing ranch dressing for my hash browns (a strange but tasty combo). It's also the only joint open past 10 pm that's not in a casino and won't break the bank. A good spot for a low-key meal with a friend. My only gripe is they don't serve dark chicken meat (white's too dry for my taste)."

"Hark, fair friends, I give thee three stars, forsooth,
For though the victuals were of goodly sort,
The prices, verily, didst make me blench.
Enchiladas, at eighteen shillings? Fie upon't!
A roach coach, for five shillings, might compare,
And chips and guacamole, at nine shillings? Pray,
What sorcery doth make them worth such cost?
I fear this place doth suffer from a pride,
That cloth napkins and fine menus do hide.
In truth, 'tis naught but common Mexican fare,
With competition fierce, and prices low.
Alas, I shall not return, forsooth,
For purse doth dictate, and my heart doth know."

"Mert's, a place that'd fit right in on Triple D. Decor's got that down-home Southern vibe, makes you feel like you're in the right place. But don't come here for lunch, unless you're lookin' to get knocked out like a newborn after a feedin'. Service is good, food's alright, but overall, it's just an okay spot for a meal."

"Harrah's, a place of merriment and delight,
Hath a business module most clever and bright.
A pathway doth lead to Carnaval Court,
Where tourists doth flock, their spirits high and court.

Kiosks abound, with trinkets and baubles galore,
Easy to find, and easy to implore.
My friends and I, in merry mood, didst stray,
And bought shirts that lit up, come what may.

In unity we didst don them, with pride and cheer,
And entered the dance floor, without fear or spear.
The floor, spacious and grand, didst allow us to move,
Without the heat, that doth often prove a groove.

Flare bartenders, skilled and full of grace,
Didst mix drinks, with flair and pace.
A place to gamble, too, they didst provide,
For those who sought to test their luck and tide.

Harrah's, a place of wonder and joy,
Doth offer all, that doth make Vegas employ."

"Relaxed over dinner this week, nice spot. Amazing view, friendly staff. Had the rib eye, cooked just right. Blue cheese potatoes, good but blue cheese overpowered 'em. Cake for dessert, ice cream melted, cake dry. Pricey, expected better details. Worth it for the view."

"A friend did recommend this place,
With dim sum, twice a year they doth grace,
Their food, quite tasty, yet not all was hot,
Some dishes, cold, my taste buds did not,

A chili oil, they did not have in store,
But nonetheless, their items, fresh and more,
Oysters, crab legs, lobster, nigiri too,
I asked the sushi man, if without rice, I could do,
He said no, but for me, he made an exception,
Thick pieces, a shame, my request, his perfection,

Octopus, I wanted, but felt shy,
So walked the line, a salad, did catch my eye,
Fresh fruit, aplenty, a delightful sight,
Desert bar, decent, but not quite right,
Dim sum, my love, next to sushi, a treat,
Perhaps this weekend, I shall return, to eat."

"Comedy's a crapshoot. Sometimes you hit the jackpot, other times you crap out. This show started strong. Our MC was a real charmer, funny as hell and knew how to work the room. He was raw, but not too rough. Then came the first two comedians. They were crass, swore like sailors and didn't give a damn if they offended anyone. One guy even kept going after a woman stood up and told him to move on. What a jerk. But our MC saved the day, patching over those two disasters like a pro. And let me tell you, Jay Reid, the headliner, made the whole night worth it. He worked that stage like a pro, using everything from the stool to the mic stand as props. His jokes were spot-on, tackling tough topics with style. And he hung around after to meet the folks. Now that's class."

"Came here for my 18th birthday with some pals. Happy hour's from 2-6 PM, Monday through Friday. Shame we got there at 7. Had the grilled chicken sandwich - chicken was a bit pink, but I was hungry and didn't wanna send it back. Shared a frozen hot chocolate too. Coulda been better, but I was chewin' on ice the whole time. Service was slow and it ain't cheap, but not by much. Gonna give it another shot soon."

"The Flamingo ain't your granddad's joint no more. Hell, it ain't even your fat, chain-smokin' Uncle Larry's spot from a decade back. I'm tellin' ya, it's changed. Gone are the depressin' 80s decor and the fanny pack-wearin' gamblers. Now it's clean, fresh, and welcoming. Might even take a side chick there, or maybe a girl you're serious about. And who knows, maybe you'll be the one to witness Donnie and Marie finally makin' their move after 35 years of flirtin'."

"Treasure Island, twice I've dined here. Pho, just okay, but it'll do. Smells better than it tastes, probably. Veggie spring rolls, decent, but the peanut sauce, just okay, a bit too coconut-y. Pho Tai, my choice, my friend went veggie. My soup, not super tasty, but plenty of beef, not much noodle. Friend enjoyed hers, bak choy, mushrooms, corn. Pricey, pho, LA, $7, better taste."

"Target's not my favorite. It's too big, too crowded. Feels like half the ASU student body's inside, clogging up the aisles. But, it's got its perks. Plenty of parking, friendly staff, and a hell of a lot of stuff to buy. Just wish it wasn't such a zoo."

"O, how the workers doth neglect their duties,
Their backs turned to the patrons, lost in chat.
Their minds not on the service they should render,
But on their own concerns, and that's a fact."

"Vegas, New Year's Eve. Decided to give this joint another shot, since I'd been there before. Salad bar, meh. Meat, too salty and bloody rare. Service? Forget about it. Waitress showed up three times: when we sat down, when she brought the drinks, and when she handed us the bill. Had to flag down the servers just to get the meat. They seemed to be avoiding us. Not worth the dough."

"Upon our quest for sustenance, we chanced upon this cozy nook,
After the Bacchanal's queue did our plans beset.
With hunger pangs, we entered, and beheld the sight,
A modern eatery, with music loud and bright.

The portions generous, yet the fare did not impress,
Save for the tator tots, which crispy, crunchy were,
My pastrami sandwich lacked zest, the flavors did not blend,
A pity, for the meal did not reach its full potential, my friend."

"Verily, this place doth please mine eyes,
A haven of knowledge, full of surprise.
The four ecosystems, neatly divided,
Didst spark my curiosity, and I didst decide,
To explore them all, with haste and speed.

Alas, the polar room, didst lack, I found,
In comparison to others, 'twas profound.
The entry fee, a bit steep, I must confess,
For what they offer, doth not impress.

But fear not, dear friends, for all is not lost,
The gift shop doth make up, for what it cost.
Bags made from juice boxes, a curious sight,
Insect snacks, a delicacy, no doubt,
And small crystals, shining bright and fair,
A treasure trove, beyond compare.

So heed my words, and save thy coins,
For the elevator ride, doth not entice.
To Mount Royal's peak, thou shalt ascend,
And there, the same view, thou shalt attend."

"Hark, fair maiden! Do not judge this place by its outward show,
For within its walls, great treasures lie in store,
A veritable trove of goods, both new and old,
Clothes, paintings, and home decor, to make thy heart enfold.

They change their wares with seasons, so 'tis said,
And now, they prepare to expand their rugs and portraits' stead,
A boon for those who seek to renovate their nest,
And make it a haven of comfort and joy, at the least.

I visited this place, and found it full of delight,
A place where bargains await, with patience and insight,
So, gentle reader, take heed of my words,
And come hither, to seek out thy own sweet deals, in good cheer."

"Hark, what news is this? The Chicken Strip Cheese sandwich, once a staple of this fair establishment, hath been replaced with something most vile and foul. Alas, poor Hooters, how art thou fallen from grace! Yet still, the wings and steak fries remain, a glimmer of hope in this darkest of hours."

"This joint's for those on a tight budget, lookin' for a basic room. Did the trick for us, but ain't no luxury spot. Saw some eats nearby - pizza, Subway, Fatburger - and a movie theater, bars, and slots. Didn't do much else but catch some Z's. Fatburger? Terrible. Took forever too."

"Saw it on the Food Network, thought it might compare to the Boiling Crab. Seafood was decent, but not as spicy or flavorful as I'd hoped. Get there early, it fills up quick. Went at 11 am on a weekend, place was packed by the time we finished eating."
"Good, honest 3-star red curry tofu. Not flashy, not overhyped. Just a solid, satisfying meal."

"We swung by Cold Stone around 8:30 PM. The line was out the door, but we were determined to get our ice cream fix. I insisted we wait in line, and it took about 15 minutes to get our order. The place was packed, but the staff were hustling to keep the line moving. I ordered the smallest size, but the employee accidentally gave me the next size up for free. Not complaining. The seating area was limited and dirty, but I couldn't blame them - they were busy making orders. We opted for takeout. I'm a fan of Cold Stone's ice cream, and I'm used to the long lines. It's worth the wait for that sweet, sweet "All Lovin' No Oven" flavor."

"Whiskey River's spirit doth live on,
In this place, where fun doth never cease.
No shit-kickers here, on beachside throng,
But folk who dance, and laughter do prolong.

A floor that doth invite, to dance and play,
With Jaeger bombers, at a mere 99p a sway.
Tacos, too, for those who hunger doth assail,
At same price, a feast fit for a king's regale.

Wet T-shirt contest, with three maidens fair,
Didst stir the crowd, in mirth and cheerful air.
Though few in number, their spirits didst soar,
And made us laugh, with joy we didst explore.

I wouldst return, to this place of delight,
Where revelry doth reign, through morning's light."

"Atop Mount Washington, Grandview Saloon doth boast  
One of the fairest views of Pittsburgh, no doubt.  
Both from within and without, the sight doth please,  
Though fare and decor leave somewhat to be desired, methinks.  
A pity, for with better taste in design and cuisine,  
This place might be the city's finest, truly divine.  
But still, for visitors new, 'tis worth a stop,  
To sip a drink and gaze upon the city's crown."
"Good grub, nice folks. Had the Caesar, duck 'n' scallops. Salad, top-notch. Duck, rich, real good. Scallops, meh. Not bad, but wouldn't order again. Solid meal, not a repeater."

"Been comin' here weekly, despite the cruddy weather. Place ain't always easy to spot, but damn, them flowers are a steal. Beautiful arrangements, too. Don't last long, though - couple days, tops. Produce is hit or miss. Got some great tomatoes 'n' peaches in season, but half the stuff's not local. Had a helluva time findin' a local apple. Sku stickers from Cali 'n' Washington, y'know? But hey, some local farmers mixed in, makin' it worth my while. I'll keep comin' back."

"Methinks I do adore The Coffee Bean,
But this one doth leave me quite dismayed.
Alack, what evil spell doth brew within,
And maketh all the coffee taste so vile?

I pray 'tis not the water, nor a plot
To drive my wits to madness, for I fear
The coffee here doth chafe my temper sore.
Yet still, I drink it, for I must confess

'Tis better than the room service brew,
Which doth pale in comparison, I do avow.
And so, I give this place a rating fair,
Three stars, for service and for fare."

A store most fair and full of goods,
Where savings great on groceries doth abound.
Well-laid out, the space doth seem,
But messy, alack, doth become,
By reason of the throngs of shoppers found.

One woe, my friends, doth trouble me,
A lengthy queue doth form, so vast,
To wait, alas, some quarter hour,
Or more, ere thou doth reach the cashier at last.
Yet still, methinks 'tis worth the wait,
For savings great, thy purse doth make.

"A place of purity, where service doth abound,
With pond of Koi, most wondrous to behold.
Yet, alas! The sandwich I didst order,
Was naught but woe, akin to packaged fodder.
Turkey, thou art a deceitful dish,
Best left untouched, lest thou desirest a wish.
The prices, fair, yet for a better feast,
Thou mayst find elsewhere, with ease, at least."

"Alas, how my heart did yearn for joy and delight,
But alas, 'twas naught but mediocrity in sight.
The grill master, gruff and rough of speech,
Didst take my order with a grumble and a scowl,
No charm nor wit did he possess, I do confess.
And lo, the onions that I did request,
Were nowhere to be found, oh what a mess!
The cheese steak itself, a tale of woe,
The meat was lean, the flavor did not flow.
The cheese whiz, a saving grace, I must admit,
But oh, the bread, it was quite fit.
If only they had added those onions, sweet,
My taste buds might have danced with glee.
But alas, my stomach did protest,
Within hours, I did feel quite unwell,
Yet still, I ponder, shall I give them another chance?
Or shall I seek out other culinary joys in this fair land?"

"Twas a Tuesday eve, and Cabo did bustle with life,
A hub of activity, full of mirth and strife.
We two, a party small, didst swiftly gain a seat,
And savored dishes fresh, though not quite meet.

The taste, it didst please, yet failed to reach
The lofty standards set by Charlotte's speech.
But, contrary to some, our waitress didst show
No haste, nor urgency, as we chatted slow.

Parking, alas, a challenge it doth pose,
In NoDa's crowded streets, a winding course.
Yet, overall, Cabo doth provide a merry space
For drinks and bites, though not a place to race."

"Hark! Upon our return from fair Mexico and Cuba's shores,  
We chanced upon this airport, easy to explore.  
Signs guided us through immigration, quick and neat,  
Our research papers ready, just in case, to greet.  

The line was long, but moved with haste, no time to waste,  
The officer, stern-faced, scanned our passports, no need to boast.  
Through customs, we swiftly went, forms handed with grace,  
Rechecked our bags, and onward, to our next place.  

But alas, security, a lengthy wait didst impose,  
Lines long, yet personnel, their duties didst dispose.  
Friendly and kind, they worked with diligence, no slack,  
Moving all along, to San Francisco, our next track.  

A pity, time was short, no BBQ to savor,  
Thanks to security, our hunger didst not devour.  
Yet, memories linger, of our trip so fine,  
Five stars, all places, a true divine.  

And Beyonce, Jay Z, they too, didst follow suit,  
In Cuba, footsteps, their love, didst ignite."

"Hotel's seen better days. Exterior's worn down, in need of a refresh. Rooms ain't so bad, but tile grout's a bit dingy. Didn't hear neighbors, but food's good, especially for a hotel. Decent bar, local brews on tap. Service is friendly. Location's convenient, but it's a hike to downtown attractions. Took advantage of free shuttle, driver Christian's friendly and knowledgeable. Easy access off I-277. For the price, it's not bad."

"Cozy joint, dimly lit. Bar and dinin' area separate. Service sharp, attentive. Beer selection diverse, sample before committin'. Food just alright. Turkey sandwich, salad. Turkey dry, flavor lackin'. Salad forgettable. Not bad for a bar, could be worse."

"Been meaning to hit this spot for a bit, heard good things and checked out the menu. Prices ain't listed online, and now I know why - they're damn steep. Ended up on the patio since the main area wasn't open yet (6:30 PM? Really?). Waitress was friendly and attentive, replaced my water when she saw something floatin' in it, and my husband's glass was dirty too. Brought us out some sample-sized frozen peach and strawberry margaritas, which were pretty good, better than the rocks margarita. No free chips and salsa, which would be fine if they offered somethin' else like Barrio. No happy hour either, which was a bummer. Street corn was decent, but I've had better. Butternut squash tacos were amazing, my husband liked 'em more than his mahi tacos. Can't believe they got the balls to charge $12 for three tiny tacos, and $12 for guac made from two avocados. Don't know how they're still in business with prices like that."

"Good things:

* Kids get a Magna Doodle to draw on.
* Friendly waitstaff.
* Clean restaurant, fresh outta the box.
* Pasta selection? Create your own, buddy! Whole wheat and 5 other types of pasta, 5 sauces, incl. rose. Add toppings, why not?
* Karaoke Fridays and Saturdays.
* Decent grub.
* Prices ain't bad, 'cept if you go wild with extras.
* Unique dessert menu, that's for sure.

Bad things:

* Kids' menu's on the down low, and it's tiny.
* They give kids' drinks in adult-sized cups, what's up with that?
* Took 'em 10 minutes to clean up a spilled glass of milk. Yikes.
* Menu's limited: pasta, pizza, paninis, that's about it.
* Pasta toppings cost $1.50 each, ouch.
* My cannelloni dessert? Underwhelming, to say the least."

"A churlish porter barred our way,
His scorn and sneer did us dismay.
But for our friend, whose day it was,
We had not entered, save his grace."
"Korean grub, this place has it. Don't believe the fool who said it's Japanese. Koreans and Japs may share some culinary similarities, but they ain't the same."

"Red 8's decent Chinese grub. Oxtail soup and Mongolian beef, rice, too. Nice ambiance, good service. Dessert menu's lacking. Pricey, but that's the Wynn for you. Not my top pick for Chinese, but worth a visit if invited."

"Prime rib for $9.99 at Sunset Station? Not bad. But where's the value, Vegas? Used to be able to get a solid meal for under ten bucks. Nowadays, it's like they're trying to rob us blind. 

Went there on a Saturday, packed house, waited 15 minutes for a table. Service was good, food was decent. Prime rib was a bit overcooked, should've gone for medium rare. 

T-bone steak special for $12.99? No thanks. Grand Cafe is better than Denny's, but for a 24-hour spot, it's not bad."

"Methinks I didst wish to enjoy this place, yet found it most vexing. Perchance 'twas o'er-praised? Fare was but middling, naught to set it apart from other spreads. \n\nBy the words of others, mayhap shall I give 'tis place a second chance when next in Vegas, but wouldst sooner return to Rio's seafood feast ere dining here anew."

"Food's good. Best part. Had endless shrimp - shrimp alfredo times two, breaded shrimp, shrimp scampi. Worst part? Wait to sit and be served. Thirty minutes to sit, fifteen to be served. Need better service for a higher rating from me. Food's good, hot. Once served, service was decent. Cheddar biscuits, excellent."
"Sashimi's pricey, but damn good. Fresh fish, well-served. Been there thrice, never disappointed."

"Alas, my stay at this hotel was not pleasant,
The room was nice, but the journey to get there, oh so tedious!
Through the casino, with luggage in hand,
A bridge o'er the pool, a most tiresome stand.

The bathroom, alack, was quite motley,
Old and worn, not fit for a Hilton, I reckon.
The casino, fresh and new, did please,
But check-in, alas, was a most dire tease.

The pool, a haven, staff, kind and sweet,
Housekeeping, tidy, a job well-done, neat.
But, alack, my stay, was not worth the fray,
For check-in, a nightmare, drove me away."
"Parking lot full, store empty. Friendly staff. Scored cute juice glasses for sixty-nine cents. That's it."

"Aye, fair readers, listen well, for I have tale to tell,  
Of coffee sought, and cakes so swell,  
At Aria, where I did abide, on business bent,  
With fianc\u00e9, dear, my heart's consent.  

We chanced upon this patisserie, so bright,  
With cakes, a feast for eyes, a wondrous sight,  
And thus, next morn, my heart did crave,  
Some coffee, strong, to lift my brave.  

Downstairs I went, with haste, to claim,  
Two Americanos, my heart's fond aim,  
But lo, the barista, with machine so fine,  
Punched buttons, swift, and coffee poured, divine.  

Alas, the taste, not great, I must confess,  
Yet, baked goods, if sought, I would address,  
For though the coffee failed my hope,  
The cakes, a marvel, did my spirit cope."
"Beer's decent, but pricey. Wait for Costco restock. ($30 at brewery, $20 at Costco). Might come back if they open a real joint. Staff's friendly, but that's about it."
"This joint's worth checkin' out. Good eatin', most times. But avoid holidays, service and grub go downhill."

"Tiny plates, delicious but small. Thirty bucks plus for a snack. Fifty to sixty for a real meal, still not enough to fill you up. Nice joint though, red and black decor. Sat at the bar, watched 'em cook. Good grub, bad value. If this is casual dining, they gotta drop the prices, twenty-five to thirty percent."

"Bagel joint. Not the best. Went with the missus. Waited for our grub. Dusty vent. Dirty floors. Slow service. Guy was nice, but slow. Twenty minutes for two bagels and a muffin. Bagels were good. Variety was nice. Muffin was meh. Prices were fair. That's it."

"Alas, how vexing doth my spirit find
This eatery, which doth bear the name
Of Pho, yet hath none in store.
A pox upon their house, for shame!
Their menu, too, didst lack the charm
To make our meal a pleasant one.
Yet still, the staff didst play their part
With kindness and with gentle tone.
Thus, three stars doth this place receive,
For service good, but food most grieve."

The stench of the joint can be overwhelming, but the instructors here are top-notch. Shame about the front desk crew, though - they're as friendly as a wet cat. If they had their act together, I'd still be coming here. But it's a hike from my place, so I'll have to look elsewhere for a more welcoming vibe. 

Other than that, they've got a tidy changing area with two showers, fully stocked with body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. You can scrub off all that funky sweat after your workouts. 

Worth checking out: Summer and Stacy. They're both great in their own ways.

"Hark! A meal most fair with Rob didst share,
The victuals, verily, didst please mine eyes.
Eggs, bacon, pancakes, a feast most rare,
Yet, alack! Their pancakes, not my heart's desire.
But, lo! Their sausage gravy, a delight most true,
Didst make my morn most bright and gay."

"This place doth not meet our expectations, my dear.  My pizza, Classic Maggie, was fair, but naught exceptional.  My husband's burger, alas, was burnt beyond repair, and thus, inedible.  Our waitress, a sprite, did vanish, leaving us to ponder our fate. \n\nTis but a common tavern, with victuals of the usual sort, and a selection of ale, neither great nor small."

Hark, fair maiden, I have visited this place twice,
And found their ale to be most excellent, in sooth.
Their own brew, they only serve, no other choice,
But food, alas, doth leave much to be desired, naught special.

Their wings, I did not fancy, nor would I suggest,
But atmosphere, 'twas jolly and quite pleasant.
Food, o'er priced, yet understandable, given the location,
But "Uncle Bears" brew, do seek it, 'tis the only libation.

I shall return, but not with great haste,
For 'tis a place to visit with friends, in moderation, at best.
TVs abound, for sporting events, a merry sight,
And dogs, allowed on patio, a delightful sight.

Take heed, fair reader, if thou dost bring thy hound,
An 8 x 10 portrait, framed, they'll display, profound.
A memorial, 'twill be, for all to see,
In remembrance of thy faithful canine, a decree.

"A hearty meal we had at Turkish Kitchen,
For those who sought a bite without a fuss,
Bread and dip did they bring first,
And oh, the dip, it was quite divine,
I pray, what secrets lay within its mix?

Turkish ravioli, I didst choose,
Though not on menu, 'twas my wish,
Salad and rice, they didst provide,
But awkward, wasteful, in a way, 'twas,
Ravioli, overcooked, didst fall apart,
Flavors, fine, but not up to par,
Compared to others, a disappointment,
Kebabs, perhaps, I should have had,
But not in the mood, I didst decline,
Others, content, with their repasts,

Strange, the beer, in varied glasses came,
Small, and not of standard size, 'twas,
A decent choice, for those who seek,
A meal, cheap, and cheerful, 'tis,
But not the best, in Edinburgh's eyes."
"Friday happy hour spot. Chambord marg on point, achiote chopped chicken salad, divine. Trio appetizer, good when half-priced. Manager, hostess, server - all cocky. Two margaritas, forget 'em."
"Pizza? Hype? Don't get it. Just a regular pie, toppings nothing special. Pepperoni, sausage, the usual. Better pies elsewhere, but hey, if you're hungry after Marquee, it'll do."

"Pho was subpar, broth wasn't up to snuff. Boyfriend's cashew chicken was solid though. Friend's chicken fried rice was good too. Prices are decent for college kids. Would return for grub, but not pho. 

Giving three stars 'cause of two things. First, Thai iced tea was a letdown. Small bottle from the fridge, not worth three bucks. Woman behind counter said she was too lazy to make a proper one. Second, restaurant was sweltering hot and humid, even with doors open. Was sweating bullets while eating pho. Uncomfortable. Workers fixing ceiling tiles nearby, unacceptable. 

Food was good, atmosphere wasn't. Still coming back for a quick Thai fix 'cause it's convenient and accessible."

"Hark, my dear friend, I didst venture forth to Kings on Saturday eve,
For an early feast, ere my Xmas shopping didst begin.
'Tis a place I've visited oft, for my seafood desire,
Yet, alack, their service doth leave much to be desired.

A platter of seafood, chilled and fresh, didst we partake,
With crab legs, oysters, clams, and shrimp, a veritable lake.
A bargain, indeed, in this fair city of vice,
Yet, the entrees, alas, didst not quite meet my device.

Grilled shrimp and scallops, a skewer didst they provide,
A burger for the youngling, and a combo, fried and hide.
But lo, the latter dish, didst disappoint mine eyes,
Over-breaded and gummy, a sorry sight didst arise.

I shall, in future, stick to what doth please mine taste,
Sanddabs, or specials, that doth bring me joy and haste.
Forsooth, the shellfish platter, that doth be mine heart's desire,
And thus, my friends, doth end my tale of woe and fire."

"Hark! I dwell but northward of yon Burger Factory,
A place of much bustle, by my troth.
Their menu doth offer diversity, a feast for all,
For groups of varied taste, 'tis a capital call.

The portions, generous they be,
A hearty meal, fit for a king, thou shalt see.
And if thy stomach yearns for a greasy spoon,
The Burger Factory shall be thy boon."

"Ping Pong Thai, I've driven past it for years, thinking it was a Thai joint with some adult entertainment. Nope, just food. Not even a single ping pong ball. Place is a bit of a letdown, to be honest. The Panang's watery and bland, but the Pad Kee Maw's got some kick. That's the only reason I come here. Service is slow and forget about getting a refill. To-go orders are a different story, but you'll still feel like just another customer. Pack 'em in at lunchtime, they do. If they had a ping pong table, I'd give it a higher rating. Maybe the owner's a Thai ping pong champ. Now that'd be something worth seeing."

"Hark! 'Tis a curious thing indeed, my friends,
That we return to this place again and again,
Despite the vexations that we there do find.
The happy hour menu, a wondrous bargain, no doubt,
Yet three beers on tap, a paltry selection, I say.
And mark you well, the service doth leave much to be desired,
Oft over-eager at first, then vanishing like mist.
How strange, that bringing the bill should be such a chore,
As if they sought to make us flee without paying, perchance?
The victuals, too, are not always of the best,
One dish, the calamari, a humble delight,
Whilst the elk meatballs, dear friends, did disappoint,
Dry, flavorless, and not worth another try, I fear.
So, shall we continue to patronize this place,
Despite its flaws, or seek elsewhere to dine and revel?"
"Counter guy, helpful. Steered me right, enjoyed my meal. Tilapia, chicken adobo, both tasty."

"Linq's got a new joint, 'tween Harrah's and Bally's. Supposedly, they're servin' up top-shelf liquor in them slushies, but I ain't too sure. Felt like I needed more to get good and drunk. More flavors though, that's for sure. Went with Patron Grand Marnier 'cause it was sour. Staff's friendly, dressin' cute, but they need more signs on them cups. That saxophone cup, damn! It's the sexiest, baddest cup around. ;)"

"Hast thou imbibed strong drink or taken drugs ere thou didst attend this spectacle? Verily, I didst not, yet found it most strange and wondrous still. 

'Twas my second Cirque show, and first in fair Las Vegas, where acrobats didst perform their death-defying feats with grace and skill, as the production's grand design didst dazzle mine eyes. 

But, by the stars, this particular show didst stir within me a sense of unease, for the infant's gleeful laughter and disembodied head didst seem most eerie and bizarre. 

Cirque's beauty doth endure, yet methinks this mayhap was not their finest hour in Sin City's realm."
"Ordered delivery through YouBuyAndWeFly. Reasonable price, good eatin'. Had hot 'n' sour soup, sweet 'n' sour pork, orange chicken, chicken chow mein. All good."

"Hark! What fun doth lie within this place,
A live band playeth in the evening's grace.
So if thou art in search of merriment,
And wish to dance with wild abandonment,
Then join us here, where music doth reign supreme.

But alack! A cash bar doth pose a problem,
For those who wish to quaff a drink, yet lack the means.
Yet fear not, for tables doth fill up fast,
And one may still enjoy the show, though seated last.

Oh, how this place doth bring back memories of old,
When Vegas doth offer entertainment bold.
No cover charged, just come and spend thy woe,
On drinks and laughter, in a night of glee.
Nowadays, 'tis different, with clubs and VIPs,
Karaoke bars, and pianos in duel.
But here, we find a gem, a throwback to the past,
A place where music doth reign supreme at last.

So gather round, my friends, and claim a table,
With drinks aplenty, let thy feet be able.
For in this place, we doth find joy and delight,
A taste of Vegas, in its purest light."

"Spice Island, been goin' there since it first opened. Early 20s, that makes it a Pittsburgh institution. Menu's mostly the same, except they added booze. Why fix what ain't broke? My favorites are veggie - fried tofu, either sauce is great, and the veggie curry trio. Coconut rice, worth the extra cost. You'll be back for more."

"Hark! What store is this? A place of cheer,
Where spirits flow and liquid joys appear.
A decent spot, indeed, with selections fine,
Though lacking, alas, my favored cognac divine.

But fear not, for service here is kind,
And though they eyed me, youthful in their mind,
I took it as a compliment, a sign of grace,
For age, it seems, has granted me a certain place.

Now, pricing, thou art somewhat steep,
A tad bit higher than my purse doth keep.
Yet still, a visit here, I shall not shun,
For joys within these walls, are worth the won."
"Scones, divine. Coffee, fine. Dogs, no. Allergic, me. Sign, needed. Service dogs, okay. Scones, delicious. Daily, made. Go, there."

"Entered the revamped joint, made my way to the great hall. Pictures and paintings, visually stunning, esoteric beauty. Contemporary spot, quiet, smaller than expected, but packs a punch. Worth the 80K spent on reno. Medieval vibes, Scottish history, medicine, war, and recording significant events. Busy gift shop, full eatery. Learn something, spend a few bob. Art, science, medicine, Royal Navy, death masks, migrated families, art history. Visited a few months back, keen to return. Above all, go for the culture, cafe buzz, either way, rewarding."

"Been comin' here 'fore I moved to Vegas. Multi-level joint, packed all the time. Located way down at The Forum Shops, connected to Caesar's Palace. Only downsides are the wait and the trek from the casino. But the grub and service? Top-notch. Nearby aquarium and animatronic show keep things interesting. If you're strollin' Sin City and hankerin' for a familiar meal, give it a shot."

"Cafe Zupas, nice to meet you. Hope you're here to stay. That BBQ chicken salad of yours, damn good. Loved the fun drink bar too, made my own Italian soda. Hubby enjoyed his summer chicken salad and turkey bacon panini. And that free chocolate-covered strawberry? Cherry on top. Left feeling satisfied, not too full, just right. Appreciate new joints that are quick, healthy, and affordable."

Siam Terrace, a Thai restaurant in Urbana, is one of my favorites. Their red curry, my go-to dish, is a standout. Don't let that sway you, though - the rad nar, pad thai, and other options are also top-notch. It's not a five-star joint, but it's close. The atmosphere can feel a bit cramped with larger groups, but it's still a great spot. The appetizers are solid, with the shrimp being a highlight. It's affordable, too - prices start at around $8.99 for vegetarian, chicken, or tofu options, and a bit higher for meat entrees.

"In fair Fort Worth, Texas, I didst stumble upon a culinary delight, a Brazilian churrascaria, a cowboy barbecue of sorts. 'Twas love at first bite, I assure thee! All-you-can-eat, a feast fit for a king, with servers bearing sword-like skewers of meat, cooked to perfection. A simple twist, a red disk to signal "no more" or a green to request a meat-filled cornucopia. The salad bar, a treasure trove of delights, with prosciutto and cheeses galore. And let us not forget the full-service bar, a haven for thirsty patrons. Verily, a dining experience most wondrous!"
"Tangier, a place of wonder. Brewed tea, sweet dates, fresh bread - a feast for the senses. Gracious host, generous with his wares. Decorations, a delight to behold. A journey worth taking."

Tried a few tacos at this joint, three for ten bucks. They were all different, but the Suadero Azteca, that's the queen's special, stood out. Damn thing was flavorful and tender, topped with some real good veggies. Get your own, don't share. Fried fish and shrimp were solid too. Great spot for some unique tacos, but it can add up. You gotta ask for chips and salsa, they won't bring 'em out otherwise, but they're good when you get 'em.

"A name so fair, doth promise food most rare,
In this small place, with flavors so divine,
You may take out, or sit and be served with care,
Or if thou art near, they'll bring it to thine door,
'Tis a family-run shop, with dishes of old,
Teriyaki and orange chicken, a feast for the bold,
Worth a visit, I say, for the food is most fine,
So stop thou must, and taste their culinary design."
"Solid joint for breakfast, better than those chain places. Omelets are good, biscuits and gravy if you're feelin' reckless. They got sandwiches, salads, and smoothies too."

"Went to Il Pizzaiolo with some colleagues last week. Heard great things about the place for years, so it was time to check it out. Had a swell time. 

Started with some vino. Waitress gave us the lowdown on the house wines - #1, #2, and #3. We went with the Pinot Noir and it was pretty damn good. Shared a couple carafes with a buddy. 

Split some apps - Panzarotti and Fiori de Zucca. The fried zucchini was alright, but the Panzarotti was the real deal. Like a fried risotto and mozzarella ball. Damn good. I even grabbed the last one, risking embarrassment. 

For my main course, I got the Ravioli alla Caprese. Simple, but done right. Can't wait to get back to Il Pizzaiolo."

"Went to #1 Brothers for pizza, but they didn't answer the phone.  So, I went to Ari's, the Japanese restaurant in the same plaza.  Good thing too, 'cause the service was top-notch and the sushi was damn good.  I told the girl on the phone about how I'd ordered the spicy tuna handroll before and it was a bit disappointing.  She said she remembered me and knew exactly what I wanted.  And she did.  It was perfect.  I also told her about my favorite specialty roll at my old sushi spot and she suggested something similar.  It was almost as good.  This place is now my go-to sushi spot.  Thanks, Ari, for treating me like a valued customer and not just another face in the crowd."

"Place is good. Go there regular for pedis. Julie and Tammy do good work. Service is top-notch. Only had one issue with a rough pedicure, but Julie fixed it quick. Salon's always clean. Pay $20 plus $5 tip. Price went up to $22 for summer, still worth it."

Hark! What service most excellent didst thou render,
When I, a novice, sought thy hue of paint,
For my humble abode. Thy skilled hand didst guide,
And with swift ease, didst answer all my queries.
Thou didst mix the pigment, and with grace,
Didst present it to me, in a timely space.
My questions, thou didst answer, with a smile,
And I, most grateful, didst depart, in haste.
Thy price, most fair, didst bring me joy,
And thus, my heart doth sing, in praise of thee.

"This place, so near my humble abode, doth bring me joy and cheer. Their shelves, stocked with essentials, do cater to my culinary whims, when in the mood for Asian flair, I do declare. The staff, a friendly lot, doth aid me in my quest, should I require assistance in finding sundry items, they do profess. Fresh fare, alas, doth leave a bit to be desired, but overall, a hearty endorsement, I do pronounce."

"A convivial, relaxed ambiance doth this pizzeria boast,
With pies most delectable, that doth please the taste.
A veritable cornucopia of toppings doth abound,
Upon a foundation of olive oil, most profound.

The pizzas with tomato sauce, I do confess,
Doth lack a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain zest.
But all the others, oh how they doth impress,
With flavors diverse and combinations most blessed.

And salads, oh so fresh and large,
Doth fill the belly and doth leave no margin for discharge."

"Been comin' here for years, close to the house and all.  Got a good local crowd, lotta take out too.  Menu's limited, but what they got is hot, fresh, and flavorful.  Hubby loves their sushi. 

You get there, they greet ya, seat ya quick.  Check the specials on the chalkboard by the door.  Like the decor, facilities, plates, utensils, glasses, all clean. 

Staff's efficient, accommodatin'.  Menu's concise, but got enough for most.  Prices are decent, portions are good.  Be back."

"Verily, a cool place doth this establishment seem,
Where burgers fresh and tasty do they serve, I deem.
Not like that wretched 5 Guys', whose greasy fare
Doth leave a foul taste in mine mouth, I swear.
But alas, the price doth make me pause and ponder,
For In-N-Out, a better value doth plunder.
Their quality and cost, a perfect blend,
Leaves this place wanting, in truth to tell, my friend."
"Dairy Queen doesn't need a review. It's like your mom and pop's place, but for ice cream. Clean joint, quick service, and worth the seven bucks for a waffle cone and a scoop in a cup."

"Methinks 'twas a wondrous place indeed,
With atmosphere cool, and victuals of speed.
Not yon typical diner, by my troth,
But a haven where one might find some truth.

Reserve a table, ere thou doth arrive,
For 'twas quite busy when we did strive.
A place most meet for younglings, I do swear,
In downtown, where such is not always near.

Their grub did please, with ale of fine cheer,
And desserts that did our spirits clear.
Service, too, was of the highest rate,
A place wherein our friends from Cleveland might partake."
"Scottsdale, AZ, had a good one too. Bartenders were top-notch, TVs plentiful, beer selection impressive."

"Mondays, I hit up my local Salisbury's for the weekly shop. It's a big store, but half of it ain't food. That don't make sense to me. Supermarkets should be about grub, not TVs. But hey, it works for 'em, I guess. Just gets frustrating when choices are limited. Freezer section's tiny too. Poor student like me's gotta settle for whatever frozen chips they got. And don't even get me started on the lack of supermarket brands. Sometimes I wanna grab the cheaper option, but they ain't got much to choose from. 

But, I do love their "Oops!" section. It's like finding gold. Reduced meat, perfect for tossing in the freezer. 

Staff's friendly, always chattin' it up. Nice change of pace from the usual supermarket crew."

"Aye, the choice is vast indeed, my friend,
European brands of high estate, their prices doth ascend,
Malt balls in three flavors, a wondrous sight,
And house-brand hot chocolate mix, a treat most bright.

Oh, 'tis a joy to merely browse and see,
All these options, laid out for thee.
In this place, one can find delight,
In the variety, a true culinary sight."

"Pets all my life. Observed that when front desk nice, doctors not. Vice versa. Not case at Alta Vista. Hours great. Front desk, techs, doc - friendly, courteous. Price reasonable. Clean, no wet dog smell. Sunday afternoon, pleasant experience."

"Hark! What wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes?
Amazing, indeed, the view doth take me by surprise.
And though I cannot speak of victuals,
I'm certain they shall please, for all else doth satisfy.

At the bar, we did sit, and converse with glee,
With Harold, our man, who did serve up martinis,
Dirty and twisted, with finesse and grace.
And though one of us did lose balance,
And spill a drink, the service did not cease.

So, gentle folk, be kind to the doorman,
And he shall grant thee access to the elevator,
That thou may'st partake in the view and libations,
In this, the finest of establishments, no doubt."

"Methinks my spouse and I didst greatly enjoy this establishment. The servitors were most accommodating, offering us samples of six of their choicest dishes. Forsooth, we didst have sufficient victuals for two days' repast, all under the sum of twenty-five silverlings. 'Twas a merry sight to behold, men of diverse attire and adornments partaking of mirth and revelry. Alas, my sole lamentation is that the eatery might have been a mite more tidy."

"Methinks 'tis a merry place, indeed,
Where one may savor tasty victuals,
And quaff a frothy ale, or two,
In jolly company of spouse and friends.
The service, prompt and courteous, doth please,
And nachos, enchiladas, all doth delight,
A veritable feast for mine own eyes,
And belly, too, doth find great joy therein.
Thus, I do say, this tavern doth excel,
In atmosphere, in food, in all,
A place most meet for merriment and cheer,
For couples, friends, and all who seek good cheer."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
This Vietnamese dish did not impress.
The broth was dull, lacking in zest,
And pork blood, scarce and dry, did not pass the test.

But fear not, for all was not lost,
For the BF's rice dish was quite the boast.
And the coffee, oh how sweet,
With coconut flavor, a treat to greet.

So if thou find thyself in this place,
Do try the coffee, and save some space.
For though the Bun Bo Hue may not delight,
The brew, my friends, will make thy day take flight."

"Good eatery in the Golden Nugget. Service was top-notch, even with a party of 14. Food was solid, caprese salad was fresh and tasty. Scallops and Brussels with grits, fantastic. Lobster, amazing. Crab legs, outstanding. Pecan ball, meh. Bread pudding, decent. Minus one star for the lipstick stained cup. Waiters did well, overall a good spot."

"A fair location, indeed, for a Target store of renown,
Wherein I dwelt, in days of yore, and oft didst roam,
The pleasant Surprise Town Center, with its shops so fine,
And found, within, good service and wares of quality divine."

"Methought I loved the place, fair 7th st.,
Where I did pass, when five o'clock did strike.
But lo, 'twas closed, and thus my heart did sink,
And forth I went, to seek another link.

An XL bean and cheese burrito, I did crave,
America's way, with sauce and all, I did wave.
So good it was, that I didst exclaim,
"Why doth this spot but two stars bear?"

"Hark! Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria, a place most fair,
With walls adorned with whimsy, a surrealist's lair.
Pepperoni-Man doth save the day, with mushrooms and chili-peppers in tow,
A sight most curious, and worth a second look, I vow.

We sat, my love and I, at a table for two,
And ordered a pizza, with toppings of pepperoni, mushrooms, and chili-peppers, too.
The crust, so fine and crispy, did please my taste,
And the service, prompt and friendly, did make haste.

But, alas! The cold, it did seep in, near the door,
And those who peered in, did quickly retreat, as if in fear.
Yet still, I smiled and waved, to show the place's charm,
For a quick visit, or a leisurely meal, 'tis no alarm.

A cartwheel of pizza, for a large group, they do prepare,
A feast most satisfying, and worth sharing, beyond compare."

"A quaint eatery, with dishes diverse and fine,
Upon the patio, we sat, and savored each bite divine.
The sliders, oh so tasty, left us quite content,
And to this place, our footsteps shall be bent."

In sooth, I chanced upon this place,
To meet an old friend, and partake in ale,
Their selection, though not vast, is quite fine,
And saves me from the tedium of choice,
That oft doth plague mine eyes and mind.

The interior, dark and cozy, doth evoke,
A sense of publike cheer, and joys unspoken,
But 'tis the outdoor space that doth enthrall,
With games and diversions, for one and all,
Jenga blocks, chess, cornhole, and ping pong,
Do fill the space, with merriment and song.

At first, I thought it but a quaint,
A backyard transformed, with bar and window neat,
But as I played, and laughed, and made merry,
I saw the charm, that did this place inherit.
'Tis a great spot, to visit in the day,
And pass the time, in joyous play.

"A wondrous Saturday it was, my friends,
When we did dine at this fine establishment.
The victuals were most excellent, I must confess,
And the ale, by Jove, it was the best!
The servers, knowledgeable in their craft,
Did guide us through a tasting, and we laughed,
And talked of nothing but the brew,
In merriment and joy, our spirits high.
Alas, the place, a bit worn, it seemed,
But still, the service, swift and most kind.
The waitress told us of a beer dinner,
A feast, no doubt, most divine and fair.
I'll wager, friends, 'twould be a treat,
To partake in such a culinary affair."

"Renovated building on Central, real purty.  Things hoppin' Uptown. Had a swell time with 7, then 8, wait, 9 on First Friday. Staff was ace, owner Dana chatted us up, food was tasty, shared it all. Patio weather, perfecto. These are the days, this is why we stay put."

"Wait wasn't too bad, 'bout forty minutes, even though it was nine o'clock on a Tuesday. Prices were a bit steep, but hey, it's Vegas, right? Did a light dinner with five of us, couple tapas plates each. Gin and tonic, real smooth, nice presentation, nerdy cool ice cubes. Marinated mussels, came in a little tin, steamed mussels, good, order bread to soak up the juice. Meat platter, house cured meat was the best. Brussels sprout salad, delicious! Sauted shrimp, good, skirt steak with grilled bell pepper, tasty. Asparagus, good, but ten tiny spears for twelve bucks? Nice sauce, good with bread. Quail, small but yummy. Tomato bread, oh man, so good! Service was great, atmosphere was chill. Lovely evening."

"Went to Lenscrafters after striking out at Chandler Mall. Donna, a peach of a gal, helped me out. Tried on a bunch of frames, took a break to feed the baby, and Donna got to work on my insurance. Turns out, the optometrist screwed up my coverage. Donna made some calls, but they were closed. Told me to come back the next day. She had it fixed by then. Got my specs and was happy with the service. Donna and Heather, those two were the real deal."

"This joint's my fave for lunch meetings and dinners with the missus. Got a real local vibe, friendly staff, clean digs, and grub that hits the spot. That green tomatillo salsa? Can't get enough. Salmon and shrimp tacos, highly recommend 'em. Service ain't always the best, but that's part of the charm. Young servers, learnin' the ropes, addin' to the laid-back atmosphere."

"Good grub, friendly joint, modern vibe, gay as hell. That's Switch in a nutshell. Been meaning to try the place for months, but the missus ain't a fan of Sunday brunch. Finally made it last week, too late for the brunch menu and cheap Bloody Marys. But hey, we got a carafe anyway, decent drink for six bucks. Generic, sure, but worth every penny. Had myself a damn fine burger, loaded with guac, salsa, and jalapenos. Nice touch with the house-made ceasar salad too. Service was top-notch, friendly folks. I'll be back for more, especially for that sweet brunch action."
"MadHouse, good joint. But not a review, just a heads up. Can't access their site without getting a trojan warning from my browser. Looks like the site's infected. Hope the owners take note."

"Star Nursery, best in Vegas. All you need for landscaping, they got. Surprised folks, I'm a fan of plant nurseries. First job, 15 years old, plant nursery. Impactful experience, landscape architecture major, ran my own company. Miss it, walking through Star. Top-notch stock, plants, materials, soils, mulches, fertilizers, pesticides. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. Do yourself a favor, skip Walmart, Lowes, come to Star."
"Vegas, baby. Get yerself a fine 'adult slurpee' outside the Imperial Palace. Bring it on in, sing some karaoke, and enjoy. That's how you pre-game, my friend."

"Defalco's, a solid spot, but slow, and limited healthy options. But hey, you know what you're getting into when you walk into a fast food joint. Food's top-notch, like you're in Italy. Ordering system's old school, like back east, adds to the wait. Worth it though. I'm from NY, and good Italian delis are scarce in Phoenix. Friend introduced me, and now I crave it when I'm near. Tried the eggplant, chicken, and cheese steak, all good. Bring a friend, order different sandwiches, share."

"Hark, we had a coupon from Travel Zoo,
Which gave us appetizer, entree, and dessert too.
A combo dish, we didst order with haste,
And found the alligator to be tough, alas!
The frog's legs, they were tough as well,
But the crabcake, oh it was swell!
Gumbo, a dish of rich flavor and spice,
Didst please our taste buds, in a nice surprise.
Jambalaya, a dish of rice and meat,
Was quite good, though not quite a treat.
The atmosphere, it was grand and fine,
With a New Orleans feel, so divine.
Large portions, for a reasonable fee,
Didst make our bellies happy and free."
"Politician's paradise. White-haired men, dignified. Special occasions, celebrate here. Waitstaff, polite, charming, witty. French cuisine, exquisite. Escargot, a must."

Friday nights, we hit this joint with the crew. Solid grub, the lamb meatballs and Johnny's nachos are our go-to. Their ranch dressing? Not bad, even for a non-ranch fan like me. Guinness stew? It's a winner.

But, it's a bit pricey for what it is. Beers start at six bucks, and most menu items are ten plus. Sandwiches? Twelve smackers. Shave a few bucks off, and they'd be in five-star territory.

Service is top-notch, though. Friendly servers, quick with splits and jokes. They put up with our non-pc shenanigans. No complaints there.

"Rice, price, and spice bring me here. Salmon bowl with brown rice and heat, under $7. Line up, menu on the wall, Japanese fare, chicken teriyaki, options galore. I go for salmon, $5.99, not fried, decent lunch price. Teriyaki sauce too much, light on the sauce. Upgrade to brown rice, $0.25. Condiments, hot chili powder, sauce, sliced green onion. Appreciate the onions. Low scores, Japanese flavors lack punch compared to Chinese and Thai."

"This place, so thronged with people, doth boast a queue most wondrous long, alack! Yet naught can be done, it seems, to change this sorry state of affairs. 

The servants, diligent and keen, didst clear away our plates with haste. A small complaint, I must confess, is that they placed the utensils on the board, which I, in truth, do prefer to keep apart. Methinks 'twould be a courtesy to proffer fresh implements, lest too much water be squandered. 

A diverse array of victuals, rich and fine, didst grace the table, making the price of forty shillings per head a veritable steal. Crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, and creme brulee didst tempt our taste buds, and drinks, complimentary, didst flow like nectar from the gods. Raspberry iced tea and soda, both most refreshing, didst quench our thirst and lift our spirits."

"Hark! This tavern be a merry place,
Where ale flows free and maidens dance with grace.
The tenders of the bar, so friendly and fair,
Do serve with cheer and make our spirits rare.
Aye, 'tis a sight to see, the screens aglow,
And victuals, fit for any king, doth flow.
Woo hoo! indeed, this place doth please,
And we, in mirth, do give our thanks with ease."
"Clean, new joint. Plenty parking, friendly staff. And, yeah, fat-free. Good spot."

"Marquee's a hot mess, but glamorous, =)
No dress code, some girls in flats and leggings, guys in tennis shoes and tees.
Lines to get in are ridiculous, but bouncers keep it under control, chaos organized.
Navigating's a challenge, stairs are killers, dance floor's too crowded, feels like a can of sardines, but worth it.
DJ and entertainers are great, sound system's crazy, bartenders are good looking and nice."
"Clean, nice joint. Good grub. Went on a Thursday, reserved a table, and had the place mostly to ourselves. Get the Manchurian Chicken - it's tasty."

"Listen up, folks. I got a story to tell. There's this comedian, see? And he's gonna roast the audience, just like that. He's gonna make jokes about race, gender, sex, age, and whatever else he can think of. So if you're easy to offend, you best stay home. Now, I've seen my fair share of comedy shows, and I gotta say, some of his jokes ain't exactly new. But hey, it's still a hoot! Just don't bring the kiddos, 'cause it's rated NC-17/R. \n\nThe venue's small, so you'll feel like you're back in high school or college. And let me tell you, there's nowhere to hide. You're gonna be part of the show, whether you like it or not. So, you been warned."
"Crab cakes, best in town. Salmon Caesar, blacken it. Flank steak, marinated, heavenly. Full-service bar, plenty TVs. Bon appetit."

"Mocha, decent brew, in hipster haven found, 
Loud, angry tunes, my youthful days rebounds. 
Fare, fair priced, and drinks, a cheerful sound. 
Gingered whiskey, remedy, I'll return to drown."

"Excalibur's got a good deal goin' on. Room cost me $27 through Expedia, plus a $15 resort fee for some extras like wired internet. Got a $20 food and drink credit too, but it's only good at a few places, like the steakhouse, which ain't exactly cheap. Also got a free play at the arcade, but no match plays. Room was alright, big enough, nice TV, slow internet though. Beds were decent, three pillows, nice touch. Elevators were weird, separate floors for 1-18 and 18+. If you want a quick ride and a high floor, book 18 or higher. Casino was stingy, lots of continuous shufflers at the blackjack tables, not my cup of tea. Minimums were around $10 for most games."

"Methinks 'twas my first visit to yon eatery,
And by the stars, what a pleasantry!
The servers, kind and full of cheer,
Didst make me feel most welcome, I do declare.
I shall return, ere long, anon,
For their warmth and smiles, they have won.
Aye, to all, I wouldst recommend this place,
For it doth seem a haven of grace."

"Methought I had a reservation at a steakhouse of note,
But my heart was not in it, so I didst decide to roam.
I walked along the strip, and saw many a place,
But none didst strike my fancy, nor didst win my grace.

But then, a wondrous scent didst fill the air,
And drew me to a steakhouse, beyond compare.
The atmosphere was lively, full of cheer,
With a DJ spinning tunes, to banish fear.

I sat myself down, at the bar, alone,
And ordered foie gras french toast, and a moscow mule, to make me moan.
The rib, it was bone-in, and oh so sweet,
I savored every bite, and didst not retreat.

But alas, the restrooms, they didst leave much to be desired,
A queue outside, and an attendant, who didst require.
May I use the bathroom, sir? I didst ask,
But nay, they didst command, with a stern task.

I shall return to Vegas, soon, to celebrate my son,
For this steakhouse, it didst win my heart, and won.
So, I shall come again, with joy and glee,
To dine and revel, in this place, so free."

"Hark, 'twas many moons since last I stepped within Nello's hallowed halls. A friend didst suggest we dine there, and thus, the three of us didst present ourselves at the appointed hour. The crowd didst swell, yet we were seated straightaway. Pray tell, what dish doth one order at Nello's? Aye, a pizza of ample proportions, with bacon, mushrooms, sausage, and a sprinkling of fresh basil, of course! Alas, the herb didst not grace our pie, yet still, 'twas most delectable. The garlic bread, a worthy accompaniment indeed! Our server, a vision of loveliness, didst attend to our needs with grace and alacrity."

"Rio's got a secret. We stumbled on it, pre-show. No reservation, our bad. Hostess hooked us up at the bar. Meatballs, a must. Scallops, sea bass, fresh and flavorful. Going back? Hell yeah. Locals, use your T.Rewards, NV ID for 25%. Showgoers, flash your stubs for 20%. Deal."

I headed to downtown Vegas for a show, stopped for grub at Bar + Bistro. My bad, it was First Friday in the Arts District, and they had a limited menu. Oh well.

I went for two tapas plates and a sweet treat. Started with their roasted tomato soup - damn good. Then, their 5 cheese mac and cheese, a mix of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp. Gigli pasta. Tasty stuff.

Finished with a warm chocolate ganache cake. Also, damn good. Came with a tiny scoop of sorbet. Perfect.

Would've liked to try the full menu, but I still got a taste of their good eats. A bit pricey, maybe. Liked the decor though. Palettes for tables, metal wells. Thought I spilled something a few times, but it was just paint splatters. Got me every time.

"Late night Tempe, we needed grub. Not in the mood to drive, opted for delivery. Took an hour, pretty standard. Food arrived, everyone loved it. Chicken bruchetta pita, excellent though small. Two pitas recommended for the hungry. Traditional hummus, subpar. Four stars instead of five. That's my review."

"Coffee joint with high ceilings, good coffee, and friendly staff. Close to my office, so I stop by for lunch sometimes. Their little toasts are top-notch, loaded with stuff like egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and various meats. Desserts look great, but I'm usually too full. Pricey, but the grub's good, so that helps."

"Went to a friend's birthday party at a comedy club. Liked the cozy atmosphere. Not usually a fan of comedy, but laughed at three out of four acts. Next door, a Fetish Ball was happening, which confused me at first. Thought it was part of the comedy club's dress code, but then saw the neon sign and realized it was separate. Great spot for a weekend night out. No need for assless chaps, but they're not forbidden either."

"Thai food, delicious. Server, pleasant. Green curry, extra veggies and tofu, yummy. Ate it all. Friend had broccoli chicken and spring roll, impressed. Ambiance, hole-in-the-wall and kitschy. Don't care. Go for food and service, not disappointed."

"My pug's gotten top-notch care at Squaw Peak. Staff's kind, appointments are easy to come by, and the wait's never long. They treat my dog like he's their own, just like others have said. 

Found a pup at work, brought him in, and he had distemper. Vet said putting him down was best. Asked about the cost, and the vet covered it, no charge. 

They've been cool about billing me for vet care and letting me make payments when I'm struggling financially. But I wasn't stoked about getting a collections notice after making a payment that covered most of what I owed. Billing person said I could make another payment this month, $70, and just needed to call in and arrange it. Considering how well they've treated me, figure it was just a mistake."

"Hark! At last, I've arrived at this famed eatery,
Whose praises my friends have oft sung to me.
The victuals, they be of fair quality,
And the surroundings, not of the usual ilk,
Of Japanese taverns, that doth oft astound.
I shall return, forsooth, anon, with haste,
For this night's repast hath won my heart, in sooth,
In love with it, I am, and that's no jest."

"Hark! What eatery is this, so full of charm?
The window seat, a view of fountains in the park.
Foie gras, a delight, and hamachi, quite fine.
But alack, the duck, a disappointment divine.
Underseasoned, o'ercooked, a shame to behold.
Yet, our server, attentive and quick to unfold
A new dish, sea bass, a savory treat.
A worthy substitute, our taste buds to greet."

"On June the twenty-second eve,
A host of us did gather, friends and kin,
At table large, where games of wit did gleam,
Checkers and Scrabble, pastimes of the mind.
My spouse, the salmon miso did choose,
Whilst I, a burger and fries, did savor.
Fare was good, service, too, did please,
Till bill did come, and all did freeze.
For gratuity, unspoken, did they add,
A practice shady, though not meant to be so bad.
Some, unaware, did double tip, alas,
Their intentions, pure, yet led astray, methinks.
I spoke of this to those near me,
And they, in thanks, did heed my words, you see.
Though not the restaurant's aim, I deem,
This practice, by the server, seemed quite queer."
"Best steak in Vegas. Seats comfy, place hoppin'. Lobster apps pricey, but damn good. Staff sharp. Can't wait to go back, sans lobster."

"3.75 stars. First LV store I visited, aside from the one in Japan. Security guards gave me the hairy eyeball, bored outta their minds. Other nice stores at Caesars, they'd smile, say have a good night. Purse bar was cool, associate showed us 7-10 bags, took off the protection tape. Forgot her name, but she was patient, helpful. Disappeared for a bit after we decided, but still recommend it if you're serious. Even if they ignore you, like they did me."
"Good spread at their lunch buffet. Veggie and meat options, plenty to choose from. Desserts are top-notch, especially the garlic naan. Friendly staff too."

"Methinks 'tis a fine establishment, with ambiance most pleasant,
And victuals that doth please mine taste, in quantity not too copious,
Lest choosing take an age, and thus, my friends, I do recommend,
The Raspberry Soda, verily, most delectable and sweet."

"Leaving this joint, I've always been a happy camper. Their bar's got some serious style, bottles lit up like a Christmas tree. But the lighting's crap, like someone's shining a flashlight under their face. Not exactly flattering.

I go for the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna, it's a real treat. Slaw's got a great taste, soy dressing, and a kick of wasabi. Not a fish place, but I'm on a seafood binge and their Blacked Fish Sandwich hits the spot. Cooked to perfection, love the sauce. Steamed broccoli's fresh and tasty, but skip the honey roasted carrots, they're drenched in sugar syrup. Gross.

Dessert's not my thing here. Too much white chocolate for my taste."

"Verily, 'tis a wondrous place indeed,  
In Sun Prairie, where we've dined with speed.  
Six times hath we graced its hallowed halls,  
And each time, the fare hath been most fair.  
Steak, fish, and entrees, all doth please,  
Even the younglings, with their meals so neat.  
Their menu doth change, and ale on tap,  
Maketh repeat visits most worthwhile, by my map.  
On Fridays, 'tis a bustling, lively scene,  
But still, they doth fill a need, most keen."

"Filet Mignon, damn good. Sauce, didn't need steak sauce, but still good. Service, top-notch. Waiter, friendly. Water, always full. Price, reasonable. Frites, too salty. Great spot for lunch, sunny day."

"A most excellent abode, with rooms of ample space and scrupulous cleanliness. The cost, fair and reasonable, doth please mine eyes. Located at the strip's end, 'tis a haven from the bustling crowd, and the air, pure and fresh, doth bless mine lungs. Within the hotel's walls, diversions abound: beach, mall, taverns, clubs, spa, and more besides. A truly wondrous place to rest and play."

We waited 30 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Sat outside, great for people watching. Ordered caesar salad, arrived fast, delicious, loved the cheese and dressing. Also got quiche lorraine, brought back memories of my childhood, amazing, filling, couldn't finish it! Friendly, attentive service. Food came quick, barely finished my salad before lunch arrived. Boyfriend had warm chicken and brie sandwich, with apple and caramelized onions, absolutely delicious. Great experience, great food, elegant atmosphere. Will definitely dine here again in Vegas.
"Cool joint. Kitchen gadgets galore. Chrome, high-end, and sleek. Coffee while you browse? Hell yeah. Fun times."

"Hark, good sir! Thou seeketh garb of urban flair? 
Amidst this vast emporium, thy search doth end here! 
For in this place, thou shalt find raiment most fair, 
From suits of finest cut, to streetwear with care. 
And accessories galore, to make thy outfit shine! 
But mark thee well, dear friend, service doth decline, 
Beyond the fitting rooms, where thou doth try on with ease. 
Yet, at such prices, who canst expect a breeze?"
