"Union Pig & Chicken in Pittsburgh serves up some top-notch BBQ. Their brisket's soft, falls apart easy, but watch out for them fatty bits. Service is decent, but slow. Good spot for lunch too. Try their sandwiches, they're damn tasty. And don't forget the mac & cheese, it's freakin' great."

"Hark! To this place didst I come with mine husband and our two teenage sprites, that we might partake of their sweet and frozen delights. And verily, each of us didst choose a different concoction, that we might share and savor together. The employees, kind and courteous, didst serve us with a smile and a song. But alas, good sir! The cost of these delectable draughts doth trouble me sore, for they be priced too steeply, methinks. Yet still, I wish they were less dear, that I might indulge in them the more oft."

"Walnut Grill, a joint I frequent for a post-work tipple or a swift, satisfying meal. Their menu, a twist on classic American fare. Wine list, top-notch. Atmosphere, lively. Recently expanded bar area, more seating, cozy booths. Servers, attentive, memorable. Live music, some nights. You'll find me here, regularly."
"Manager read my review, called me up, and apologized. Haven't been back since, but he said it'll be different next time. Fired the server who messed up my order. Lookin' forward to tryin' it again."

"Steak N Shake finally made it to the valley. I'm a big fan of their Frisco melt - it's a juicy, greasy delight. The joint's clean, the service is friendly, but I miss the surly waitresses. Wish they were open 24/7 like the others, but no big deal. The menu's smaller, but I can live without the peppers. The milkshakes ain't up to par, but I'll take my Frisco melt with fries and cheese sauce any day."

"Hark! What light through yonder drive-thru doth break?  
A McDonald's, by my troth! And one that doth earn my keep,  
For in the realm of fast food chains, this one doth reign supreme.  
Their service, swift and friendly, doth make my day begin,  
And whether I desire but coffee, or a pair of hash browns for me and my kin,  
I know that in five minutes, at most, I shall be on my merry way again."

"Ox tail soup, that's what they're known for. California Hotel, late night spot. Fans of the soup, this is the place. Hawaiian and Filipino influence on the menu. Check in on Facebook, it'll say Home of the Ox Tail Soup. Tips: 1. Wait in line, be prepared. 2. No peanuts, that's the way to go. 3. Validate your parking ticket, don't forget."

"Hark! The place doth please mine eyes, and food, most wondrous fair!
I chose the market fish, a dish divine, so tender and so rare.
The meat, oh how it melted in mine mouth, like snow in spring's warm air.
And other dishes, duck and pork, didst tempt mine taste, so bright and bold,
A feast fit for a king, or queen, or noble of the land, I do avow!"

In this fair inn, I found much joy and cheer,
The chambers clean, a fridge with water near,
A gymnasium of decent sort, to keep
One's body fit and healthy, as one ought.

But lo, three things did mar my bliss,
The Internet, which required a fresh kiss,
Each day, a new code, ten coins to pay,
For each device, a price to dismay.

And then, the morning meal, not quite,
Up to the standard, I had hoped to bite,
Unless made special, just for me,
Then 'twas edible, as it should be.

Lastly, the tray, left outside my door,
Until the next day, a sore point, no more.
Yet all else, was pleasant, as could be,
Location prime, attendants, kind and free.

"Local fella at a liquor store turned me onto this joint a couple years back. Been comin' here ever since, whenever I'm in Vegas. Only had the pizza and wings, but they hit the spot real good, especially after a long night of drinkin'. It's just down the street from the Stratosphere, so it's easy to find. You can tell it's a local hangout, but don't let that scare you off. Good eatin', no frills."

"Crab legs, good. Line, long. Sushi, fresh. Desserts, cute. Gellato, many flavors. Price, high. Bellagio, better. Buffet, aquariums. Tropical desserts, out of this world. Escalator, down. Todai, great. Reasonable prices. Chicken, beef, too."
"Fuel up 24/7 in Vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip! Skip Mickey D's and Denny's, hit this joint for real grub that'll keep you full."

"XS, we ended up there after Hakkansan turned us away. Not disappointed, no sir. Inside, gorgeous. Outside, great spot for tunes and fresh air. Danced the night away with Rusko. Definitely worth a visit."

"Aye, 'tis true, my friends, this buffet doth stand apart,
Amongst a thousand others in this city of chance.
'Tis cheap, and of good quality, a rare find indeed,
In this town where fortunes rise and fall with speed.
I shall return, forsooth, to partake of its delight,
For here, in Vegas, buffets doth bring joy and mirth."
"East coast, noodles, good. Thinking 'bout 'em still. Next time, straight there."
"Good grub here, mate. Vodka cokes for 12 bucks, can't beat that. Had a blonde server, Marcia or Mercy, something like that. She was pleasant."
"Service was slow, but it was noon. Cashier was quick and friendly."

"Upon mine first visit to Ingleside Grooming, I must confess, fair maiden, that thy response to mine queries didst seem a mite curt, as if thou wert annoyed by mine presence. Yet, I didst persist in requesting thine expertise to groom my loyal pet. And lo, upon mine return the next day, I didst arrive late, a sorry sight indeed. But fear not, good gentlewoman, for I didst explain that my pet was a nervous creature, prone to soiling herself at the mere mention of Petsmart or the vet. Thou, in thy infinite wisdom, didst show great understanding and patience, and didst not chastise me for mine tardiness. Nay, I didst feel most comfortable in thine presence, and when I returned to claim mine pet, thou didst regale me with tales of her behavior and sweetness, and didst assure me that she didst not soil herself, praise the heavens! And verily, her new look, after three years of unkempt growth, doth please mine eyes mightily, and the cost, most reasonable indeed! Hark, I do highly recommend thee, fair groomer!"

"By Yelp's guidance, I chanced upon this place,
And gladly did I partake of their fare.
Their Sonoran hot dogs, oh so tasty and fine,
Two of them filled my belly to the brim.

In days past, when first I stepped inside,
Communication was not at its prime.
I asked of dog varieties, and the reply,
Was simply, "How many?" with naught else to say.

But now, on my second visit, all was well,
The staff were friendly, and service swell.
A hearty meal, and a tidier space,
Made for a pleasing experience, in spite of the place.

So, though the surroundings may lack some sheen,
Do venture forth, for the food is worth the scene."
"Saw a billboard on our way, Seinfeld was performing that night. Couldn't pass it up. Got seats near the back, but the view and sound were still top-notch. Great spot for live acts."

"Liked the show. Some cheese, but mostly excellent. Something for everyone, done with taste and art. 

Twins killed it, big girls owning the stage. Rest of the bodies, lean dancers, real breastshooray! 

Choreography, beautiful, tasteful, poignant. Not just shock, but love, lust, joy, pain, pleasure, desire, distress, giving, taking, physical, emotional, silly, fun. Human animal, full circle. 

Standouts: African dancer, suspended bondage, water gymnasts, transvestite torch singer. That red cape, spectacular. 

Must-see. Would go back, enjoyed every minute."

"10am at Poppy's. Bagels, a dozen. My plan? Play Bagel Fairy all day with the best damn bagels in Charlotte. 

Fair distribution, but I had to test the merchandise first. Two in one sitting, no regrets. Coffee was mediocre, but who cares when the bagels are top-notch? A+ in the bagel department. Shame about the cheese and slices though, Bore's Head just doesn't cut it. 

No more Bruegger's for me. No more torturing Owen. Poppy bagels, Poppy love."
"Cool joint, good people, comfy vibes. Affordable drinks and grub, tasty too. Happy hour deals, sweet. Gets packed, but always a blast."

In sooth, I didst dine alone in Las Vegas,
A feat most rare, and one I ne'er thought wise.
For I, a man of company and cheer,
Didst take a table for one, with naught to fear.

The Japanese call it "ohitori-sama,"
A term of honor, and one of grace.
And indeed, my dinner was quite fine,
With service warm, and hospitality divine.

The booking was easy, made with ease,
A weekday reservation, swiftly seized.
The hostess, friendly, welcomed me with grace,
And the service, low-key, left naught to trace.

The food, outstanding, needed no words,
For this Californian, foie gras, a treat, not blurred.
And reasonably priced, a surprise, indeed,
In Las Vegas, where prices often exceed.

A half-bottle of Champagne, a steal,
And Chateauneuf du Pape, a wine to reveal.
The fellow next to me, a man of taste,
Ordered a whole Sancerre bottle, his thirst to quench.

But alas, the mood, the atmosphere,
Was broken by a man, a stranger, near.
He spoke of hockey, and Ottawa, too,
And thus, my romantic dinner, anew.

"Hark! Whataburger be my heart's desire,
Where chicken strips doth reign supreme, my soul's on fire.
A token of their love, a slice of bread they bring,
To pair with meat, a most wondrous, heavenly thing.
No other place, my friends, doth offer such delight,
As Whataburger, where my hunger doth take flight."

"Good grub, clean joint. We had the alloush and June's special - mushroom melt. Both were tasty, no doubt. But a couple things kept it from being a five-star affair. Bread was soft, not crunchy like we expected. And the greens on the sandwich? Limp, not fresh. Maybe that's just me, though. Still, worth checking out. Just know what you're getting into."

"Methinks we've had the pleasure of attending two performances in recent years, Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly, and verily, we didst enjoy them both immensely. Alas, by the time we arrive and find lodgings, even at Jerry's humble abode, we find ourselves able to afford naught but the most modest of seats. The chairs, I do declare, are somewhat narrow in that lofty realm of opera glasses. Mayhap we shall have to open our purses a bit wider on the next occasion. And mark my words, good sir, it doth behoove thee to attend the pre-show lecture, for 'tis well worth the time, and perchance thou shalt secure a more favorable parking spot within the garage. Parking, indeed, doth prove a most excellent bargain for those in Arizona."

"Starbucks here's a good spot. Service is snappy, even when it's busy. Wi-fi's a crap shoot, but that's not their fault. Problem is, like most places downtown, you gotta watch out for the homeless. They take up tables, beg for change. Can't blame Starbucks for that. City's gotta handle it."
"Strip-side joint. People-watch, drink hard, DJ booth coming. Summer hotspot."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
Where vegan fare doth abound and doth feed
My hunger for delicate flavors and freshness.
In nineteen hundred and ninety-six,
I chanced upon this haven, and since then,
My taste buds have been in love with its essence.

Last eve, I savored the papaya salad,
A dish most refreshing and light, with a hint of sweet.
The spring rolls, fresh and minty, did delight,
Though the flavor was a mite different from the norm.

For my repast, I chose dish number three,
A feast fit for a king, or so it seemed to me.
A crispy fried roll, a soup of coconut and mushroom,
And pad thai, a dish of noodles, spices, and aroma.
Alas, the pad thai, though tasty, did burn my tongue,
For I had asked for mild, yet it was fiery and strong.

The service, swift and courteous, did make amends,
And I shall return, for their luncheon deals beckon.
This place, a gem, doth shine with culinary grace,
And I, a humble bard, do sing its praise."

Ikea for Prez.

Imagine a gov like Ikeaefficient, affordable, useful. Faux wood, real wood, options galore. Help's decent, 7/10 times. Got everything you needstring, bags, dollies, measuring tape, pencils, notepads.

Personally, I dig Hemnes (real wood!). Bought it for my master bedroom, living room. Excellent results. Did Malm too (haven't we all?). Small investment, years of use.

Downside's the directions. No words, just pictures. Need patience, a clear head. Gentleman friend assembles; I hand him the pieces and step back.
"Lived close by, passed it often. Wife called, wanted lunch brought over. Gyros hit the spot, no disappointment. Meat stacked high, sauce just right, fresh pita. Great midday meal."

"Anniversary weekend, suggest DW Bistro to the husband. Had been there two weeks prior with the girls, amazing. Husband impressed by the smell alone, rare for a former restaurateur. Split a house salad, mixed greens, fruit, cheese, nuts - a must-have. Short rib sandwich and salmon, both perfectly cooked, great flavors. Our waiter, top-notch, personable. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"The performances were top-notch, like something straight out of America's Got Talent. Good mix of acts, solid characters, and some fresh material. 

I paid $23 for a mojito in a skinny glass. It was a damn good drink, but as a local, I couldn't help thinking about all the grub I could've gotten for that price. =p

All in all, the entertainment blew away my expectations. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it delivered."

"Hark! What news is this? Capprioti's Bobby doth take steroids,
And now doth call himself Sir Robert, by my troth.
His outward show doth seem more rugged, tough and strong,
But deep within, his heart doth beat with love,
As soft and sweet as cranberry sauce, wherein
He doth bathe, to make the ladies love him more.
For though he be but six inches tall,
He doth transform into a dozen, for the fairer sex.
So, lonely souls, seek out Sir Robert at Eddie D's,
And find in him a worthy companion, by my guess."

"Paradise Bakery, great spot. Friendly staff, but lines can get long when it's busy. Love their apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins, always consistent. Nice rewards program too, easy to earn freebies if you're a regular. Only downside, sometimes pushy home business types hog the booths on weekdays. Whole families with screaming kids on weekends. Other locations don't have this issue, maybe it's the hotel next door."

"Verily, 'tis true, my dearest friends,  
The Mattress Factory doth possess a charm,  
That doth set it apart from all others,  
In this fair city, where art doth flourish.  

Amazing, indeed, doth be its installations,  
Unique and original, beyond compare,  
Thou shalt not find, within these city walls,  
Art that doth rival, its beauty so rare."

"Hark, what store is this? Avalon, by the mount,
In Lebo, 'twas my heart's desire, now found.
Eye-catching garb, in windows displayed,
Funky, neon sign, my heart doth sway.

Typical layout, pants, shirts, dresses, and more,
Upfront, bags, jewels, for the ladies in store.
Higher end selection, Prada, Gucci, Cho,
For Mount Lebo's desperate housewives, don't you know.

Good selection, Buffalo Exchange doth rival,
Wide shoe choice, for the fashion-conscious gent.
Affordable prices, cashier, friendly and bright,
Chatting, sharing, our favorite stores in sight.

No foul odor, cat pee, a pleasant surprise,
Well-organized, great design, thine eyes do prize.
Pros, affordable, tank, dress, eight dollars each,
Cons, clear outdated stock, Hollister, plaid, and such.
Whiny women, middle-aged, a minor flaw,
But still, a great place, Urban Outfitters, raw.

A constant, in my shopping rounds, 'twill be,
This Avalon, in Mount Lebo, a gem, for thee."
"This joint's shut down? Damn shame. Good eatery, that one. Now I gotta find some other joint for my grub."

"Nice joint. New, modern, non-smoking. No casino. That was cool. Liked being up high. Could see a lot. Automatic shades, big shower, fast toilet, great tub. Prices in the cafe were steep, but that's Vegas. Appreciated the morning latte. Valets were solid. Checked in early. Nice surprise."

"Fare was passable, I must confess,
But my smashed spuds didst lack a certain zest.
And yon lass who bore our victuals to us,
Didst display a most unpleasant mien,
When my love requested a bit more sauce.
A pox upon her, sayeth I!"

"This joint's my favorite spot in Vegas. Been to over ten hotels in this town, but this one takes the cake. Got the M Life card, so I get treated right. Rooms are big and the staff's friendly. Pool's got a sweet beach vibe, especially when it's scorching outside. Burger Bar's my go-to. Their Kobe burger's top-notch. \n\nOnly two things that bug me. One, it's turned into a family place. Not a bad thing, just not my scene. Two, TVs are old and not HD. But hey, that's just a minor gripe."

"Vanguard's been my haunt for a while now. Great spot for a unique cocktail or something new. Bar's always clean, no problem getting a drink even on busy nights. I'm a man of many drinks, but at Vanguard, it's always the Jack Rose. Apple brandy, maple syrup, black cherry - damn, I'm craving one just thinking about it. Maple syrup, you know? Can't go wrong. Drinks are top-notch, but take a break after a few, you hear me? Weekend nights get loud with the DJ, and Fremont's finest come in for a quick shuffle before they bounce. All in all, solid joint."

"Came for dinner, food was top-notch. Steak and fish, cooked to perfection. But service, slow as molasses. Waited over an hour for grub. They made up for it though, gave my grandpa a box of truffles and a twenty-five dollar card. Food, four-point-five stars. Service, three stars."

"A night most pleasant at the Bamboo Club didst we enjoy,
With victuals savory and a setting fair and bright.
But lo, our server, a knave of the first degree,
Didst mar our evening with his woeful plight.

We arrived late, as the clock didst strike nine,
And sat without, beneath the stars divine.
The d\u00e9cor, a theme of the East, didst please mine eyes,
And had I lived in Scottsdale, oft wouldst I visit the guise.

Their Pad Thai, a dish of renown, didst taste most sweet,
As didst the appetizers, save one, alas, didst meet
My fate, a choice most ill-conceived, I do confess,
For tuna, frozen and seared, didst my senses oppress.

A foolish whim, a craving most absurd, didst drive me
To seek fish in the desert, a folly most extreme.
Yet still, the fault, theirs, for fresh fish, flown in,
In Arizona, a tale, mayhap, yet truth within.

Thus, in conclusion, a place of delight,
The Bamboo Club, with atmosphere most bright.
Good food, aye, and orange chicken, a treat,
But shun the seafood, and that knave, a swift kick, doth merit."

"Alas, the tavern doth close at ten o'clock,
A shame, forsooth, for those who'd revel late.
With wagon wheels and country charm aplenty,
It seemed a place where one might merrily dine and dance.
But nay, the fries were not worth a second glance,
And peanuts, too, did leave my taste buds unmoved.
Yet, lo, the burgers, they were quite divine,
With guacamole, a topping most sublime.
And though I did not partake of them myself,
I heard the cookies were a sweet and tasty gem."

"ShooGoo, a four-star establishment, didst serve up dishes most fair,
With American fare, and portions large, beyond compare.
The service, too, was friendly, and with a smile so bright,
But alas, 'twas missing that certain je ne sais quoi, that doth make a five-star sight.

My filet, with B\u00e9arnaise sauce, was cooked to perfection, I must say,
And the mushrooms, with Gorgonzola, didst steal the show, in a playful way.
The view, of course, was pleasant, as the sun didst shine so bright,
In Sedona, where the skies are forever blue and bright."

"Verily, 'tis a truth universally acknowledged, that a person in possession of a sweet tooth must be in want of Krispy Kreme. Forsooth, the mere sight of that radiant Hot & Now sign doth light up mine eyes and stir within me a craving most fierce. 

Many a doughnut have I sampled, yet never have I been disappointed by this humble abode of sugary delights. The staff, swift as they are, doth produce a baker's dozen of those delectable glazed treats in no time. 

The interior, a place of wonder for younglings, where they may behold the conveyor belt, a marvel of modern technology, churning out doughnuts as if by magic. 'Tis a temple of joy, a haven of bliss, where one may partake in the simple pleasures of life. 

Alas, my sole grievance doth lie in the accessibility, or lack thereof. Tucked away on Independence, 'tis a challenge to reach, what with the congested roads and limited parking spaces. But fear not, dear friends, for the effort doth prove worthwhile, for Krispy Kreme doth stand as a beacon of hope, a shining example of all that is good and right in this world."

"Hark! This tavern, fair and bright,
A haven for imbibers of the night.
The Penn Pumpkin Roll, a wondrous sight,
With cinnamon and sugar, a sweet delight.
Sprecher, a brew of renown,
A hard root beer, with flavors profound.
Upstairs, a space for mirth and glee,
A view most grand, for all to see."

"A most excellent way to pass an eve,
Our first time here, the seats did surround,
The stage, in circles, actors did perform,
In all directions, their talents did abound.

The singing, better than I did expect,
The wigs, a bit cheesy, yet still quite affect,
A fun night, indeed, save for the crowd,
Geriatric, whispers loud, a bit too proud.

But still, they had fun, so 'twas easy to ignore,
And thus, we enjoyed the play, and that's for sure.
A tip, arrive early, parkings fill fast,
Dinner and show, a good plan, doth last."

"Hark, good sir! Kelly's doth be a merry place,
Where friends do gather, and laughter doth embrace.
A pint of ale, or mayhap a bite to eat,
Doth make for a fine evening, so neat.

The atmosphere, it doth please mine eye,
With cozy nooks, where one can sit and sigh.
And though the service doth move at a slow pace,
'Tis but a minor quibble, in this place.

A velvet rope, it doth indeed adorn,
But fear not, for 'tis but a small horn.
For in Old Town, such finery doth abound,
So let us raise a glass, and make a sound.

And should thou choose to dine within these walls,
Do give the short ribs a try, for they doth enthrall.
Five stars, I say, for their tender, juicy delight,
A culinary masterpiece, in the morning light."

"Passed this joint plenty times, never stopped in 'til an ex wanted to give it a shot. Glad we did. Inside, it's like South Blvd never existed. Classy joint, nice decor. Prices a bit steep, but worth it. Portions big enough for two. Staff top-notch, eager to please. Owner came by, offered free drinks. Not one to turn down a freebie, I'd give it four out of five."

"I like this joint more now that I've been inside. Free drinks for ladies from 10-12am, no line, and friendly staff. The drinks are strong, the place is small but bigger than I thought, and you can sit for free. The lounge is inside, but there's also a bar behind the REVOLUTION letters. The DJ wasn't great, but maybe it was just the music. Good spot for free drinks and chillin' with friends. Some folks were dressed up, but others were casual, like guys in t-shirts and beanies, and girls in denim and dressy tops. The crowd seemed a bit older."

"Food's good, portions just right, service top-notch. But they got a 20-dollar minimum for credit cards. That's a problem for me, since I usually fly solo and don't carry cash. Means I won't be back, 'cause I can get the same grub, service, and portion control two blocks down the road, and use my debit card whenever I please."

"Samosas? Two-and-a-half stars. Potatoes and cilantro? Meh. Naan? Average. Three stars. Kashmiri Dum Aloo? Five stars. Well-spiced, creamy, perfect potatoes. Vegetable Jalfrezi? Four stars. Too much oil. Rice? Perfect. Service? Great. Bollywood videos? Enjoyed 'em. Be back soon."

"This joint's alright, for out here in the sticks. In town, it's just another hole in the wall. But hey, at least someone's giving the locals a decent spot to grab a bite. My pop's taken a liking to the place too, so it's become our go-to when he's feeling hungry. 

The pies are pretty good, and I've had some solid pasta dishes. 

Just remember, it can get pretty packed, so it's best to book ahead."

"Shirts with sleeves, that's the rule for guys in Vegas, no matter how hot it gets. Worth the cost though, the grub and decor make it worthwhile. Plenty of options for your plate, and their desserts? Not bad, not bad at all. Corn on the cob, that's the real winner here."

"Spinach artichoke dip, damn good. Used to be bigger, but who cares? Strong drinks, that's what matters. Our waiter, Matt, top-notch. Helped us choose, had a blast before hitting the town. My friend digs the menu, Weight Watchers friendly. I'm sold, two for $20."

"JD and I were lookin' for a real casual spot to grab some grub after our workout on Saturday. He suggested this place and it was dead on. The chips 'n' salsa were top-notch, either they were really good or I was just starvin' from the gym, prob'ly a bit of both. 

JD gets this cheese crisp thing and I give him a hard time about it, askin' if he's on a diet. Then I eat my words when this huge, greasy, cheesy monstrosity of a pizza comes out. It was friggin' huge! Thin tortilla, loads of melted cheese, cut up into squares like a pizza. Made it real easy to chow down on. I had these Mexican Flag enchiladas, they were alright, but they couldn't compete with that cheese beast across the table. 

All in all, it was a killer meal. Undid all the good I did at the gym, but that's life and I'm a-okay with it."

"Rito's got the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe. Don't let the haters tell you otherwise. Sure, the area might seem rough, but that's just part of its charm. You'll find all sorts of folks here - city workers, CPAs, medical staff, teachers, and the occasional sketchy character. But don't let that scare you off. This family-owned joint serves up some damn good grub. Their menu might be limited, but it's all about quality, not quantity. And don't worry about the prices - you're getting fresh, soulful food, not some heartless crap like at Taco Bell. If you're feeling lucky, grab three tacos while you're there. The guacamole tacos? Amazing. I'd rob old people for 'em. Just saying. Now, if only they'd step up their game and offer fountain drinks... that'd be something else."

"Hark, what gym is this? A palace, or a place to stay?
Gold's Gym Elite, a name that doth convey
A sense of style, and modernity, I pray.
And lo, upon entrance, I didst feel
As though I checked into a hotel, quite swell.
The W, it doth compare, in its cleanliness
And friendliness of staff, a true success.
Cardio machines, with personal TVs,
A cord for i-PODs, a most excellent spree.
Alas, no pool, a downer, I do confess,
But views, they make up for it, I must profess.
Sky Harbor's planes, a wondrous sight,
I watched them fly, as I worked out with all my might.
Not crowded, this gym, a pleasure to behold,
A former gym, too crowded, I didst unfold.
Filthy bathrooms, a sight most foul,
I ended my membership, and didst enroll
In Gold's Gym Elite, a wise decision, I say,
For cleanliness, and style, doth rule the day."

"Buffets don't usually sit well with me, but Studio B is an exception. Quality over quantity, and worth the trip. Dinner's around $25 Monday to Thursday, seafood bumps it up to $35 on weekends. Not a bad deal, considering you get unlimited beer and wine. They've got craft drafts and ciders, a few wine options too. Something for everyone - sushi, carving stations, veggie options, and a dessert spread that'll satisfy any sweet tooth. Gelato and milkshakes too. Modern, comfy, and clean, with a view of the Strip. Lines can get long, so come prepared. Check out the M Players Club for free buffets."

"I joined this gym and it's been great. Friendly staff at the counter, always a warm welcome. Plenty of machines to use, variety for every muscle group. Juice bar's top-notch, staff's friendly too. Brent helped me sign up, explained everything clearly. No issues with parking, place is well-kept. Recommended."

"Three of us ate at this joint last night and I'll definitely be back. Service was top-notch, Emily was a real sweetheart, and the owner, Daryl, even stopped by our table to make sure everything was A-okay. Good guy. \nNow, if I had to nitpick, I'd say the apps could've been bigger. They were pretty cheap, so we should've gotten a few more. But other than that, the grub was great. I went for the curried tofu and cleaned my plate. Martha got the Jerk Chicken (real spicy) and Binnie had the Chicken and Dumplings, which was different but damn good. \nAll three of us agreed we'd come back."

In fair Las Vegas, where gambling doth reign,
A classic hotel doth stand, the Rio its name.
A place of rest, with comforts plenty,
Despite its age, modernity doth abound.

The buffets, oh how they doth delight,
A feast for eyes, a treat for appetite.
But alas, the line at check-in doth grow,
As weekenders flock, the crowds they do show.

Yet, staff doth bear it with grace and poise,
Their patience, a virtue, doth surprise.
For those who seek a respite from the fray,
The Rio, a haven, doth beckon thee away.

Though distant from the Strip, a trifle far,
Cabs, aplenty, doth wait, a ride to scar.
Yet still, a gem, this hotel doth remain,
A place to rest, after a night of gain.

So here's to thee, dear Rio, may thy fame,
Endure, and may thy guests find joy in thy name.

"Pizza, salad, wine - all good. Owner recommended the Emiliana salad, so we gave it a shot. Split it with the Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both were top-notch. Went with a Tuscan Cabernet blend for the wine, nice choice. Good vibes, good grub, good times. Definitely going back."

"Green chili burro and beef taco, that's all I got. Took it to go, so it wasn't as good as eatin' there, but the green chili was still a must. Not too hot, not too bland. Good tortillas. Taco was decent, but next time, I'll eat in. It's a pretty good neighborhood spot."

"A wondrous site, this Joint did prove to be,
For my first concert, there did I decree,
Prince, the artist, did take to the stage,
And with his music, did our spirits engage.
From the floor and the suite, we did behold,
His majesty, in all his glory told.
What a show, it was, that night so fine,
A memory etched in my mind, forever divine."

"Hark, what lodging have we here? LaQuinta, by my troth! Yet, alas, not quite the one we sought, forsooth. 'Twas Thomas, the one on the outskirts of town, where vice and villainy do abound. My mother, dear lady, didst protest most vehemently, "Get thee hence, good sir! This place doth not befit thy station!" And so, we fled with haste, in search of better quarters, where comfort and safety might be found. Our journey ended soon, at Residence Inn, a haven most divine. Our AAA rate, a generous discount didst procure, and for a mere $40, a savings of $10, didst grant us entry to this pleasant domain. A studio, cozy and neat, with kitchen, didst await us, and breakfast, a feast most bounteous, didst satisfy our hunger and our souls. The day, though filled with stress and worry, didst end on a happy note, for our legal case, didst conclude in victory, huzzah!"

"Amidst the bustling streets of downtown, there lies a caf\u00e9, so neat,
Opposite McGill, its location most convenient, doth meet
The needs of those who seek a place to rest and sip,
And enjoy some pastries, fresh from the oven's lip.

The coffee, rich and bold, doth please the palate well,
And Jason, the owner, with his colleagues, doth tell
A tale of friendliness and warmth, so pure and true,
That one doth feel at home, in this cozy caf\u00e9 anew.

The pastries, oh so sweet, doth tempt the taste buds sore,
Fresh from the east end bakery, they doth restore
Memories of mothers' love, and childhood's joy,
In every morsel, a delight, a boy.

I, myself, doth visit oft, this caf\u00e9 so fine,
For in its warm embrace, I find a peace that's mine."

"Re Salon & Med Spa, great place. Staff's top-notch, give 'em a visit. Been goin' there six months, had my fair share of services - cut, color, mani/pedi. Bethany, the color and cut magician, she's the best."

"A wondrous journey, full of delight,
Smooth sailing, fair views, and wisdom's light.
A feast for taste, with champagne's flow,
Just as the brochure had promised to show.

But alas, six passengers crowded the space,
Leaving naught but discomfort in their place.
I, of average stature, felt crushed quite sore,
In such close quarters, could not take more.

Thus, four stars I give, for the experience grand,
But for the tight fit, a deduction at hand."

"A buffet review, thou say?
In Vegas, my dear husband and I do play,
At Bellagio's spread, we doth frequent,
For 'tis a feast most wondrous and convenient.

Their crabs, both snow and king, they do provide,
Cut in half, cold, and ready to collide,
With melted butter, a tasty delight,
(But snow crabs, mark thee well, are the better bite.)

Prime rib, oh so tender and juicy too,
A fast line, but worth the wait, I do declare to thee.

The price, a mere $29.95, a Thursday eve steal,
Ambiance, nice, yet not too grand to make one feel
Awkward with crab legs and butter, a happy medium, indeed,
Service, attentive, refills and clean plates, their creed."

"Solid spot for frybread tacos, but the real draw's the green chili stew. Variety of dessert frybreads, too. Chorizo with hot sauce hits the spot. Good for a change of pace or satisfyin' your sweet tooth."
"BBQ's not bad. Samplers, big ones, liked 'em all. Meat, falls off the bone, nice. Pork, real good. Atmosphere, like gramma's house. Food, plenty. Go again?"
"Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, then P F Chang's. Happy. Good grub, decent service, fair prices. Minor gripes, but P F Chang's wins."
"Buzzberry, not the best coffee spot, but it's good enough. Support local, that's what I say. Friendly staff, quick too. Large drink, secret menu, that's the way to go."

"Hark! A traveler, I, in fair Las Vegas,
For months now, have I tarried here,
And thus, a few hotels have graced my presence,
But none, like Downtown Grand, so dear.

A retro feel, it doth possess,
With colors of the sea, so fine and bright,
Yet modern furniture, doth it boast,
Flat screen TV, and cabinets, so fair and light.

Alack! But hidden fees, there be,
For internet, they say, is free,
But alas, 'tis part of the hotel fee,
A secret charge, so sly and sleight.

And should thou choose to park afar,
In yonder garage, dark and grim,
Beware, good sir, for safety's sake,
Lest thieves and rogues, thy valuables take.

Yet still, not bad, this Grand Hotel,
For in its lobby, restaurants doth dwell,
On par, they be, with all the rest,
So eat and drink, and merrily make haste."

"Hark! What fortune brings me to this place?
A haven of delight, with victuals so fair,
And ale, a draught most wondrous and cheap,
That doth quench thirst and lift spirits so high.
The servitors here, of kindness so true,
Do make my visit most pleasant, anon.
Indeed, 'tis a gem, this humble abode,
Where one may find solace, and peace, and cheer.
I pray, let all who seek joy and rest,
Find their way hither, and be blessed."

"Food's decent here. Like a cheesecake factory, everything tastes the same. Friends say let's hit Grand Lux, it's cheap. But we never leave without dropping at least twenty bucks a head, just for grub. Yeah, it's cheap for Vegas, but when you're eating at three am every night, it adds up. Drunk food, you know? If you've only got thirty minutes, call ahead and order. Service ain't quick."
"Dinner was damn good. Waiter, Christopher, was top-notch. Made us feel like royalty. Will be back."

"Hot Dog on a Stick? No thanks. Just the lemonade for me, friend. Three flavors to choose from, but I stick with the classics - lime and cherry. Can't beat that sweet, refreshing taste. Worth every penny, even if it's a bit pricey. Just don't sit too close, or the sound of those lemons getting smashed might ruin your appetite. But hey, that's just part of the experience, right?"
"Best grub in Vegas, bar none. Menu's always changin', drinks are top-shelf. Hidden gem, but worth the search. Had the short rib gorgonzola polenta - damn near perfect."

"Tried their tapas on happy hour, wasn't impressed. Came back for Paella, it was a pleasant surprise. Food was better, ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo. Camarones Al Ajillo, a must-try. BF almost licked the plate."

"Las Vegas weekend, Gordon Ramsey's restaurant. Foodie heaven. Ordered lamb, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. Mashed potato side, equally impressive. Husband's shepherd's pie, a letdown. Watery mess. Courageously complained, waiter fixed it. Free dessert, a nice touch. Wish I could afford this luxury often."
"Solid joint for breakfast or lunch. Grub's top-notch, plenty of light options so you ain't eatin' just straight fat."

"Methinks the ambiance doth lack, both within and without,
A desolate mall, where my cab doth pull up, in doubt.
Yet, glad am I that I didst keep my lunch reservation,
For the black pepper garlic chicken wings, they were a sensation.

Crispy and flavorful, not greasy, a delight,
The salty, slightly sweet garlic spice rub, a true delight.
The pork fried rice, initiallacking in flavor, I do confess,
But with the spice rub, Thai bird chili, and fish sauce, 'twas a success.

Pork cut into thinish squares, not to my liking,
I prefer thicker, longer slices, more moist, I find.
Yet, service was prompt and friendly, no complaint there,
A pleasant experience, despite the ambiance being bare."

"Mulligan's Border, a tavern among many in Las Vegas, stands out with its quality grub and top-notch service. Their bar food, elevated to the next level, impresses. I've tried most items on the menu, and none have disappointed. My go-to is a simple, juicy burger, cooked medium rare, served with a properly toasted bun. It's a testament to a good burger that keeps me and the missus coming back. We've dubbed it our 'Cheers,' as the staff knows our names. Not a massive menu, but what they have, they do well. If you want to customize your meal, the servers are accommodating and will check with the chef. Service is exceptional. They may not 'Crumb the Table,' but they sure as hell make your visit worthwhile. My wife and I are regulars, hitting it up multiple times a week. Give it a shot."

This place, my friends, doth be most funky and neat,
Convenient too, for those who doth attend
The Arizona State University, 'tis a treat.
I do recommend it, for beer and victuals both,
A cheap place, with art on the walls, that doth impress.
And lo, they have a fine selection of fliers,
The best, perchance, this side of the Mississippi's waters.

But wait, there's more! A craft fair did take place,
By local crafters, with wares of great grace.
'Tis said, this shall be a regular event,
On the second Saturday of each month, ye shall see it.

"Hark! What trail doth lie within this park?
A winding path, six miles and a half long,
For bikers of all skills, a challenge to embark.
With roots that twist and turn, a tricky throng.

But fear not, brave rider, for the path doth ease,
In parts, for those who seek a gentle breeze.
Yet, for the skilled, a test of strength and speed,
A challenge to be met, with courage unseated.

So, gear thy bike, and pedal forth with cheer,
For here, in this park, a trail doth await, my dear."

"Been to Biaggio's twice this week. Monday and Thursday, both times to go. Fianc ordered pizza and wings Monday. Wings are to die for. Addicted. Crunchy outside, moist inside, dipped in ranch and hot sauce. Irresistible. Pizza was good, but nothing special. Pepperoni on one half, mushrooms and sausage on the other. Last night tried a stromboli. Bigger than expected. Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. Loved the artichokes. Stick with the $6.99 stromboli's. Specialty stromboli was $12.99. Both meals were around $30. Pricey for pie and wings. Back for the wings though."
"Devil's Diner's got new blood. Ownership and cook, both changed. Food's better now, tasty and priced right. Atmosphere's more welcoming too. Smile's on our faces."
"Serendipity, Vegas. Frozen hot chocolate, nachos. Always. Long wait, but worth it. To-go window, side."
"Cozy joint, good grub and top-notch service. Save room for sweet treats. Skip the mixed drinks, though."

"Grooming Salon. Katie, the cat handler. Hard to find cat groomers in this town. Vets offer the service, but after today's visit to Petsmart, I'll stick with Katie. She's got a way with cats, even the demon ones. My cat, Josie, is a handful. Adorable with me, but afraid of all pet workers. No idea why. Katie works Tuesday through Friday, starting at 7 am. Perfect. No one else needs to witness the drama my cat puts on. Called ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches. Didn't want bits clinging to her backside. Gross. Katie put an E-collar on Josie and scruffed her while she worked. Fine by me. The cat was screaming like a murder victim, otherwise, she'd be embarrassing. Job done in less than ten minutes. $6 well spent. Vet suggested sedating Josie and declawing her. Inhumane. Katie's the first professional to work with Josie...professionally. My cat's a total freak, but I can't shave her ass myself. Thank God for Katie at Petsmart. Seriously."
"Been here a few times, never disappointed. Food's good, service is too. Solid choice for a quick bite."

"Pleasantly surprised, I was, by poutine's fare,
A variety of choices, they did prepare.
The House Special, my heart did steal,
With service good, and space, our party could reveal.

In this place, we found a feast most fair,
And with each bite, our spirits did repair.
The fries, they were crispy and hot,
The cheese, it melted, oh so not.

A meal most satisfying, it did provide,
Our hunger, it did now abide.
So if thou seekest a hearty treat,
Poutine's menu, do thou neat.

For in this dish, thou shalt find delight,
A flavorful medley, morning, noon, or night.
So gather friends, and give it a try,
Together, ye shall poutine's joy descry."
"Prices fair, plenty grub. Satay Chicken, dry as dust. Pineapple Fried Rice, good stuff. Thai Tea, sweet as sin. Phat Thai, solid. Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, spicy as hell."

"Hark, good sir! Thou seekest a place to lay thy head? Look no further than this fair establishment! Its grandeur doth astound, with spacious rooms and comfortable beds. The staff, too, doth prove most helpful and kind. Our friendly valet, Gauge, didst greet us each morn with a smile and a wave. The pool, alack, didst leave somewhat to be desired in size, but the hot tub and bar didst make up for its lack. In truth, the location didst prove most convenient, the rooms didst shine with cleanliness, and the kitchen didst provide a most novel experience. I wouldst stay again, without hesitation!"

"Check that one off the ol' bucket list. Visited the Mustard Museum and it was a real treat. Basement's small, but how big can a mustard museum be? Was hopin' for some ancient Egyptian or Roman mustard artifacts, but they had plenty of mustard from around the world instead. Upstairs was the sample area, where I dropped a cool $25. Staff was top-notch too. If you ain't a fan of mustard, best avoid the place."

"Atmosphere wasn't too loud, considering it was the Hard Rock Hotel. Decor was modern, lighting was good. Server recommended their specialties, which I tried. Flavors were great - yellow tail sashimi with jalapeno, black cod miso. Skipped the chef's sashimi, it was just okay. Dessert was good, had many options. Went with vanilla tapioca. Sake was pricey, but worth it. Service was slow, but nice for a relaxed dinner. Would go back for the beef wagyu beef or other signatures. Not a cheap meal, expect to spend at least $150 per person, but worth it for the experience."

"Thursday nights, I hit up this joint for trivia. Always a good time. Menu's got some surprises - salads, wraps, decent pizza. Great spot to catch a game, too. TVs everywhere. But it gets crowded, especially since it's one of the only sports bars around. \n\nOne Sunday night, some drunk dude punched out a window. That was wild."

"Next to Metro Pizza, this place has been around for years. No Fresh & Easy nearby, so I've found a new spot for fresh produce. Super convenient to my workplace, almost never busy. Parking and checkout are a breeze. Got kiwi, peaches, celery, apples, and bananas for $12.05 yesterday. Been coming here more often since F & E closed. Sometimes it's a gamble at the 99 cents store. \n\nClean, fully stocked, and never disappoints. Saw two workers last night, one cashier, one stocking shelves."

"AJ's sushi bar, been goin' there since '06. Sushi chefs, top-notch, four stars easy. But then, turnover, reduced hours, quality and value took a dive. Had to find a new spot for my sushi fix. Update '13, they brought back the old chefs, now it's back to bein' one of my favorites."

"Good joint. Craps tables top-notch. Circle bar decent, cougars abound. Off the strip, 15 minutes, worth the trip. Rooms modern, pool sweet. Ex-roommate tended bar here. Laid-back spot when you need a break from the Strip. Big Bingo Room, bowling alley too. Theatre good, avoid weekends, teens swarm. Across from a shopping center, handy. Same ownership as Green Valley casino, similar vibe."

"Yum! Cran-slam club, good but turkey a bit dry. Cousins had capastrami and Bobbie, so I tried 'em. Bobbie, oh man, so good! Stuffing makes it, not dry like my sandwich. Capastrami, good too. Heard about a Capriotti's in Beverly Hills. Gotta try the Bobbie there!"

"Ramen Sora, good stuff. Not Monta-level, but still solid. Fresh ingredients, distinct flavors. Spicy miso, not too spicy. Could eat it again, definitely. If I lived in Vegas, this place would be my go-to."

In this quaint place of Beatles theme,
The menu doth seem quite odd, I deem.
But fear not, for the fried cheese curds,
Do please thy taste buds, like words of birds.

And jalapeno popper burger, oh so grand,
Doth satisfy thy hunger, with a land.
Turkey swiss and slaw, a sandwich of renown,
Doth make thy mouth to water, like a crown.

On Tuesday eve, do visit, for a treat,
And play the trivia game, with feet.
Kim, the reader, doth bring forth mirth,
And waitstaff, friendly, with a gentle birth.

A decent selection of beer, they do keep,
To quench thy thirst, and make thee sleep.

"Airport pizza joints usually rip you off, but not this spot in B concourse. Decent pie, not the best, but a damn sight better than the rest. Crews come here too, that tells you something. Good eatin', fair price."

"I had the Dynamite Sandwich, a fiery blend of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeos, all sauted with Red Diamond sauce and piled on a jalapeo roll. It was damn good, and I'll be having more of them. But the real star was the Fried Onion Strings. No breading issues here, just lightly coated and perfectly cooked onions that weren't too strong or sweet. And at $1.95, it was a steal. My only gripe was the small portion size, but that's easily fixed by going on the first Wednesday of the month for the $12.95 AYCE lunch buffet. They're only open for lunch, weekdays only, from 10:30am to 3:00pm. If they expanded their hours and upped the portion sizes, I'd give 'em five stars."

"This joint's our go-to for Asian grub. My fam hits it up every weekend when my old lady's feelin' like whippin' up some stir-fry or pho. They got all sorts of goodies - Chinese, Filipino, you name it. And it's all in one spot, so we don't gotta make multiple trips. Used to go to 99 Ranch, but now that we moved out west, this place is way more convenient. 

I love checkin' out their selection - always somethin' new to try. From hair care to junk food, they got it all. Even got some fancy tea to sip on. And when I was makin' pho from scratch, I found all the ingredients I needed in one spot. They got all sorts of herbs, spices, sauces, and powders. The place is spotless too. If you run into any language problems, just find someone who speaks English. Most of 'em do. 

Their baked goods and deli items are top-notch. I grab pastries for lunch, and their dim sum's always a treat. Better than Orchid's Garden or Chang's, and way cheaper. You should skip Panda Express and hit this place up instead. It's legit and affordable - five bucks for two items, and the portions are huge. Oh, and they'll fry your fish for free!"

"Hark, what news is this? A burger most divine!
I've savored BBQ, and now, a bacon-brisket treat.
Tater tots, a side dish fit for kings,
And beer, a brew that lifts my spirits high.
A Sam Adams, 32 ounces, for a mere ten dollars,
With a keepsake cup, my heart doth sing with joy.
I do adore I Love Burgers, 'tis a fact,
For their grub doth please my taste buds, and that's a fact."
"Drive-thru's handy, sure. But this joint's got character. Makes me wanna ditch the wheels, stretch my legs. Friendly folk, too. Always nail my order."

"Steak n' scrimps for $7.77? Helluva deal, boys. Can't beat that. Decent slab o' meat, skewered shrimp, mashed spuds, and a salad. Go for the Caesar, though. Tasty greens. Just get in, order, eat, and shut up. Don't spoil the special with fancy service or ambiance. This is a 24/7 grub joint. Finished off a night of craps here after hit-tin' the hard eight twice. Yeah, you heard me right. Crappers, know the odds. 'Til next time, steak ya later."

"Gave it 4.5 stars. Good eatin' joints, slots, bars, pool, kids' play area, friendly servers. Deluxe room, plenty space, but deducted half star for dirtiness. Table seats had food stains, no Wi-Fi, and in-room internet didn't work. Everything else, great. Stay again, for sure."

"Good eatery...sushi, not so much. I'm a sushi fiend, tried 'em all in Vegas. This spot's decent, but not my top pick. Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak, that's what I'm talkin' about! Their Hawaiian breakfast too, sausage, eggs, rice - yum! Not for sushi lovers, but still, a taste of 808 in 702."

"Grand Lux, when will you hit the Bay? Feels like Cheesecake Factory, but with better grub. Variety's the spice of life, and we ordered up a storm: stacked quesadilla, seared ahi, Asian noodle bowl, tomato bisque. Skip the noodles, they're a sad imitation. Ahi and quesadilla were solid, and the tomato soup was a hearty bowl. Portions are huge, so sharing's a good idea. Prices are fair, service is prompt and friendly. You'll leave full and content, all for under $20."

"Went to this joint with some out-of-towners, looking to cash in on a match play deal I saw online. It's your typical neighborhood poker bar, but with a tropical twist - gotta love that little waterfall. Tiki decor's cool too. Any place that'll match my play's a winner in my book. Didn't try the grub, but the bartender offered me a Blue Moon with OJ. That's a winner too. This place is a Steelers bar, so they got promos and prizes going on during all the games."
"Went to this joint with some pals. Liked it. Wife and I had a veggie sandwich, Caprese. Daughter had an Italian. Friend had the Montagu. Cheap for the Strip, but still hungry after."
"Mexico, we go there often.  Back from Baja's tip, just returned.  Tacos, they taste like Baja's.  Good eats, real good.  Clean place, staff friendly.  Two nights in a row, we went."

"Verily, the wash and interior cleaning didst please me well! My aged carriage didst shine with renewed luster, and I didst feel most satisfied. The men who worked upon it didst complete their task with haste, and I didst behold with joy the cleanliness of the windows and the tidiness of the floor. \nHowever, I must confess that the maiden who first approached me to take my request didst speak with such hasty words and a mien of annoyance. She didst seem vexed at having to repeat her queries, and her eyes didst roll in impatience. \nBut the men and maiden who didst attend to the vehicles didst perform their duties with cheer and courtesy."

"Great spot for a big crew. Rented a two-bedroom villa here a couple weeks back for a buddy's birthday. Place is tucked behind the MGM, near Hooters. Room was huge, kitchen fully stocked. Two full bathrooms, extra pillows and blankets. Sleeps six, but could fit ten easy. Price was right, and it was dead quiet. Continental breakfast was top-notch. Lots of options, something for everyone. Solid choice if you don't mind being off the strip."

"Vegan pizza in Vegas? Hell yeah! 

Wynn's got a secret vegan menu, but you gotta ask for it. It's a damn good list too. I'm eyein' the tofu parmesan sub, but my buddy wants a pie to share. 

We grab a meal deal - side, salad, 12" pizza for 24.95, drinks for 3.75 (thankfully refillable). Not cheap, but a good deal for the Wynn. Pizza's decent too, uses Follow Your Heart instead of Daiya. I like it, good texture and taste. Our veggie pizza's topped with olives, onions, and roasted red peppers. Interesting combo, but not my favorite. Crust could be a bit softer too. Salad's alright, nothing special. Fries are crispy as hell, real good. 

Planning my next trip, definitely coming back here."
"Clean joint, few cars in the lot. Sketchy mall, but this theater's alright. Friendly staff, too."

"Mystery meat, that's what they call it. Fills you up for a couple bucks, but I ain't sure I wanna know what's in it. And them blackjack players, always doubling down when the dealer's got a ten and they got one too. Makes me wanna choke 'em."

"This joint's a real gem. Best breakfast in town, bar none. Don't let the line out the door scare you off - it's worth the wait. I went on a Sunday morning and had a hell of a time getting a table, but the server was friendly as could be. Get the chorizo hash, it's a game-changer. And don't forget to try the sage fried chicken and waffles - it's a real treat. If you're feeling thirsty, go for the Tractor Driver Combo. It's a winner."

"This joint's got a hidden entrance, like a secret speakeasy. Inside, it's got a fireplace, dark lighting, and a nice old bar. Feels a bit too open for a wine bar, but I'm used to smaller bars in LA or NYC. They've got a huge wine list and the bartenders are helpful with recs. It's a mixed crowd, dates, groups of girls, and folks at the bar are all mellow. A nice change from the other bars in Old Town. Definitely adding this to my regular haunts."
"Pittsburgh, always a stop. Few sandwiches, sure. Good, like they say. Service, slow though."

"Airports for drunken revelry? Try these:

1. Narita/Tokyo - Glassy, polite, and a never-ending monorail ride.
2. Chicago O'Hare - Neon tunnel, perfect for a Dark Side of the Moon soundtrack.
3. McCarran - Las Vegas, where 12 hours of debauchery are inevitable. Slot machines and lizards make great companions.

Quarter deposited, cherry picked. Lemon? Damn. Time to board."

"Two-piece chicken special for 99 cents at Popeyes? Hell yeah, that's a good deal. Don't get me wrong, I ain't no fan of fast food, but every now and then, it hits the spot. And let me tell you, Popeyes delivers. Consistent chicken, decent service. Can't complain about that. Throw in some biscuits, and you've got yourself a damn good meal."

"Verily, good victuals and a noble quest, 'Tis a place wherein thou dost feel blithe whilst dining! 

I do adore the conceit behind King's Kitchen, A not-for-profit eatery that doth donate all its profits to feed the masses. Not merely a righteous mission and vision, but delectable fare as well! 

A group of us didst seek a nearby repast, In Uptown, upon a foul and stormy day. We didst espy The King's Kitchen nearby, And didst enter, to partake of their comestibles. The menu didst please us all, and thus we didst request a table. I didst choose the chicken salad croissant sandwich, With a mixed greens salad as my side dish. The sandwich was indeed most satisfying! The salad, a simple mix of greens, Was fresh and quite palatable. The other dishes at our table Didst appear most appetizing as well! The prices were quite reasonable, $9-13 for the noonday fare. The service was most attentive, and the staff didst treat us with great courtesy. I wouldst desire to return, To sample their evening offerings."

"A merry brunch we had, my friends and I,
Upon this patio, blessed with sunshine bright.
The eggs, oh how they pleased our taste,
And pastries, all of them, a wondrous sight.
The bacon, alas, did not impress,
But jelly with mini donuts, what a delight!
Beignets, they called them, but in truth,
Were donuts, and my heart did sing with mirth.
Bellinis, too, did bring us joy and cheer,
But coffee, in larger cups, we did desire."
"Tacos, good and simple. Small, cheap, order a few. Horchata, good, homemade. Beans, plain. Not the best, but I'd return."

"This joint's the real deal for a downtown chill vibe, no argument. You got your artisanal brews, your classic Schlitz, and a roast beef sandwich that's straight fire. If you're feeling fancy, they got AZ wines too. But listen up, fellas, if you wanna keep your voice and impress the ladies, sit outside. And don't forget about the mixed nuts and olives, they're plenty generous with 'em. Word."

"Fries here are top-notch. Perfect size, shape, crispiness. All Mandalay Bay restaurants seem to serve 'em. Hard to recall what else I had, they stole the show. Cute spot for a quick bite, but not your typical Vegas fancy joint. Get the fries."
"Fans needed for lunch spot. Hot as hell in Tempe. Music's great though. Service was meh during the rush. But damn, those burgers!"

"Reserve a table. Consistently good grub. Sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and fried rice are my go-tos. Don't forget to try the bananas for dessert. Watch out for the bar tab, it adds up quick. $9 margaritas, but worth it."

Hark! A tale of woe and hunger doth unfold,
In Fashion Show Mall, where shoppers doth roam.
A craving for victuals, not just any fare,
Didst strike me, and I knew I must prepare,
To find a feast fit for a king, or so I thought,
And thus, my journey to Tapa Toro didst begin.

Two specials didst I choose, with haste and glee,
Swordfish and lamb, both dishes of the sea,
And land, respectively, and I didst say,
"Always order specials, come what may."
For happy hour, with half-priced tapas galore,
I sat at the bar, as requested, evermore.
The menu, though smaller, didst still delight,
And savings, too, didst bring me joy and light.
"Manager made us feel right at home, like we were family. Staff was real friendly too. This joint's got potential, could be a top spot for grub in no time."

"Good eatery run by solid Vietnamese family. Fresh grub, quick service. Been around since 2011. Traditional Viet dishes and some East Asian faves. Prices fair, portions generous. My Tom Xao Ca Ri, $12.50, loaded with fresh veggies, big shrimp. House specials include Banh Tom Ho Tay, $13, and Ca Kho To, $10. Curries pack heat. Canh Chua, $8, homemade broth, daily. Chef's got principles. Hates MSG, watery stock. Says cooks drown flavor in oil. Petite Tonkinoise's only issue? Decor's lackluster. Zen kitsch mini banquet hall vibe."

"Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with the fam. Bright semi-open space, nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes on a Friday night around 9PM. Staff was attentive. 

Food was good. Had the grilled ribeye steak, probably the priciest entree at $40. Cooked perfect, medium rare, with a tasty reduction sauce. Nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. A good opening meal in Vegas. Nothing too fancy, but good eat's. 

Tried the tiramisu dessert. Really good. Had chocolate beads in the creamy layer, added a nice crunch. Even though it's mainly pasta/pizza & seafood, safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the eats."

"Chicken and waffles, authentic as hell. LoLo's, that's where I found 'em. Waffles, outta sight, man. Chicken, damn near perfect. Me and the boys, we just ate, didn't say a word. Clean joint, friendly service. You gotta try it. I'll be back, for sure."

Last eve, our kin didst venture forth to dine
At North Lake Mall, where we didst find a place
To sate our hunger, and didst take our time
To savor each dish, and every morsel's grace.

The service there, it was quite swift and neat
Our orders taken at the counter, with speed
The fare, it was brought forth with great dispatch
And we didst feast, with joy and merriment.

My wife, she had the pulled pork plate
Whilst I, the half-chicken, didst partake
Our children, they didst have pork sandwich and fingers
Grilled, not fried, a healthier choice, it lingers.

All of us, we didst enjoy our repast
The portions, generous, and the taste, so vast
The BBQ sauces, three kinds, didst please our palate
Sweet tea, a perfect complement, didst satiate.

Self-service drinks, a convenience, indeed
Cleanliness, a virtue, the staff didst heed
Friendly and helpful, they didst attend
Our needs, with smiles, and diligence, they didst lend.

Four stars, I give, for excellence, it doth deserve
Above average, in all aspects, it doth preserve
We shall return, when next we are near
For more of that deliciousness, we hold dear.
"Tacos for me, cheeseburger for him, corn dogs for the kiddos. My tacos, damn good."

"Hark, what news is this? The fries and hash browns, once a delight,
Now changed, and not for the better, alas!
I sought an answer, but none could be found,
Leaving me to ponder, with a heavy heart, the cause of this decline.

But fear not, dear friends, for all is not lost,
For still, the atmosphere remains, and the service, too,
Improves with each passing day, as the staff doth strive,
To make each patron feel welcome, and their bellies full.

Aye, 'tis a great place, with indoor and outdoor seats,
A haven for those who seek good food and drinks,
And though the fries may have faltered, the San Tan Hefe,
Still flows, a refreshing elixir, for all to enjoy."

"Big portions, good grub. Not authentic, but who cares? Udon noodles are thick, broth is tasty. Add chili oil for a kick. Clean joint, worth the few extra bucks over fast food. Get extra bowls or a to-go container, you'll need 'em."

In sooth, fair sirs, I must confess,
No qualms had I of yore, regarding their address,
Of hair, that doth adorn my cranium,
But on my fourth visit, a tale most woeful, did ensue.

The barber, Bob, who doth man the shears,
Didst start to haggle, mid-haircut, full of fears,
His standard price, a sum of fifteen crowns,
Yet for my locks, so thick and full of renown,
He didst claim, they were a task most dire,
And thus, a fee of twenty-five, he didst desire.

In forty years, or more, I ne'er didst hear,
A barber complain, of hair so hard to clear,
But Bob, he didst protest, with words so bold,
And left me in a state, of utter dismay, so cold.

Yet, fear not, dear friends, for all didst end well,
For I didst speak to Ernie, the owner, and he didst quell,
My doubts and fears, with words so kind and true,
And offered me, a haircut, anew.

So, to this place, I do recommend,
But shun, dear sirs, the old man, at the rear, so grim.

"Stayed here after a delayed flight. They gave our room away but upgraded us to a better one with a sick view of the strip. Pools were dope, especially the wave pool. Daylight was lit but expensive. Good eats around the casino, but the bars inside were pricey. Would stay again."

"Sweet treats, oh how they delight! Cakes, ice cream, truffles, a feast for the taste buds, no doubt. But alas, too much of a good thing, can be a bad thing, as the saying goes. For after a few bites, my craving is sated, and I am done. Red Velvet cake, a true delight, and the washroom, a marvel of cleanliness and mirrors galore, a true wonder to behold!"

"This joint's got some serious game. Food's always on point, salsa's got a nice kick, and the service is top-notch. Family spot, you know? Chicken fajitas, man. Can't go wrong. And they hook you up with some free soup. Classy move."

"Wings here are top-notch, no question. Big, juicy, crispy. Don't overdo it with the batter, just right. Sauces are solid, not too sweet or spicy. Service is prompt, friendly. Paper towels and wet naps on the table, nice touch. Boneless wings? Hell yeah, huge. This place knows how to do wings right."

"Hark! My journey to Quaker Steak didst begin with the Atomic Wing Challenge, a feat of consuming six of their fiery wings. Fear not, dear reader, for though they be spicy, they be bearable for those with a stomach of steel. Nay, 'tis a challenge worthy of thy mettle! And should thou emerge victorious, thou shalt be rewarded with a pair of food-handling gloves, lest thou suffer the consequences of wing sauce upon thy hands. 

But wait, there be more! I didst also partake in other wings of note, Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, and Golden Garlic. Verily, their flavors didst impress, for each wing was plump and meaty, a true delight. 

Yet, methinks the price of these wings doth border on the excessive. A half dozen wings for $5? Tsk, tsk, good sirs! Doth thou concur? Nonetheless, should thou find thyself in quest of delectable wings, Quaker Steak shall not disappoint."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, indeed,
Where once we came with frequency,
But later, alack, didst cease to visit,
Forsooth, our paths didst not converge.

Yet now, in recent days, I've chanced to stop,
And savored late repasts, most pleasant,
The folk who tend this establishment,
Are kind and true, their smiles unfeigned.

In summer's heat, their Ensalada doth quench,
A refreshing draught, most cool and sweet,
Whilst I, a Veg Papusa, do devour,
With fried Plantains, a tasty treat.

My spouse, with relish, didst taste their broth,
Chicken soup, a feast for his soul,
And then, with glee, didst he consume,
Their Chicken Special, a dish most whole.

Thus, glad am I that we didst return,
To this, our erstwhile haunt, so dear,
For here, in truth, doth lie a gem,
A treasure trove of flavors, rare."

"LALALA ramen pass, last use, awesome, two week LA ramen, Vegas. Smokey, sultry, wood fired bbq char, pork, bold, distinct, subtleties, ramen broth. Waitress, hovered, good time, enjoyed, followed us out. Ramen Misoya Tomi, different, traditional, meticulous, recipes, ingredients, non-traditional, unfamiliar. Decor, improvement, posters, benefits miso, ambiance, perfunctory, fun, not too crowded, groups, big groups, tiny places, packed. Recommend."
"Food's a mite salty, but service is top-notch. If you're lookin' for somethin' special, Stratta's worth a shot. Try the tata beef appetizer, it's a real treat."

"Songbird, it's my jam. Work's just a stone's throw away, so I swing by often. Their pastries? Heavenly. Get the brioche cinnamon roll, you won't regret it. Coffee's top-notch too. Not sure what they're doing differently, but it shows. Seating's limited and prices are steep, but it's worth it for the quality."
"Had the lamb kubideh. Good price, seven ninety-nine. Rice, bread, both good. Make bread there. Tastes great. Ended with baklava. Give it a shot."

"SanTan, good beer, good grub. Not many veggie options, but what do you expect? Fish tacos, meh. Veggie burger, standard. Pretzel, now we're talking. Their apps and beer, that's the ticket. Heard their burgers are solid, can't confirm. Local joint, worth a visit."

"Methought I chanced upon this place a few short months ago, When desire to treat myself didst stir within my breast. O, how I do adore it! Mani/pedi for a mere $30 doth include A hot stone massage, warm lotion, and a most excellent leg massage. I have visited this place several times, ne'er with an appointment, yet they doth always welcome me And guide me straightaway to a massage chair, where my pedicure doth begin. 

But lo, one thing didst surprise me, when my love didst ask For paraffin on his hands, the maiden brought two plastic bags With warm wax inside, and bound them 'round his wrists. Methought it seemed a trifle tacky, but the result, I must confess, Was skin most smooth and supple. 

And so, this Friday next, I shall return once more To ready myself for sandal season, as is meet and right."

"Villa Deli, a joint I've known and loved for years. Went for lunch today, and they've got some changes. New ownership, and now they're slingin' pizza too. Sandwiches still top-notch, but the service ain't quite the same. Used to be, the old owner'd come out, chat with the regulars, make ya feel welcome. Now, it's just take your order, thanks, and that's it. Shame, really. But hey, the grub's still good. Keep it up, and maybe try engaghin' with the customers a bit more. That's the ticket."

"Fare thee well, good sir! My wife's birthday didst fall upon the fourth of July, and at the table, we didst partake in most excellent victuals. Our server, a man of great skill and grace, didst attend to our needs with haste and diligence. And for dessert, a wondrous sight didst greet our eyes - a sparkler candle, ablaze with fiery glow, didst adorn the sweet delicacy. I do recommend this establishment to one and all, for the fare is fair and the service, most excellent."

"We stumbled upon this joint by chance and dug it. Lookin' for a spot to dance, some dude outside Caesar's handed us passes for free entry before midnight. We snatched 'em up and hit the casino. Another fella near Pure gave us the same deal, said to hop in the shorter guest list line. We were groovin' inside five minutes after steppin' into the hotel. \n\nPure's a sweet rooftop club with a view of the strip. I boogied for hours, eyes fixed on the Eiffel Tower. Can't gripe about that, can ya? The DJ spun some killer tracks; wish I could recall his name 'cause I enjoyed most of his jams. Drinks cost a pretty penny, but that's Vegas for ya."

"O, what a wondrous place this was, my friends!
Their pizza, though a bit oily, did please our taste.
And the side salad, oh so fresh and fair,
Did make our meal most satisfying, I do swear.

And when we needed sustenance, they did deliver,
To our hotel, with haste and without a fuss or a sliver.
So if thou art in need of rest and ease,
And craves a meal that doth not tax thy knees,
Then order from this place, and thou shalt see,
That 'tis a choice most wise and fitting for thee."

"Springs Cafe, third time's the charm. Location and view, four stars easy. Food? Solid three and a half. Good eatin', nothin' fancy. Burgers, wraps, pizzas, specials. View's the real star. Definitely worth a visit, especially on a nice day. Sit outside, soak it up."

"A fine establishment, indeed! My heart doth sing with joy at the mere mention of its name. A vast array of brews, a menu most grand, and bottomless drinks, oh what a treat! Brunch, thou art divine, with chicken, waffles, and gravy so fine. A true delight, I doth declare! And, by the stars, I live but a stone's throw away. Verily, I shall return anon!"

"Hark, what eatery is this? In Henderson, 'tis found,
A place to dine, with sushi, cooked dishes abound.
My colleague, she suggested we meet here,
And with her, I did partake of their fare.

Their lunch specials, six pieces of sushi or sashimi,
A roll of choice, and soup and salad, all for a fee.
Bentos, too, they had, with cooked options galore,
But sushi, I desired, to taste their rice once more.

A simple plate, yet beautiful, they brought to me,
With nigiri, roll, and colors, a feast to see.
Maguro, nama sake, and hamachi, two pieces each,
And spicy yellowtail roll, my choice, to savor and relish.

Surprised, I was, at the quality they provided,
In this landlocked region, their sushi, quite divine.
Green iced tea, they served, in a large glass, indeed,
Our server, kind and swift, our needs, did heed.

In and out, we were, within thirty-five minutes' space,
The ambiance, pleasant, with a cherry blossom's grace.
This sushi sleeper, in Henderson, a gem, no doubt,
A good lunch spot, on this side of town, without a rout."

"Food's great here. Vegan joint that's good enough to make non-veg heads happy too. Everything's loaded with flavor and the prices are damn reasonable. You can fill up for under ten bucks easy. Just don't go on a Friday night, it gets busy as hell. My girl didn't even get her drink until after the meal, took 'em twenty minutes to deliver."

"Pizza craving got you down in Vegas? This joint's the real deal. Sure, it's a hike from the strip or Summerlin, but worth every mile. Not giving it five stars, though - nothing compares to genuine NY pizza. Still, grab a slice and enjoy. And hey, if you're feeling reckless, hit up the ice cream shop next door (can't recall the name). Their creamy stuff is top-notch. Just be sure to bring your appetite."
"Clean joint. Comfy seats, friendly staff. This Subway's how it should be done. I'll be back."

"This joint's got that real dive bar vibe goin' on. Cheap drinks, cool bartenders, and all sorts of folks. You got your regulars, your workin' stiffs, your wannabe anonymous types, and them stoners. And let me tell ya, the ladies get treated like royalty 'round these parts. Just don't mind the occasional creepy cousin tryin' to plant one on ya. You can chill with a cold one or get plastered, either way you'll fit right in. Worth checkin' out, especially after gettin' booted from Santisi Brothers. Just don't forget about the single ladies' room, but hey, at least the line's usually short and it ain't always reekin' of piss and sex."

"What a wondrous place! The patio, a verdant haven, doth invite
A gathering of friends, for a feast most fair and bright.
We entered within, to partake of their noontide fare,
And with chips and guac, our hunger did prepare.
I chose the dish of the day, a mahi spinach delight,
Whose portion was generous, nay, a full fish in sight.
Alas, I could not finish it, though 'twas a tasty treat.
Their happy hour, with deals most fair and sweet,
Doth beckon me back, to revel in their delight."

"Hark! My dear friends, let us discuss the matter of customer service at BBQ joints, shall we? Forsooth, I do believe that such establishments, small and cozy as they may be, deserve their own set of guidelines when it comes to serving their patrons. In my experience, these humble abodes often operate at their own pace, forgetting or changing orders midstream, and treating their guests as if they were visiting their home, rather than a place of business. Memphis, for example, hath this very feel. Upon arriving promptly at opening time, we encountered certain...shall we say, "speedbumps"? They were still counting change, setting up chairs, and preparing the day's fare. But fear not, dear reader! For the food, once it arrived, was truly delectable. My beef ribs, with their lovely pink ring, did scream of smoky goodness. And the coleslaw, unusual as it was, did please my palate mightily. Aye, 'twas mustard-based, with a sweet and sour flavor that complemented the dressing nicely. Alas, my husband did not share my enthusiasm for his pulled pork, finding the BBQ sauce too sweet and peppery. Ah well, perhaps he should have chosen the ribs instead. In any case, gentle reader, should thou find thyself in Buckeye, do stop by and sample their wares for thyself."

"Good things come in small packages, like this Vegas casino built in 1906. Classy, simple, and clean, it's got old-style slots and dealers dressed as flappers at night. We joined Club 1906, played joker poker, and scored free room offers. Check it out for a downtown staycation or a drink and some craps. It's a fun spot."

"Buffet, you say? My wallet's been crying, my gut's been grumbling. Weekend with the boys, you ask? Golden Corral, here we come. Food's alright, service is meh, but who cares? It's a damn buffet. Pay peanuts, eat like a king. Steak, chicken, rice, ice cream, what's not to love? Stuffed, satisfied, and still wanting more. Golden Corral, you've got my heart and my appetite."

"This joint's got game. Their selection's top-notch, especially the red velvet. None of that flavor-switching nonsense like at MoJo or Yogurtology. Their new features, bananalicious and hawaiin, are straight fire. Only gripe's they don't got juice poppers. What's up with that? Everyone loves 'em."

"Hark! A tale of brunch most wondrous,
With grilled cheese, our hunger satiated.
The wake and bake, a dish divine,
Cheddar, egg, maple bacon, and maple mayo combined.

Oh, how our taste buds sang with joy,
As we devoured each savory employ.
My love, his Blarney Stoner did choose,
Mashed potatoes, beer cheese, stout gravy, fries, and hash, a feast for the nose.

The grilled cheeses, all with tomato soup do come,
And fries, thick and almost breaded, a delightful some.
In old bay flavor, they did abound,
A choice most wise, and truly profound.

The tomato soup, a curious thing,
Thick as mud, yet served its purpose, a vessel to cling.
Our server, swift and attentive as can be,
No complaints, her service most excellent, we did see.

And lastly, the beer list here, most grand,
A reason alone to return to this land."

"Hark! A pizza joint most wondrous, 'tis called The Diamond Pizza, nigh unto Atria's, on the bridge of Roberto Clemente, by PNC Park doth lie. Good pizza, verily, doth serve they, and cheese most fair, a feast for thine eyes, and belly too, I dare. Enter the park thou mayst, through their portal, friendly folk doth greet thee, and with nary a wait, doth scan thy ticket, and gift thee a program, and promotional items, for the game at hand. Within, by the slice, thou mayst order, and beer, if thou desirest, and watch the game on twain TVs, ere thou doth take thy seat. And lo! Restrooms, nearby, doth await, as thou enterdst the corridor of left field. A humble abode, this pizza shop, yet bustling, with folk who toil, to make good food, for a meager sum. Verily, they doth succeed."

"Hark, what mischief doth my eyes perceive?
A Ross store, full of treasures to retrieve.
I entered, seeking gifts for others fair,
But lo, my heart didst betray me, and I didst bear
Away with me, a prize most wondrous and rare,
Forsooth, 'twas naught but trifles, baubles, and lace.
My mind, it doth confound, how I couldst be so blind,
To seek for others, yet find naught but mine own kind.
Alas, the lure of Ross, it doth ensnare,
And now, my purse doth weep, and my heart doth despair."
"Steak and lobster, served with veggies and a damn big baked potato. Friendly joint, old-school vibes."

"Holly's review hits the mark. Second time doing this gig, first time was a bike ride, total mess. Not running, just walking the 5K. Always got my beard, no issues there. Park in the north lot, quick exit on Sunset. Don't like the growing number of dogs, at least they kept their business at home. Good entertainment, Jabbawockeez, dancers from Fantasy, flying Santas, makes it a fun event. Walking over the freeway on Sunset, not something you do every day. Main fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a worthy cause in Southern Nevada. I'll be back next year, suit and all."

"NYC transplant, great spot.  Pricey, trendy, menu's a bit tricky with a big group.  Our waiter was top-notch, made sure we were well taken care of.  Joint was jumpin', lots of energy, beautiful people.  If you're with a group, ask for help with the menu.  Couples, you're good to go.  Plenty to try, could eat here 100 times and never get bored."

"Tucked away, hidden from sight,
I forgot how I came to this place,
In the night, with friends, without light,
They drove me hither, in haste.

The inside, small, dark, and funky,
With copper counters, shining bright,
Adds to the charm, quaint and punky,
A place to dine, with delight.

Pork enchiladas, I did order,
And shared the garlic, sauteed,
Oh, how delicious, a true border,
Left me craving, more to savor.

But alas, the garlic, it did seep,
Into my pores, oh, how it clung,
Days passed, and still it did linger,
A scent, that would not be sung.

Yet, worth it, the meal, it was,
A place, you should visit, with haste,
For the flavors, they do entice,
And leave you, in want, of more delight."
