"Went there a few months back. Damn glad I did. Their tacos are killer, especially the spicy meat one. Went back a few weeks later for a burrito, and it hit the spot. Better than that overrated Chipotle joint. My only gripe is they should tell you what the hell their meat is. Most of it's unfamiliar, and they could use some more soda options or tea. But overall, a great, cheap spot for tasty tacos, burritos, and street corn. Open late too."
"Carne adovada, I love it. But sometimes, too much fat. Hate that. Best chipotle ranch though."
"Chai latte, best in town. Chocolate twist, quiche lorraine, both light, delicious. Ciabatta boule, moist, good."

"Delectable fare, kind service, a place we hold dear. 

Tofu, sesame-kissed, doth please our taste buds so. 

A dish most wondrous, at a tavern of renown."
"Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl? More like a sad, soggy mess. Frozen meal, heated up. Not worth a star. Stickin' with the good stuff - 5-star wraps and salads. Leavin' the 2.5-star bowls for the birds."

"Terrific show. Lead actor killed it. Cozy venue. Wished Angel had more stage time, but enjoyed her in a new role. \n\nP.S. Absinthe's a nice touch, though not quite like the real deal abroad. Appreciate the effort."

"Went back a second time, and they've changed how they make the Wellington. Now it only comes one way - can't order it medium well or any other way. Funny, after my initial review. Still very good, though."

"Jennifer C's review hits the mark. I had a similar experience. Being from Pittsburgh, taking a 'tour' felt strange at first, but it was a fresh way to see the city. \n\nThe only gripe I got is that it was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a blast (especially when they let us loose) but the tour itself was lacking. The guide shared some tidbits here and there, but I expected more."

"Prepare thyself, good sir, for a feast most wondrous,
Whose portions are of such size, they shall render thee senseless.
The fries, they do accompany the sandwiches with grace,
And shall bring thee to a state of culinary ecstasy."

"Hosts in restaurants, lately? Zero personality, poor first impressions. But hey, let's talk food and service. Carol, great. Makes up for the podium guards' lackluster vibe. Tomato capresi appetizer, excellent! Classic with a twist - fresh red onion, balsamic reduction, basil. Could be a main course, but I lack self-control. Pasta Franco, very good too. Olives, artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, a tad salty towards the end, but expected. Would order again. Carol, attentive, not pushy. Ask for her."

"Hark! What's this? A place to dine and sip,
Where coffee flows and soups do simmer?
Aye, 'tis true, the service here doth dip,
But still, I say, 'twill be a pleasant summer.

For in this hall, they serve with glee
Fresh soups and sandwiches of high degree,
And smoothies too, that doth delight,
In flavors sweet and colors bright.

So come, my friends, and taste for thee,
The brew that doth awaken thee,
And if thou dost return, as thou shouldst,
Thou shalt find fare that doth please thee well, no doubt."
"Tasty grub, quick service. Thai tacos and mac 'n cheese, a real treat. Burgers done right too. Not gourmet, but good eats all the same."

"Place was hoppin', Monday night or not. Malbec flowed like water, olives marinated to perfection. Sausage and mushroom pizza, just the right size. Decor? Top-notch. Not exactly easy to find, but worth the search. Local spot, hidden in a strip mall behind the tire shop. Check it out, Arden."

"Hark! A word of caution, ere we dine,
This Chinese restaurant, I've tried but their noon repast,
Their buffet, full and plentiful, a feast for the eyes,
With eight treasures and chicken curry, my heart doth rise.
A solid meal, at a fair price, without delay,
'Tis a bargain, my friends, come, let us dine today!"

"Dickey's saved my Thanksgiving. My brother and I decided to do Thanksgiving with friends last minute. No turkeys at Hash House a Go Go. WTF? Same at Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves. Double WTF. Needed Thanksgiving to-go, stat. Dickey's had two turkey options for $49.99 - Cajun Fried or Smoked. Course they were sold out of the fried, but had one smoked left. Called dibs! Pick-up was easy - zipped in and out in five minutes. Closed on Thanksgiving, so picked up the day before. Ready-to-heat, oven-safe aluminum pan. Two hours to eat-time. Perfect - my friend just moved to Vegas, minimal bake/cookware. Needed low maintenance. Dickey's delivered. Pretty tasty too. A little worried the smoked wouldn't deliver the flavor, but it was delicious. Not the best, but damn good. Love cooking, but it was nice to skip the large bird and focus on Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis."

"Walked into the joint, tired from the day's work. Menu was different, couldn't find what we wanted. Waiter still took our order, though. Ended up with a makeshift surf and turf - filet mignon, lobster tail, mashed potatoes, and a sad excuse for a salad. Salad was a mess, just a bunch of wilted lettuce dumped in a bowl. Lobster was overcooked, tough as shoe leather. But the filet and potatoes, they were top-notch. I'm a meat and potatoes man, through and through. Atmosphere was still nice, despite the mediocre grub. Maybe it was the late hour, who knows? Been there before, food was better. Give 'em another shot, sure."
"Sweet joint for ice cream, old-fashioned style. Load up on toppings, make it your way. Fun spot, good service, and the scoops? Top-notch. I'll be back next spring, you can bet your ass on that."

"This joint's not half bad. For a chain, the grub's pretty damn good. Their tacos are loaded with homemade-tasting stew meat. And don't even get me started on the burritos - they're the size of a small child. Staff's friendly too. They'll hook you up with a free cookie or scoop of ice cream for dessert. Not bad for a quick, cheap Mexican fix."
"Wait wasn't long. TV's on, news or sports. Brought my own readin' material. Techs were top-notch. Office staff friendly, bit scattered. Try their best for patients."

"Good eatery, this one. Been there thrice, never had a bad meal. Garlic crab, top-notch. Salt and pepper calamari, tasty, but watch out for the seasoning. Atmosphere's swell, live jazz playing in the background. Great spot for a romantic evening or meeting up with pals. Not the best for kiddos. Parking? No clue, always take a taxi."

"Ravioli, six pieces, covered in rich Alfredo sauce. Breadstick, warm and soft. Filling, perfect portion. Best Alfredo sauce I've had, not watery, full of flavor. Pizza, too pricey. Going back for more pasta."

"Hark! What flavors doth NoDa Brewing Co. bring forth?  

Inspired by Dogfish Head and Founders, they do sing 

A tale of two IPAs, both bold and hoppy, one with a hint of earthiness, the other citrusy and sharp.  

And then, there's Coco Loco, a brew that doth please, 

A rich, smooth porter, perfect for a night of ease.  

The taproom, full of life and energy, doth play host 

To many a beer enthusiast, of diverse backgrounds, all united in their love of the craft.  

Though the beer may not quite knock thy socks off, 

NoDa Brewing Co. remains a place worth visiting, and that's no jest. 

Give Coco Loco a try, and ignore the rain, 

For in this taproom, thou shalt find joy, and perhaps a bit of gain."

"Hark, what news is this? A pizza place doth come,
With naught but crust and toppings, no seats to claim.
A take-out joint, they say, yet fear not, fair maid,
For their pies, they do delight, and worth the quest.

Their Superbiotic, a marvel, a feast for the taste,
As good as any wood-fired, at a fraction of the waste.
And the crust, oh so fine, a delight to the bite,
Leaves none for the dogs, or any to fight.

I went again, and again, a loyal fan,
For their pizza, a love, that doth never wane.
So here's to Naked Pizza, a gem in our midst,
May their pies forever, our hunger and thirst."
"Went there twice since opening. First visit, few mistakes on order, but fixed quick. Good grub, fair price. Clean joint, fun vibe. Compare to Baja Fresh, Wahoos wins on value."

"Saturday night, six of us hit up this joint. Table was ready, nice touch. Old spot, loads of character. Busy as hell, staff looked slammed. Took a while to get bread, even longer for apps. Waiter disappeared for long stretches, tough to order more drinks or food. Service was meh, but the grub? Top-notch. Fresh, delicious, some of the best Italian I've had. Gnocchi? Outta this world. Would go back, hoping for better service next time."

"Taco heaven found. Sampled chicken, asada, pork street tacos. Pork, sweet and smoky. Asada, well-seasoned, smoky. Chicken, flavorful but not as much. Husband shared Bombero burrito. Mexican barbecue sauce? Yes! Dining experience worth 30-minute drive. Would sample entire menu. Thanks, Bill B."

My dearest sister and I did dine at this establishment,
Upon seeing an advertisement most persuasive and fair.
It showed Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton, both of great renown,
Celebrating parties here, and thus we thought it a crown.

The menu did boast of "gourmet college food,"
A claim most intriguing, and our taste buds quite mood.
We ordered Mini Kobe Burger sliders, oh so fine,
And Buffalo Chicken wings, a dish most divine.
Fries came in a swirl, a clever presentation indeed,
All of the food we ate, our hunger did exceed.

Alas, the prices may be somewhat high,
But still, a trendy place to dine, and worth the try.
If thou art in search of a hearty meal,
Mayhap the steak, a dish most famed and real.

"Saturday mornin', we hit up this joint in Ahwatukee for brekkie, third day in a row. Place was bustlin' but the hostess hooked us up with seats at the bar. We waited for a table, sippin' coffee, chattyin' with the locals. Chiliquilas, man, they were better than expected. El Jefe, just like they said, no disappointment there. Huevos rancheros, that's what I ordered, came with a killer pancake on the side. Ranchero salsa, damn good too. Service, solid. Busy place, tickets took a bit longer, but hey, that's Saturday mornin' for ya."

"Hark, good sir or madam, I do confess,
A fan of Penn Brewery, I must profess.
A lover of beer, in all its forms,
From pale ales to dark stouts, it warms.

But alas, on this day, I could not partake,
For work did call, and duties did make.
Yet still, I say, if thou dost seek,
A place to find thy perfect brew,
This establishment, doth fit the bill,
With Braumeister Steak, and fries, so still.

Ten times, I've visited, and this, my first,
Non-drinking venture, did leave me cursed.
But fear not, dear reader, for the fare,
And service, both, did leave me rare.
So heed my words, and take the time,
To visit Penn Brewery, and taste their fine wine."

"Good grub. Sipped brews and snacked at the bar with a mate. They got some top-notch IPAs. Not a fan of squid usually, but their stewed calamari was damn fine. Also had a caprese that hit the spot. It's a chill joint, not the best for watchin' a game, but perfect for a romantic evening."

"Went to Zinburger with my buddy on a weeknight. Place was hoppin', but we snagged a spot at the bar. Great view of the joint, nice design. Food was pricey, but worth it. Shared a kobe burger, double truffle fries, zucchini fries, and a bottle of vino. Left feelin' good, maybe because of the wine. Definitely comin' back to splurge. This place was top-notch."

"Benihana's where you wanna be when you got cash and a crew. Once or twice a year's enough. My Iowa pals come visit, we got time and money to burn. Friendly folks, love the cook-in-front-of-you vibe. Fire tricks can be a bit much, but hey. Not a sushi joint, so skip that. Hibachi's the way to go. If you're a kid, get the kiddie meal. I'm 30-something, my little ones are too wild for fancy places. But their fried rice? Top-notch."

"I checked out this boarding joint and I gotta say, it's not half bad. I left my little terrier there for a night and everything was A-okay. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but the place is huge and the dogs get to run around all day. That's worth a few extra bucks in my book. They got different sized play areas for different sized dogs and the staff was real friendly. I'd definitely use 'em again. It ain't perfect, but it's getting there."
"Atmosphere top-notch. Grub, delish. Service, spot on. If in Belmont, stop by. Had a burger, fantastic."

"Tucked away in the MGM Grand, this joint's a gem.  Food's top-notch, especially the pork belly sandwich and caesar salad.  The pizza's good too, but could be crispier.  Still, it's a great spot for a break from the slots."

"Tortillas made this joint. Went at 12:30, got grub and a table quick. Had the bean and cheese burrito with guac on the side. Fresh and excelente, but the tortillas, man...homemade and off the chain. Menu's limited, but prices are right. Cute little spot, too. Dug it even more when I found out America was the owner, not some corny name."

"Tough times, indeed. Can't fill a Cirque du Soleil stadium on a Saturday night? That's rough. Went last minute, kid wanted to see it again. Enjoyed it, prime front center seats. Noticed new things second time around."

"Waverley Train Station, a place of sustenance and haste,
Where travelers may find victuals ere they board their train with haste.
Sandwiches and salads abound, a feast for weary eyes,
But alas, at night, the shelves do bear a sorry guise.
Devoid of staff, the store doth seem cramped and small,
A space not fit for royalty, nor for a noble's call."

"Bam, another contender in the commercial center district, vying for best Thai grub in Vegas. Didn't know much about Komol, but now I do. Had a mid-day craving for something spicy, and this place delivered. First off, fresh spring rolls, not greasy like others. Then, pad kee mow with tofu, spicy level 3 'cause I'm still a rookie. Tofu was surprisingly tasty, but I wasn't sharing it. Lastly, Panang curry with chicken, finally some meat. Level 3 again, but I'll work my way up. Sorry, seasoned Thai foodies, my palate can't handle too much heat yet. But hey, great meal, and I'll be back to update this review."

"Methinks I've visited this establishment twice,
On dates most auspicious, 4/20, 2013, and 1/10/14,
A place of revelry, in downtown's heart,
Where jeans and shirt, a proper garb, doth wear.

The first time, on a day of haze and smoke,
The rooftop crowded, a line didst invoke,
A madness that didst spread throughout the town,
A night of dancing, scarce, a sight to see.

But on the second visit, fortune smiled,
A beer in hand, I danced, my spirits wild,
The roof, a haven, with a view so fair,
A night of joy, without a single care.

Drinks, a tad pricey, yet of quality fine,
Bartenders skilled, their craft divine,
My love, a fan of cocktails, didst declare,
This place, a gem, in Las Vegas' lair.

No troubles didst we face, a peaceful night,
Good vibes, aplenty, a pleasant sight,
So shall we return, again and anon,
To dance, to laugh, beneath the stars, in fun."

"I've been here twice now. Like the way they work together, efficient as hell. Get the job done quick, too. Just had my car painted, so I didn't want 'em to use the high-pressure hoses. They were cool about it, used the regular one instead. Even offered to bundle and save me some cash when I asked for a detail on the inside."

"We stumbled upon this joint while explorin' our new city. Best find so far. \n\nWalked in for a late dinner, got seated quick and easy. Service was top-notch. Ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chicken vidaloo. Food came out fast, and it was freakin' delicious! Tikka masala was smooth, fresh. Beau got his vidaloo spicy, just right. Been back at least 8 times, always leave full and happy. (ITIS!)"

"Food's top-notch. Don't let the cramped space or usual suspects deter you. I'm not a fan of the joint itself, but the grub's worth braving the crowd. Chefs are top-notch, prices are fair. If I need a taste of Scottsdale without the hassle, this is my spot. Would give it five stars, but the ambiance's not ideal."

"Pimpin' ain't easy, but this joint's got you covered. Consignment and new gear, all top-notch. Vargas girl ties? Hundred bucks a pop. Everything else? Eighty-five, every damn thing. Lady behind the counter didn't even look up from her phone. Didn't offer no help neither."

"This joint's got some real nice trinkets. Colorful too. Furniture, sculptures, fabrics, bobbing turtles - they got 'em all. Picked up some decorative tiles for a buck apiece. Unique, cheap gifts. Good spot for an Arizona-themed present."

"Upon a Saturday morn, at half past nine,
We chanced upon this eatery divine.
And straightaway, we were seated with grace,
Their hospitality did leave us in a daze.

My Brunch Des Cantons, oh how grand,
With beans so fine, and pork so bland.
I savored each bite with gleeful cheer,
My hunger sated, without a speck of fear.

My love, her Brunch Sucre did enjoy,
But found it not to be quite the employ.
Yet still, she praised the flavors bright,
And deemed it worthy of a second sight.

Our coffee and juice, they flowed like wine,
A perfect complement to our repast divine.
In conclusion, 'twas a morning fair,
And we departed, with hearts full of cheer."

"September '07. Twice. What the hell?

Allergic reaction, viral something. Throat closed up, couldn't breathe. Nearly passed out.

Nurses? Top-notch. Private room? Bangin'.

Told 'em about my hidden veins, they listened. Butterfly needle, perfect.

Beau, parents, daughter visited. All pleased with my digs.

If somethin' else happens, Meriter's my hospital. Thanks."
"Panera, same in Madison. Quality grub, friendly folk. Busy joint, but they keep things movin'."

A fair review, I pen, of gourmet burgers,
'Twas passable, I say, with naught to stir.
Dominic, the server, merry and bright,
Did make our visit pleasant, with his cheerful sight.
The place, clean, friendly, and welcoming, indeed,
A spot for families, with laughter and good deeds.
My memory, alas, doth fail me now,
For the food, I recall not, how or why.
The fries, bottomless, a delight, I do avow,
But the burger, dry, a disappointment, I allow.
Its name, forgotten, doth escape my mind,
A pity, for I would not wish to find.
Yet, shall I return, if fate doth bring me near,
To give the place a second chance, my dear.

"First time I had Burrito Boyz, it was at a meetin' where the grub was catered. No clue where that mystery burrito came from. My first thought? Best damn burrito I ever had. Brain: 'Holy shit, they got avocado in here too.' What else can I say? They cram everythin' you could want - and stuff you didn't know you wanted - into that bad boy. Been to the Toronto spot a few times, food's still top-notch. But service, quality, and price? Not so much. Don't matter though, you came for the burrito."

"Hubby and I hit this joint on a Saturday night, sushi was fresh and drinks were stiff. Place was jumpin', DJ spinning tunes, but not too loud. Good spot for people watchin'. Our waitress was a peach, knew her stuff too. We'll be back."

"Went here for lunch with the missus. Nice spot. They give you a discount if you bike or walk. Check in on foursquare, use your Amex, get five bucks off. 

 Had a good time. I got the trout, she got the happy hour fish and chips. Food was top-notch. Only gripe was feeling a bit rushed. But the grub and drinks were great. Fish and chips were fresh, crispy. Trout came with green beans and peanuts. Got mash as a side, too. Fish was seasoned just right, green beans nice and crunchy. 

 All in all, a swell joint. Be back."

"Methinks 'twas a most wondrous experience, my dear. Forsooth, I am quite particular about mine own taste in wine, but this place didst present no challenge. When I was not fully satisfied, they didst proffer a new suggestion, and verily, 'twas perfection itself! The lobster, oh how divine! And the crab legs, by the stars, they shall ever be mine own favorite. They didst even allow me to customize mine own dessert, a feat most rare and wondrous. Pray tell, what is thine own desire? Ask them, I pray thee, and they shall surely assist thee in thy quest! \n\nAnd, prithee, do not forget to request a table outside, when thou dost make thy reservation. For the lake and light show, 'tis a sight most fair and wondrous, a true delight!"

"Toast, a prime spot for a weekend breakfast. Efficient service, teamwork among staff, prices reasonable. Food exceeds expectations, especially eggs, coffee, corn bread, fruit. A great spot for young families, fast service, moderate prices. Grandparents will appreciate the tunes. If the food doesn't meet your lofty standards, try The Gallery, Cafe Monte, or Zebras, but be prepared to pay double Toast's prices. For me, Toast strikes the perfect balance between quality and cost."
"Surprised by the joint's offerings. Thought it was just another deli, but they got a menu that'll please anyone. Stopped in for a quick bite, but I'll be back for a real meal."

"Rum Jungle, the place to be for hip-hop and R&B fans. Great grub, strong drinks, and a lively atmosphere. I went there twice, first time in '05, had the fire pit, $50, but worth every penny. Little did I know, the joint turns into a club after hours. My crew and I kept the party going, no need to hit up another spot. Last November, I went back, and it still delivered. Same vibe, same genres, same strong drinks. Prices were Vegas-style, but I must've been generous to the bartender, got Bay Area prices for two straight nights, same bartender. Verdict? Top-notch joint, don't bother with other clubs in Vegas, stick with Rum Jungle."
"Good prices, big portions. Almost didn't finish my grub. Been here twice, once for brekkie, once for dinner. Both times, I was satisfied. Friendly staff, quick service. I'll be back."

"Don't judge a book by its cover. We passed by this joint dozens of times, thinking it was just another dive in a strip mall. But boy, were we wrong. Last night, we wanted some good Wisconsin grub, something different. So, I checked out reviews and decided to give this place a shot. My family was hesitant, but once we walked in, they were impressed. The joint was big, well-laid out, and the decor wasn't half bad either. And the food? Top-notch. The only gripe I had was the fish fry. It took forever to come and no one asked if I wanted more. But hey, they were packed, so I'll give 'em a break. Can't wait to go back."
"Worth the wait, my friend. Texas-style BBQ, like Franklin's in Austin. Avoid the crowd at 11, come at 1:30 for a shorter line."

"O, how I do wish we had spent more time on Fremont Street, fair Vegas! For there, amidst the bustling throng, I found a sense of comfort that eluded me upon the Strip. 'Tis a curious blend of old and new, where street performers, historic sites, and modern marvels meet. A touch of seediness doth linger, yet not unlike the Strip, where opulence and gleam do mask a certain taint.

We did take public transport to reach this place, and though 'twas cheap, our journey did seem endless. But then, we hailed a cab, and oh, what joy! Our ride back was a merry one, indeed.

The eateries and taverns here, they pleased my heart. More affordable, they were, and less ostentatious, yet cozy and inviting. A throwback vibe, they had, as if we'd stepped into a bygone age. And no one here doth take themselves too seriously, for 'tis Vegas, after all. A city of mirth and glee.

The restaurants, oh, how fine they were! Some, with histories rich and grand. And cheaper, too, than those upon the Strip. The video screen, a wonder, verily! A marvel that did delight mine eyes."

"Clean joint. Fair prices for quality grub. Simple menu, no frills. Cheesesteaks and fries, done right. Thick cheese on the fries, so be warned. Might be too rich for some. Solid spot, we'll be back."

"Love the furniture joint. Went in search of coffee table, large ottoman. Pricey, sure, but each piece unique. Not too busy, sales folk didn't swarm like vultures. Didn't even say hi, so knocked off a star. Didn't need help, just browsed. Plenty of options for any room. Looked like they had a design center. Didn't find the perfect fit today, but not a loss."

"Met an Aussie mate at the diner, decided to do the whole American thing. Fun times, good eatin'. Friendly staff, laughed with 'em, like we were old pals. Food was top-notch, loved the chilli cheese fries - hard to find that good stuff across the pond. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak, damn good, cooked just right, served quick. Good prices, too. Efficient service, friendly folks. I'd go back for lunch, no doubt."

In this fair city, where culture doth abound,
There lies a pub, a haven, a place to be found.
With wooden paneling, warmth doth it impart,
An intimate setting, for friends and their heart.

Monterey Pub, 'tis a name that doth ring true,
A place to gather, to laugh, to make anew.
After a day spent in museums of old,
Here doth one find solace, stories untold.

Pints of ale, poured well they be,
Drinks of joy, of cheer, of glee.
Food that doth nourish, doth fill the belly,
Beef marinated in Guinness, oh so jolly!
Boxty's, a dish of wonder, of might,
For those who dare, a taste most bright.

Seek ye the pub? Look not far,
On Monterey Street, 'tis easy to scar.
YMCA, a landmark, doth stand tall,
And there, my friend, doth the pub enthrall.

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, where cheese doth reign supreme,
A paradise for gourmands, with curds most serene.
Their beer cheese soup, a brew most divine,
Doth complement the curds, like a lover's embrace.

So heed my words, good sirs, and make haste to this abode,
For in it thou shalt find, a feast most royally bestowed.
Note well, fair traveler, the portions they do provide,
Are generous and plentiful, like a bounty from the skies.

And cheese, oh cheese! Doth thy heart sing with delight?
For in this realm, 'tis the star of the day and night.
Gluten-free bread, three choices they do proffer,
A boon for those who crave, a culinary splendor.

The prices, fair and reasonable, a steal indeed,
For four did dine, and under seventy coins did pay the deed.
So gather round, good friends, and partake of their cheer,
For in this place, 'tis a feast, most wondrous and dear."

"Been here twice now, both times after gambling. Decent spot, affordable. Portions are huge, couldn't finish my salmon. Beignets, better than Disney's. Recommend it if you don't want fancy. Server messed up the bill, barely checked on us. Sunday night, not too busy."

"Coffee, good stuff. Student brings me two cups, Creme Brulee and Sugar N Spice. Spread the love, he says. Give one to co-worker, they like it. Don't live nearby, but support local. Tasty coffee, twist and all. One day, drop by."

"Love this joint. Found it by chance, but been back plenty since. Hubby never tried nothing like it before, but he took them up on their V-Day deal for couples. Now he's hooked, just like me. Feel like a million bucks after our sessions. Thirty bucks an hour, ain't bad neither. They got some talented hands here. Back in Yakima, we didn't have squat like this."

"Been meaning to hit up this joint for a bit. Finally got the chance with some coworkers in Phoenix. Whipped out my GPS, Chino Bandino popped up. Told the crew, they were down. Busy at lunchtime, but some dude came over, asked if he could help. We said we were newbies, he hooked us up with samples - Jade Chicken, Carnitas, black beans, fried rice. All good. Ordered up, stuffed ourselves silly. Snickerdoodle came in clutch for a late-day snack. Good times, will return."

In Viv B.'s boutique, a merry place,
With sophistication, youth doth grace.
Their jewels and art, my heart doth steal,
And scents, that sweetness doth reveal.
Their garb, though limited in choice,
Doth make up for it with elegance and voice.
The owner, with love, did name the place,
After her grandmother, a woman of grace.
Her portrait, like a saint, doth watch,
Over the shop, with style and such.

New patient. Arrived 545, waited 'til 6. Room right away, 20-minute wait for the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Cost $42 (chihuahua, size varies). Clipped her nails ($10, horrible parent, very long). Needed more done (x-rays, blood tests, two meds). Bill $700, no diagnosis. Pain and barely using left front paw/leg. Sent home with pain meds and anti-inflammatory. Back a month later, same thing. Nice doctors, staff seemed rushed, not concerned. Good overall, back a few times a month for nail clipping.

"Hark! This place doth please mine eyes and taste,
Their service swift and their location most convenient.
Before or after film, do give 'em a try,
And savor each bite with joy and delight."
"Cinema's not bad. First time here. Restrooms, clean. Theatre, good size. Snacks, decent selection. Be back."

"This joint serves up some damn good grub, no question. But let's talk turkey - them prices are steep, friend. Take the appetizers, for instance. Flavorful, sure, but $14? That's a pretty penny. Now, I ain't one to scrimp on a good ribeye, but the Spackle? That's a mighty fine cut, but I ain't sure it's worth the price tag. Cooked it just right, though. Maybe a bit too well done, but that's just my two cents. Desserts? Solid, but over $20? You could do better elsewhere. If you're gonna shell out that kinda dough, might as well head on over to Harvest Moon Grille. Better food, better value. And it's practically next door to the Blumenthal, so you can't use location as an excuse."

"Pho Kim Long, heard good things, checked it out. Not disappointed. Big place, seated quickly, attentive staff. Menu, impressive, not just pho, apps, entrees, smoothies, more. #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, Chinese Doughnuts too. Doughnuts plain, used peanut sauce, good fix. Fast service, apps good, pho stole show. Steak, brisket, tender, delicious. Noodles plenty, broth rich. Going back."

"Airport's a dump, but that's Vegas for you. Security's a breeze, nothing special. People complain, but what's the point? Just grab your gear and move on. It's not worth sweating in the grand scheme."

"Hark! A tale of two visits, both with excellent service, I swear! 
A convention, thou ask? Indeed, 'twas the cause of my stay, 
And the hotel, it did provide a most spacious venue, fit for a king! 
The chamber assigned to me, luxurious and grand, did offer sweet repose, 
After a day filled with training, mingling, and drinks, as one does suppose. 
The space, so plentiful, allowed me to fully unwind, without a care, 
And though the cost, I cannot say, yet gratitude to my employer, I do declare! 
To experience it all anew, I would not hesitate, forsooth! 
The Venetian theme, a delight! The casino, a place of merriment and chance, 
And the eateries, a culinary journey, a true gastronomic dance! 
This part of the Strip, most ideal, a location most prime, 
Viva Las Vegas, indeed, a city of wonder, a place divine!"
"Solid joint. Killer cocktails, tequila's my poison. Nueva Latina bites, duck empenadas a highlight. Upscale vibes, attentive bartenders. Fun spot."

"Methinks 'twas one of th' best buffets e'er I saw,
With meats diverse, as lamb and prime rib, both cooked fair.
I do confess, I am quite choosy o'er sliders,
But here, they did impress, beyond compare.
The ramen, decent; crab legs, not too shabby,
A vast array of victuals, each dish, a joy to sample.
Not fond of buffets, I, but this one, an exception, doth make."
"Good workout at the gym during lunch. Hate the teeny bopper crap they play in the men's locker room, though."

"Hark! My frugal friends, gather 'round,  
For I have found a place most profound,  
Where Chinese cuisine doth reign supreme,  
And all for prices that doth seem most dream.  

On Harris Blvd., a humble abode,  
Doth serve a feast fit for a king,  
A special lunch, with egg roll included,  
For mere dollars, thy hunger sated, thy purse unruffled.  

The chicken, real meat, not some fake substitute,  
The sauces, savory, not oversalted,  
Vegetables galore, a true delight,  
A meal most satisfying, a true culinary sight.  

But, alas, dear friends, do not expect,  
Authentic Cantonese or Szechuan, no need to inspect,  
For this, my friends, is Americanized Chinese,  
A fusion, if thou wilt, of East meets West, most serene.  

Yet still, four stars, I give it with glee,  
For value, taste, and portion, all doth agree,  
So, hasten thee well, and give it a try,  
This humble eatery, a true surprise, doth lie."

"A bar most wondrous, small within, yet grand in atmosphere doth lie. With seats of varied sort, high perches, stools of bar, and soft cushions, comfort doth abound. A draught of fine ale, a sip of sweet wine, or cocktail of zest, all doth please mine eyes. Fare of sandwiches and wraps, so I have heard, doth tempt mine taste, and soon, I shall partake."

"Hark! A maiden visit, and what doth lie in store?
A feast fit for a king, and all for nine dollars more!
The wait, a mite long, yet worth it in the end,
For such a spread, with sweets that ne'er shall wend.
A chocolate fountain, flowing like a dream,
And cotton candy, spinning in a scheme.
The food, a varied lot, with naught to scorn,
For such a price, 'tis worth a trip, ere dawn.
So come one, come all, and bring thy sweet tooth,
For here, a feast that doth befit a youth."

"Hark, what news is this? A culinary delight in the North, they say! 

Fried Chicken, oh how sweet thy taste doth be! A generous portion for two, indeed. 

Catfish, verily, a fine dish, yet a mite too scanty, alack! 

Burgers, ho hum, a common fare, they do resemble. And thus, I ponder, why Hamburger Hut, when burgers be but middling, pray tell? Haha! 

A curious establishment, half shop, half eatery. Busy as can be, 'tis true, with fried chicken the popular choice, no doubt. 

But lo, the parking space, a scant seven, alas!"

"Eat'n Park, a joint I know well. Lived blocks away, back when Wilkie's Inn was still kickin'. Memories of drunken brawls, but that's another story. This place, it's the real deal. Scrambled eggs, french toast, burgers, pickles - the works. And don't forget them smiley face cookies. Can't get enough. If you're new to Pittsburgh, make sure to stop by. You won't regret it."

"A merry inn, with theme park on its roof,
My family found, at price most fair and proof.
With amenities galore, 'twas fit for kings,
Though not a five-star, still, 'twas pleasant things.

Atop the building, pool did shine,
Where water sports did take their place in line.
And rides, oh rides, how they did thrill,
Upon the roof, a wondrous sight to fulfill.
As guests, we gained entry, free of charge,
To this most lofty realm, where fun doth large.
The site, most prime, the Strip doth border,
Convenient, indeed, for those who do explore."

"Clean joint. Good for fam and buddies. Pizza's decent, not top-shelf but better than most bar grub. Thin crust, ground beef, tasty. Games galore - pool, shuffleboard, TVs. Focaccias are my jam too. Weekends are prime time for sports."

I took an iPad 2 from work to get fixed here. They fixed it in six hours, no problem. Needed a new glass, cost me $129 plus tax. Happy with the service, they give a 90-day warranty. Wish they were a bit more professional, but they got the job done. Shop's on Mill Ave, easy parking and drop-off.

"Hark! If thou hast visited Asian buffets in fair Arizona, and found them to thy liking, then thou must, by all means, give Jasmine Tokyo a try. 

Verily, I am a tall man, six feet four inches in height, and oft am asked if I play for the Cardinals. Thus, when I enter an eatery, the proprietors do glance at me with some trepidation. Fear not, dear Asian maiden, for I am no glutton. My desire doth lie in the seafood, sushi, and green tea. 

The sushi selection, my friend, doth excel any other AYCE in the Valley. Twenty types of rolls didst they have, and not just surimi crab and tempura, but tuna, salmon, and snapper nigiri, all of which didst please mine taste buds. 

And should thou have room for fried rice, fear not, for 'tis delicious, as well as the Chinese sausages and grilled fowl. Even the raw oysters, a rarity in Arizona, didst delight mine palate. 

The service, kind and courteous, didst make mine experience most pleasant. And, by the decor, I wouldst wager that this place didst once belong to Claim Jumper. In conclusion, Jasmine Tokyo, a vast restaurant with a bountiful selection, doth cater to vegetarians, with more options than I have e'er seen at a buffet. Seaweed, a vegetable, no?"

"Bouchon. Never been, despite the hype. Location's a bitch, but who needs a compass in a casino? By the registration lobby, up the elevators. Simple. Small wait for brunch, menu's similar to breakfast, few additions. Chicken and waffles, glorious. Bacon-infused waffles, roasted chicken, can't be beat. Must-try. French toast, meh. Ambiance, dated decor, cramped tables. Single old men, coughing, cringeworthy. Still, highly recommended, especially for chicken and waffles."

"Methinks this coffeehouse doth serve the best brew in all the land! Their red velvet latte, in sooth, doth rival any other. The baristas, friendly and welcoming, do make one feel at home within the cozy confines of the shop. Alas, the prices be a mite steep, yet shall I not let that deter me from partaking in their fine wares. Verily, I shall return anon, forsooth!"

"Breakfast at Tableau, top-notch affair. Efficient service, attentive staff. Sat by the window, nice view. Liked the purse chair, cute touch. Had the duck hash, eggs, pancakes looked good too. Classy, elegant, but still casual. That's Tableau."

"Stayed at NY NY in Vegas. Hotel's a mini-city. Big casino, plenty of tables and slots. Food's a plus - cheap eats or high-end dining. Stayed on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower. Best view in Vegas - strip and mountains, lit up at night. Room was spacious, comfy for three guys. A bit dated, but clean and functional. Separate sink room, nice touch. High-end shower, plenty of hot water. Impressed with my stay, would recommend."
"Cheba Hut, never a bad meal. Food's great, subs toasted, yum. Must-try in Mesa."

"First off, my girl and I hit this joint in Vegas. I'm dressed down, the only one in the place who ain't tryin' to impress nobody. But the hostess gives me the stink-eye like I'm some kinda scrub. C'mon, lady, you work in Vegas, you know the drill. Rich dudes and their sugar babies, that's the name of the game. Anyways, the place is poppin', real classy, upscale joint. Food's top-notch, especially the salmon sashimi. Damn, that shit's good. Two days later, I'm still thinkin' about it. New standard for salmon, fo sho. Lobster's pretty sweet too. Prices are steep, but hey, you gotta pay to play, right? Minus the snooty hostess, this place gets five stars from me."

"Cafe grub's good, real good. Eight bucks gets you a blueplate special, comes with soup and salad bar too. Salad bar's top-notch, even got fresh fruit for dessert. Don't expect fancy, just a damn good value. Staff's friendly too. They got dessert specials every month for two bucks."

"Hark! The victuals were most wondrous fair,
But service, alas! did leave much to despair.
Forsooth, thou dost not order from the cook,
But from the waitress, with a gentle look.
And lo! We did request three rolls, besides,
Some sushi, too. But, ho! They did forget,
The sushi, till we did remind them, 'twain
A curious oversight, indeed, in sooth.
Yet still, their fish, most fresh and sweet,
Did please our taste, and left us neat.
So, shall we return? Aye, verily,
For their AYCE doth offer much variety."

"Free? Hell yeah, that's the way to do it. Got into one of them LMFAO nights and it was top-notch. Ended our Vegas trip with a bang. Each room's got its own vibe, specially the library. Not too cramped, not too loud. XS still my favorite, but damn, these club designers know how to bring the heat. All about creativity and throwin' a killer party."

"Boardwalk Billy's for seafood. Steampot, extra shrimp, huge meal with potatoes and corn. Clam chowder, wonderful. Thursdays, trivia and two-dollar drinks. Galleria location, prompt and friendly service. Burgers, awful. Stick with seafood and wings, no disappointment."
"Good grub, nice folks. Been comin' here a bit. Prices went up some, but still worth it for the curry."

"By chance, we stumbled upon this humble abode,
Whose sign, Chicago Gyros, did our hunger implore.
A family-run establishment, cozy and snug,
With fare that did our taste buds most kindly allure.

I ordered my usual, a gyro, and fries,
The latter, standard issue, crispy and hot,
But the former, oh so plentiful and fine,
Did fill me up, a feat most wondrous and not.

The proprietor and his daughter, kind and bright,
Did attend to us with warmth and gentle might.
Our victuals came forthwith, piping hot and neat,
A pleasure it was, to dine at this eatery so discreet.

Indeed, I do cherish the local and true,
And thus, shall return, to this place anew."
"Lettuce with spring rolls, plenty of it. Service sharp, attentive. No trouble getting a server's eye. Good experience overall. First pho in Vegas, not bad. Broth could be better, but not bad."

"Place used to be a Starbucks, now it's a bakery. Strange hours, closed some days, open noon others. Called before going, despite Yelp saying otherwise. Went in on niece's birthday, saw stuffed cookies, and was sold. Oreos, cheesecake, snickers, butterscotch inside. Cake pops too, unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, red velvet. Caramel and candy apples, big chocolate-dipped marshmallows. Good service, fair prices. Only issue, odd schedule. Looking forward to going back."

"This joint's part of a chain, but don't let that turn you off. It's got some top-notch grub and brews. I had the flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat, and my missus went for the veggie option. Both were damn good. Next time, I tried the meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage, and a killer sauerkraut. We watched the Habs game at the bar after our meal. All in all, it's worth checking out, especially for the beer."

"Hark! What news is this? A humble tavern,
On Mondays, doth offer such a bargain.
A burger, priced at five dollars, thou shalt gain,
When thou dost purchase, with three dollars, a beer of fine quality.
'Tis a deal most wondrous, and the victuals, most delicious.
So, gather round, good sirs and madams, and partake
In this feast, fit for a king, or commoner, as thou wilt."

"My taste buds, alas, are not refined,
To savor spicy dishes of India's kind.
My mouth, a weak and feeble vessel,
Doth protest mightily, with fiery tremors,
Leaving me in quite a sorry state,
Unable to discern the flavors great.

But still, I sought to challenge fate,
And sampled Kashmiri curry, bold and great.
With Cobra beer, a liberal dose,
I dared to tame my taste buds' wild rose.

To my surprise, the flavors pure,
Were not lost to sweat and tears, as before.
I savored each bite with joy and cheer,
And found the meal most pleasant, I do declare.

The price, fair and reasonable,
The name, cool and most appealing.
I shall return, without a doubt,
To partake of their delicious curry, no doubt."

"A feast fit for a king, with sashimi most fine,
And rolls aplenty, spiced to taste divine.
I, a fan of rolls with heat, do declare,
Sushi Fever's selection doth leave none bare.

In the room to the left, with entrance grand,
A massive HD TV doth take its stand.
A useful sight, for those who do delight,
In distractions other than porcelain's light."

"Hark, Aaron, thou hast customer service skills most fair,
As doth the brunette barkeep, with a smile so rare.
Thy hospitality doth shine, like the sun in high noon,
And maketh strangers feel welcome, as if 'twere their own.

The nachos, alas, didst prove a challenge, I confess,
For the portion, so large, didst test my humble abilities.
But fear not, for I shall return, with reinforcements at hand,
To conquer the feast, and show my mettle, like a brave knight.

I made acquaintance with Greg and Mariam, from afar,
And Mark, from New Mexico, a gentleman of great charm.
Pray, good sirs, give this place a review, most kind and fair,
That others may know, of its excellence, beyond compare."

"Hark! What's this? A Cuban eatery, by my troth!
The sandwiches, they doth taste of authenticity,
And pastries, oh so sweet, a true delight.
Breakfast, it doth fill me up, and not too greasy,
A budget-friendly feast, a true godsend, I say.

Ironbeer and Materva, drinks of old Cuba,
Here found, a rare treat, my heart doth sing.
Om nom nom, I savor each delicious sip,
A taste of Havana, in this distant land.

Alas, they do compare themselves to Portos,
But fear not, friend, for they are not the same.
No long lines here, a mercy, praise the Lord,
The pastries, though fewer, still of high renown.

So if thou seeketh Cuban fare, look no further,
For Yummo, 'tis the place, a true treasure."

Hark, fair readers, listen well to me,
For I have tales to tell of Optima, thee.
A place of wonder, full of sights most fair,
Where beauty doth abound, beyond compare.

Three years have passed since I didst take up residence,
And still, I call this place my humble abode.
Noise and parking woes, they do exist,
But still, the charm of Optima doth persist.

Friends have I made, and contacts too,
A network vast, of people true.
Four stars, I give, for Optima's grace,
A place of wonder, in this world's space.

If thou art seeking, a home so fine,
Optima, thou must visit, ere thou doth decline.
A year, thou must spend, to truly see,
The beauty of Optima, in all its glee.

And lo, the Sonoran Village, soon to be,
A sister complex, of equal glee.
On the other side, of Fashion Square,
It shall rise, with splendor, beyond compare.
"Went to a meetin' at Caesars in May. Been there plenty, but never stayed at the hotel. They put us up in the Octavius Tower. Nice digs. Big rooms, comfy beds, clean bathrooms, great views."

"Solid burger joint. Had the half-pound Jalapeo Jack with onion rings. Meat was top-notch, spices on point, and cheese was flavorful. Rings were great too. Filling portion, left me full. Only gripe was the price, $11 and change for a no-frills spot. Didn't even get a drink. Minor complaint, still a solid recommendation."

"Reminds me of Pompeii, back in Chicago. Ordered carry-out, like old times. Wonder if she thought of it too. Got the salami, turkey, ham, and mozzarella panini. Red wine vinaigrette, real good. Fresh ingredients, well-packaged. Prices, average by Chi standards. Don't mind trying more."
"Burgers, built your way. Fries, served crazy-style. Hot, fresh, cooked to order."
"Been here a couple times. Not as good as Canadian clubs, but better than the rest in the valley."

"Thin noodles, woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage, Thai spice. Squeeze a lemon, I'm in heaven. One order feeds three, but we get two. Honey chicken, yummy appetizers, spring and egg rolls. Friendly service, no wait. Good Asian food at a fair price."

"Hyde's got a swanky vibe, perfect for a romantic night out. But watch out for those stunning wait staff, they might just steal your attention. Calamari's top-notch, crispy and flavorful. Wine's pricey, but worth it. And don't even get me started on the soda prices, six bucks a pop? Ouch."

"Whoa, this joint's a real behemoth. Don't reckon I've seen all of it yet. Multiple stages, upstairs rooms, you name it. The gals here are a real treat, too. Course, might be 'cause I'm a gal myself. Nah, it's 'cause they're strippers, that's why. Strippers, they're good people, and they smell nice too."

Two nights at Aria didst I stay,
A grand hotel, in truth, they say.
My company paid, 'twas their desire,
For such expense, I wouldst not aspire.

Drinks at the pool, a costly affair,
A sum, indeed, beyond compare.
No chocolates or turn-down service, I found,
Yet, all else, was quite profound.

Bath products, of lower end, alack,
And quality, not of the finest tack.
Restaurants, a delight, I must confess,
Thai cuisine, in the US, a rarity, at best.

Casino, pleasant, smoke-free, they say,
Servers, quick, in a timely way.
Pool, a haven, with choices, a few,
Adult-oriented, peaceful, anew.
Shade and umbrellas, a wish, I do declare,
Yet, a great pool experience, beyond compare.

In conclusion, a grand hotel, indeed,
Pricey, yet, luxury, doth proceed.

In sooth, this hotel doth boast a modern theme,
A chill and classy refuge from the city's scheme.
Its pros, my friends, are many and fair,
A clean pool, rooms, and hallways beyond compare.
The rooms themselves are fitted with all mod cons,
Electric stove, fridge, microwave, and dinner table, no less.
The staff, too, are friendly and kind,
Eager to help, their service most divine.
But alas, my dear, there be a con,
For those who seek to party, this may not be the spot.
Little black dresses, alcohol, and stumbling feet,
May earn hard stares, and trouble, perchance, doth meet.

"Hark, what rating doth my stars bestow?
A 2.5, nay, a 3, I say, yet know
That coffee, place, and brew, did make amends
For that fourth star, which otherwise doth wend.

Oh, food, thou art a curious thing,
For some, a pleasure, for others, a sting.
Authentic Spanish dishes, a delight,
But for those who have tasted, a sorry sight.

Olives, good, gambas too, a treat,
Paella, risotto-like, yet a feat.
Tortilla, burnt and dry, yet fair,
Wine selection, limited, beyond compare.

Coffee, a saving grace, a gem,
Cold brew and kopi luwak, a worthy theme.
Paraphernalia, a sight to see,
For caffeine lovers, a paradise, 'twill be.

Menu, a mystery, a secret kept,
Cafe bombon, a Spanish classic, unheard.
I shall return, to verify,
And savor coffee, a true delight, anon."

"Richardson's, a place so dear,
Where warmth and joy do abound,
A haven from the world outside,
Where laughter doth resound.

Their cuisine, a wondrous sight,
With flavors that doth delight,
Green chile potato, a dish so fine,
And pork, oh how divine!

I, myself, do love the sea,
And fish, a feast for me,
But scallops, blackened and grand,
Did recently take my hand.

A salad, huge and fresh, did join,
The scallops, oh what a treat,
Tortilla, rice, beans, and spice,
A dish that doth entice.

Wine, a bottle or two, did flow,
And pizza, plain, yet sweet,
A feast for all, a time to share,
At Richardson's, we did meet.

So, go thou forth, and dine with glee,
At Richardson's, a place to be,
But call ahead, a reservation make,
Lest waiting, thy patience doth break."

"Tucked away in a strip mall, this joint's easy to miss. Went with Elite Emily, and we were the only ones there. Orders were huge, fresh, and damn tasty. Had to ask for a box. Looking forward to trying something else next time."

"Boy don't usually dig museums, but this one was different. Lot of old-timey sex toys, crazy stuff. Videos, movies, demos. Sexual intensity all over the place. Bondage, pics, and a deep look at how sex has evolved. Damn interesting. Would go back. Staff's cool, too."

"Sunday afternoon, no reservation needed. This joint's the cat's pajamas. 

Terrific smells, swell decor, and top-notch service. Mentioned I was vegan, chef showed me what was good to go and what could be tweaked. Who knew oyster sauce was in everything? 

Give it a shot. Can't wait to come back for that green curry and tofu... mmm."

"Visited a couple times, loved it each visit. Last time was with fam and friends, everyone left satisfied. Great cocktails, unique menu. Happy hour, half-price steaks, filets a bit undercooked but mostly spot on. Truffle mac and cheese, Farmer flatbread pizza, bacon, spinach, cracked egg - delish. Desserts, pizooki, homemade doughnuts - to die for. Great food, solid drinks, unique atmosphere. Away from the strip, a gem."
"Patio's grand, perfect for shootin' the breeze with pals. Inside's tidy, service is snappy. Pastries? Mouthwaterin'."

"Alack, fair friends, upon a sweltering day,
In Chinatown, my belly did protest and say,
'Feed me, good sir, or else I shall expire!'
My metabolism, swift as a raging fire,
Did crave sustenance, and so I did stray,
In search of new delights, beyond my Thai,
To HSP, a place I chanced upon, by Yelp's decree.

"My initial thought, in wonder and surprise,
Was this: 'Holy shade of night, what magic lies here?'
For in the Chinatown Plaza, extension bound,
On Wynn Road, near Spring Mountain, did it abound.
The lady, kind and fair, did tell me then,
'Five years, good sir, we've been open, by the pen.'
I felt, in truth, like one who dwells beneath,
In ignorance, where knowledge doth not reach.

"But lo, the shop, small, yet full of delight,
With poke, in quantities small, but oh so bright!
No old, stale fish, with funk, did I espy,
But freshness, in each bite, did meet my eye.
In Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl, with rice so fine,
And black sesame seeds, did I partake, and dine.
Eight dollars, fair price, for such a feast,
I shall return, to savor more, at the least."

"Boys had a blast. Pricey, but worth it for the clean, well-lit atmosphere. WiFi's a bust, grub's mediocre and overpriced. Can't bring your own drinks, but hey, at least they got Pepsi. Games were in good shape."

"Since mid-eighties, I've frequented this place,
Consistent, it be, in taste and grace.
No fine dining here, but good cheer,
Fair prices, too, and service near.
On winter nights, when winds do howl,
And cold doth seep within thy soul,
This curry house, a haven, doth provide,
Warmth and spices, a gentle stride.
Beware, dear friend, when naan thou dost order,
For sizes, they do come in but one,
A feast for five thousand, 'twill suffice,
And leave thee full, nay, overspiced."

"Patio wait time's a bitch. Been here plenty, know they don't take reservations. But a 90-minute wait at 5:30's a bit much. Food's always great though. Get a steak, hubby does skate or short ribs. Service is solid too. If you want the patio, be prepared to wait. People watching's top-notch, but the sensors only work close by in the casino. Worth it in the end."

"Never caught a Cirque de Soleil show before. Nor any Vegas act. But damn, I loved it. Musicians killed it, dancers popped, acrobats took my breath. One hell of a night. And hell yeah, free tix made it sweeter."

"Hark, my dear! We didst order yon lobster and shrimp dip,
And verily, 'twas a dish most wondrous and fine.
But alack! The cheese, it didst make it too heavy,
And the chips, they didst break, oh so sadly.

Twice we sent it back, and they didst take it away,
And in its stead, we didst try the parmesan fowl,
With baked potato, a dish most fair and bright.
'Twas enough for two, and we didst share with delight."
"Good eatery. Unique menu, witty. Food, top-notch. Pierogi sliders, eggplant lasagna, both A-1."

"Good eatery, plenty on the menu. Breakfast too, eggs, taters, that sorta thing. Not sure 'bout the authenticity, but they got good meat. Pastrami, corned beef, can't go wrong. Service top-notch, friendly folks. Popular spot, I'll be back."

"Went on a date night with the missus. Had a swell time. Our instructor, Melissa, was a peppy gal, full of energy. She talked fast, but gave us enough time to paint each step. There was a finished painting to reference. Drinks were average price, five bucks for beer, seven for wine. Last call drinks were half off. Didn't eat there, but people were snackin' on apps throughout the class. Would do it again, and recommend it to anyone lookin' for somethin' fun and different."

"Hark, good sir! If thou dost seek a meal most fair,
'Tis Joy thou shalt request, our server of great care.
A feast fit for a king, or so it doth seem,
With saimin, sausage, eggs, and rice, a dream.

So come thou here, upon this sacred ground,
And ask for Joy, ere the sun doth rise profound.
For in the morning's early hour, 'tis true,
This meal shall satisfy, as none other can do."
"Food, authentic. Spicy, like the name said. Went there twice, happy both times."

In fair Summerlin, where folks do dine and drink,
A new establishment doth now take its place,
A pub, where one may find solace and cheer,
And partake in victuals of merriment and grace.

The staff, so friendly, doth attend to thy needs,
With smiles and service that doth make one feel at ease,
Their chicken sandwich, a dish most wondrous and fine,
Doth satisfy thy hunger and doth taste divine.

Yet, alas, there be a few things to note,
For those who doth frequent this place, beware,
The house whisky, a drink most vile and base,
Doth taste of cinnamon and orange, a wretched mix, I pray thee, pass it by, and save thy taste.

And lo, the bathroom sinks, a curious sight,
A slab of tile, tilted, doth make it hard to stay dry,
A basin, a better choice, doth save thy clothes,
From splashes and the limited space, which doth annoy.

In conclusion, a great place to visit, indeed,
With food most delicious, and staff most kind,
But shun the bathroom sinks, and the house whisky,
And thou shalt have a merry time, I doth predict.

"Been here thrice now, and'll keep comin' back. Best buffet value for locals, and with coupons, a good deal for visitors too. Prime rib's perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they're happy to oblige. Crab legs are fresh, and they got several types of shrimp. Somethin' for every seafood lover. Mexican food could use some work, enchiladas been a bit hard, but they got plenty of Asian choices, and the American part's always delicious. And the desserts? Oh yeah, lots of 'em, with plenty of no-sugar-added options for those who need 'em. Servers are professional and personal."
"Family-owned joint, great service. Bagels, top-notch. Breakfast and lunch menus, plenty to choose from. Kitchen's accommodating, too."

"Moved to the other side of town, found a new sushi joint nearby. Service and rolls, top-notch. Happy hour, 4-8 pieces, try a bunch of different ones. Nice spot, loving everything so far. Better than my old spot, I Love Sushi."
Wine and bruschetta, real good. Apple one, best. Live music, nice touch. Outside, needs work. Fire pit, add some life. Great spot, still.

"Verily, they do take their time with mine own children, and are most skilled. Ofttimes, they have a list of those who wait, and are full booked, so 'tis wise to call ahead and make a meeting. Forsooth, 'tis well worth the while, for the outcome doth speak its own tale."
"Pizza impressed me. Mozzarella and provolone blend, not too much provolone. Service top-notch. Been underwhelmed here before, but yesterday they brought their A-game."

A wondrous place, where families may partake,
In horseback rides of joy and gentle sake.
The setup, my dear, doth please mine eyes,
With ease of paperwork, and riding guise.

In North Scottsdale's desert, fair and bright,
This time of year, doth bring forth delight.
The grounds, so lovely, doth invite,
To take a springtime ride, with nary a fight.

The staff, so helpful, courteous too,
Doth make mine experience, most anew.
Their knowledge, vast and deep, doth shine,
And makes me want, to ride again, in fine.

I shall return, with haste and cheer,
To this place, where memories doth appear.

"Methinks 'twas a wondrous chance, a roller coaster ride,
Inside a casino, hotel grand and wide.
My age, alack, doth make me feel quite ill,
But who cares? Youth lasts but a fleeting still.

The line, a winding snake, did move so slow,
As all, like us, did rush to go, ere midnight's toll.
The ride, a thrill, did make me laugh and shake,
My shirt, a poor choice, did cause me to partake.

My love and I, we laughed with joy and mirth,
At photos taken, worth each penny of their worth.
Two pictures, priced at fifteen gold coins each,
We bought, and split the cost, our love to teach.

The employee, a scowl upon his face,
Did glare at me, for asking a separate place.
But nay, good sir, we paid, and with a grin,
For joy, not anger, should our souls win."

"Hark, fair maiden, what news dost thou bring?
A tavern named Whiskey Dicks, of dubious fame,
In location most vile, yet within, a gem.
The service, swift and kind, doth make amends,
For beer, a decent choice, doth flow like streams.
A hearty welcome, from a lass so fair,
In shorts, didst greet us, with a smile so rare.
I prayed for Ranger IPA, a brew most fine,
And lo, they didst possess a range divine.
My feast, a Philly cheese, with fries of might,
The seasoning, a marvel, a true delight.
Alas, the steak, a tad dry, and bread, excessive,
Yet onions, fresh, and peppers, a true delicious.
Thus, with the ale, and service so bright,
I raised my rating, one whole star in flight.
For most pubs, alas, do lack such brews of renown,
But here, a few New Belgian, and Sam Adams crown.
Since nigh, my work doth lie, I shall return anon,
To savor more, their ale, and cheerful tone."

"Hark, I've dined here oft, 'twas my wont,
At my old work, they'd deliver, 'twas convenient.
And later, fortune smiled, a new post,
But a stone's throw away, no need to boast.

Once a week, or so, I'd make my way,
For their Chicken Pita, a feast for the day.
Grilled fowl, of flavor, rich and deep,
In a whole wheat wrap, a satisfying sleep.

Cucumber sauce, a cooling delight,
Hot garlic chili, a spicy ignite.
Together, a harmony, a culinary bliss,
A meal, fit for a king, at a reasonable price.

Eight dollars, for a full pita, fair,
A bargain, for such a delicious fare."

"Hark, what cheer! This place doth please me well,
A haven of delight, where all doth farewell.
The staff, they doth excel, with friendliness and grace,
Their promptness doth astound, leaving naught to trace.

The vibe, akin to Toby Keith's own nest,
Doth bring a smile, and put all cares to rest.
The entertainment, live and full of cheer,
Doth make the heart sing, banishing fear.

The bar, a marvel, with all save Norm,
Doth quench thirst, and doth no harm.
The prices, average, yet still a bargain,
For all that's offered, 'tis no scam.

The food, alas, doth leave somewhat to seek,
Yet burgers and fries, they doth the trick.
So, to this place, I give a hearty nod,
A solid A, and worth another visit from God.

Check it out, good sirs, and thou shalt see,
This place doth offer all, in harmony.
We shall return, forsooth, anon,
For more of their warmth, and merry tone."

"First time here, I came with a seasoned shooter who provided the hardware. Range virgin, I was. Central location, nice setup. Staff, friendly. Two others sought certification, not the paper kind, but the real deal. I needed more practice, so I passed. Tourists swarmed the place, hope they open a local joint. Prices steep, but classes gratis. Monday morning, not too busy, but it picked up. I'll return to hone skills and take the test, but looking for cheaper ammo and targets."
"Food's great. Better than other Biancos, more options. Service? Slow, forgetful. Portions? Small. Went on Sat night, had our pick of tables, no wait. That's hit or miss."

"Vietnamese Sandwiches, the only reason I come here. Best in Las Vegas, trust me. Fresh-baked bread, soft and crunchy, still warm. Tried others, this place wins. 

Other dishes? Meh. Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai, but not super authentic. Stick to sandwiches and boba (decent, not great). No Pho fan here. 

Price? Dirt cheap, $3.50. Minimum $20 for debit cards, annoying. No cash, no problem. 

Dine in? It's alright. Odd cleaning product smell, weird sea theme, eye-sore bathroom hallway. 4/5 stars for price, sandwiches, boba."
"Barbecue was decent, not amazing. Sauce selection, top-notch. Kettle chips, free and tasty. Food arrived quick, like lightning."

"Damn good burger at The Farm. Sweet potato fries, too. Powdered sugar, nice touch. But service? Forget about it. Forgot our fries, had to ask twice. By the time they arrived, we were almost done with our burgers. Slow, man. Real slow."
"Ten years I've been comin' here. Try other joints, but always end up back at Nancy's. Friendly folks, good work, like my nails and pedis."

"This joint's great. Got a ton of hand-me-downs for my kid when he was born, but he couldn't wear 'em all. So, I hit up some consignment shops. Checked out a few, but Smarty Pants was the best. Friendly owners, nice selection, and got some sweet deals. They're expandin' too, gonna have a separate spot for furniture and more adult clothes. Can't wait to go back and spend my consignment cash."

"Paul's review got me thinking. This joint's got a sweet setup, outdoors but feels like a club. Acoustics are top-notch. But, let's talk turkey - drinks are pricey. Like, credit card or hide-your-flask expensive. The parking lot's begging for a keg party, but we tailgate before shows anyway. Ten bucks gets you a 12-pack and a sandwich, or one 24-ounce beer inside. My two cents? Lower those drink prices, folks. Still, this place is solid, bringing in better acts all the time."

"We heard good things 'bout this joint on Yelp, so we made the drive from Scottsdale to Tempe. Worth it? Hell yeah. Friendly doorman, attentive bartenders, killer blue cheese burger. My boyfriend sampled their beers, all three, and gave 'em two thumbs up. It's a laid-back, sporty spot with tasty grub. We dug it."

"In sooth, I chanced upon a vacant shop, devoid of mark or placard, nigh unto the other furniture emporia. 'Twas then revealed to me that it had shifted its abode, yonder, across the way, where now it doth reside, a beacon of brightness, with windows reaching to the heavens, twain sides of the edifice, at 2711 S. San Tan Village Pkwy, in Gilbert's fair town."

"Princess Nails, dingy joint, but Michelle, oh man, she's a gem. Second time getting my brows waxed, just as good as the first. Ask for her. Can't give it five stars though, place could use a scrubbin', but what'd they do without Michelle? Note: Review's based on eyebrow waxing, don't get my nails done, so take it for what it's worth."
"Old hotel, not the fanciest. But the buffet? Surprisingly good. Not a ton of options, but what they had was top-notch. I'll be back."

In fair Phoenix, where the sun doth beat,
We find solace in sweet, cool retreat.
Amidst the heat of summer's day,
We seek the shade, and drinks that play.

One such place, of old renown,
Is Sphinx, where dates are crowned.
Their shakes, a treat most fine and sweet,
Do quench the thirst of those who meet.

For many years, this place hath stood,
And served the folk of Scottsdale good.
So if thou find thyself in need,
Of cooling drink, and gentle deed,

Seek out Sphinx, and taste their delight,
And let the dates, thy thirst take flight.

"Been eager for this joint to open. Went there second night, pretty damn good. Service, chips, salsa, grub, and drinks all top-notch. They did a swell job fixin' up the inside. Another solid spot in the area, variety's always welcome."

"Jimmy John's finally made it to town. People raved about it, so we gave it a shot. Two sandwiches caught our eye - the No 9 Italian Night Club on a crispy French roll and the No 12 Beach Club on hearty seven-grain bread. Quality stuff, no doubt. Good bread, too. Prices were fair. But the joint was loud, what with the tunes blasting and the echoey decor. New spot, though. Maybe they'll tone it down as time goes on."

"Went to a burger joint at Mandalay first. No service for five minutes. Left. Came here. Service good, not snooty. Got different tasting menus. Mine was four courses sans wine. Cold broccoli soup, lobster curry, foie gras filet, Armagnac dessert. Everything presented well, tasted great. First time with foie gras. Rich, but balanced by filet. Junk was tasty. Only misstep, basic mashed potatoes. Atmosphere romantic, view stunning, experience to remember. Not cheap, but worth it."

"A wondrous small cafe, most fortuitously placed,
For a quick boost amidst a shopping spree.
'Tis somewhat hard to find, but fear not, dear friend,
For 'tis between Eaton Centre and Place Ville-Marie that it doth reside.
A counter rather than a cafe, I must confess,
For there's no place to sit and savor thy latte with ease.
But fear not, for thy order shall be prepared with haste,
And the service, though swift, doth still maintain a level of grace."

"Hark! What portions great! My colleagues and I did dine,
At this establishment near the Hilton, where we did confine.
Our server, swift and cheerful, did attend to our needs,
With smiles and grace, she did our hunger feed.

A cheeseburger, fries, and salads we did order,
The latter two, a feast for the eyes, a bonanza to devour.
Steak and mushrooms, fruit galore, they did astound,
We marveled at the bounty, the kitchen's profound.

Alas, my burger, well-done, did come a bit too done,
Charred, alack! Yet still, I did consume, for fun.
In conclusion, a decent place, for a meal most fair,
But only if nearby, would I return there."

After our woeful night at PURE, we stumbled, inebriate, towards Poetry. The sweet melodies of hip hop, a welcome respite from the tedium that had beset us, greeted our ears. Our initial visit occurred on a Thursday eve, or rather, Friday morn, around the hour of 1:30, with nary a penny charged for entry (a feat of magic, indeed). The fairer sex paid a mere $20, as I recall. Verily, we danced the night away, imbibing in drinks that flowed swiftly, and reveling in mirth. This haven, a paradise for aficionados of hip hop, shall be my destination of choice whenever Fortune guides me to Las Vegas. We returned the following eve, and, lo, the merriment continued unabated.

"Hark! Fish and Chips, perchance? Aye, had them, with quesadilla too,
Last eve, and deemed them most delectable, I do confess.
But, alack, this morn I feel a tad sluggish, 'tis true,
Yet blame not the victuals, for they were quite fine, I do aver.
The tavern, neat and tidy, boasted a fair maid,
Whose service was prompt and most courteous, I must say.
A quiz night, or trivia, did ensue, and all was mellow,
Save for the tap beers, which seemed quite standard, I do tell thee.
Still, I shall return, for a nightcap, 'tis my intent,
Since 'tis but a short stroll from mine abode, thou wilt see."

"A dish of smoked salmon upon an egg white omelet,
I didst partake, and found it most delightful.
The staff, they were pleasant and kind,
The ambiance, grand, and parking, most convenient.
Alas, my drink, it was weak, I do confess,
But still, I would return, for this place doth impress."

"Hark! My review doth speak of what I didst order,
A White Pizza, straight and plain, yet full of flavor.
Cheesy, but not too much, so as to be a burden,
One slice, a meal, for one of moderate means.
Fresh from the oven, hot and savory,
Ricotta, in great quantity, a true delight.
I do confess, a tad more creamy, my desire,
But still, a worthy slice, and worth the fire.
In Las Vegas, five dollars, a fair price,
For late night morsels, a convenient device.
The staff, kind and quick, a joy to behold,
So, heed my words, and give it a try, I do bold."

"Verily, a wondrous encounter! I do confess,
My locks, they doth hold a special place within my heart.
And thus, I am oft filled with trepidation
When strangers doth essay to crop them with their shears.
But fear not, fair maiden Summer, forsooth,
Didst prove herself most skilled and courteous,
She heeded all my wishes, nay, didst exceed them,
With her deft scissors, she didst shape my mane most wondrously.
I shall return, anon, to her expert care,
For she hath won my trust, with her gentle touch, so rare."

"Methinks 'tis my second time to visit fair Victoria's halls,
A Yelp event brought me thither, atmosphere most grand,
But even sans such merriment, the barkeeps' mood did tell
That 'tis a place most pleasant to tarry, come what may.

The mulled cider, oh how sweet! In two flavors, 'twas served,
Lingonberry, my heart doth sing, like memories of Sweden's fare,
And pear, a fruit most fair and bright, a worthy choice indeed,
At Victoria's, part of a kin, with Hemma, Sofi's, and Joseph's creed.

Verily, I shall return anon, to meet and make merry,
When Leith Walk doth beckon nigh, this bar my heart doth carry."

"The second day of our eatery's opening, all hands were on deck, you see. We sampled the Salumi & Cheese Board, a platter most fine, with olives, veggies pickled, bread grilled, and meats cured, a feast divine. The capicola and proscuitto, oh how they shined! And the gorgonzola, a cheese most rare, with a taste of blue and a texture so fair and bright. A burger, you say? Indeed, we didst play, with the Pat Lafrieda, a sandwich of delight, brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and fries of the Tuscan kind. The tiramisu, a sweet treat, the best we hadst e'er met. Ask for a table by the window, a view of the Strip most grand, and bring thy camera, to capture the cakes, a sight most bland."

"Camelview's one of my go-to spots for indie flicks. They get some great films that you won't find at your average multiplex. Plus, the staff's friendly and the drinks are reasonably sized - no bucket-o-cola nonsense here. And let's not forget the tasty cinnamon almonds at the concession stand. It's got a retro vibe going on too. Sure, it's an older theater and the seats could use some work, but it's still a cool place to catch a movie. And hey, it's popular with an older crowd, which makes for a different kind of movie-going experience if you're used to something else. All in all, it's a fun spot to hit up every now and then."

"Yelp steered me right. Hired solo, had doubts 'bout the movers. First off, they sent a pic and bio of the estimatormade me feel safe. Showed up dead on time, worked like hellions. Five stars, no question, but for the botched trundle bed. Still tryin' to fix that mess. Other than that, A-1 move. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend 'em."

"Liquor store's not my usual haunt, but this joint's alright. Friendly staff, no hassle. One time, I brought my boyfriend along. He wanted some fancy beer they didn't have. Counter guy said they'd get it. Sure enough, next visit, there it was. We stocked up. Rest is history."

"Aye, the show was fair, yet not so grand a spectacle as one might hope from yonder ABCD contest. But, mark thee well, they performed twain shows in one eve, each of ninety minutes' length. Thus, 'twas wise of JBWKZ to hold somewhat back, lest they exhaust themselves. And so, though 'twas not a show most wondrous, they did add sparks of fun with their clever use of technology. Aye, they played diverse tunes, from fourscore, Disney's, hip hop, punk, and even some disco, ha!"

"Good joint for the location and size. Good place to start the night. Got carded for water at the bar, what a drag. Drinks were tasty, though, and there was a tiny dance floor. \n\nBut the real action was on stage. A sultry broad belting out tunes, oh man. Great entertainment after a few drinks."

"Methought the iced coffee didst taste divine,
And all I didst order, didst please mine eyes.
This place, my go-to breakfast haunt doth be,
While in this land of plenty, I do stay."

"DSW's got some new kicks, man. Used to be all dress shoes, but now they got some runners too. Not like those specialty stores, but still, it's cool they got some Mizunos and Asics. I usually stick to the men's side, but my sister loves this place. She'll spend hours in there, and I get it. They got a lot more options for women."

"Tired of waiting next door, I chanced upon Waffallonia's door.
A waffle with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries did I order,
Doubting its size, but soon I found it quite sufficient.
The sweetness of funnel cakes did it resemble,
Fresh fruit and mix did make it most delectable.
Glad was I for the wait, else I had not tried,
This cozy place with waffles that did satisfy.
Though small the space, the atmosphere was snug,
Waffallonia, a gem, with waffles most delicious."

"Went to Oregano's in Mesa. First time. Had a great bowl of pasta. Bartender/server was top-notch. Name's Ashley. Friendly, efficient, and knew her stuff. Made the whole experience even better. Will be back for more."
"Sipped Grey Goose and cranberry, savored a Las Vegas roll - my favorite, fried or not. Courtesy of the owner's girl, who trimmed my locks. Her treat, my delight."

"Upon our journey from the airport, my comrades and I didst seek sustenance to start the day aright. Happily, we chanced upon an IHOP, where we didst partake in a hearty breakfast. The establishment was mostly vacant, save for a few other groups. Our server, a pleasant lass named Shee, didst attend to us with haste and warmth. The victuals were consistent with the standard of the chain, naught extraordinary but still satisfying. As an added boon, the IHOP lay near the Pinball Hall of Fame, a site most wondrous and worthy of visitation. Verily, 'tis a decent venue for breakfasteers, and I shall return, mayhap."

"I wandered into the Chippery, Forum Shops, looking for a quick bite. Friends were getting daiquiris, but I spotted homemade chips in the back. Shoved through the crowd, made my way to the counter. Selection was decent, 6-8 flavors. Prices, $3-$5 per bag, depending on size. Service, however, was lacking. Not exactly the friendliest folks at Caesars that afternoon. Still, a hidden gem for a cheap snack."

"Toy store's a real maze, kid. Organized, too. Easy to find what you need. Sections for toddlers, games, stuffed animals, learnin' toys, dolls, sports, action figures, cars. One way in, one way out. They gotta keep the little ones from runnin' wild. Curvy aisles at the start, then you hit the main drag. Checkout was smooth. Lady caught me hidin' somethin' from my niece's view and she scanned it when she wasn't lookin'. Prices are steeper than most department stores, but worth it for the selection."

"A small eatery, yet full of cheer,
With tasteful trimmings, and service most dear.
Pad See Ew, a dish of flavors bold,
Yet lacking in quantity, I must be told.

Pad Thai, a feast for my tongue to delight,
Chicken tender, noodles cooked just right.
A generous helping, leaving me quite content,
And since I dwell nearby, they'll see me oft, by fortune's bent."

"Tasty joint. Drive-thru's still kickin', order-taker's friendly and peppy. Wings? Perfectly cooked, big as hell. Sides? Meh. Fries good, potato salad small, overpriced. Avoid 'em, stick with wings. Mix and match flavors, you won't regret it. Other wing spots, watch your back."

"This dive bar's become a regular haunt of mine in Vegas. Two shots and a cold one for nine bucks? Hell yeah! Crowd's a mixed bag, but they know how to have a good time. Karaoke's top-notch too. Place gets packed on Saturdays, but that's part of the charm. If smoke bothers you, best to steer clear. Bartenders pour 'em strong and the staff's friendly as can be. One thing though, there's just one john in the joint, so be prepared to wait your turn, ladies."

"Fair Leith Links, a verdant haven, doth lie
In North Edinburgh, a peaceful retreat.
With winding paths, playgrounds, and space to roam,
It beckons thee to stroll, to run, or play at home.

A refuge from the bustling city's din,
Leith Links doth offer tranquility within.
Though quiet, still, it doth not lack delight,
For festivals and circuses doth take flight.

Allotments and orchards doth flourish here,
And golf, my friends, didst first appear.
So, take a stroll, and let thy spirit soar,
In fair Leith Links, where recreation doth explore."

"Tis a common sight, this eating place,  
With naught unique, yet mostly fresh face.  
The prices, reasonable, doth make it so,  
A frequent stop, for me, 'twill be, I know.  
  
Half-half combos, for soups, salads, and sand,  
Do make my heart sing, with joy, so grand.  
Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini too,  
And Cesar, all classics, anew, anew.  
  
But, alas, there be a problem, I fear,  
The sweeping, oh, how it doth appear.  
A brush broom, with dust, doth make a fray,  
And noise, that doth take, from the meal, away.  
  
Not wholly unique, this place, doth be,  
But, fair food, for a quick bite, doth see."
