For he will cast thee out, as yesterday's trash, no more."

"Moved to Bloomfield in April, thought Little Italy would be a good fit. Wrong. Every Italian joint I tried was subpar. Until tonight. Lombardozzi, had no idea why I hadn't tried it until now. Had their meatballs during Little Italy Days, enjoyed 'em. Decided to give 'em a shot. Started with calamari, perfectly fried, no rubbery texture. Gnocchi with red sauce, homemade and delicious. Meatballs, just as good as I remembered. Service? Bad. Waitress took forever to take our drink order, seemed annoyed. Will be back, though. No Italian food in Bloomfield comes close to Lombardozzi."
"Shrimp and crab, fresh as can be. Prime rib and leg of lamb, carved to perfection. Other dishes abound. Desserts galore, crepes made to order. Better value on weekdays."
"Steak sandwich, damn good. Fries, crispy and hot. No sauce needed. Wife had Mamas burger, bun and mushrooms, nice. Meat, flavorless. Give 'em another shot."

"Sitting down to eat meant waiting in line on the street and sharing a table with strangers. Didn't bother me none, though. It added some charm to the place, I thought. The smoked turkey sandwich was real good, moist and tender. Fries were crispy outside, soft inside. Dill pickle was big and tasty. Cole slaw was lightly dressed, some of the best I've had. Our server was top-notch, funny and fast. Place had the best reviews and highest rating, no surprise. Worth checking out."

"This joint was top-notch. Had the buffalo cheesesteak sandwich with raw jicama fries, a welcomed change from the usual fare. 

Modern vibes, plenty of comfy seats, and a decent-sized crowd. Most folks were dressed for the gym next door. Parking was a bit tight, but there was always space to be found. 

They had a nice cafe area too, with some stylish furniture. Impressed, and I'll be back."

"Lotus of Siam, five stars, no question. Beef thai jerky, tom kha soup, must-haves for appetizers. Prik King, Panang, incredible entrees. Can't handle spice like I used to, so I go mild and add my own heat with the spices on the side. Worth the ask, trust me."

"Verily, I feel like a character from old cinema,
With red lips and a gown fit for royalty,
When within these walls, I do often venture,
To partake in the art of jazz, in all its grandeur.

The stairs, I descend with grace and poise,
Clicking my fingers, as if in sweet surprise,
At the prospect of the music that doth await,
In this dimly lit den, where passion doth ignite.

Tis a gamble, the jazz that doth ensue,
For oft, the house band doth deliver anew,
The pianist, in particular, a maestro true,
But alas, the guests, their skill may not always shine through.

Yet still, my love for this place doth abide,
For in its essence, 'tis a haven, where souls collide."

"Walked from Caesar's Palace towards the Forum Shops, left at the fork. Ordered waffle fries dusted with cocoa and chili powder, chocolate chai to go. Watched the barista make my drink, step by step, like a recipe. Ate a few fries before heading back into the mall, before they got soggy. For $7, about 10-12 large waffle fries. Didn't taste much cocoa, just a hint of chili. Drink was worth it, rich and hot, but not too frothy."
"Killed time at Apache, waited for a spot to open. Enchilada plate, red and cheesy, surprised me. Tomato-based sauce, not my thing, but it worked. Six bucks, a steal."

"Coffee was weak, but dad's breakfast special - two eggs, hash browns for 3.95 - was a steal. Korean omelette was flavorful, but won't order that combo again. Cheery owner and chef. Colorful decor. Great morning spot."

"Hark, good sir! I do confess,
I know not this land, nor its ways,
But when in Phoenix, I do make haste,
To visit Jersey Mike's, for their fame doth spread wide,
And sample their wares, of which I do speak,
Their quality, unmatched, doth leave me weak.
Oh, how I wish they had more locations near,
For then, my hunger would be ease-ier to bear.
But alas, they do not, and so I must content,
With but a few, and savor each bite, as if 'twere a gem.
And though Subway and Quiznos may have their place,
Jersey Mike's doth stand apart, in taste and grace."

"Verily, the victuals didst prove worth the coin,
In size, they didst surpass our expectations.
The menu, alack, didst stretch on for miles,
A burden for our taste buds' deliberations.

A trimming, perchance, wouldst do it good,
To split the choices twixt morning and evening's mood.
But, lo, the innards of the place didst shine,
With artistry that didst mine eyes doth blind.

Four burgers we didst sample, each a delight,
And fries, in varied forms, didst please our sight.
In sooth, a feast most wondrous and fair,
That didst leave us sated, without a single care."

"A place most wondrous, where pizza and wings doth please,
With friendly folk, and service that ne'er doth cease.
'Tis one of mine own favored haunts, for dinner most fair,
In atmosphere most jovial, and food most rare."

"Hark! My friend didst say, 'Twas Guy, of Food Network fame,  
Who didst host a show in this fair place.  
Thus, we didst decide, my dearest friend and I,  
To partake in their culinary delight.  
At six and thirty minutes past the morn,  
We didst arrive, with hunger pangs born.  
Enchiladas, we didst order, with great cheer,  
And found them quite delectable, I do declare.  
A bit more substance, we didst expect,  
But still, the dish didst please, and that's a fact."

"McAlp's, across the street from where I worked. Twice a week, minimum. Atmosphere, good. Food, better. Desserts, best. No need for renovations. Classic vibes only. Making me hungry just thinking about it. Need to schedule a downtown meeting, excuse to eat there again."

"Scottsdale for spring training, sought a top-notch steak. Locals pointed me towards Mastro's Ocean Club. Now I understand why. Energy abounds the moment you step in. Bar area bustling, but not too crowded for a drink. Meals - outstanding. Steak? Top three I've had. Recommended, though pricey."

"Wine list? Ridiculous. But that's their shtick. Huge, like a damn phonebook. Organized by price, not variety or region. Serves two restaurants, Cowboy Ciao and Kasmierz. Cowboy Ciao's doing well, location, setting, food's good. Went there with L and my pops and his new wife. Had the K Vintners' highly-rated wine for $200. Better memory with wines than what we ate."

"Driving back from Tempe, I swung by this joint for a bite. Clean digs, friendly folk, and damn good grub. Had their ribeye steak sandwich, a solid 7 bucks, with fries and onion rings. One of the better steak sammies I've had. Onion rings? Not usually my jam, but these were game-changers. Giving 'em four stars for now. Need to try the burger before I can give 'em the full five."

"Hark, what news is this? A place so fair and bright,
My wife and I didst visit, and with delight.
'Twas but a fortnight past, we didst hear tell,
Of Bread and Butter, a cozy nook to dwell.
We didst venture forth, our hearts full of cheer,
And found within, a feast for our ears.
Their cinnamon roll, oh sweet and tasty treat,
Didst tempt our taste buds, and didst us greet.
The waffle sandwich, with Bechamel so fine,
Didst make our morning, most divine.
Our cousin Johnny, didst join us the next day,
And didst partake, in all the delights we didst play.
A resolution we didst make, to visit each week,
Or every other, our souls to seek.
I do recommend, this place so fair and bright,
For breakfast, and lunch, a true delight."

"Steakhouse, good stuff. Salad, veggies, lobster mac, all delish. Service top-notch. Ambiance, music, A+. But steak? Overcooked. Medium rare, my ass. More like medium-well. For real? Payin' premium, expect better. That's a fact."

"Saturday night, Labor Day weekend. Not too busy. Scored a sweet spot in the back, comfy couches. Our waiter, a friendly bloke, gave us the lowdown. Sampled some wine and dessert. A bit steep, but we'll be back. Solid experience."

"Ribs and brisket at this joint? Damn good. Ribs usually ain't my thing, but these fell off the bone, juicy as hell. Brisket had just the right amount of fat, real flavorful. 

They got three BBQ sauces: sweet, smokey, and white thunder. Sweet's your typical BBQ sauce, smokey's my favorite, white thunder's just heat. 

Prices are standard, around $8. Close to work, I'd definitely go back."
"Urban chic, this place. Chai tea latte, top-notch. Breakfast, pricey. Bagels, Sara Lee. Honey-butter, makes up for it."

"Four to five stars, easy. Spicy as hell, but that's what we came for. Fried avocado, oh man. Best thing I've ever tasted. Owner was a sweetheart, too. Friendly, helpful. She knew her stuff. Thursday nights, wine's half off. We took advantage, stayed for hours. Small joint, but packed. Must be the good word from the locals. Summerlin knows a good thing when they see it. Great lighting, too. Don't let the strip mall location fool you. Perfect for a date or girls' night out."

"Verily, 'tis a pleasant scent that doth fill mine nostrils.
A trifling sum, indeed, doth purchase this delight.
A subtle jape, a playful jest, doth aim at thy hygiene, good sir.
And lo, another market doth present itself, where gifts for women of a certain age may be had, come Christmas tide."

"Methinks 'tis one of the finest brunch buffets in all the land. A feast fit for a king, with omelets made to order, eggs of the finest quality, and sweets that doth delight the senses. And let us not forget the bubbly brew that doth complement the mimosas so well. Verily, my tiny roommate didst partake in this spread for three full hours, and subsequently didst indulge in a most satisfying food-coma, forsooth."

"Hark, what news is this? A feast most fair and bright,
The lunch menu doth please mine eyes and appetite.
In Vegas, I shall return, with haste and speed,
To partake of this delightful repast indeed."

"Great spot, got here just before three on a Monday. Only four people ahead of us, but it took around ten minutes to be seated. Don't bother trying to push your luck, the line grows fast as dinner approaches and the smart diners aren't leaving anytime soon. They want to see the dinner selection too. 

A few things disappointed me: eggs benedict was impossible to cut with the provided knife, and when I tried to bite through it, it was rubbery...I love meat, but there were only two options at the carving station (top sirloin and flank steak?)...desserts were cute, but some were off, and none made me want seconds. Had to ask for milk because some desserts were too creamy or sugary (weird, since I've never thought something was too sugary)...left about thirty minutes after dinner started, didn't notice much of a change in what was being served. Dishes were refilled, that's about it. 

Food was good, but I expected to try dishes that I don't usually see and that taste phenomenal. Minus a star for not serving anything I wanted second helpings of."

"Methinks 'twas a night most fair and bright,
With atmosphere so merry and light.
The service, too, didst please mine eyes,
With swiftness and grace, they didst surprise.

But, alack! When I didst order a drink,
I didst expect a wee bit of a kick.
Alas, two draughts didst leave me quite sober,
Leaving me to ponder and to sobber.

The popcorn, verily, didst taste most sweet,
And tuna, oh! 'Twas a dish most meet.
Prime rib, with its presentation so fine,
Didst bring a smile to mine face, and a twinkle to mine eye.

In conclusion, 'tis a place most wondrous,
Where one can take their guests, and be most hospitable.
I shall return, to sample more of their fare,
And revel in the joy that doth abound there."
"Birthday dinner with loved ones. Sushi spread fit for the gods."

"Hark, they do provide conveyance of victuals!
Their pizza, a culinary delight, doth surpass
Most other delivery establishments in flavor.
A ten-inch pie, a suitable portion for one,
Doth satisfy hunger and craving. The staff,
In merriment and mirth, didst converse with us,
And answers to our queries didst provide.
We shall, anon, partake of their fare once more."

"In days of yore, when EM Cafe didst open its doors,
'Twas a hit straight away, by fortune's favor.
Its decor, so breezy and effortless, doth please,
With tall ceilings, white walls, and art local.
A big table in the midst, for gatherings great,
Doth make it a place where folk do congregate.
The victuals, though basic, didst satisfy,
But late, alas! some dishes didst decline.
Sandwiches, omelets, and French toast, a treat,
Portions, not vast, yet still, they didst suffice.
In Mile End, 'tis now a haunt most dear,
A wonder, indeed, on Parc Avenue, quite near."
"Aria or Cosmo? Toss-up. But I know one thing - Aria's got the best poker game in town. That's why I stick with them."

"Food was top-notch. Had the carne asada platter, real good. Friend had some burrito, said it was great. Service was slow, but the guy at the register was friendly. Didn't get our drinks refilled, no one checked on us. Not a big deal. We'll be back."

"I stumbled upon this joint due to its catchy name. It's tucked away in the Noda area, where parking can be a real hassle, but it's got its own private lot, which is a definite plus. They also offer free Wi-Fi, which is always a bonus. 

The place has a cozy vibe, with about ten tiny tables scattered inside and out. They've even got their own roasting machine, which is a big plus for coffee snobs. I'm a fan of strong, sweet coffee, like you'd find in Cuba. But, I made the mistake of ordering a hazelnut cold brew. Don't get me wrong, it's still decent, but I prefer a bit of sugar in my coffee. 

I stopped by to do some research, since we haven't gotten around to installing internet at our place yet. After three hours of sitting there, I decided to try a Chai iced latte and a lemon poppy muffin. The latte was alright, but it didn't blow me away. 

I'll definitely be back, though, for the super friendly staff and to try their Cuban coffee when the weather cools down."

"Methought I did enjoy myself full well,
Despite the fact that many friends did say
The lady's visage was not fair to tell,
But in truth, she did surpass my gaze.

The bottle service, oh how grand a sight,
Did make our evening most delightful and bright.
One bottle of ciroc, four maidens fair,
We drank it all, and laughter filled the air.

The bench, so cushioned and soft to sit,
Did grant us comfort, and a place to knit.
The view from thence, most wondrous to behold,
Did make our spirits high, and our hearts bold.

The dancers, with their props and finery,
Did stir within us, a desire to be merry.
I would, anon, this spectacle behold,
For 'twas a night most joyous, and worth the gold."

"Loud joint, but good thing we had a reservation. Service top-notch, food and drinks came quick. No bad seats either. Had the cheeseburger, simple but damn good. Still thinking about it actually. Then had the brownie, felt like I died and went to heaven. Wine list was decent too, some interesting picks. Would definitely go back, solid American grub done right."

"This joint's great. Good eats, cheap. Persian/Middle Eastern grub, casual, fast, and fresh. Lunch with a drink, under 8-9 bucks easy. Kubideh combo, two skewers, ground chicken and lamb, plenty of food. Eight bucks, that's all."
"Coffee shop, inconspicuous, beneath Elizabeth Arden's Red Door Spa. Few pastries, iced coffee, three bucks. Watery, but on a hot day, refreshing. No sugar water, a shame."
"Food's alright, but the service is top-notch. I come here for the game, a couple drinks, and the atmosphere. TVs everywhere, different games on each one. Big screen on the patio, it's a real treat."

"Saturday mornin', still on the road. Laundry time. Real easy access, real clean too. Nice attendant tells me they got fluff 'n' fold for $1.50 a pound. Plenty of machines, wifi, change machine, soap, TVs, A/C, ceiling fans, carts, foldin' tables, seating. And if you're a trucker, this place is on the corner, plenty of bobtail parkin' on the street. I'll be back."

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy for thee,
Cajun barbecue shrimp, thou art divine!
Bread, oh bread, thou art a worthy friend,
To mop up all the saucy goodness that doth end.
Great service, drinks of fine quality,
Before the crowds, a peaceful reprieve doth be.
And music, country tunes that doth delight,
In this, a country bar, where spirits take flight.
Aye, shrimp most wondrous, thy praise I do sing,
For thou dost make my taste buds dance with glee!"

"I didn't stay here, but I did win a few hundred bucks gambling. Had a good time, but getting drinks took forever. Not gonna let that ruin it for me though. The roller coaster's a blast. Rode it last time, had a hell of a lot of fun. Can't wait to come back and maybe even stay here next time."

"Great concept! Loved the individual portions, fun novelty. Shareable items with a buddy. Highlights: pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried chicken, mushroom risotto, truffled scalloped potatoes. Lowlights: too-salty ramen, subpar sushi, disappointing desserts (rock-hard red velvet cookies). Cool mac and cheese bar, but shareable, rich, and creamy. Save room for king crab legs. Unique items make it interesting, despite fewer options."

"Good eatery. Love their chipotle sausage. Cheese top-notch. Had it on a burger, too. Hushpuppies decent. Moist like conch fritters. Pork, mac, beans all good. Variety of sauces. Signature sauce, vinegar and tomato mix. Brisket, meh. Ribs, fatty and tough. Hope that's a fluke. Support local spots. Friendly staff."

"Husband and I hit up Presto for the first time. Ahi tuna sliders, Greek pide - both solid. Never had pide before, but the non-greasy crust was a welcome change from the usual pizza mess. Service was good, despite some online gripes. Only gripe: pre-made salads kept in a cooler. Wanted the ahi salad, but it sat all day, so passed. Can't say how it tasted, but overall, a good lunch spot."

"The Cosmopolitan, four stars. Didn't stay, but still saw plenty. Casino's a stunner, crystals hangin' like a chandelier. Loved it. Clubs and shops, high-end, outta my league. Sports Book, watched my team win. Better odds than my place. One of the nicest on the Strip."
"North Phoenix, friend's birthday. Mutual pal chose the spot. Authentic joint, Cantonese-speaking staff. Helpful with recs. I'd return if I lived nearby."

"Upon the bustling Las Vegas Boulevard, where revelry doth reign supreme,
My comrades and I didst seek refuge from the din and noise,
In a tavern, where we might find solace and a moment's peace.

Our arrival, at ten o'clock, didst coincide with a lull in trade,
And thus, we found ourselves ignored, as if by fate's decree.
But patience, dear friends, for soon our waiter didst appear,
And with a smile, didst take our order, banishing all fear.

Their menu, vast and varied, didst cater to each whim,
Yet, alack! My first encounter, left me in a state of woe.
For chili, that dish most vile, didst leave a foul taste in my mouth,
But, lo! The salads, numerous and fresh, didst make amends, no doubt.

Thursdays, they do offer, a dish most fair and bright,
A BBQ chicken, served o'er cold soba noodles, a wondrous sight.
The marinade, a blend of sweet and salt, didst evoke Chinese delight,
And the half-portion, eight dollars ninety-five, didst fill me with cheer.

Ah, but the fries, oh how they didst tempt me,
Thick-cut and golden, a delicacy, indeed,
I could not resist, and thus, didst partake,
A sinful indulgence, yet, a joy, indeed.

And thus, we dined, and laughed, and made merry,
Whilst the music, of the nineties, didst play on,
Smashing Pumpkins, Bush, and more, didst bring us cheer,
A night, most pleasant, and one, we shall hold dear."

"Methinks what pleaseth me most about this place, my dear,
Is the basement where the used vinyl doth reside.
In Milwaukee, twain locations doth have the records on the ground,
So full they be, that sitting on the floor doth seem profound.
And moving twenty at a time, 'tis a chore, indeed,
But here, oh here, the vinyl doth reside in bins with ease,
Seventy-five percent, a number most divine,
Doth make my heart sing with joy, and my spirit doth entwine.
And in this basement, empty and still,
I doth feel welcome to sit and peruse at my will.
For two hours, or more, I doth not feel ashamed,
To search through each album, and each note, unnamed.
In Milwaukee, at the store on 76th street,
I doth not feel welcome, with people all around,
But here, my dear, I doth feel most at home,
In this basement, where the vinyl doth roam."

"Moon Doggies, a dive bar that's surprisingly clean, serves up grub that's worth trying. Chris, the owner of Naked City Pizza, told me it's a cool spot, mostly for industry folks. I took my hubs and dad there for lunch, and we skipped the pizza - I mean, when in Rome, right? We went for the buffalo wings instead, and they did not disappoint. They were cooked just how I like 'em, nice and hot. My old man loved his chili cheese hot dog, loaded with all the fixin's. The steak frites sub was a beast of a sandwich, packed with garlicky beef, creamy horseradish, and crispy fries. It came with a side of peppery gravy that hit the spot. Our lunch for three was $25, and we even took some home. I'll definitely be back soon to try the pizza!"

"Saturday afternoon, early, dropped by for lunch. One other table, not many, but new, so understandable. Server, new too, but did well. Ordered Ma Po Tofu, Baked Pork and Rice with Portuguese sauce. Good taste. This place, good for Hong Kong-style western dishes. East side alternative to Spring Mountain Road Chinese restaurants."

"Dish ain't no fancy joint, but it's got its charm. Laid-back, Southern vibes, perfect for a late night bite or nursin' a hangover. Grilled cheese, tomato bisque, deviled eggs - simple, good eatin'. Black bean and rice burrito, my go-to. Jukebox plays some cool tunes too. No frills, just a solid local spot."

"I hit this joint twice in 24 hours during our Vegas trip. Reasonable prices, food's not half bad either. Had the garlic chicken wings, hubby liked 'em, but I thought they could've used a bit more flavor. Crispy garlic was decent, though. Salted fish and chicken fried rice? Hell yeah, that's what I'm talkin' about. Generous portions, too. My pops wasn't feelin' too hot, so I got him some jook - salted pork with thousand year old egg porridge. Not bad, nice balance of saltiness without bein' too watery. Later on, my old man had their curry beef. Can't say for sure how it was, but he cleaned his plate, so that's a good sign. Beef chow fun? Now we're talkin'. Lot of flavor, nice kick from the stove. A few other dishes, but overall, this tiny hole in the wall outside the strip's a solid find. And best part? Won't break the bank."

"Hark! No frivolity, fair prices doth reign. My trusty steed, an Audi of fine renown, didst receive servicing from Dan, a man of skill and worth, whose expertise doth rival that of Chapman's own. No grievances didst I bear, as is customary with this most excellent of men."

"Went there last night with some pals. Service was top-notch. Our server kept our glasses full and even split the tab for us after we forgot to tell her to. My pizza was damn good. Got a personal pie with artichokes and sliced tomatoes. A bit pricey, but the ingredients were high-quality and I was real pleased with it. Everyone else at the table raved about their grub too. Didn't see a single slice of pizza left at the end of the night. Worth going back for, just wish they had more options on the menu."

"Fare thee well, good sir! Forsooth, the victuals here do surpass the common pub grub, with flavors most rare and delectable, by my troth! In sooth, I didst find great pleasure in yon tomato soup, made with goat cheese, and the goat cheese fritters, verily, they were most divine. And, by the stars, the butternut squash croquettes didst delight mine taste buds! Moreover, they do possess an array of local brews, of highest quality, upon the tap, forsooth. The ambiance, warm and welcoming, doth evoke a sense of comfort and cheer, most fitting for a public house, methinks."

"This joint's always bumpin', but not so packed the staff can't take care of you. I've chowed down here a few times and the grub's always been top-notch. Their pasta dishes are where it's at, haven't had a bad one yet. If I'm feelin' frisky, I'll go for the flank steak salad. It's still damn good. And their Italian sodas? Hurricane's my jam. This place is my new go-to for Italian and it's a must-try."

"A cafe most wondrous, near Concordia's halls,
Where scholars gather, and poets enthrall.
A place for lunch, or study, or to sip,
And savor flavors, that doth please the lip.

The panini, half-price, a bargain true,
With soup, a meal most satisfying, anew.
Lemonade, with lavender and rosemary,
Tart and full of zest, a refreshing draught, indeed.

Atmosphere, cozy, tables set with care,
A place to linger, without a single snare.
Shisha, once present, now gone, alas,
I pray, dear cafe, bring it back, prithee, at last."
"Saturday afternoon, lunchtime. Food came quick. Tasted good. Had Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. Spicy, but needed more. Order at 11, maybe you'll get lucky."
"Lunch was good. Service? Not so much. Came here after Qua Spa. Pizza? Amazing. Toppings galore, crispy crust. Server? Unresponsive. Water glasses empty. Meal unchecked."

"Verily, I was informed that this buffet was the finest in all of Las Vegas, and upon my visit, I found it to be most excellent indeed. A feast fit for a king, with snow crab, king crab, steak, prime rib, shrimp, and all manner of delectable dishes that one might find at such an establishment. Though the cost may be a bit steep, 'tis a small price to pay for such a sumptuous repast. I didst partake in a bounty of crab, worth a pretty penny, no doubt, at any other eatery. And what's more, I didst spy John Wall, a man of great renown, enjoying himself nearby, which didst only add to the ambiance. In conclusion, I shall most certainly return to this buffet again, should I find myself in Las Vegas once more."

"A bar most wondrous, with staff so kind,
Their brews, a sampler, do thou find.
Red ale, my heart doth sing,
A taste, so rich, so bold, so king.

Tuna poke, a memory so bright,
Lulu's in Lahaina, a delight.
BJ's, a challenge, they didst take,
And with their version, my senses didst shake.

Avocado egg rolls, a treat so fine,
My belly, with joy, didst entwine.
Not greasy, a wonder to behold,
A culinary feat, so bold.

A place of merriment, with screens so bright,
Sporting events, a delightful sight.
Fun and cheer, doth fill the air,
At BJ's, a place so fair and rare."

"Best joint on Mill for grub, hands down. Chicken ceasar salad, phenomenal. Fussy about my ceasar dressing, but this one's spot on, not too fishy. Margarita pizza, great too. Woodfired, so might be a tad dark, but just tell your server to cook it less if that bugs you. Service top-notch, dig the vibe."

"HH, a joint for the cash-strapped, offers a sweet deal on Mondays. Used to be a medium 1-topping pizza for $5.55, but now it's a large for $5.99. Not bad, considering you don't need to buy three pizzas like at other places. The taste? Pretty good. Thin crust, sausage or pepperoni, and a few added toppings. They don't drown the sauce or skimp on cheese, and the pizza's still decent reheated."
"In we came, for dinner. Enjoyed it. Ordered masala, spicy. Not like others, too bland. Here, flavorful, hot. Staff, friendly, attentive. P.S. Love Indian food."

"Fair Southern victuals, fit for a king!
The cornbread, oh so fine and sweet, did sing.
I chose the BBQ Beef Ribs, with sides of Mac & Cheese,
Collard Greens, and Yams, a feast most fair and pleasing.
The ribs, with tang of vinegar, did taste divine,
The macaroni, cheesy and rich, did make me dine.
The greens, with zest of citrus, did delight,
And yams, with savory sweetness, did ignite.
In Charlotte, first dinner, I did find satisfaction.

Prices, fair and reasonable, did seem just right,
Service, good and prompt, did make my night.
But parking, alas, a challenge it did pose,
Best to park in structure, near, not on the roads."

"Chipotle be damned, I found a new fix. Tortilla soup, enchiladas straight from the oven. Why didn't someone think of this before? Parking's a bitch, but worth it. Snickerdoodles and Mexican wedding cookies too. Arrrgh."

"This humble shop doth please me well,
Though 'tis not grand as yon Scottsdale's sprawl.
Yet, I do prefer its peaceful spell,
For shopping there, my sanity doth preserve.
They may not boast the same vast array,
As that great store, where crowds doth sway,
But still, they hold the choicest prey,
And thus, my visits doth it earn, each day.
After Trader Joe's, 'tis my next stop,
For goods and wares, it doth not drop."
"Chicken's good. Been there a few times, simple menu. Only issue's the chicken, sometimes it's rubbery. But that's on the bird, not the cook."

"Sierra Gold's got a real cozy vibe goin' on. Good grub, too. You can score some solid satisfaction whether you're there for the game, poker, or just hangin' at the bar. Happy hour's every day, 3-7 and 12-4. That's right, half off all drinks and pizza. Now, let's talk food. Thin crust pizza, not my thing, but it's decent. Wings, they got 'em in a bucket, and they're pretty great, especially the garlic parmesan. Curly fries, yep, they got 'em too. And don't even get me started on the Zookie. It's like a warm hug for your taste buds. White chocolate macadamia nut cookie, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate and caramel drizzle. Service ain't bad either, even at midnight. Open 24 hours, this place is a gem."
"Thai Taste, a college haunt of mine. Green curry, my heart's desire. Later, fate took me to Thailand, devouring dishes I once savored here. Thai Taste's renditions? Sublime."

"Atop yon hill, a wondrous sight doth lie,
On fair days, all of Edinburgh's land doth meet thine eye.
The Observatory, a marvel of old, doth stand,
And columns of a monument, unfinished, yet grand.

In summer's heat, when sun doth shine so bright,
Thou shalt bask in its warmth, and all thy cares take flight.
And should thou be a photographer of skill,
Sunrises and sunsets here, shall make thy heart fill.

This hill, a venue for arts and performances, doth play host,
To Beltane Festival, on April's thirtieth, a night of boast.
And on New Year's Eve, fireworks doth light the sky,
One of seven hills, where revelers doth gather nigh.

Mayhap, they shall not change this hill, nor hinder access,
For 'tis a blessing, for residents, in this busy city's press.
I find solace here, in peace, away from throngs,
A haven, for quiet walks, where troubles fade, like morning's mist."

"My first dim sum adventure didst take place at Great Wall, a tableau rosa* indeed. Being unfamiliar with such cuisine, my thoughts are but a narrow reflection of my own limited experience. Nonetheless, I shall share them with thee.

Mr. K hath penned a most accurate depiction of this establishment, so I implore thee to peruse his words. The victuals didst taste pleasant unto me, and the atmosphere didst possess a merry and lively quality. Verily, the demonstration of culinary artistry found within these walls doth differ greatly from any other eatery I have visited in Phoenix. Those who lament the dearth of variety in this fair city, mayhap a visit to Great Wall shall broaden thy horizons.

I must confess, I didst traverse a considerable distance via the highway to partake in this gastronomical journey. Thus, my willingness to return doth speak volumes. For those whose sense of direction doth falter, fear not! The restaurant doth reside within the initial shopping plaza situated on the east side of 35th Avenue, a short distance north of Camelback."

"Pizza joints claiming to be the best in the States? Been to a few. This place? Not bad. Motorino in New York City and A16 in San Fran still top my list. But hey, good pie. Cool spot. Friendly service. I'd go back."

"Friday night, me and the boy hit up Tamari. Reservation was for around nine, but we had to wait a few minutes 'cause the place was hoppin'. Hosts were real friendly, though, and got us drinks from the bar while we waited. They've got a good selection of drinks, some interesting cocktails, and decent wine and beer.

Now, the tapas. They've got some real creative combos. I was impressed. Didn't even need to eat much, just wanted to try a couple things. Had the lamb lollipop, real tender and tasty. And the red snapper, man, that was good. Came with mussels in a saffron broth, real different, real yummy.

The boy didn't like the empanadas too much, but he loved the hangar steak. Said it was worth way more than the $2 price tag. They're small servings, sure, but quality makes up for it. Haven't tried the sushi yet, but I'll be back. Oh, and Sam Worthington was there. From Avatar. That's worth an extra half-star, according to the boy."

Hark, good sir or madam, heed my words of wisdom,
Come early to the theatre, lest thou be denied a seat,
For swiftly they do fill, and thou shalt be left standing,
A sorry sight, indeed, and full of woe and disappointment.

I do confess, I hold this theatre in high esteem,
For oft it doth play films that elsewhere cannot be seen,
And the seats, they are most comfortable, a true delight,
A place where one may sit and watch, with joy and rapt attention.

Alas, the prices be a bit steep, I must confess,
And the crowd, it doth swell, making parking quite a mess,
But still, I say, 'tis worth it, for the experience doth make,
A night to remember, full of laughter and of joy, a true delight.

"This joint's gotta be my fave sports bar. Atmosphere's top-notch, screens galore, and not a bad seat in the house. Plus, they got a sick patio - one of the best in town, easy. Been there twice in the past week for Suns playoff games. Grub's solid, especially for bar food. First night, we shared some wings, potato skins, chicken quesadilla - you know, the usual health nut stuff. Second night, we went for the prime rib, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. Twelve bucks, and it was on point. Finished it off with the skillet cookie - best thing I've ever had, period. Only downside was the waitstaff. Had to work for our drinks a few times. But hey, that's minor. Great spot, and we'll be back."
"Clean, fresh grub. Great addition to any town. Owners on the ball, giving folks what they want: organic, healthy options."

"A wondrous place, indeed, where one may quench their thirst with ease!  A private gathering brought us hither, yet we found ourselves most merry upon the dance floor.  Tidbits and potions, both were savory and swiftly served by skilled barkeeps.  The lounge, cozy and inviting, didst play host to our revelry.  The melodies didst fill the air, a most pleasant accompaniment to our evening's delight.  Should thou seek a refuge from the crowded, boisterous throngs of XS or Tao, this place shall serve thee well."

"Hark, good sir or madam, to my words of praise,
For Villa Antonio's lunch buffet, 'tis a feast most fair and bright!
For just nine silver coins, thou shalt partake,
Of a meal most wondrous, with no limits to thy plate.

Their baked chicken, roasted veggies, salad so fresh,
Mashed potatoes, cheese ravioli, all doth impress.
Other Italian delights, they do provide,
A veritable cornucopia, to satisfy thy inside.

So, if thou art in search of a quick repast,
During the workday, when time is of the essence, at last,
Villa Antonio's lunch buffet, doth come highly recommended,
For value and quality, it doth leave all else unmentioned."

"Hark, my friends, and heed my words of cheer,
For Jason's Deli doth provide a feast most fair and dear.
Their salad bar, though small, doth make up for its lack of size,
With offerings diverse and plentiful, a true delight for the eyes.

For just a few coins, thou shalt partake in this bounty,
And enjoy unlimited trips, as if in a dream, or so it seemeth.
Captain's Wafers too, a nostalgic treat, doth bring us joy,
A taste of childhood memories, a sweet and savory alloy.

But, gentle friends, beware the patio's plight,
For vagrants doth roam, and trouble doth ignite.
So, if thou art in search of peace and quiet,
Best to avoid that place, and seek thy meal within, or by delivery, swift.

And should thou choose to order in,
The turkey reuben, a dish divine, doth come highly recommended,
With baked Lays and pickle, all for a mere 550 calories,
A guiltless pleasure, and a satisfying repast, that doth console.

So, go forth, my friends, and indulge in this delight,
For Jason's Deli doth provide, a true culinary sight."

Hark! We've just returned from four days in fair Las Vegas,
Where we didst dine and revel in merriment with ease.
Two nights in a row, we didst grace Level 107 with our presence,
And found the service, food, and drink to be most excellent.

There were seven of us in total, and we all didst agree,
That the appetizers were delicious, and the martinis didst please.
Two for one on martinis, and half off on apps,
Didst make our evening most enjoyable, and our spirits didst lift.

I, myself, am not a fan of martinis, I confess,
But the caramel and raspberry didst tempt me, and I didst acquiesce.
So if thou find thyself in Sin City, do not hesitate,
To visit Level 107, where thou shalt find great drinks, and service most elate.

"A fair and sunny eatery near our lodging, where we dined oft in two weeks' time.  Tis a place that doth fill thy plate, with crepes, waffles, pancakes, omelets, blintzes, and more.  They pour free coffee, too, and keep it full, by my troth.  The weekday folk speak little English, but fear not, for on weekends, those who serve are skilled in speech.  And thus, we had no trouble in ordering, by the grace of Providence.  I know not why others didst leave such poor reviews, for this place doth meet my humble needs."

"First Watch, a place where healthy meets delicious. Consistently serving up great meals, with service to match. Never had a bad experience, always leaving me wondering why I don't come back more often. Chickichanga, my personal favorite, but everything on the menu is top-notch. Love that I don't feel like I've consumed a ton of grease after eating here. A truly fantastic spot for breakfast."
"Pastries, breads, breakfast, lunch, dinner. Cozy joint with a fireplace, plenty of tables. Cash only, pay up front, they'll bring it out to you. Free refills on joe. Never disappointed."
"Peru, been there a few times. Food's good, real good. Went for lunch, came back for dinner. Owners and staff, they work hard. Make sure you enjoy yourself."

"Last month, my daughter didst treat my husband and me to a feast,
For our anniversary, at a Chinese restaurant of great renown.
I must confess, the fare was quite decent, and the ambiance fair,
But the cost, alas, didst make mine purse feel quite bare.

Yet, we didst enjoy the service, and the food didst please,
And I, a lover of dim sum, doth seek more such ease.
For though we lived in San Francisco, where Chinese cuisine doth reign,
I search for non-chain eateries, with flavors not in vain."
"Good pho joint. Special combo's solid, but portions vary. Big one day, sad face the next. Only pho game in town, though. Service is top-notch. Hope this helps."

"Hark! What light through yonder Longhorn Casino breaks?  'Tis the Chuck Wagon, a haven of culinary delights, A place wherein one may find solace from the smoke-filled night.  For in this den of chance, the food doth reign supreme, A veritable feast fit for a king, or so it would seem.  My heart doth yearn for breakfast, and thus I do proclaim, The Stampede, a dish most wondrous, with eggs, bacon, and hash browns in its midst, And toast, a humble servant, doth complete this royal quest.  But lo! There's more, a dish most cherished by my sire, A man of great renown, a Marine of some fire.  He doth swear by the S.O.S., a culinary delight, A true masterpiece, worthy of the gods in their fight.  The service here, a shining star, doth make amends, For the smoke-filled path that doth lie betwixt friends.  Yet still, a wait doth come, a test of patience, no doubt, But fear not, fair traveler, for 'tis worth the rout."

"Hark, good sir! I vow, ne'er shall I step foot in County Market more,
For Old Time doth meet my meat needs, and that's fore sure.
Their sausages, oh so tasty, and flavors, they do change,
But still, the classics, bratwursts, and spicy Italian range.
Their flank steak, a delight, and bulk Italian sausage, too,
Especially for spaghetti sauce, made from scratch, anew.
My gripe, their hours and place, could be better, I say,
But staff, most helpful, doth aid in special cuts, come what may."

"Fuzzy's Tacos, been there a few times. Good experiences, always. Taco Plate, my go-to. Two tacos, two sides, six forty-nine. Veggie, tempura shrimp, both solid. Chips, salsa, plenty. Burritos, eh, stick with tacos. Hot sauce, sufficient. Waited a while, few times. Suggestion: grab chips first. Good spot for tacos, chips, sports. Give it a shot, buddies."
"Burger joint serves up top-notch grub for a steal. Smash fries and fried pickles, damn good. Friendly service, quick too. In N Out can't compete."

"Wine shop, good one. Went there for a CMYE, though don't drink much wine. Organic, sustainable wines for the eco-conscious. In Atherton Market, plenty of parking, but the Vin Master's hard to find. Tucked away, hidden behind a pizza joint. Thankful for signs and GPS or would've missed it. Shop's bigger inside, exposed brick, high ceilings, pleasant lighting. Couple chairs, tables, folks sipping wine. Nice touch, trying before buying. Owner Chris, super friendly, certified sommelier. Helps you pick the right wine. Check it out, worth it."

"Closed for reno, two weeks now. Pricey? Maybe. But for a Berto's plate, I get a nice seat, good salsa, and some heat. Service is solid too. Problem is, the food's a mixed bag. Great ingredients, but the protein's a letdown. Shame, really. If your pals rave about Macoa's, this place will blow 'em away."

"Methinks 'tis love that doth inspire the menu at this fine eatery, for all the ingredients are fresh and locally sourced. The ambiance and decor do please mine eyes, and the service, by the gods, doth fill my glass with water ere it doth dwindle to naught but half its capacity. A goat cheese appetizer, by the name of Apollo, doth grace our table, and verily, 'twas most delectable, especially when paired with those beets that doth resemble rubies. I, myself, didst opt for yon smokey burger, whose flavor didst rival that of any king's feast. Alas, the fries were scrumptious, but alack, the burger didst fall apart betwixt mine fingers, making it a challenge to consume. My spouse, that noble sir, didst choose the sirloin steak, and though the flavor didst delight, the cut of meat didst leave much to be desired, being overly chewy and with gristle in the midst. And thus, we didst conclude our repast with a s'mores parfait, which didst prove to be most excellent. In sooth, I wouldst return anon, and sample either the prime rib or some finny dish, forsooth."

"I'll level with you, I didn't have a damn clue what was happening. But it looked pretty cool, like a full-on assault on the senses. Not sure I'd pay to see it again, but it was definitely something."

"This pub doth please me well, my friends,
With its interior bright and welcoming.
Me and mine companions frequent here,
For their pizza special, most endearing.

'Tis half off past midnight, a bargain fair,
A large pizza for eight silver coins, quite rare.
Their crust, so thin and crispy, doth delight,
The best I've had, in truth and in sight.

Besides victuals and drink, they have a space,
For games and merriment, a joyous place.
Two pool tables and screens, for entertainment,
A touch-screen device, for games, not for payment.

If music be thy desire, a jukebox grand,
Doth offer two songs for each silver brand.
'Tis heard throughout the tavern, loud and clear,
A pleasant melody, to banish fear.

Located near Ann and Camino Al Norte,
Across from Smith's, a short walk, no more.
And should the doors be locked, past ten o'clock,
Fear not, for 'tis not closed, but a mere knock.
They'll buzz thee in, with hospitality,
And thou shalt enter, with great felicity."

"Newk's never disappoints. Soups top-notch, especially the lobster bisque. Had the Ultimate Lobster today, despite my aversion to shellfish. Fresh caesar salad, crunchy and flavorful. Toppings bar offers roasted garlic, hot peppers, pickles, capers, parmesan cheese, and crispy breadsticks. But let's be real, the real MVPs are the oversized plastic cups. They're perfect for hydration at work, and we've got a stash of 'em in the cupboard. It's the small joys in life, folks."

"Tasty deals at this joint - two for $5 fro-yo or boba. I stick with taro milk tea and pearls. They give you a stamp card, too. Every purchase earns a stamp - waffles, crepes, fro-yo, or boba. Double stamps for the twofer. Waffles are great, but take a bit. Shaved ice is good, too. Regular with fro-yo, three toppings, shaved ice, and condensed milk. Solid spot. Give it a shot."

"Another SinCity burger, please. Delectable. Egg, bacon, cheese. Drool. Smash Fries, good but inconsistent. Salads, not bad. Dressing on the side, necessary. Five stars, almost. Inconsistent fries and drowning salad dressing, sorry, four stars."
"Took CCW course, instructor knew his stuff.  No gripes, made me a better shot.  That's all I need."
"Great bar in Pgh. Wide selection of brews on tap. Daily specials. Delish apps, stacked burgers, yummy wings. Get the sauce for the wings, teriyaki or honey BBQ. Highly recommend."

Chick-fil-a, comfort grub for me. Original chicken sandwich, add honey mustard. Grab another for dipping waffle fries - sometimes skimpy, but still good. \n\nSaw a talented balloon artist, best I've seen. Not there every week, but on some Wednesdays for "kids eat free." Mesmerized while waiting in line, didn't notice the wait or the crowds of kids. Chick-fil-a does family well, kids' meals come with educational toys, promoting literacy.
"Family-run joint. Small, but clean. Good chow. Eat in or take out. Fast delivery. We tried a few things. All good. Leftovers for another meal."
"Steak, bacon, and sweet potato tots with a dash of hot sauce. That's how I started my day. My friend Scott went for the Hawaiian breakfast. We both left satisfied."

"Suicide by soda and sweets? Rocket Fizz's got you covered. Childhood memories abound with odd sodas and candies. Jelly Belly Strawberry Jam soda, grab it while you can. Great prices, plenty of options, and a sweet tooth's paradise. The Fizz, it's a good time."

"Coupon for a free glitter ball in my email, so I took my little man for a free toy. Plenty of glitter balls to choose from. Signing up with the email rewards club is a good idea, they got events for kids, freebies, and great coupons. Took my little guy here when Ozzy Osbourne was signing his new book, it was wild, line around the building. But I cut in front, no one said anything 'cause I had my baby. Met Ozzy, had a blast. Staff was a bit overwhelmed, but they handled it."

Alas, poor Chocolate Swan, thy sweet delight
Hath left this mortal coil, and taken flight.
In Mandalay Bay, thou didst reside,
And with thy delectable treats, didst abide.

Thy eclairs, oh so divine, didst please
The palates of all who didst appease.
And cakes, so fair and beauteous, didst grace
The tables of brides, in their nuptial place.

Thou didst touch the hearts of all who didst partake
Of thy sweet creations, and for them, didst make
A memory, forevermore to last.

Alas, thy passing, doth bring forth tears,
For those who knew thee, and held thee dear.
But fear not, for thy legacy shall live,
In the hearts of those who didst thy sweets perceive.

Donations, warm wishes, and condolences,
To Mandalay Bay, do send, in token of thy praise.
For though thou art gone, thy spirit doth remain,
In the sweetness of thy desserts, forevermore to sustain.
"La Condesa, it's a real treat. Salsa bar's got some kick, tacos too. Had the shrimp, steak, and mole chicken. All good. Service can be slow, but it's worth it. Check it out if you're nearby."

"Hark, my friends, to this place we didst venture,
For an all-you-can-eat feast, a wondrous sight.
Cheap it was, compared to other joints,
And the victuals, they didst please our appetites.
We sat ourselves down, as soon as a table was free,
And forthwith, our server didst attend to our needs,
With speedy refills of drink, and fresh meat in abundance.
All was well, from start to finish, I do declare,
But take heed, lest thou dost reek of Korean fare."

"I've been hitting up this PetSmart pretty regularly over the past couple weeks. Got a new pup at home, and he needs his fair share of treats, kibble, and toys. Howie's a fan of Blue Buffalo, no surprise there. It's the good stuff, no soy, gluten, or corn, and no meat byproducts. Yeah, it's pricier, but hell, I eat healthy too, so why shouldn't my dog? The toy selection's alright, I guess. People might not wanna shell out for fancy toys, but come on, give a guy some options. And the collars and leashes? Forget about it. I've got a boy dog, and I'm a girl. Some variety would be nice. It's his outfit, after all. He should look sharp every day, coordinated with his coat. The staff's been cool, though. They're dog lovers, and they've given me some handy training tips. But I ain't taking Howie into PetSmart. It's a germ fest in there. You never know what sicknesses other animals might bring in. Not everyone's got their animals vaccinated or takes care of 'em right. It's nice to shop with your furry friend, but they're better off at home."

"A hearty fast food establishment, indeed,  
Where sandwiches are devoured with great speed.  
Ten times or more, my foot hath trod this path,  
And found satisfaction in each savory bite.  
But now, alas, my wonder doth begin to wane,  
For though the fare be good, 'tis not the same.  
The salads, too, I find not to my taste,  
And so, I leave them be, with nary a trace.  
Yet still, the sandwiches, they do please me well,  
And swiftly served, without a lengthy spell."

"Methinks the victuals here be of great worth,
In sooth, the green chile burger doth please my taste.
Aye, though 'tis strange to order such a dish
From out a Mexican kitchen, 'tis no waste.
And after, they do bring a sweet delight,
Sopapillas, crispy fried and sugared just right.
But, alas, the service doth leave much to seek,
For oft it doth drag on, and refills be meek.
Yet still, 'tis a fair place to sate thy hunger,
So patience, dear friends, and enjoy the splendor."

"Hark! I didst venture forth to this establishment,
Based on reviews most fair and bright.
And lo, the victuals didst not disappoint,
For I didst partake of Machaca's delight.

With rice and beans, and tortillas besides,
I didst feast upon a hearty meal.
But when I asked for more tortillas,
I was not told of the price, alas!

A dollar fifty, for two small tortillas?
Why, 'tis a price most vexing and vile!
For a dozen, one may pay but ninepence,
A bargain, indeed, yet still, I do protest.

For though the food was good, these trifles,
Do chafe my spirit, and doth beguile.
Free refills, or extra salsa, pray tell,
Are courtesies most meet, and worth the while."

"Methinks 'twas fortune that didst guide us to this humble tavern,
Wherein we found a feast most wondrous and fair.
The maiden who didst serve us, her name I know not,
But her skill and grace didst make our hearts sing.

She worked with speed and diligence, a true delight,
Her smile didst light up the room, like the sun in the sky.
Our cups were ever full, our plates didst overflow,
With savory dishes, fit for a king's table, I trow.

The menu didst boast a variety of fare,
From burgers to salads, and appetizers galore.
We chose the Western burger, a hearty meal,
With BBQ sauce that didst complement the patty most well.

And Frings, oh Frings, a side dish of renown,
Fries and onion rings, both crispy and brown.
A perfect accompaniment to our feast,
A worthy addition, indeed, to this humble roast.

So here's to thee, dear tavern, a place of note,
Where one can find a meal most satisfying, no doubt.
A haven for sports fans, a place to cheer,
With food and drink, most excellent, my dear."

"Hark! What have we here? A feast most fair and fine,
Leftovers from yestereven's Amore divine.
Deep dish pizza, cold as winter's snow,
And yet, it doth taste better so, I do avow.

The flavors, hidden before, now doth reveal,
A secret charm, that only cold can conceal.
So, keep a slice on hand, for unexpected guest,
For cold pizza, it seemeth, is the best.

In this discovery, I do find delight,
A new way to enjoy, the pizza's sweet bite.
So, let us raise a glass, to cold pizza's might,
For it doth bring us joy, in the morning light."

"Good spot for a bite, doesn't matter if it's a snack, appetizer, or meal. Especially useful when you don't know what else is open on Xmas and you gotta kill time 'fore you get sat at Sam Woo or Dim Sum. 

Pork Buns - decent size for $1.30, straight outta the oven at 11:30. 
Chicken Pot Pies - not worth it unless you're hankerin' for a classic American spin-off. 
Shredded Beef w/ Green Onion Roll - only good 'cause the rolls last all night, perfect for them hangover snacks. (costs more than the pork bun).

Honey, I wanna see your Pork Buns in Vegas, baby Vegas."

"Parking lot, easy peasy. Bar first, Crown Royal, no dice. Un-freakin'-believable. Breadsticks, hot, perfect. Grilled shrimp, clams, great. Angel hair, marinara, meatballs, excellent. Busy, service good. No room for dessert, next time."
"Pizza in Madison, WI. Good stuff. Crust, meh. Toppings, wow. Had it again after five years. Glad I did."
"The joint had space, lots of it. You could dance on the water and not feel cramped. A good time was had by all."

"Hark, this BoA branch doth be my favorite spot,
The staff, they doth assist with a friendly thought.
But lo, 'tis true, the place doth get quite busy,
With shoppers banking, oh so hazy.

Yet, I do not mind, for when I am done,
There be many a food place nearby, to make merry fun."

"A humble eatery, where food doth please,
And though a queue doth form, 'tis swiftly ease'd.
We sat without, for tables within were full,
Yet naught but drawbacks did our visit pull.

First, 'twas serve thyself, a cafeteria's plight,
Where utensils, condiments, and drinks we must take in sight.
And second, nay a drop of alcohol doth flow,
So Sunday's mimosa or Mary, here thou shalt not know."

"Hark, what news is this? My birthday bowl,
I sought it here again, on this fair day,
The seventh of May, a date most true,
And lo, the corporate folk didst play,
A part in extending my special treat,
In letting me have it, whene'er I'd eat.

Oh, props to them, for their kindness shown,
For making my day, with this gift alone.
But alas, a wait, there often doth seem,
Whenever I doth visit this place, 'tis true.
Yet, this time, my veggies, cooked to perfection,
And my sauce, almost flawless, save a little too much salt,
But still, a great $16, for two, I do avow,
Love to thee, GG, forevermore, thou art my bowl's best friend, now."

"Good layout here. Custom baby store, but not just for rich folks. Quality stuff at different prices. Some made me and the missus do a double take, but we're old pros now. Third kid, nine years later, lot's changed. Staff was top-notch, gonna register for some essentials."

"Solid joint. Not Two Sisters Thai or Sala Thai in Phoenix, but still good. Flavors are above average, not exceptional. Go there often since it's close to home. More authentic than trendy Scottsdale spots. One thing, if it's packed, leave. They can't handle a full house."

"Burger joint, great. Went on Memorial Day, place was jumpin' but not too packed. Grabbed two seats at the bar, easy peasy. Wanted a boozy milkshake, but the missus was feelin' frisky, so we went for a cocktail instead. Brown cow float, that's what I got. Light, but still needed a hand from the missus. Damn good, taste the booze, you bet. Love a good root beer float. Burgers, we both got 'em. Steakhouse burger, egg on top, nice touch. Funghi, that's my jam. Cooked just right, generous portion, damn delicious. Truffle flavor, Gruyere melted perfect. Refined mushroom and Swiss burger, yessiree. Fries, just okay. No excuse for subpar fries, but props for includin' 'em in the burger price. Service, good from the bartenders. Shakes and burgers took their sweet time, though. BF said his cocktail was on point. We'll be back, and next time, I'll make sure my fries are crispy."

"Two blocks from my place, I saw the joint prepping for opening day. Stoked, I tell ya. Been there 15 times now, and it's a dream come true - cheap, tasty tacos just a stone's throw away. Pork tacos, sublime. Beef, decent. Chicken, healthy and decent. Carne Asada, meh. Fish taco, not great. But hey, they got organic cabbage and tomatoes, so that's a plus. Flavored lemonades? Fantastic to meh. Three huge tacos for $4.50? Hell yeah, I'm sold. Not authentic, but who cares? It's healthy, cheap, and the owner's a peach. Once a week, easy."

"Le Rive review. Show was like expected. Not what you'd think though. Too much goin' on. Can't take it all in at once. Storyline ain't exactly clear. Clears up in the end though. Synchronized swimmin' with red heels, that was cool. Arena was neat, 360 pool view."

"XS may have stolen Tryst's thunder, but I still dig this joint. Always a good time. Love how the dance floor spills outdoors by the waterfall. Fresh air, you know? Layout's got character, not like those cookie-cutter clubs. Staff's top-notch, way better than TAO. Getting in's a breeze, never a hassle. Drinks come quick, and the bathrooms? Adorable."

"Decent joint for a burger. Not the best I've had, but still tasty and filling. Fresh veggies, plenty of toppings to choose from. Prices are fair. Tip: Jr burger's plenty, no need for the large. Fries, too - small's like a large elsewhere. Clean atmosphere, quick service. Good spot for a burger."

"I hit this spot every two weeks. They got a killer selection of organic veggies, always rotating so you ain't stuck with the same old thing every week. Employees are generally solid, happy to lend a hand. Just watch out for some quirky cashiers. But hey, they mean well. Some folks gripe about long lines, but I ain't never had that problem. Guess I'm just lucky, or maybe it's 'cause I go during the week. Either way, I dig shopping here."

"A humble bakery, tucked away on Rachel street,
Across from yonder church, where souls do meet.
Near Jeanne Mance park, where trees do sway,
A haven for sweet-tooths, 'tis a place to stay.

The space is small, but worth the wait,
For friendly staff and pastries, oh so great.
We ventured in for croissants, fresh and hot,
But alas, they were not yet ready, we were told.

So we didst venture forth, and tried instead,
An almond chocolatine, and petit pain brioche in our stead.
Oh, how delightful! Our taste buds didst sing,
For those sweet treats, they didst take wing.

I shall return, to sample more,
For there were pies, that didst call to me, and squares galore.
A veritable paradise, for those who love to eat,
This bakery, a gem, doth await thy treat."
"Good eatery. Plenty grub options, no wait. Sugar-free cheesecake, a highlight. Worthy indeed."

"Food was good, not great. Atmosphere was stuffy, overdone. Broccoli for ten bucks? Rip-off. Service was top-notch, though. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Would I go back? Sure, but with lowered expectations."
"Fresh grub, 'cept the meat's frozen. Service is good though. For nine bucks, you get a heapin' bowl of food, rice, soup, noodles, and a drink. Clean joint too."

"Fair Chaya, with dishes of Japan most fine,
In Pittsburgh's streets, a culinary shrine.
From California's coast, where sushi reigns,
To New York's boroughs, where ramen sustains,
My taste buds, trained on flavors rich and bold,
Have savored many a Japanese dish, of old.
And though Chaya's fare may not be the best,
It pleases still, and passes the test.

The prices, high, yet service, kind and fair,
Attentive, asking how the meal doth fare.
So if thou seekst traditional Japanese delight,
And hast the coins to pay the price of night,
Chaya's doors, open wide, inviting thee,
To partake of their delicious tea."

"Fresh from the Pacific Northwest, I chanced upon Big Heng, a culinary delight, by the grace of Yelp. The victuals were palatable, and the servings, generous. Alas, some confusion did arise, and I found myself paying a tad more for certain items that customarily accompany a Chinese feast - egg drop soup, for instance. Moreover, I had to request with some frequency, both mustard and sesame seeds, these being essentials that typically adorn the table in my native land. Kung pao chicken and a combo platter (#3) graced our table, and lo, the fare arrived with haste, which did stir doubts regarding its freshness. Nonetheless, the repast was delectable, and we shall indeed return."
"Bibimbop, good. Normal bowl, expected. No hot pot, menu said no dolsot. Kimchi, good too. Server, pleasant. Price, ten bucks. Reasonable. Glad to have bibimbop near me."

"O, how I love this place, my dearest friend! 'Tis a haven of delight, where sushi doth flow like a river, and for a mere $25, one may feast to their heart's content. Verily, the food hath always been of the highest quality, and never have we tasted anything that did not please our palates. 

But alas, the service, it doth leave a bit to be desired. Alack, the staff, they doth seem overwhelmed, and oftentimes, we are left waiting, our hunger pangs growing by the minute. And when the crowds do gather, oh, how the noise doth rise! 'Tis a cacophony of sounds, a symphony of slurping and chattering, that doth assault mine ears. 

And yet, despite these flaws, I still would give this place a 5-star rating, for the value and the quality of the food doth make up for the shortcomings of the service. So, my dear friend, let us return again, and hope that on the next visit, the service shall be improved, and our experience shall be truly divine."

"This joint's got a lively bar scene, downtown Phoenix, near the US Airways Center. Family area's separate, which I liked. Plenty of seats, but it gets packed on game nights. Parking's a pain, especially if you're just there for grub and drinks. I paid ten bucks for parking, oops. Ordered a Long Island Iced Tea, strong and tasty. Hubby got wings, seemed impressed. Fish tacos were solid, cilantro sauce was a bit thick and ranch-like, but the salsa was alright. Friendly bartenders, attentive service. All in all, great spot."

"Tao's my jam for dinner. Food's great, service is A+, and the joint's got style. Salads are a fusion of American and Japanese, and they're so good I could make a meal out of 'em alone. Seabass is top-notch, almost as good as Sushi Samba's skewers. Desserts? Amazing. I've tried 'em all, and they're worth saving room for. And the lounge? Perfect spot for a pre- or post-dinner cocktail."

"Fare most wondrous and fair, fit for a king,
And yet, most gentle on the purse, a rare thing.
A place so quaint, it doth remind me of
A Manhattan eatery, where taste doth reign supreme.

But alas, the service doth leave much to be desired,
Slow as molasses, and oft quite tired.
For though the fare be fine, the wait doth take its toll,
Leaving patrons to wonder, shall we ever be whole?

Yet still, I say, give this place a chance,
For the flavors, they do dance, with nary a glance.
If time be on thy side, and patience be thy guide,
Then venture forth, and let thy taste buds decide."

"Crab cakes, perfect. Flavorful. Dim lights, candles, romantic. Tables too close. Server, good jokes. Ribeye, big portion, lacking flavor. Average. No dessert, too full. Waiter, anniversary plate, chocolate, Happy Anniversary. Night made."

"XDC event, been here a few times. Only seen one track, but that's not all. Next to it, a lake, big as hell. People drive their water vehicles, do jumps, skiing. Get burnt, sure, but that's part of the fun."

"Good spot for a snack while crossing campus. Wright St., just off the quad. Decent flavor, fresh too. They stopped making my fave, Earl Grey truffles. Bummer, minus a star for teasing me with something I can't have."

We hit up Delights after a night of drinking at the Signature. The grub was solid. I had the Las Vegas Blvd sandwich - skirt steak, fried egg, caramelized onions, and a tasty sauce. It was a damn good sandwich, but the portions were a bit small and it was on the pricier side. I shelled out $12 for it, but it was worth it. No major gripes.

"Verily, this place doth please mine eyes and taste! Five meats they have, and with each dish, two sides doth come. Corn muffins, hush puppies, or dinner rolls, they doth provide. For eight coins, thou doth receive a hearty feast! Doug, the chef, doth cook in the back, while his fair wife doth serve and maketh desserts in the front. Their sweets, they doth call sweet potato pie and lemon cake. Solid fare, without fancy frills, they doth provide. Fried chicken, crispy and juicy, doth delight. Mac and cheese and collard greens, they doth impress. Pork ribs, a bit lacking, yet still, when heated, they doth satisfy. Ten tables, they have, and takeout, thou mayst also choose. On a Wednesday eve, few patrons, I didst spy. Yet, make haste, good sirs, and give 'em a try!"
"Food so good it'll make your taste buds dance. Pho, fried rice, rice plates - all winners. Don't take my word for it, try it yourself."
"Rigatoni Bolognese, a dish divine. My go-to order at this joint. A taste of Italy in every bite. Delayed post, but still worth the share."

"A culinary master and historian of victuals didst lead me to Joe's Diner, a place where I have since returned with great frequency. The interior design doth evoke the classic American diner, yet the fare and beverage doth excel expectations. Sandwiches priced at ten dollars are prepared with great skill. The coffee, Arbuckles Ariosa cowboy coffee, doth please mine taste buds. The server, a kind and gentle maiden, didst attend to mine needs with great care."

"Hark! This place I've visited oft, and ne'er have I left unsatisfied! 
Their potions, oh so fine and diverse, do please mine taste, indeed. 
A trio of my favorites, I shall name thee: Red-Headed Stepchild, Stoney Bah-Loanie, and Pure Vesper, by the gods! 
And, lo! Their victuals, too, do delight, in truth. 
Pork belly, Nancy with pork belly, charcuterie, pork tostadas, and, methinks, the TOT of the day, doth round out my feast most excellently! 
Verily, I say, a poor repast here, I cannot foresee!"

"I called, they came out, checked the serial numbers, gave me a real quote. Honest folk, third quote I got, a bit higher but they guaranteed their work for a year. Cooling my place down in a day, middle of summer, called me twice to make sure all was well. Good, honest service."

"Good grub, friendly folk, swell joint. Not the cheapest in the MGM, but worth it. Four of us had drinks, plenty of victuals for $300. Oysters, mate, they're top-notch. Don't bother with clams, they're mediocre at best. Meat selection's limited, but what they got is decent. Rib-eye's the real deal."
"Went to the lunch buffet with friends. First time there. Amazing spread. Tons of veggie options. Loved it."

"Hark, this be the spot where my love and I do partake,
In libations and tomes, and games of wit and chance.
'Tis not the hippest joint, nor the most in vogue,
But regular hours keep, e'en on the Sabbath day,
When grading papers doth my mind beset.
The staff, a kindly bunch, with smiles so bright,
Do offer to procure books, should they be out of sight,
And games, aplenty, for a bookstore of such might.
E'en Pandemic, that wondrous game of strategy and skill,
Didst I purchase there, with joy and delight.
And oft, I do espy, amidst the throng,
Teachers, like myself, who do delight,
In this, our haven, from the world outside."

"Stay here if you don't need frills. Not luxurious, but good experience. Went with friends to Vegas, booked two suites for three nights. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, two bedrooms, living room, flat screen, couch, chairs, dining table. Comfortable, homey feel. Clean, plenty of towels. Nice pool, no glass, solo cups okay. Relaxing, quiet. Would stay again. Only issues: suite wasn't ready, bathroom door had a hole."

"Verily, the victuals and the service here do excel! No frills or fancies, merely honest worth and excellence doth abound. Each dish that doth pass mine eyes doth seem a feast for royalty, and my nostrils do detect the sweetest of scents. By my troth, I shall return anon to partake of more delectable fare!"

"We caught the late show, unsure what lay ahead. But damn, it was a treat. Variety acts, plenty of 'em. Adult stuff, no kiddies allowed. Seats? Tight fit, like a too-small saddle on a horse. But hell, it's worth it. Good time, that's for sure."

"Wildflower Bread Co., a spot where you can grab a solid sandwich and not feel like you're in a stuffy joint. One of the founders even hit me up after I gave 'em a good review, just to address some minor gripes. That's service. They got a variety of sammies, salads, and pastries, all made with fresh bread. My missus' Caesar salad? Top-notch. This spot's got some perks too - power outlets under the booths, a chill lounge area, and a private room for bigger groups. If you're in the area, give 'em a shot."

"Oh, how my heart doth sing with joy at West Elm's name! What maiden fair doth not adore their wares? From bedding soft to pillows of grace, all things within their halls doth please.

Yet, alack! This grand emporium, though spacious, doth lack some designs that on their website doth shine. A pity, forsooth! But still, their staff doth boast a kindly mien and helpful spirit, ever ready to assist.

In sooth, their prices, though not always matching those online, doth prove a minor quibble. For in this city of sin, West Elm doth stand as haven and solace for the home-decor-seeking soul. Rejoice, fair shoppers, for thy search hath ended here!"

"Ethiopian grub, love it. First had it in Frisco, courtesy of an uncle's connection. Damn good. Then, a family friend from Ethiopia, introduced me to more. Would eat it daily, no problem. Blue Nile, first Ethiopian joint I tried in Phoenix. Always passed it, till one day, decided to give it a shot. Impressed, it was! Don't recall the names, but had the chicken with mushrooms, lentils, and that spongy bread. Eating with your hands, awesome. Wish I could've tried more dishes at once, but oh well...Cafe Lalibela, holds a special spot. I'll be back, and I recommend giving it a go."

In days of yore, when thirst didst beset thee,
And thou didst seek a draught to quench thy drouth,
A place there was, in Michigans' heart,
Where spirits flowed like a bounteous brook in springtime's birth.

'Twas called The Old Fashioned, a name most odd,
For within its walls, youthful vigor didst abound,
Amidst a college town, where learning didst unfold,
This tavern didst dispense a merry round.

Mixed drinks they offered, of quality fine,
At prices fair, that didst make thy purse to shine,
But one dish, above all others, didst entice,
The humble cheese curds, a culinary surprise.

With sauces diverse, they didst come to thee,
A treasure trove of flavors, for thy taste to see,
Worth every penny, this dish didst impart,
A joy to consume, and set thy spirit apart.

"Hark, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes! A place so cool, it doth astound and surprise. The stools, made from tree stumps, doth add a rustic charm, while the tables, unfinished and adorned with hardware, doth give a sense of rough-hewn elegance. And the staff, so friendly and kind, doth make one feel most welcome. But alas, the coffee, oh how it doth impress! A simple iced latte, yet it doth satisfy and delight. And the chocolate chip cookie, with bacon, no less! How doth it manage to make all things taste better? Verily, I say, 'tis a marvel indeed. I shall return anon, to sample their wine collection, and revel in the joy it doth bring."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
With ambiance that doth please mine eyes and soul.
The lighting, cool and dim, doth set the tone,
And at the bar, a sight most fair doth unfold.

The bartenders, skilled in their craft,
Do mix and shake with grace and art.
The drinks, a far cry from the common fare,
Are truly an experience beyond compare.

But alas, the special dish, so smoky and strong,
Did taste as if a piece of wood were consumed.
Yet, no high-handedness didst the server show,
For she did take it back and prepare another dish, as requested, with nary a frown or slow.

The chacatuire, a delightful appetizer,
Was served with fried Brussels sprouts, a tasty treat.
The main course, a special strip, so tender and juicy,
Did satisfy mine hunger and leave me feeling quite sprightly.

But, alack, the waygu, oh so fatty and bland,
Did detract from the meal, leaving a bad taste in mine hand.

Yet, fear not, dear friends, for dessert did save the day,
Chocolate pecan pie and mousse, both doth convey
A taste so sweet and rich, we did crave more,
And nearly ordered another, such was our desire.

This place, a gem in our fair city's crown,
Doth deliver a dining experience most renowned.
Karen, our waitress, a true delight,
And my friend from Cincinnati, in awe, did say,
'Twas naught but envy, for in his city, none could compare,
To Meat and Potatoes, a true culinary lair."

"Whole Foods, a decade in NYC. Still, I check out new spots. This one's nice, maybe 'cause it's new. Second-floor outdoor seating, nice. Not NYC prices, though - four salads for $4? Soup's decent, but hot and cold buffet's just okay. Plenty of parking downstairs."

"Bakery discovered through Yelp. Craving almond croissants, we arrived early Saturday afternoon. Unfortunate, they were sold out. Settled for apple pastry and pistachio eclair. Delicious. Eager to return."

"Sandwiches, good. Open 24 hours, convenient. Late night visit, line still long, tables taken. Crispy bread, nice. Recommendation: Original. Horseradish, unexpectedly enjoyable. Returning, updating review."

"Good eatin' at this joint. Grilled steaks, burgers, chicken, all that jazz. Rustic but clean. Prices fair, selection decent. Service top-notch. Off the US 60, take the Idaho exit. Give it a shot, won't regret it. Only downside, snowbirds flock here."

Alas, my dearest wife didst have some errand  
Down yonder street, and thus I came alone  
To this laboratory, wherein I didst find  
No soul, save I, upon that fateful morn.  
In seven brief minutes, all my tasks were done,  
And lo, I didst depart, with heavy heart,  
For now, alas, this place doth lie in ruin.

"Methought, fair friends, that long I had desired
To visit this place ere work did consume my day,
And lo, last week, the chance did finally arise,
And verily, 'twas worth the wait, in sooth.
A dollar fifty, mere pence, did they demand
For doughnut and coffee, a most excellent plan.
Their pastries, too, didst delight mine eyes,
So do thou stop, good sir, and partake in their guise."
"Flew with them once, Phoenix to Portland. Enjoyed it. Terminal 2, easy parking, quick security. Would fly again if heading back to the PNW."

"Hark! A word of warning, my dear countrymen,
For pasta, that dish most delectable and fine,
Can be our downfall, a pitfall most grim,
If consumed in excess, as I have oft done.

But fear not, for I have found a place,
Where fresh pasta doth reign supreme, in grace,
The sauces, a delight, a symphony,
And the staff, most kind and helpful, doth be.

So gather 'round, my friends, and heed my words,
For this place, a gem, doth truly merit your regards."
"Jambalaya, good. GF's fish and pasta, loved it. Bee outside, annoying. Drinks, great. Food, plentiful. Atmosphere, calm."
"Hunan Park. Your go-to spot for Chinese takeout. Quick, reliable, and delicious. General Tsao's chicken, a must-try. Don't forget utensils, or bring your own. Solid choice for dinner."

"Food was top-notch, especially the salmon. Waiter was a character, had a bit of an attitude when we asked questions, but the price was right so I'll give it four stars. First time here and I'm not one for rude service."

In fair Las Vegas, where excess doth reign,
A gem of a hotel, off the beaten path, doth remain.
'Tis a place of wonder, with renovations grand,
A surprise to find, on Fremont's bustling land.

The pool, oh the pool, doth steal the show,
With a shark tank, and a slide that doth flow.
A marvel to behold, a sight to see,
A place to relax, and let thy worries be free.

And if thou art not staying, fear not,
For the price of admission, a mere $20, doth be got.
A bargain, indeed, compared to the strip,
Where prices doth soar, and thy wallet doth rip.

But alas, a downside, there doth be,
The air quality, not so fresh, doth thee see.
A nuisance, perchance, for those who doth not smoke,
But for smokers, a haven, a place to partake.

"Tea Station's a joint that'll perk you up, late night. Me and the boys hit it up before we paint the town red or after chowin' down. It gets wild 'round 9-11. Real laid back vibe, but the service used to be lackin'. Nowadays, they're on the ball, friendly too. Got all sorts of teas, boba included. Taro milk tea's my poison."
"Food, top-notch for a brew pub. Beer, some of the best I've had. Service, prompt and friendly."

"A most excellent burger joint, fit for the whole family,
With craft beer aplenty, and a spacious patio to boot.
What more couldst thou desire? Their burgers, though not the best,
Are still quite satisfying, and worth a hearty quest.
And let us not forget, their beer selection doth reign supreme,
In this, a humble tavern, where all can revel and gleam.
B.T.'s, a fine establishment, doth shine so bright,
In Charlotte's realm of burgers, a true delight."

"Dependable. Consistent. That's what I like about the Cheesecake Factory. Big menu, always good. Not gourmet, but worth the price. Their curbside pickup? Genius. Convenient as hell. They were the first, far as I know. And the cheesecakes? Damn good. Variety, too."

"I'm writing this in December 2016, so by the time you read it, it'll be March 2017. I've tried most of the Strip buffets, and let me tell you, this place delivers. Sure, they've got those tiny pots and baskets for some dishes, but they're cute and you won't need much more than one. The seafood selection is solid, and the bone marrow? Damn good, but don't start with it or you'll be too full for the rest. Desserts? Plenty to choose from, including macarons. Service is top-notch, attentive and friendly. The only downside is the hike to get there, but hey, that means shorter lines. So, grab a plate and get ready for a food coma."

"This quaint eatery, hidden 'neath the Grand Canal's shops,
Didst delight us with its authentic Italian fare.
A family-run business, the staff didst hail from Italy's lands,
And their recommendations didst prove most fair and square.

I ordered linguine, fruti de mare, a dish most fine,
With clams, calamari, and shrimp in a spicy marinara divine.
My mother, linguine in clam sauce, didst savor each bite,
While my aunt, swordfish piccata, with steamed veggies in sight.

The swordfish, oh so tender, the piccata didst impress,
And the garlic knots, a gift from the gods, didst pass the test.
Tiramisu, a dessert most creamy, didst surprise us all,
A light and airy treat, that didst make our evening fall.

The service, top-notch, the food, most delicious and fine,
Didst warrant a expansion, for all to see and dine.
A gem, this restaurant, in the city of sin,
Didst leave us full and happy, with memories to win."
