"Chicken rice noodle soup, good. Fried egg roll, good too. Husband had chicken curry soup, didn't like it much. Thai coffee, good. Go back, yes."

"Caballero Grill, what a joke. Name's got nothing to do with the grub or atmosphere. Place needs to shut down, like Goodyear needs another pizza joint. But hey, we gave it a shot. Had a damn good burger and fries for six bucks during happy hour. Wife had a couple of their fancy drinks, decent deal at four bucks. Rest of the menu? Meh. Trio dip, overpriced at five bucks, mini chimis, not worth four. Club sandwich sliders, too much bread, not enough flavor. Domestic drafts half off during happy hour, microbrews, twenty percent off. Not bad, but not great either."
"Good grub and attentive service. Cozy joint, not too big. Sat down, and a server came over right away. Will be back to sample more from the menu."

"Took the family and grandkids to Joe's for breakfast. Left without breaking the bank and everyone was pleased. If you like bacon, get five sides of it - you won't want to share. French toast, breakfast burrito, pancakes, and cinnamon buns were all devoured. My son and I had the biscuits and gravy - soft biscuits and perfect gravy. Would go back just for that, and it's only $2.99. More than enough food too."

"A hearty bowl of pho, the broth most savory and rich,
A generous portion, fit for a king or such.
And rolls, oh rolls, prepared with utmost care,
A delightful treat, beyond compare.

I've visited this establishment twice,
For the fare, a worthy prize.
A lengthy drive, but worth the while,
To partake of their culinary smile.

With comrades, I have tried their diverse dishes,
Enough for all to sample and enjoy,
And even had some left o'er,
To savor later, with a joyful sigh.

Though late in the evening, they did admit,
Us and others, with a kindly spirit.
Good people, indeed, and most obliging,
A credit to their trade, and worthy of praising."

"Sushi at your own pace, no need to tell the chef what you want. Quality's good to excellent, surprising for a conveyor belt joint. Prices are reasonable. Staff keeps the dishes fresh and cold, no warm or lukewarm sushi here. Selection's average, more rolled sushi than nigiri. Hope they give out ginger and wasabi to all customers. Not a place for power meetings, but good for groups and families in a casual setting."

"Went there for grub and drinks. Place was swell. Pretzels were huge and soft, slathered in butter and cheese. Rich, but good to share. Prices were fair, patio was nice. But the real kicker? Music. They played some great tunes."
"Whole Foods, fresh grub, decent prices. Employees? Rude, lack personality. Cashiers, glum, little chat. Four stars, despite the staff."
"Brunch in Montreal. Worth the wait? Hit it midweek, avoid crowds. Did just that, ran into GSP. Eggs Benny and a UFC legend. Not bad."

"In fair Charlotte, there lies a verdant space,
A miniature Central Park, a wondrous place.
With sculptures unique and signs of whimsy,
'Tis a spot for families, love, and glee.

The sun doth shine bright, and children play,
While couples stroll, hand in hand, all day.
I, too, have visited this fair scene,
And cast a penny in the fountain serene.

But, alas, the Green is oft reserved,
For weddings and receptions, so observed.
I, myself, would choose a quieter place,
To find my peace and solace in the space.

Yet still, I cherish strolling down the path,
To find some rest and calm, in this green wrath."

"Hark! A craving for Asian fare didst beset mine appetite,
And so, I chanced upon PF Chang's, a place of note.
A solitary diner, I didst fear neglect or scorn,
But lo! The service was swift and with a smile born.

The lettuce wraps, crab rangoon, and hot and sour soup,
All three didst please mine taste, and I didst devour them with glee.
This place, I do recommend, to travelers on business bent,
For nearby hotels, it doth present a convenient invent.

Well worth the visit, PF Chang's doth prove,
A haven for flavors, both new and well-loved."

"Hark! What wondrous speed doth this Wi-Fi bring?
In my chamber, swift and strong it doth cling,
A true delight, a marvel of our time,
That doth make my heart with joy doth rhyme. 
Whoever doth tend to this Wi-Fi's art,
Doth do their job with skill and finesse from the start."

"Tiny shop in Bellagio, smaller than Aria's. Chocolate fountain, a sight to behold. Confusing line, packed with people. Limited seating. Excited for individual desserts, missed the rose oil detail. Didn't enjoy my raspberry macaroon, but friends loved theirs."

"Food's great here, vegan options galore. Date spot, you bet. Order's been messed up a few times, but staff's on it. They fix it, no fuss. We pay full price, no freebies. Drinks are top-notch too. Always coming back."

"This joint's got some serious mojo. If you're a fan of Mexican grub, you owe it to yourself to give it a shot. Their flour tortilla chicken flautas are top-notch, and the free chips, salsa, and beans they serve up before your meal are a nice touch. They also do a killer Sunday brunch spread, loaded with homemade tortillas and all the Mexican breakfast classics - eggs, ham, chile verde, and of course, bacon. It's a solid spot with live tunes to boot."

"Pike's Place Market, a fan's paradise. Two reasons why: price and variety. Breakfast, $8.95 before 10 am, or brunch, $13.95. Buffet, perfect. Stick with breakfast. Golden Corral, plastic, boxed food, disgusting. Pike's, heavenly goodness. Fresh fruit salad, biscuits and gravy, grits, cheese/potatoe hash, muffins, scones, pastries, eggs, egg benedict, sausage, bacon, blueberry french toast. Crispy, fluffy, moist, all very good. Limitless. Friendly servers, packed by 10:30. South-end location, key. Give them a try."

"Hark! Oyster shots, a tasty treat indeed,
A starter most fine, fit for a king's need.
A group of 8 to 10, or just thou and thee,
This place doth serve oysters, fresh as can be.

Their oyster monger, though ne'er to the sea,
Hath knowledge vast, of oysters, 'twain true.
He let me sample, each one, a delight,
To choose the best, a dozen, pure and bright.

Alas, their seafood special, a mark doth down,
Steamed seafood, sitteth too long, a frown.
But still, good cheer, a $50 feast,
At the bar, with bartender, a friend, at least."

"A place most charming and fair,
Where pastries sweet and savory doth abound.
The staff, so pleasant and kind, doth make one feel welcome,
In this cozy nook, where space doth abound.
But beware, dear traveler, for they do give freely,
Of their tasty treats, that thy resolve doth melt away.
So, if thou art but seeking a simple cup,
Prepare thyself, lest thou leave with a greater haul."
"Ten minutes, that's all it took. They called my name and it was done. Fastest oil change I've ever had. Cost me $38 and some change, but I got a $5 discount for the ladies' special on Wednesdays."
"Amazing view and ride through the mountains. Recommend it to anyone in the area."

"Restaurant's got a new look, feels bigger than Nix. Bar's been pushed back, more room for mixin' and sittin', vibe's hipper now, leather chairs, red lights. My favorites? Cowbell Chili, Smoked Cornbread, black bean burger, sweet potato croquettes, Dali's fries with garlic aioli, buffalo, Parmesan, fresh herbs. Full review's on the blog, these are the highlights."

"Methinks this tavern doth possess most excellent flavors, good sir! Verily, I am quite taken aback by the sheer variety of tasty victuals they do offer. The prices, too, are most reasonable, and the hours do stretch late into the eve. Should thou be a devotee of genuine Mexican cuisine, and dost crave a plethora of delectable meats to choose from, then hasten thee well to this establishment! \nAlack, the only cause for my rating of four stars doth lie within the somewhat disorderly queue system. Fear not, fair traveler, for a simple query unto a staff member or a fellow patron shall swiftly clarify which line to join. A pair of tiny signs, placed above the ordering stations, would surely enhance the experience and earn this place a full five stars, anon!"

"Years of visits. Happened to pass through today. Stopped in. Should've ordered one sandwich. Split it instead. Enough for both. Saved the other for later. Fried okra? So-so. Zucchini's better. Prices? Fair for what you get. Didn't eat outside. Too damn hot. Brought it home. Pretty good. Be back next time."

"Flavors and portions, aye, were just aright,
But service, alack, did leave much to despair.
Yet, despite this flaw, I would still visit the place,
For food, it seems, can make amends for poor grace."

"Eggspectation, a place I once didst praise,
Hath now improved, their service in ways.
Their menu, revamped, doth lack quirks and play,
But eggs, aplenty, doth still grace the day.

A core set of dishes, they now do focus,
And flavors, pleasant, doth they now profuse.
Though variety, once vast, doth now decrease,
Their skill, in eggs, doth still increase.

With brunch spots lost, my trek, a kilometer long,
To Eggspectation, doth show 'tis worth the song.
Good, filling, pleasant, doth their fare provide,
And so, four stars, they doth now preside."

"Went with two girls. Squash blossoms, great. Ambiance, perfect. Pork chop, thick, grilled medium rare. Juicy, flavorful. Quail, showstopper. Highly recommend. Menu's seasonal, will check back. Wine list, AZ-made. Didn't partake this time. Next trip, definitely. Very sensual experience. Yum."

"This mall's the best of the three. No vacancies, gets busy. Great steak joint, too bad it shut down in Springfield. Like the specialty shops here - kitchen, kids', GameStop, departments, pet store, etc."

"In fair Las Vegas, where nurses did congregate,
My friends and I did stroll along the famed Strip.
Our hunger pangs did lead us to the grand Bellagio,
Where dining options numerous did present themselves.
We wandered through the hotel's halls,
Until at last we found The Noodle, a place to satiate our thrall.
Their shrimp pad thai, a dish most fine and fair,
Did please my taste buds beyond compare.
My comrades' soups and noodles, though not as prime,
Were still quite tasty, save the beef, a mite too done in time.
This restaurant, I do highly recommend,
For those who seek a meal both hearty and well-prepared in demand."

"Upon a Saturday eve, my wife and I didst venture forth to Praying Monk, a place of great repute and charm. The staff, with their warmth and hospitality, didst make us feel most welcome. 

A fan of Belgian brew, I was delighted to behold their fine selection of ale on tap. I didst partake in a St Bernardus ABT12, while my fair spouse didst indulge in the Triple Karmilet, our two favorites. 

And thus, we didst proceed to the fare. We didst begin with Brussels sprouts and a soft pretzel, both of which didst impress. The sprouts were light and fresh, not heavy and oily as at many an establishment, and the pretzel was served with a most excellent mustard butter. 

For my main course, I didst opt for the Burger, a savory and juicy delight. The Sriracha Aioli didst add a pleasing heat, and the arugula, a most noble garnish, didst complete the dish. 

My wife, in her wisdom, didst choose the Kale salad. The kale was crisp and fresh, though perhaps a bit large in its pieces, but my wife didst find it satisfying. The dressing, well-balanced and not overpowering, didst complement the greens most nicely. 

Verily, I do look forward to my next visit, when I shall endeavor to sample the Lump crab, a dish of great renown."
"T-bone steak and eggs, a hidden gem on the menu at one of my go-to spots for cheap eats. Check out the photo."

"O, wouldst thou hear my tale of woe,  
Of restaurants twain, near as can be,  
In Vegas, city of delight,  
Where revelry doth reign by day and night.

A waiter, wretched and forlorn,  
Did mar our feast with scowls and scorn,  
But still, the victuals were devoured,  
And laughter flowed, as wine did pour.

Two locations, both so fair and bright,  
We visited, and our hunger did excite,  
The service, swift and attentive too,  
Despite the grump, our mirth did brew.

A shame, that some menus were not available,  
But still, we found a feast most suitable,  
The atmosphere, clean and neat,  
Did please us well, in Vegas' heat.

And thus, my friends, I do conclude,  
This place, a gem, in Sin City's muse,  
For those who seek a meal most fine,  
And merriment, till the morning shine."

"Lines stretch long at this joint, worth the wait. Chicken sandwiches, both times, hot peppers, amazing. Other, meh. Coffee, top-notch. Greek salad, fresh, decent quality. Open 24/7 in Planet Hollywood. Food arrives quick, line moves fast."

"Hark, what hidden gem doth lie within Charlotte's bounds?
A place called Wing Haven, full of feathered friends,
Tucked away in quiet street, betwixt Dilworth and Sewlyn ends.
The locals know it well, but strangers may not hear its call,
Until they stumble upon it, as I did, on a bike ride's fall.

A lovely spot for bird enthusiasts, nature lovers too,
With activities for young ones, and space to rent anew.
So seek out Wing Haven, on a sunny afternoon's stroll,
And discover the charm that doth this place unfold."

"Salt n Pepper Shrimp, fried chicken wings, cocktail shrimp, snow crab legs, raw oysters, greens, and fish. Clams, mussels, crawfish too. Kids love it. Print out the 10% off coupon online. Better than your average Chinese/Asian buffet."
"Lounge/bar review. Loved the vibe and decor - balcony overlooked the casino, colors shifted. Plush leather seats, pricey drinks. Boogie enough to impress, Vegas style."

"Lululemon, my dear. Can't help but think of you as "The One." Charming, well-built (all that yoga and running, must be working hard), polite, attentive, good sense of humor, kind heart... and always taken by the prettier girls! I adore Lululemon's clothes because they last forever, but with the price and limited colors, it's a luxury I allow myself only once a year. It's missing a star, but let's face it, "The One" isn't perfect. Can't help but visit my dear Lulu regularly, hoping for a more durable relationship, living happily ever after."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, listen well,
For I have tales to tell of a fine establishment,
Where food and drink do flow like a river in spring,
And service, oh service, doth shine like the sun in high summer.

'Tis a place where one may find solace in soup,
A tomato brew that doth warm the cockles of the heart,
And roast fowl, oh so tender and juicy,
Doth please the palate and doth set apart.

And steak, oh aye, a dish most wondrous,
Cooked to perfection, doth make the senses swoon,
But note, dear friends, the portions be small,
Yet quality, oh aye, doth make up for it all.

Now, bartender William, a merry soul,
Doth pour drinks with a flair and a grin,
And server Yolanda, a gem beyond compare,
Doth make us feel welcome, and doth show she doth care.

But, alas, a glass didst break, oh woe is me,
With my iPhone, a tragic fate, indeed,
Yet, lo and behold, a kind email didst arrive,
From Yolanda, a gesture most kind and most neat.

Now, to the matter of fish, a topic most dear,
I do confess, I prefer wild caught, and naught else,
For salmon, a king among fish, doth reign supreme,
And sustainability, a virtue most esteemed.

Raw tuna, a dish most delectable,
Yet, alack, the fat content, a bit too much,
But fear not, dear friends, for desserts, aplenty,
Didst satisfy our sweet tooth, and made our day most bright.

And last, but not least, the tableware,
A feast for the eyes, a true work of art,
Eclectic, old china, a delightful array,
A fitting end, to a meal most fair and bright.

So, to sum up, this place, a true gem,
A culinary delight, a true dream,
Angelo, the chef, a master of his craft,
A place to return, again and again, and laugh."
"Five bucks for the works. They scrubbed her down good, dried her off proper. I'll be back."

"Saks Fifth Avenue, my go-to spot for top-notch service. Friendly folks, always ready to greet and offer a drink. They let you roam free, checking in just enough without being too pushy. Makeup counter, best in the valley, no contest. YSL and Dior, a duo of excellence. They know their stuff and aren't afraid to suggest alternatives. Last visit, they showed me their concealer and even ran to the Nars counter for a better match. Just wish they had a bigger shoe selection, but that's a minor gripe. All in all, a fantastic experience."

"Gyros, I love 'em. Been eatin' 'em since I was a kid in the burbs outside Chicago. Had my first one from Mad Pita Express and it was the best I ever had. Meat's tender, fresh veggies, and that pita bread, soft and fluffy. 

Went back with my fiancee and she got the lemon rice soup, real lemony and good. She also had some baklava, special stuff. 

Five bucks for a gyro, good deal. Soup's three bucks, worth it. 

Place is cozy, couple minutes wait, but we liked lookin' at the family photos, plants, and artwork. 

Small joint, counter service, eat in or take out. We sat down, they brought the grub, plastic utensils, and napkins."

"Health issues? Limited diet? No problem. Found some great raw options at this joint. Chile rellano, coconut curry spring rolls - outta sight! Vanilla cupcake with coconut strawberry frosting? Even better. This place is my go-to for raw food."

"Love the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal, had to try this one. Co-worker and I, dinner on a Thursday night. Not too busy, but enough business. Decor was cool, booths were neat. Waitress was rad. Same menu as Bloomington-Normal, except beer selection. Had the Beer Battered Asparagus, delish! Usual is White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers, but switched it up. Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout, fantastic flavor! Co-worker got my usual, loved 'em. Went for dessert, Creme Brulee. A bit runny, not as smooth as I like. Great food and service though. Love this joint."

"Hark, what place is this? A haven for Philly phans, indeed! Tucked away in fair Philadelphia's bustling streets, 'twas here I chanced upon a culinary delight. A hearty Philly sub, its flavors did abound, and lo, the roll, so fresh and soft, did make it all the more a joy to consume. And after, as my belly did protest, I sought diversion at the shuffleboard table nearby, where games of chance and skill did await. The staff, so friendly and congenial, didst engage me in most pleasant conversation, and though the premises may lack sheen, 'twas naught but a minor quibble, forsooth. In truth, a merry time didst I have, and thus, my friends, doth recommend this place, despite its humble visage. Fare thee well!"

"Clean joint, a tad pricey, but worth it. Felt like royalty, got a gel mani, white tips with glitter, $42. Not bad on my natural nails, but the fake ones, not so much. Looked a bit chunky, but blended okay with the rest. All in all, not bad."

"Solid joint. Good value, too. Went for the 3-meat combo, didn't spring for the fancy stuff. Had a few plates of it, though. Can't recall the cuts, but one was eye of round. Sukiyaki style is the way to go. Sweet soy has more flavor, and the udon noodles are better. Add some minced garlic for extra depth. Noodle and veggie plates are premade, which can be a bummer. Meat plates are done right, sliced to order. You can watch 'em put it together, too. Four stars, mostly 'cause I messed up and got the shabu shabu instead of Sukiyaki. Made do with Anthony M's leftover broth, but a staffer topped me off with shabu shabu water and it got watered down. Not his fault, but I didn't get to taste everything in Sukiyaki."

"Methought, fair sir, upon mine quest for victuals,  
A place of note didst catch mine eye,  
With three thousand reviews, a single coin, and four stars bright,  
In all of Vegas, none couldst compare, yea, verily.  
My curiosity, it didst stir within mine breast,  
And forth, I went, to partake of this feast.  
EoS, by Jove, doth please mine taste,  
A cornucopia of sandwiches, most wondrous,  
And cheap, a blessing, indeed, for mine purse.  
Nigh unto the strip, 'twain doth lie,  
A short walk, or a brief cab ride, doth make it nigh.  
A breakfast menu, open till eleven,  
But alack, I didst not partake, my friends,  
For mine desire, the hot sandwiches, they didst win.  
The Chicken Chipotle Avocado, a delight,  
And later, the Original, a treat,  
But, alas, the sauce, it didst lack,  
So, I didst ask, for more, ere I didst attack.  
With extra sauce, the Chicken Chipotle, sublime,  
For seven coins, a bargain, in truth, a crime.  
Note, good sir, the sandwich, not vast,  
For mine own self, sufficient, but others, mayhap, not so vast.  
And, lo, if thou dost dine in the eve,  
Pray, enter the PH, and behold, the Pleasure Pit,  
A sight, most wondrous, doth await thee,  
In sooth, a tale, worth heeding, verily."
"Forty of us feasted on fine fare at this joint. Grub and service, top-notch. Even had some strings playin' outside, classy touch. I'd go back, no doubt."

"Thrifty's, where the ice cream flows like liquid gold. I'm an 80's kid, so I know a thing or two about good eats. Circus animal flavor, snickerdoodle, and sugar cookies - my sandwich game is strong. Who needs calories when you've got Thrifty's? Not me, that's for sure. 

Their cookies used to be a bit crunchy, but not tonight. They were soft, just how I like 'em. And let me tell you, their scoop of ice cream is no joke. It's huge, and worth every penny. Sure, some might complain about the price, but when you're getting a treat like this, who cares about a few bucks? 

The staff is friendly, the place is spotless, and there's plenty of room to move around. Plus, they've got some rad arcade games and unique sodas. If only they had some MJ, Madonna, Boy George, and Cindy Lauper playing on the radio, and maybe a little Ronald Reagan on TV, this place would be pure 80's heaven. Give it five stars? You bet your ass I would."

"Tuesdays, a day most wondrous, doth bring forth a treat most delectable, a Signature dog, priced at two silverlings. Who can resist such a culinary delight? Those who abstain from pork, forsooth, yet they should reconsider, lest they miss a feast most divine. 
A plentitude of options doth await, each one a masterpiece of flavor and creativity. The Frank, grilled to perfection, doth serve as a canvas, upon which artisans doth paint a gastronomic masterpiece. 
And let us not forget the humble chip, nor the ring of onion, both doth complement the main attraction, in a harmony of taste and texture. 
Thus, I doth proclaim, this establishment doth reign supreme, a veritable haven for those who doth seek a meal most satisfying, and on spring eves, the rooftop patio doth beckon, a place to savor, a moment to delight."

"Methought the crust of yonder pizza most divine,
A culinary delight that did mine eyes shine.
And though the dining space was somewhat small,
The taste of their pies did make up for it all.

Upon a double date, we didst venture thither,
And found the experience to be quite pleasant, save for the wait,
Which didst last some forty-five minutes, alack!
But still, the pizza's quality didst make it worthwhile,
For those who love a good pie, 'tis worth a try,
Just avoid the crowded Fridays, ere thou dost cry."

"Hark, what praise doth pour from mine own lips,
For this humble abode of victuals and sips.
'Tis not as if they did invent the sandwich,
But my stars, their fare doth please mine appetite's scratch.

Their service, too, doth shine like the sun in spring,
Art, the owner, doth take an interest in all who doth sing.
A breath of fresh air, indeed, and a sight to behold,
In this place, thou shalt not find the chain's cold shoulder.

My Roasted Turkey sandwich, a feast for mine eyes,
With Boars Head cold cuts, a taste that doth arise.
Freshly baked bread, a delight for mine teeth,
And mozzarella, a treat that doth make mine heart leap.

Thumbs up, too, for the turkey chili,
On a chilly day, it doth warm mine heart and belly.
Drinks, in vat size cups, they doth flow,
A refreshing draught, for those who do know.

Lunch specials, too, they doth offer,
A half sandwich and soup, a meal to devour.
And Art, the owner, a man of great cheer,
Did sit with me, and chat, without fear or spear.
He asked of my job, and how I liked the town,
A friendly soul, who doth make mine spirits astound.

So, come one, come all, and give this place a try,
For thou shalt not find, a better spot, to dine and lie.
No fanny packs, nor airs of pretentiousness here,
Just good food, and service, that doth bring cheer."

"Arena's easy to find, parkin's a breeze. Garage or street lot, both right next door. Decent size, mostly hockey and grads. Box Office is a bit off, but close enough. Restrooms nearby, prices fair. Seats comfy, ice rink covered for events, still feels chilly."

Amidst the splendor of the Palazzo's halls,
We tarried for a night or two, my friends and I,
Then descended upon the Cosmopolitan's walls,
To sample its wares and gauge its vaunted pride.

A far cry from the tawdry, overwrought decor
That plagues the Strip's more garish venues, this place
Exudes an air of elegance and modernity,
With nary a tacky statue nor kitschy grace.

The rooms, a haven of refreshment and delight,
Invite one to linger, free from stress and fright,
While the casino's ambiance, though pricey, feels right,
A cosmopolitan blend of style and excitement bright.

In Citycenter's heart, the Cosmo stands apart,
A beacon of sophistication, for those who seek
A respite from the Strip's more crassy, boisterous art,
And wish to indulge in finer pleasures, without meek.

"Pancakes, best I've had. Fluffy, warm, buttery, moist. Crisp outside. Maple syrup, warm. Eggs, phenomenal. Apple-smoked bacon, avocado, jack cheese omelet. Deconstructed. Pure egg whites, scrambled well-done. No high chairs. Service, meh. Facelift needed."

"Last eve, my love and I did share
A meal most wondrous, fair and rare
A pie of white, with onions sweet
And cheese, oh so delectable treat

With steak, our hunger did abate
And left us both in joyful state
I do adore this dish, my friend
And urge thee, give it a try, ere end."
"Great grub, separate dining from the bar. Love the burger options. Caught a hockey game on the big screen. Go on a Monday, burgers are $5. Not worth $8-11, but that's just me."

"Inside the wildest indoor carnival, Circus Circus' walls did hold
A feast most wondrous, a veritable cornucopia to behold
Three of us did dine, our hunger to assuage
For two hundred pieces of silver, a sum not too large
I, a triathlete, did compete that morn
And with my comrades, devoured a ribeye, a meal most born
In this meat oasis, we did find our peace
And left, our bellies full, our spirits release."
"Had a killer meal here, three years back. Spicy shrimp, lit AF. Service and vibes, top-notch. My man and I still rave about the Mexican feast we had. Give it a shot."
"Friendly staff. Flights get busy during snow season. Crowded gates. Get here early."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
Where breakfast doth reign supreme, in deed.
A Fat Boy bloody mary, with bacon and cheese,
Did start my day most excellently, if thou please.
Crab Benedict, a dish most fair and fine,
Didst follow, and with delight didst shine.
My comrades, they didst order Denver's scramble and prime,
And both didst declare their meals most sublime.
The cookie dough egg rolls, oh how they didst tempt,
With sweetness and richness, they didst invent.
But alack, the wait on Sundays doth prolong,
So heed my words, and tarry not too long.
A lounge area, with drinks to pass the time,
Doth make the delay seem less a crime."

"Verrado Grille, last night. Got there at 8:30, closed at 9. Expected poor service, but the waitress was nice. Had a pint of Verrado Ale, ordered the Almond Encrusted Basa. Beautifully cooked white fish, delicious Orzo/Risotto side. Price was right, would pay a bit more. Great experience, recommend it for sunset dinner. View over the golf course and White Tank Mountains was amazing."

"Hark, good sir! This place doth stay open round the clock,
A convenience indeed for those who flock.
The maidens within, so fair and bright,
Do greet us warmly, with a smile so light.
They doth converse with us, should we desire,
And keep the premises in neat attire.
Our visits weekly, they doth anticipate,
And restocked are the drinks and snacks, in abundance great.
We shall return, 'tis certain, to this place,
Where hospitality and cheer do reign with grace."

"Hark! Good Blockbusters be mine delight,
One near my home, but selection poor,
The staff, rude and gruff, doth make me frown,
And 'tis a place most vile, a true ghetto town.

But lo! This other store, so grand and wide,
With choice of films most fair and bright,
The employees, kind and full of mirth,
Do make my visits swift and full of worth.

I do confess, their online service doth please,
Akin to Netflix, it doth bring ease,
And when I come, my in-store exchange doth flow,
Quickly done, without a single woe.

Alas! The parking lot, so cramped and small,
Doth make me sigh, and wish for more,
And did I not desire it nearer home,
This Blockbuster, my heart would call it own.

So, two stars lost, for parking woes and space,
Yet still, my favorite Blockbuster, in this place."

"Upon our timely arrival, we were straightaway seated,
And lo, a meager morsel of bread was proffered,
With nary a choice to savor more, alack.
The spinach salad, verily, didst delight,
As did the barbecued shrimp, with sauce so sweet.
Yet four small crustaceans for twenty pieces of silver?
A sorry value, indeed, upon the Strip.
The seabass, a worthy dish, and lamb shank, too,
Didst satisfy, with sides that didst make it true.
The blueberry cobbler, a sweet and tasty treat,
Didst round out our repast most excellently.
Mayhap we shall return, at luncheon time, anon."

"I came here 'cause it's close by, good for a student like me livin' in Campustown. They got good hours, never had a problem gettin' an appointment. Price is right too, ain't broke the bank for a GUYS haircut. Been to pricier places in the NW, same quality. It's quick, no waitin' around. Stylists are friendly, one of 'em always jokes with me, says "That'll be a million dollars, please." If you're lookin' for deals and wanna pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free."

"Yoshinoya's got fans beyond Cali, kid. New Yorkers dig it too. Me and my buddies hit it up all the time when I worked in the city. Packed joint, good grub, quick service. Only gripe? It's a haul from Phoenix. But hey, it's just a minute off the highway. Wish they'd bring it to the city limits, though. And yeah, that clam chowder trick? Crazy, but it works. But if you're new to the beef bowl game, start with the basics first. Enjoy."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, to my tale of woe,
Of a place near downtown, where margaritas flow.
'Tis called Los Dos Molinos, a haven of delight,
Where one may find solace from the trials of the night.

With friends, I didst venture forth to this place,
To partake of their famous margaritas, and to grace
Their menu with mine eyes, and taste their fare,
And see if 'twas true, what others had declared.

The outside seating area, quaint and full of charm,
Didst remind me of Guadalajara, in a disarming way,
But 'twas the chips and salsa, complimentary,
That didst first catch mine eye, and made me cheerful.

For we didst order, to share, a feast most fair,
Adovada ribs, chorizo pizza, and more, beyond compare.
The ribs, country style, marinated in red chili,
Were spicy, tender, and made mine mouth to smile.

The pizza, thin and crispy, with chorizo most bold,
Didst make mine taste buds dance, and left me feeling quite old.
I wouldst order these dishes again, without a doubt,
For they didst please mine palate, and left me feeling devout.

So if thou art in search of a place to dine,
And drink, and merry make, with friends of thine,
Los Dos Molinos, near downtown, doth await,
To serve thee well, and make thy spirits elate."

"Hark, fair maiden Rachel doth possess  
A kitchen, wherein she doth prepare  
Savory wraps and burgers, of quality fine,  
Yet 'tis the smoothies that doth make her shine.  
Oh, traveler, do thou highly recommend  
Her sweet concoctions, for they doth ascend  
To heights of flavor, unmatched by any other,  
In this fair town, where gastronomy doth reign."

"Chandler's got a killer gyro joint. Guy's from Chi-town, too. Haven't hit up the Italian beef yet, but I'm stickin' to the gyros and plates for now. Been there 20 times and still lovin' it. Shame about their website though, it's a real letdown. But hey, don't judge a book by its cover, their grub's the real deal."

"Methought I ne'er wouldst venture on this path,
But my fair spouse didst persuade me with her cunning wit,
That 'twould be a luxurious treat, a bargain of great worth,
And lo, she didst speak the truth, for we didst find delight
In the 24-hour pass, beginning with a late repast
At Paris, where the line didst stretch until they didst close the door,
And on the morrow, we didst dine at Planet Hollywood,
A feast most wondrous, causing us to return once more,
For dinner, and again, the buffet didst impress,
With its cleanliness, management, and fresh preparation,
I do advisedly commend it, for 'tis a rare find,
In this city of excess, a place of moderation,
Where a salmon Caesar salad, a rarity, doth cost,
Less than three score pieces of silver, a true bargain, indeed,
So, once in a blue moon, why not indulge,
And savor the delights, that this buffet doth provide?"
"Been seein' Doc Woodson for years. Always real friendly, takes his time explainin' things. Office got better since new folks took over. Wait can be a bit long, but Doc's worth it."
"Shoes fixed here. Sole peeled off, glued back on. Two others needed new soles. Boris, the son, nice guy. Fast turnover. Pricier than home, but fair and good quality. Thanks, Yelpers."

"Hark! What feast doth lay before mine eyes?
Tostones great and big, a wondrous sight.
And hot sauce, oh so nice, doth please my taste.
Mojo, too, doth bring me joy and delight.
My guests, two in number, ne'er had tried
Cuban cuisine, yet they didst clean their plates,
A testament to this fine culinary fare."

"Hark! This eatery doth offer solace from winter's chill,
With victuals that warm both belly and soul.
A bowl of steaming broth, complimentary, they do proffer,
Miso soup, a taste that doth make one whole.
Their barbecue, spicy and savory, doth delight,
With meat of highest quality, a true culinary sight.
Kimchi and other delicacies, they doth bring,
To complement thy feast, and make it a true king.
Some dishes may seem costly, but fear not,
For they do serve two, and thy purse shall not be wroth."
"Mandalay Bay's got a killer breakfast joint. Hash browns, waffles, you name it. Shame about the juice, but still a solid spot."

"Dinner with the missus and three rug rats. Grub was top-notch, service even better. Not much for little ones, but they shared a drumstick app nice and juicy. Big burger, decent steak, but the nachos were lackin'. Pizza stole the show, though - buttery, flaky crust, well-balanced sauce and cheese. Wouldn't mind havin' it again. Interior could use a spruce-up, but eatin' outside's an option too."

"By my troth, the place doth please me well,
Next door to yonder dentist's spell.
And, marry, their poultry doth delight,
In particular, the spicy honey mustard and Asiago parmesan, a true sight.
Their homemade Asiago chips, a tasty treat,
Verily, a culinary joy, most meet."
"Good pho. Not the best I've had, but still satisfying. Spicy, but needed a bit more kick. Just right after a cold snowy day."

"Hark! This review doth sing the praises of the food court,
More than the shops, methinks, doth it deserve a thought.
A fine selection of stores, indeed, doth it boast,
Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G, and more, no doubt.
Two hours, at least, doth it take to peruse the lot,
So dress thou well, for summer's heat doth not abate.
Now, to the food court, where doth lie the feast?
Japanese and Chinese, Subway, and Italian, we find,
Pizza, I didst taste, and found it good, I must confess,
Teri chicken, from Japan, and orange chicken, from China, didst please."

"Dined here with the missus, ma, and our little one this weekend. Place was dead, but service was top-notch. Food was traditional, but still damn good. Had the appetizer platter and three specials off the yellow menu. Mango lassi too. Bill came to $43 with tax. No booze, but they let us bring our own from the store next door. Grabbed a couple cold ones. Background music and TV were a real hoot. Indian Who Wants to Be a Millionaire followed by music vids. A funny night."
"Pizza Hut? Good? Damn right. 10:30 AM, best time to be there."

"Methinks 'twould be unfair, my friends, to pen naught but praise for Tacone of Tustin, when in truth, the tale of its Vegas counterpart doth stir within me such delight. Forsooth, a coupon in hand, my kin and I didst venture forth to partake of their delectable wraps, our hunger sated by the anticipation of a quick repast ere we visited BuildaBear. Howe'er, our expectations, though lowly, were surpassed by the bounty that lay before us! A sauce bar, free and unbounded, didst offer up a cornucopia of flavors, from honey mustard, bbq, to creamy cilantro and balsamic dips, the children reveling in their newfound gastronomic freedom! Wraps of ample proportion, filled to bursting with soft jasmine rice, fresh cucumber salad, and peanut sauce, didst leave me sated, nay, verily, defeated by the sheer abundance of the feast! My spouse, his Mambo wrap devoured with relish, didst savor each bite of the tender filet mignon, while our progeny, their Campfire chicken wraps with sweet bbq sauce consumed with gusto, didst cry out for more. Alas, the cost, a trifle dear, yet worth the expense, forsooth, a novel and refreshing change from the common fare."

"Rooms are decent, not too flashy but still pleasant. Big bathrooms, even in basic rooms, are a major perk. If you're a fan of long soaks in a deep tub, you'll be in heaven. Rest of the casino is alright, but I'll probably stick to my regular spot at the Mirage next time."
"Vig McCormick Ranch, good job. This'll be a swell spot for grub in your foodie book."
"Komex opened up on my turf, great spot for a fast bite. Bring out-of-towners here, never disappoints. Fusion tacos, spicy pork specifically, lit AF. Tried other menu items, meh, not too exciting."

"Verily, 'tis a curious place, my dear,
A take-out spot, with hours of five to ten,
No ordinary Thai food joint, I do declare.

The victuals, they are quite divine,
My heart doth sing with joy at the Mango Sticky Rice,
A generous portion, indeed, doth shine.

Cleanliness, a virtue they do hold,
No tables, yet nary a speck of dust doth bold,
A testament to their diligence, I do unfold.

The matron, a friendly soul, doth greet,
With haste and purpose, she doth meet,
Her kin, anon, doth aid, a family affair, no doubt.

In conclusion, 'tis a humble abode,
Quaint, inexpensive, and of gastronomic renown,
I do implore thee, give it a go, my friend,
For those eves when homebound, a movie to amend."

"We scored a sweet deal on Priceline for $90 a night. The room was cozy, but the view of Heinz Field made up for it. Great location too - we walked everywhere. The hotel's lobby was a work of art, maintaining its historic charm while still feeling modern. Skip the restaurant though. Overpriced and forgettable breakfast."

"Hark! A meal most wondrous, fit for lords and ladies fair! In yonder plaza, dumplings homemade with care, Soft as a cloud, they melt within thy mouth, a treat beyond compare. Carrots and beef, a savory blend, didst taste, And found them most delectable, a true delight. Congee, a stew of rice, a humble dish, yet rich in flavor, Two dollars, a small price to pay, for such a feast, a true bargain. Give this place a chance, thou shalt not be disappointed, 'Tis a gem, hidden in plain sight, a treasure to be found."

"Cirque, you know it's gonna be good. Flaw? Vague storyline, but who needs it with sets, costumes, and choreography like this? After a few cold ones, I realized KA's story is basically Star Wars. Luke, Leia, Vader, Emperor - easy as that."

"Grand Lux Cafe, founded by the creator of Cheesecake Factory, is an upscale, 24-hour eatery. After a wild night, it's the perfect spot to sober up. I've been here before, and I recommended it to my friends Lucy Y., David G., and Sarah A. when we were all hungry at 4 a.m. We encountered some rowdy, half-naked drunks outside the restroom, but that's part of the charm. \n\nWe were quickly seated, and I ordered the Smoked Salmon with onions and scrambled eggs, which came with hash browns. It was simple yet elegant, with the contrast of flavors creating a satisfying meal. It was filling enough for bedtime, but pricier than other 24-hour spots. However, the quality of the food and service makes it worth it."

"Wynn Casino: swanky joint. Had a blast at their casino, even though I didn't stay there. Signed up for their Red Card, got $10 free play. Enjoyed some tasty chocolate martinis, feeling pretty good by 1 pm. Hit a nice streak on the Mona Lisa slot machine, walked away with an extra $12. Thanks, Wynn. You've got my heart. Looking forward to coming back."

"Great spot for meetings in Edinburgh. Rented the 'Glass Room' at the top, private balcony with a view. The Hub served sandwiches, but the real treat was the chocolate cake. Damn good. They also left Edinburgh rock on the tables. Perfect for when the meeting got dull. A sugar rush to keep me alert."

"Fair chalet, cozy and quaint, doth charm,
In this small restaurant on McGill street, no doubt.
Well-situated, near business district and old port,
Grange becomes a place to adopt, for an evening's sport.
The menu, simple and concise, yet varied,
With tartares, salads, burgers, all well-prepared.
Prices, moderate to dear, but worth the cost,
For their wine selection, quite impressive, no boast.
The service, friendly, though a bit slow,
We enjoyed our experience, and shall return, I do know."

"Went to the October Adults Night Out. Free admission, drinks, good stuff. Liked the museum, nice way to spend a Friday night. Two issues though. First, the check-in line was a bitch. Long and slow. Forgot to print my tickets, so I had to suffer through it. Second, the beer garden was a joke. Only two beer servers and one wine server for a shitload of people. Line moved like molasses. People were giving away their tickets 'cause the line was too damn long. Would go again, but hope they fix those things."

"Methinks this place doth hold a special place within mine heart, forsooth.  My friends and I, we do endeavour to partake in a 'girl's night out' once a month, and thus, we find ourselves at Radio Maria, drawn by the savory victuals and convivial ambiance.  Verily, 'tis a tranquil abode, replete with objects of interest that do spark lively discourse.  The hospitality, too, doth excel, making it one of mine dearest locales to break bread in Champaign."
"Sushi craving hit hard. Nearby hotel, easy pickup. Food abundant, sushi sublime. Thirty minutes, Saturday night, done."

Across from Midwestern, a fave spot for lunch. Lunch special, student discounts, but get there early. Crowded, slow service, but worth it. Tasty grub, salads, paninis, pizzas, all good. Tomato soup, must-try, best in Phoenix, almost like having soup all day.
"Rose macarons, my dear. Exquisite, just like the rest of their sweets. Avoid the crepes, though - they're a letdown. This joint's got it all: class, elegance, and a passion for perfection."

"Hark! What's this? A mighty sandwich, so big and grand,
With bread that's fresh, or fair, depending on the land.
My mother doth adore the Philly cheese-steak,
Whilst I, a humble Italian, do seek
Hot peppers, added to my feast with glee.
But, alas! The payment process doth confuse,
For one must order, then straightaway pay,
Lest hunger pangs doth strike, and thou doth stay,
And thus, the risk of theft doth come what may.
Yet still, their chips, of which I do not know the name,
Are quite delicious, and worth the fame.
So, to this place, I shall return again,
For BBQ, my heart doth truly gain."

"Signature's rooms are similar in size to those at Cosmo and Venetian, maybe even larger. They come equipped with a stove and microwave, convenient for heating up leftovers or whipping up a snack. But, it's located off the strip, requiring a trek through a tunnel to reach MGM. No casino on site, and parking's limited to valet for guests only. Despite these drawbacks, it's still a pleasant place to stay, quiet and peaceful."

"This joint's got some serious mojo. Folks are cheerful, welcoming. Pool's a real treat, too. Had a bite to eat at five different spots. All five hit the spot. Strolling through the forum shops, feeling good. Only downside's the stench of smoke. Strong stuff, man. Brought the kiddos along, they had a blast."
"Flavors of India, decent joint for a quick lunch. Been there a few times, food's hit or miss. Wish they had more variety. Friendly service, good price. Giving 'em four stars for now. See you there."

"In Chandler/Tempe, this joint serves up genuine Italian grub. Family-owned, just like Nonna used to make. Decor's nice, service is friendly. Caesar salad, hell of a start. Linguine with red clam sauce, loaded with garlic and clams. Baked ziti, two pounds of heaven. Even the kid loved it. Cannoli for dessert, perfect ending. Prices? Fair, especially for an Italian spot. Coupons and takeout deals? Jackpot."

"Methinks I've had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable confections on multiple occasions, and by the stars, they doth delight my taste buds! Their frosting, not overly sweet, doth complement the subtle flavors of their Asian-inspired creations, such as green tea and sweet potato, which may not be to everyone's liking, but are indeed divine. The more traditional fruit flavors are also quite satisfying.

Verily, I do implore thee, good bakers, to consider adopting a modern payment system, such as Square, to ease the burden of those who do not carry cash. Forsooth, thy cakes are pricey, and it doth cause me vexation to procure the necessary funds. Methinks a small surcharge for the convenience would be worthwhile."
"Good eatery in a strip mall. Waitstaff, top-notch. Mojitos, mango and delish. Appetizer, interesting. Pan bread, delectable. Entrees, tasty. Not much to dislike."

"Solu'shn, a record shop that defies the mainstream. They pride themselves on the rare and hard to find. Vinyl and CDs, averaging 12-14 pounds each. But you can test them out on their decks before buying, like trying on a pair of shoes. Perfect for aspiring DJs seeking to bolster their collections with unique tracks."

"The Key Shack. That's what it is, a small shack in the center of Park Road Shopping Center. Looks a bit rough, but they get the job done. Friend referred me, needed a hard-to-find key duplicated for an uptown building. They had it. New key and cash exchanged in five minutes. If you need a tough key duped, this is the spot. And after, take a stroll through the rest of the shopping center. Cupcakes, coffee, Michael's, antiques, it's all there."

"Tried out Isis Salon last month. Read the reviews, decided to give it a shot. Kelly was great, real friendly and listened to what I wanted. Loved how my hair turned out, got a haircut and partial highlights for $85, half of what I usually spend. Great price, been to fancy salons before and got mediocre service. Now that I know about Isis, I'll be back."

"Sunday reservation, easy peasy. Prices, reasonable. Service, attentive. Steak bernaise, surprise - lemony butter, good. Sirloin, chewy but manageable. Fries, plenty. Good meal, sure. Four stars, two thousand Yelpers? Meh. Apple tartin, underwhelming. One big slice, no fanfare. Three stars for food, plus one for service. That's four."

"Went to Butters at 11am on a Saturday. Half hour wait. Popular joint. Waitress came over quick, got us our coffee and OJ. Carafe of ice water on the table. Coffee was good, OJ fresh squeezed. Ordered an omelet with hash browns and pancakes. All very good! Service was attentive, despite the crowd. Place was hoppin'! Scottsdale, ya know? Women in their 40s and 50s, fake fun bags galore (if that's your thing). Overall, a solid spot for breakfast, even with a bit of a wait."

"Coco killed it last night. Best performer I've seen yet. Mel B and some other chick were great back in the day, but Coco took it to another level. Holly Madison? Awful. Like, tape-a-spot-on-the-stage awful. Angel Porrino, though. That girl's got energy and looks. Better than Holly by a mile. And Coco? Damn. She can dance. Shake that thing, girl. Hope they keep her around and change up the show some more."

"Lunch at a spot down the street. Guac and sangria margarita hit the spot. Torta was good, meat marinated well, not too sweet. Fish tacos solid too. Service lacking though. Opentable reservation mishap. They didn't log it in and I got a call asking where I was. Sorted it out but shouldn't have happened."
"Good grub, top-notch service. Big joint, no waitin' around. Family friendly, give it a shot."
"Sunday mornin', we rose with the sun, makin' for Edinburgh Castle. Beat the crowds, we did. The castle, well-preserved, a must-see, it is."

Sunday night, we hit the town for grub and a stroll 'round the lake. Three of us, figuring it'd be busy, late afternoon, early evening. But jeez, it was a ghost town. Parked in the village garage, saw a few cars, walked through a passage to the lower shopping area. Empty. Like, Twilight Zone empty. Ate at Black Pepper Grill, asked the one guy if they were open, sat at a table, one of two parties. Good chow, good service, but damn creepy. No folks around, prime dinner time, weekend. Checked out Ravella, nice and cozy, great front bar, cheap drinks. Still, just us and some random dude in the lobby. Hope Lake Las Vegas bounces back. It's got a lot to offer. Otherwise, I'm gonna film an ep of "Life After People" there.

"Good mall. Lots of fun places to spend your dough. Gave it four stars 'cause it's a pain in the ass to shop there during the summer. Some of the big stores are way out in left field, so you gotta drive and park multiple times. Other than that, it's a swell joint."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous joy to sit at yonder bar,
A place where culinary delights doth abound.
The victuals, they did please mine taste,
And cooking, it was done with skill and haste.
Not every dish didst strike my fancy's chord,
But craftsmanship, I could not help but adore.
A costly eatery, yet worth a visit, forsooth."

"Hast thou chairs before the entrance, where one may sit and bask in the radiant heat of summer's sun? The servants, too, are full of cheer, most notably at dawn's early hour, when I do oft partake of their brew. 'Tis a place of moderate stir, by reason of its proximity to the throngs that roam the street."

We chowed down at an off-strip hotel with some pals. The server gave us the lowdown on the menu and portion sizes. We had to try a couple of their raved-about dishes - Sage Fried Chicken Benedict and Griddled French Toast. They were gargantuan! Our server was cool and warned us about the size, even offering to-go boxes for our leftovers. We devoured half of each dish, feeling stuffed and satisfied. The breakfast menu was top-notch, according to the concierge. The only bummer was the trek from the Strip. Next time, we'll hit up the joint on West Sahara or Imperial Palace.

"Went in for a slice, felt like they made a fresh pie. Annoyed no one said anything. Left due to time. Came back, ordered an 18" pizza and wings. Forgot how many wings I ate, but they were good. Place makes decent wings, not too hot, but I'll feel it tomorrow. That's the true test of wings."
"Fresh joint. Good eats. Friendly folk. Country charm."

"Good BBQ, but not perfect. Chicken was a tad dry, and the joint could've been cleaner. Not dirty, mind you, but that damn sign on the fountain drink got under my skin. And what's with the trash cans? One's turned around and another's just sittin' there, takin' up space. Still, not a bad visit."
"Vienna Beef dog, hot and juicy. Scratch-made fries, crispy. Four bucks. Best deal in town. That's all."

"Hark, what place is this? A veritable feast for the senses, a cornucopia of delights! For a mere $30, one may partake in a never-ending spread of delectable treats, and for $37, a limitless array of bubbly drinks, including mimosas, bloody Marys, and champagne. By the stars, 'tis a bargain indeed! 

But wait, there's more! During the merry hours of brunch (8 am - 3 pm), the menu doth boast a wondrous variety, ranging from fluffy pancakes to Kalbi Korean short ribs. Verily, my heart doth sing with joy at the mere thought of such a spread! 

A skilled chef shall prepare for thee a customized omelette, or thou mayst serve thyself from a plethora of dishes, including seafood, Asian delights, fruits, veggies, pasta, eggs benedict, and even sushi. Tut, tut, what a feast! 

And should thou feel particularly frisky, fear not, for the dessert area doth await thy arrival. A case of luscious, creamy gelato, a pastry case of tiny, colorful delights, rich chocolate mousse atop tangy passion fruit, golden wafer cones, chocolate-covered strawberries, and more! Methinks my mouth doth water at the very thought! 

But lo, they do understand portions here, a rare quality indeed. Mini cups, bowls, and dishes doth provide a taste of all, without the need to overindulge. A clever notion, indeed! 

Alas, the wait, though brief, didst seem an eternity, but fear not, fair patron, for 'twill be worth the while, I doth assure thee!"

"Methinks I am not one for breakfast, fair friends,
But on some morns, my stomach doth protest and cry out for sustenance.
This day was such, and thus I made my way to The Silver Spoon,
In hopes they'd have their corned beef hash, a dish most wondrous.
Alas, 'twas not to be, and so I asked young Jono for his counsel,
And he suggested a breakfast bagel, a meal most fitting.
An everything bagel it was, and bacon, oh so crispy,
Did grace my plate, and thus my hunger was quite satisfied.
Aye, verily, I did enjoy this tasty treat,
And had to pause from discussions of banking matters, to savor each bite."

"Need a fancy dress outfit? Look no further than Party Mania. They got all sorts of getups for any occasion. Superheroes, disco divas, witches, and more. They even got accessories like wigs, hats, and gloves. And don't forget the Hen Nights essentials - L-plates and garters. 

Halloween's their busy season, but they're always well-stocked. Makeup, ribbons, feathers - they got it all. Conveniently located near the university, too. 

But, fair warning, it ain't cheap."
"Shop's got character, sells quirky cards, nice paper, and fun knick-knacks. Staff's friendly, too. Parking's a hassle, but worth it once you snag a spot. You'll dig the joint."
"I axed my gym membership after six years, no fuss. Got my refund, too. It's a good spot, but I found better use for my cash - private yoga sessions. No need for the gym now."

"Married in Caesars Palace, stayed in the Augustus Tower. Asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio water show, but got put on the wrong side. Still, the room was huge, bathroom was enormous, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Pillows were great too, wish I knew what kind they were. Despite being near the elevator, it was quiet. Would definitely stay here again."

"Step onto the patio, feel the mist from the waterfall, and let it cool you down. Bliss. No need for lines here, no sir. Got my own bodyguard, takes care of everything. Best table, front of the line, you name it. Service is top-notch, attentive, and friendly. Little perks like chilled strawberries make it extra special. Dress to impress, strut your stuff, and you might just find yourself at a table surrounded by admiring gentlemen."

"Verily, this Chang's doth serve the finest Dim Sum in all of Las Vegas! Thrice have I visited this establishment in recent months, and each time, the fare hath been most excellent. Alas, the service doth leave somewhat to be desired, for we have been compelled to request our beverages twice upon each visit. But, indeed, 'tis the Dim Sum that doth make this place shine, for the carts doth overflow with delectable victuals. The 'cart pushers,' though not overly friendly or loquacious, doth provide the items we desire with nary a fuss. And, verily, the prices doth seem most reasonable for a family of four. \n\nAlack, the parking situation doth leave much to be desired, for the lot doth fill up quickly, and we have been forced to wait for others to depart ere we could park our carriage."
"This joint's the real deal. Like a subway, but with pizza. Friendly staff, too."

"Bought a Groupon deal for two months of unlimited car washes. Fifteen bucks. Includes their "red towel" service. They give you a microfiber towel to use, and when you bring the dirty one back, they give you a clean one. Air and vacuums included. Self-service bays too. Asked about adding one-off services like wax. They said sure and gave me a free wax on the spot. Been a few times, and I'm satisfied. Wish I could pause the tunnel to give my wheels some extra attention, but that's not gonna happen. Also wish they opened earlier, but 8-6 is reasonable. After my Groupon is up, I'll keep my membership going. Sixteen bucks a month. Only need to go once a week to make it worth it."

"We hit Greek Wraps in Peoria once a week. Their hummus is top-notch. Never had a bad meal. Veggie pita wrap with grilled eggplant and onions drenched in yogurt sauce? Amazing. Grilled lemon kebab with garlic sauce? Equally great. \n\nLine forms quick, but worth it. Fresh food takes time. Portions are generous. Wish they delivered."

"Good run of luck lately. Sat down for brekkie, nice welcome. Friendly server, efficient as hell. Pancakes and eggs benedict, top-notch. Muffins could use some more toasting, though. Coffee's decent, but my home brew's better. Still, a solid spot for breakfast. Oh, and my cat just hopped on me. That's all for now."

"Tigerlilly's my jam. Better for cocktails or tea, you know? Had a great meal, but the afternoon tea's where it's at. Ketel One cocktail, plenty of sweets, scones, and sammies. Staff's top-notch too. Decor's swell, atmosphere's always on point. Professional all the way."
"Pricey for the portion size. Good grub, but the bill added up quick. They say their Krab is legit Cali-roll stuff, though. Tasty, just a bit steep."

"Hark, this place doth offer delectable Oriental fare,
And American dishes, aplenty to share.
A sushi bar, renowned for its finest catch,
Doth please my taste buds, with nary a scratch.

I do confess, my heart doth sing with glee,
When they prepare the dishes I hold dear.
But lo, my joy doth turn to dismay,
When a favorite dish doth disappear, alas!

The service here, doth merit high praise,
For 'tis swift, courteous, and ne'er astray.
All-you-can-eat, a veritable feast,
Fitting for families, or a gathering of guests."

"Methinks 'twas my first time at Archies' cafe,
The service there didst please me mightily,
And of a truth, their victuals were most fair,
Their Pad Tai, in sooth, didst taste divine.
I prayed them make it six on fiery scale,
Yet still, methoughts, 'twas not quite hot enough,
But, by my troth, 'twas naught but jest,
For all in all, 'twas a right merry feast.
A pleasant atmosphere doth reign within,
And thus, I say, 'tis a most excellent inn."

"Book shopping, I'm in and out. No time for browsing, gotta have a purpose. Borders lays 'em out front, easy to grab what I need. New non-fiction, clearance, bestsellers, they got it all. Prices might be steep, but it's worth it for the convenience. Staff's friendly, parking's plentiful, and there's a Seattle's Best inside. That's my kinda bookstore."
"Plenty to see and do, my friend. Hands-on exhibits, you know? Robots, for one. They never miss a shot on the court, and they'll whoop your ass at air hockey. A fine way to pass the time."
"Arrived finally. Food's great. Spicy? They'll bring the heat. Veggie curry, top-notch. Wine selection, impressive. Staff, friendly. Rice, extra. That's how it's done."

In this fair town, I chanced upon a new eatery,
Wherein I sought a hasty dinner, ere my journey's end.
The victuals were quite good, with choice abounding,
And generous portions did the cooks proffer, without stint.
The servers, too, were pleasant, and their service fine,
For they did roll the dishes in pancakes, Chinese-style divine.
They also poured wine and sake, both warm and sweet,
A rarity in such small taverns, 'twas a treat indeed.
Thus, I declare, 'tis a fair place for Chinese fare,
In Apache Junction, should thou seek sustenance there.

"If you're lookin' for some damn good Mexican, this place is worth the trip. Friendly staff, clean as a whistle, plenty of seats, and a killer view. Had the shrimp tacos and sweet plantains, both top-notch. Their ultimate margarita was a letdown though, three types of tequila or not, it didn't even give me a buzz. Pricey too. But overall, this place serves up some of the best Mexican I've had."

"Ere we departed for Los Angeles from fair Las Vegas,  
We chose to dine and savor the city's delight.  
The seating was swift, our server passable,  
But the whole establishment seemed not quite right,  
As if they had just opened, and all was not well.  
Some waiters appeared lost, in a state of disarray.  
But we waited patiently, our hunger to assuage,  
For the salad, that took an age to arrive,  
And came but two minutes ere our meals did come.  
Yet, the Twisted Mac, Chicken, and Cheese, oh so fine,  
Did sate my hunger, and left me feeling prime.  
The ambiance, as in any Hard Rock Cafe,  
Was cool, and worth another visit, I would say."

"Hark, good sir, how Postino doth shine,
Since LGO's departure, it doth divine.
This newest branch, the best of all, doth lay,
Near to my humble abode, what luck doth play?

Indoor/outdoor bar, a wondrous sight,
Within, the atmosphere doth take flight.
Food, oh food, how thou doth delight,
Each dish, a culinary work of art in sight.

Breakfast, a meal most noble, doth shine,
Grilled French bread, egg, asparagus, and tomato, a divine line.
Wine, a beverage of the gods, doth flow,
Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc, a taste to know.

This place, I do adore, with all my heart,
Save for the service, which doth depart.
A five-star review, I wouldst give, in truth,
But for the spotty service, a deduction of youth."

"In Scottsdale, found a gem. Twenty bucks for a haircut, great atmosphere. Two-dollar beer happy hour, served in the bar or while you're getting trimmed. Cool, knowledgeable dude cut my hair. This'll be my spot from now on."

"On a Saturday eve, our merry band of four didst dine at Roy's, a feast most fair and bright. We entered, greetings given, and straightaway found our table, a cozy nook apart from the main throng. Our waters, poured forthwith, and the server, a friendly lass, didst introduce herself with grace. Edamame, a gift from the gods, didst appear, and we didst order drinks with haste: a Cosmo, a Martini, rocks, and olives, aplenty. Alas, the Martini, a slip-up, no olives, a lime wedge, alack! But swiftly, 'twas corrected, all well once more. \n\nTuna Poke and Signature Roll, our first course, a delight, a veritable cornucopia of flavors. And then, the main event: Braised Short Ribs, Seared Sea Scallops, Blackened Island Ahi, Tempura California White Sea Bass. Cooked to perfection, each dish, a masterpiece. But, alas, dear friends, the ambiance, a mite lacking, a chain restaurant still, despite the fare, most excellent. A place for families, aye, but for romance, mayhap not, the night, a mite too bright."
"This joint's got character. Like a neighborhood bar, but for adults. Good grub too. Entertainment's top-notch. Get a table, it fills up fast in summer. Service is A-one."

"Friday afternoon, hungry and broke. Where to eat? Not the fanciest joint, but for $7.55, you get a lot of grub. Fill your gut, but watch out, it's easy to overdo it. I know, I did. Belly's full, feeling guilty. Shouldn't complain, it was cheap. :)"

"Methinks these men of skill do rock indeed,
Their service swift and their prices fair,
I sought a fan motor, new and neat,
For my heat pump, which did much declare
Their diligence, in searching far and wide,
Didst bring me deals most opportune and bright.
One of them, with haste, did drive to fetch,
The very motor, that I might possess,
And thus, with speed, my need was met,
Their kindness too, didst not forget.
A capacitor, they offered free,
But alas, 'twas not necessity.

Alas, a week didst pass, ere I didst pay,
For they didst not say, up front, the way,
A simple miscommunication, methinks,
Yet, naught but praise, their service links.
Their hours, on Yelp, be not accurate,
For they do close, at four and thirty, precise."

"Went to Bunna with the missus last Saturday. First time. Heard they had a poetry slam goin' on and we were hungry. Place had a cozy vibe, eclectic. Owner seemed proud. Didn't try the coffee, but will next time. Husband got the Mediterranean chicken wrap, I had the turkey and swiss panini. Both good. Came with veggie chips, different, but nice. Lunch menu's a steal. Will be back."
"Lisa's Bowl of Balls, it's a damn good dish. Satisfying, real satisfying. Meatballs, that's what I'm talking about. Craving meat? Go to Lisa G's. Highly recommend it."

"Aye, men and companies do err, my dear.
But here, the master did take blame full clear.
He fixed the fault, and all was well again.
'Tis proof he holds his clients dear, and values his gain."

"My boyfriend took me to this joint, said it was top-notch. I'm a sucker for good baked potatoes, and he swore this place had 'em in spades. I didn't eat much, just a potato and some cornbread, but I couldn't shake the feeling I'd been taken for a ride. Thirty bucks for a couple of spuds and some bread? Seemed steep. 

Haven't tried the BBQ yet, but the grub looked pretty damn good. Friendly atmosphere, too. Busy as all get out, and the place smelled like a dream. Cornbread and honey butter? Best I've ever had. Guy next to me had some killer ribs, too. Gonna have to come back for those. 

Food was good, but pricey. Place seemed popular, though. Worth another visit, I reckon."

"Pho, thou art divine! Thy noodles, not too clingy, and broth, just right. Bo vien, a delight! Yet, alas, thy spring rolls, a disappointment. Service, good sirs, most kind. Ambiance, pleasant, save for yon fish tank, unkempt. Rating, four stars, nay, five, for service most excellent."

"3.5 stars, but let's call it four. Long lines, especially during that damn BOGO promo. Waited an hour, and just made the 4pm cutoff. They said if we didn't make it, we'd pay full price per person. Jesus. 

But once inside, the spread was impressive. Anything and everything, plus free booze. Food was good too. 

Go for lunch, it's cheaper. Twelve bucks with the player's card. Dinner's a bit steep. Think they take reservations, unless there's a promotion."

"Good eatery. Big portions. Chica, their purple corn drink, tastes like hibiscus tea, not corn. Had roast chicken on a Friday. Juicy, tender, herby, roasted right. Fish ceviche for an appetizer. Nice tang, citrusy. Also had lomo saltado. Beef's tender, full of flavor. Friendly service, a bit slow. Will return."

"Federico's, I stopped by for a bite. Two beef tacos, a drink, I ordered. Service slow, woman at counter double duty, drive-through too. But food, excellent. Tacos, tasty. Lettuce, crisp, fresh. Impressed, I was. Good value, very."
"The clothes here ain't top-notch, but if you frequent the place, you might find something worthwhile. The fella who runs the joint's a good egg, too. Get to know him and he'll help you out."

"Primanti Brothers, the real deal. If they were in San Fran, I'd be their neighbor. Their sandwiches? Sloppy, robust, full of goodness. Pittsburgh to the bone. Love the OG spot, got memories of drinkin', devourin' kielbasa like a true Yinzer. May they rule the sandwich game forever. Amen."

"Houstons, consistent as hell. Hillstone Group knows their stuff. Tell Fox Restaurant Concepts to take notes. \n\nWord to the wise, Houstons soup enthusiasts - they swapped out the Mexico City style for Mushroom Artichoke on Sundays. Bummed, but still stoked on the new option. Two thumbs up."

"Maverick Tours, this mornin'. First time on a chopper, staff gave safety training, good job. Pilot Joe, smooth ride, Grand Canyon and back. Informative flight, nice views. Landed, sipped champagne, took photos. Plenty room in chopper. Thanks, Maverick crew, lifetime mem'ry."

"Grilled octopus, Israeli couscous, duck confit ravioli - they got it all. Bison flank steak, too. Five-star service, classic French cuisine. Staff's friendly, food's perfect. Pre-fixe under $50, can't go wrong. Anniversary dinner, happy tummies, big smiles. Thanks, Le Pegase."

"Pam and Nibblers pulled through for me. Last-minute office lunch and they whipped up a damn good spread. Quick service, too. Had all I needed and then some. Grilled veggies, flank steak - hell, everything was top-notch."

"I got a hankerin' for a place that's reliable, you know? This joint fits the bill. Good grub, no matter the meal. I was flyin' outta Phoenix, needed somethin' to fill my belly before dealin' with TSA and the friendly skies. Got myself a power protein sandwich, real reasonable price, too - five bucks in an airport, ain't bad. \n\nThey whipped it up in no time, just five minutes. Whole grain bread, egg whites, white Vermont cheddar, lean ham. That ham and egg combo, damn good. Bread was top-notch, too. Made eatin' healthy taste like a sinful delight. I devoured that sandwich, felt full 'til lunchtime."

"Methinks 'tis wondrous fare they serve at Pura Vida,
For every time I dine there, it's a feast for mine eyes,
The flavors dance upon my tongue, so sweet and true,
And all my senses are delighted, as if in paradise anew.

My father, a man of flesh, and mother, fair and finick,
Have both partaken of their dishes, and found them most divine,
No complaints do they utter, nor any discontent,
For the victuals here are truly fit for a king, or so it would seem.

Their cafe con leche, oh how smooth and rich it flows,
A coffee so fine, it leaves Starbucks in the dust, I vow,
'Tis a marvel how Chef Mayra doth create such culinary joys,
A true artist, with flavors and spices, she doth employ.

She doth emerge from the kitchen, to greet her guests with grace,
A kindness seldom seen, in this fast-paced, modern race,
The restaurant may be hidden, but once found, 'twill be hard to forget,
For Pura Vida doth offer a dining experience most rare and unique, I wager."

"In days of yore, upon a vacant shore,
I tried my hand at scuba, but alas,
It brought me naught but woe and fear,
And left me doubting if I'd e'er draw near.

But then, a friend didst speak of place,
Where scuba lessons were taught with grace,
And thus, my heart didst change its tune,
For Destination Scuba didst make it soon.

Their instructors, skilled and patient too,
Didst guide me through the watery blue,
And though the ocean's vast and deep,
They showed me wonders that I'd ne'er sleep.

Their trips, they plan throughout the year,
To tropic climes, where sun doth shine so clear,
And thus, my dear, I say 'tis worth the cost,
To travel forth and dive with them, no loss."

"Clean, spacious rooms at this hotel. Never had the buffet, but the casino's comfortable, clean, and fun. Didn't win, but that's nothing new for me in Nevada. Ha! Fun regardless. Would stay here again and recommend it to friends. Fitness room's pricey, but you get access to the'spa.' Treatments are overpriced, but the steam room and showers are top-notch."

"Vegas has plenty of joints to grab a bite, but I knew I wanted somewhere local. India Palace fit the bill. Great reviews and not too touristy. I went for the Vegetable Pakora and Onion Bhaji to start. The Onion Bhaji was killer - spicy and crispy. Just how I like it. Then, I got my usual Chicken Vindaloo. Spicy as hell, just how I like it. I was sweating bullets, but it was worth it. I cleaned the plate with some garlic naan and cheese naan. Didn't need dessert, but that's not saying much. Service was top-notch. Friendly, attentive, and fast. Can't wait to get back."
"Good work. Needed mani pedi, found great spot near strip. Quality nails, friendly folk."

"Home sweet home. Miss the ol' place, best spot to live life. Gated community, secure and convenient. Close to the 101, 202, and 60. Tempe Marketplace and Mesa Riverview just a stone's throw away. Old Town Scottsdale a mere 10 minutes down the road."
"This joint's my go-to for AYCE sushi. Prices are better than most, and the fish is fresh. It's tucked away in a shopping center, but it's worth finding. Ranks high on my Vegas list."

"Allure, it's a damn good salon. Clean, friendly staff, fair prices. Fifteen miles from my place, but worth the drive for their top-notch service. Jen, she's the one to see for eyebrow waxing. Been going to her for two years now, and she's the only one I trust with my brows. Keeps 'em full and natural, but tidies 'em up real nice. And remember, bring cash for a tip. Can't write it on your credit card receipt."

"Hark! This Cracker Barrel be the best I've seen,
The wait, shorter than Bell's or 101's queue,
I do adore their cheesy hashbrown casserole,
A dish most wondrous, and highly recommended too.
Alas, the din within these walls doth ring,
Yet still, a place most pleasant for my soul to sing.
On Sundays, after or before our holy rite,
I do delight in visiting this merry sight."

"Aria Hotel, top-notch. Stayed there in December, can't believe it took me this long to give my two cents. Here's why it stands out from the rest:

1. Elegant, modern architecture. Our room, nice and stylish. Great view, and affordable too, $220 a night.
2. Location, smack dab in the middle of the strip. Easy walk to nearby hotels, shops, and restaurants. They got a tram too, but we walked everywhere, no need for it.
3. Restaurants, especially the buffet. Wynn's got nothing on Aria's buffet. $40 for dinner, $45 for dinner, worth every penny. Endless options, top-quality grub.

Loved everything about this place. Highly recommend it to anyone passing through Vegas. Off-season prices make it a steal. Give it a shot, won't regret it."

"Furniture like no other. Hand-painted, one-of-a-kind pieces. I've bought several items for my new place and they're all unique. The owners are friendly and offer delivery if you don't have a truck. Worth checking out."

"Don't let the name fool you. This ain't no ordinary deli or grocery. It's got some of the best Italian grub in town, and that's no joke. Sure, they got sandwiches and salads, but the real magic happens on the daily specials board. Risotto with shrimp, mussels, and sea bass? Check. Homemade meatballs? You bet. Veal ravioli? Damn straight. Tuscan-style steaks? They got 'em. And don't even get me started on the wine. They got a corkage fee, but it's worth it. This place may look like a hole in the wall, but trust me, it's the real deal. And when the owner/chef and his pals are sittin' around, speakin' Italian, and watchin' soccer, you know you're in for a treat."
"Food and service, top-notch. Chicken bento box, $9, plenty of grub. Green tea crime brle, outta this world. Be back soon."

"Fresh fare and frothy brew, a feast most fair and fine!
I didst order yon burger, number twenty-nine,
A culinary delight, most juicy and divine.
With fries, crisp and golden, a perfect pairing, methinks.

Near to the Kitchener Rangers' arena doth lie
This tavern, where we parked our steeds with nary a sigh.
The owner, Liam, a merry soul, didst grant us leave
To partake of his hospitality, for which we didst give thanks.

Highly recommended, this establishment doth stand,
For those who seek good cheer and victuals of the land."

"In Wickenburg, we did make a brief sojourn,
As on our journey from Phoenix to Vegas, we did stray.
Our hunger sated, the victuals did astound,
Swiftly served, a feast fit for a king's renown.

Pulled pork, brisket, beans, and fries of sweet potato,
With potato salad, our repast did start to grow.
My spouse, enraptured by the fries' delight,
Did claim them as the best she had ever in sight.

I, too, did find my brisket most delectable,
But then, the pork, oh how it did ascend!
Baked beans, a culinary joy beyond compare,
And chocolate brownie, warm, with ice cream so fair and rare."
"Good folks, good grub. Warm chips, salsa bar - my kind of joint. Dessert bars too, not bad either. \n\nThis place, cheap, quick, friendly. Not bad nowadays."

"Place was damn near perfect. Service, impeccable. Wine selection, top-notch. Not the usual crap they serve around here. Carpaccio, beautiful. Sliced just right, melted in my mouth. Fresh, quality meat. Mussels linguine, exquisite. Garlic sauce, just right. Pasta, perfectly cooked. Tiramisu, YUM! Decor, great. Elegant, but comfortable. Big round bar, nice. Table, well-placed. Wine cellar, beautiful. Mauricio's hospitality, genuine. Glad to see a restaurant like this, not owned by some corporation. Fine dining, but comfortable."
"Cloud 9, top-notch hookah joint. DJs spinning sick beats. Friendly staff, lively crowd. No booze, but who needs it? Xbox one's the cherry on top. Best flavors in town, bar none."

"Methinks 'tis four months past, fair friends, since I didst adopt the vegan way. And yonder eatery, with its progressive fare and elegant decor, didst pique mine interest. My love and I, we didst partake of lasagna, pad thai, the living burrito, and a vegetable burger. Verily, all dishes were deemed good, save for the burger, which didst lack a tad in moisture. Yet, by borrowing a dash of my fair maiden's fiery elixir, all was made well. Aye, the cost didst border on the steep, but such is the price of finery, I reckon."

"Sunday morning, we went for brunch. Bottomless bloody Mary's and mimosas for sixteen bucks. Not bad. I had a breakfast skillet scramble. Damn good. Our server, Angie, was top-notch. Attentive and friendly. We'll be back."
"Toms, we eat there plenty. BBQ, damn good. But don't stop there. Fish, Italian beef, burgers - all top-notch. And don't miss Tom's pride, his joy. Prices fair, grub excellent, service friendly."

"Elegant grub, cooked to perfection. Snagged a prime table by the window, views of the Bellagio fountain. Servers galore, each one assigned to a specific task. Water poured, seats taken, orders taken, dishes delivered. Feeling spoiled. 

Split the spaghetti, added mushrooms and broccoli. Noodles cooked just right, tomato sauce rich and full of flavor. Simple, yet satisfying. Sides equally impressive. Flavors on point. 

Definitely coming back, looking forward to the same dishes again."

"Ice Pan, a frozen treat joint, offers a unique experience. You choose the milk, flavor, and toppings, and they whip it up in front of you. Two minutes, tops. Worth the wait, despite the casino smoke and crowd. We went on a weekday afternoon, and it took a bit, but the end result was sweet."
"Clean, attentive joint. Free internet, killer tapas bar. Unwind after a long day on the road. My top pick for personal trips, close to public transit and other great eats."

"Spices and herbs, oh boy! Quality's top-notch, no need to look elsewhere. Cumin, extracts, vanilla, almond - can't go wrong with 'em. And their cinnamon? Best in town. Keep a list, never run out. No need to rush, got my Penzey's."

"Hark! A Groupon didst I purchase, and swiftly didst I enter,
For fear of missing out on sweets most dear.
Their choice was limited, alas, but fortune smiled upon me,
