And I didst obtain a decent pick, methought.

I knew not that special orders couldst be made,
But verily, 'twas a pleasant surprise, I didst find.
Red velvet, cookies and cream, peanut butter, chocolate, and vanilla,
My children didst devour them with glee, and didst exclaim,
"These cupcakes, they are huge, and oh so tasty!"

The icing, sweet as honey, didst they find hard to consume,
But still, they didst enjoy each bite, and didst exclaim,
"Mother, these are the best! We shall return anon!"

The staff, attentive and kind, didst make our visit most pleasant,
A gentleman, with manners fine, didst assist us, and didst present
A deal, a steal, a bargain, beyond compare!
I shall return, forsooth, and partake of their fare once more."

"This ballpark, man. Nestled downtown Phoenix. US Airways arena across the street. Rail runs past it. Clean, alive area, especially game days. Parking's not bad, either. Favorite lot's a block away, seven bucks. Fenced in, secure. Getting out's easy. Police block off streets, guide you through downtown no problem. 

Park itself? Awesome. Love the RF bleachers. Something about 'em. Plus, tickets include dog, drink for twenty-five bucks, fees included. Try to sit close to field, but tonight we hit Friday's Front Row balcony. Prefer sitting with crowd. Game's more fun, people way more entertaining. Vendors usually good for small talk, jokes. Roof opened tonight, enjoyed it. Fireworks post-game, too. 

Catch a game here? You should. DBacks ain't doing great this year, home games especially."

"Record City, a converted house filled with vinyl treasures, stands tall in the best crate-digging tradition. Quality and selection, that's what sets it apart. From rare gems to classic albums, the collection boasts a diverse range of genres. Rock, R&B, jazz, country, and classical, you name it, they got it. The constant flow of visitors to Vegas keeps the inventory fresh and exciting. You'll leave with an armful of records, not just a few. Don't forget, they close at 5 PM and take Sundays off. My last visit yielded a cache of sealed Motown classics and hard-to-find Quads. Worth the trip, it is."

"Veggie meat sandwiches, best I've had. Morning Star chicken shreds, sliced smoked soy-based turkey. Fresh bread, generous portions. Polite staff. Wish they had one back home. Would eat here every night. Thirteen bucks for a twenty-inch sub, can't beat it."

"Amazing, amazing, AMAZIIING. Five stars all around - drinks, food, service, decor. As a bartender myself, I was impressed by their skills. They knew how to make a proper mojito, and it was the best I've ever had. Sure, it took a bit longer than usual, but that's because they took their time to craft each drink with love and care. It showed in the end result - pure perfection. Worth the wait, any day. DW is a hidden gem, no doubt about it. Can't wait to return."

"YELP HELPS 2013, what a night. Vendors brought their A-game, orgs showed their impact on the 'Burgh. Luke Wholey's Mahi Mahi, Vito Girosole's RED RIBBON soda, both top-notch. Ciao Vito, good job. Thanks to Rachel and the YELPERS for another great evening. -Gary K."

"Chicken kabob, my go-to at Market Grille. Juicy, marinated chicken, packed tight on a skewer. Comes with veggies, rice, salad, and hummus. A damn good deal. 

The lamb gyro's a close second. 

Now they got waiters and waitresses. Don't need 'em. Old system worked fine. Order at the counter, grab a number, get your own drink. Simple. 

Friendly staff, though. Always helpful. 

Tip: Keep an eye out for 15% off coupons in the Review Journal."

"Hark, what news is this? A grocer doth provide
Such savings, 'twill make thy purse sing with delight!
Winco, the name, doth conjure images of cheer,
Their prices, a blessing, doth bring us near.

Produce, of quality high, doth grace their shelves,
And milk, a staple, doth flow like liquid wealth.
Breads, aplenty, doth satisfy our daily needs,
HyTop brand, a secret, doth unlock sweet deeds.

But lo, Walmart, a behemoth of ill repute,
Doth mistreat its workers, a woeful plight.
In contrast, Winco doth treat its staff with care,
A beacon of hope, their service doth bear.

Fry's and Safeway, both fine establishments,
Yet Winco, unique, doth stand apart with ease.
For those who seek not bulk, but still would save,
This hybrid store, a haven, doth pave.

So let us raise our voices, in praise we shall,
For Winco, a gem, doth stand tall and proud.
Our pockets, full of coin, doth thank thee,
Our bellies, full of cheer, doth sing with glee!"

"We love this joint. First visited for my kid's second birthday. Did the hayride and petting zoo tour. Loved the milk bar and feeding the animals. Went back after getting a Groupon and joined the Dairy Club. Great being close to where our grub comes from. The chefs make some killer dishes - peanut butter ice cream, garlic and herb butter, red pepper aioli, and a damn good chicken salad. We're hooked."

"Tortellini salad, shoulda gotten bigger size. Key lime dessert, perfect balance, not too tart, not too sweet. Apricot pork tenderloin, looked great. Daughter loved her cookies. Great addition to the neighborhood."

"Sambalatte, my go-to spot. Great coffee, good vibes, and free wi-fi. Perfect for working or meeting friends. Feels like SoCal, not Summerlin. People-watching paradise. Two floors, chill atmosphere. Give it a shot, take your time. No rush, no Starbucks feel."

"Arizona, finally got the best pizza. Been waitin' a while for this. Owners from Illinois, kept the quality high. Didn't wanna go back to Illinois for good pizza. Thanks, Buzzyz. Always deliverin' the real deal."
"One of the top five poker rooms in Vegas. Lots of tables, good games, and a solid room overall. My go-to spot."

"Arepas? Amazing. First timer, perfect fit. Couple miles from the strip, old plaza, nice inside. Two sauces, bottle, spread, delicious. Spicy, savory, creamy. Great with food. Cashier, George, patient, knowledgeable. Not cheap, but worth it. Quality food."

"Recovery from a wild night on the Strip? This joint delivered. Food, service - top-notch. And that Mechilada? Hair of the dog never tasted so good. Eggs Benny? Don't miss it. A great spot to fuel up before hitting the strip or pool."

"Verily, this place doth please mine eyes and taste,
A haven for vegans, or so it doth seem.
The folk who work here, kindness doth abound,
Cash only, alack, yet still a gem found.

I chanced upon this spot, my daughter's graduation the cause,
Two dishes didst I seek, Spam Musabi, and vegan donuts, perchance.
A contradiction, mayhap, yet still I didst crave,
And thus, my heart didst sing with joy, my hunger didst wave.

The apple fritters, delectable morsels, I didst bear,
Through graduation, then on plane, a secret, hidden there.
In frozen state, they didst await, their fate,
At my love's abode, her freezer, their new estate.

Indeed, the donuts, vegan, who wouldst have thought?
Delicious, beyond compare, their sweetness hath been brought.
And heed this warning, cash only, 'tis true,
For Ronald's, a rare find, in Las Vegas, anew."

"Finished a great meal here. First time trying Turkish food. Be back soon. Kuru Fasulye, lamb and beans, was tasty. Lentil soup, smooth and well-seasoned. Turkish baklava, soft and chewy, not too sweet. Must try with Turkish coffee. Friendly staff. Highly recommend."

"Best sushi joint I've been to, no lie. Not one to embellish, but this place warrants it. Spent three nights in Vegas, hit this spot twice. Everything we ordered, pure gold. That crunchy spicy roll? Deadly."
"Food's good here. Not fast, but real good. Carnitas burrito, tasty. Tacos, quality. Street corn, takes me back to Mexico, when I was young."
"A tribute to the Beatles, it was. Music that moved us, like the waves of the sea. My wife and I, we were blown away. Best show we've ever seen, it was. Cirque du Soleil at its finest."

"Hark, a new favourite doth lie in Uptown Waterloo,
A place unbeknownst to me, until now, alack.
With friend in tow, I ventured forth to try,
This eatery of which I speak, and didst not buy.

The exterior, modest, yet full of charm,
The staff, friendly, and eager to disarm.
I ordered eggplant parmesan, a dish divine,
And water, for I drove, and wished to keep mine.

'Twas served as a sandwich, flavoursome and grand,
With marinara sauce, a perfect complement, at hand.
The bread, not soggy, a delight to my taste,
In short, a dish that doth rank among the best.

The evening, quiet, save for the sound,
Of laughter and chatter, joy unbound.
If peaceful dining be thy desire,
Then come, dear friends, and claim thy share.

Stay tuned, fair readers, for part two,
When cocktails shall be tried, anew."

"A-rolling into town on a Saturday eve,
After sixteen hours of driving, my heart did crave
A drink for my trusty steed, a green machine,
Whose engine did protest, with oil and coolant keen.

In haste, I filled 'er up, with a liquid new,
From the nearest gas station, where I didst pursue
A brand of coolant, that didst meet her needs,
But alas! I feared, my choice of coolant didst seethe.

I searched the forums, and manuals too,
To learn of colors, brands, and what to do,
But fear didst grip me, like a vice so tight,
That I had erred, and chosen wrong, in the dead of night.

Off to Zimbrick, I didst hasten with speed,
Where Bryan, patient, kind, and friendly indeed,
Didst check my coolant, and dispel my fears,
With a top-off, that brought me tears of cheer.

We talked of oil, and other things,
That a traveler must heed, ere he embarks on wings,
And when the transaction ended, with a smile so bright,
I thanked him, and departed, into the night,

In love with Madison, its people so fair,
I left with a heart full of joy, and a soul so rare."
"DB, I love it. Great coffee, top-notch service. No gripes. Saw 'em on Undercover Boss, sealed the deal. Would've worked there in high school."

"O, what a wondrous place! So clean, so bright,
With customer service that doth shine so fair and bright.
Their pasta, made with love, doth taste divine,
And cheese, oh cheese, doth melt upon my tongue like wine.
Their sauces, too, doth bring forth joy and delight,
All made with fresh ingredients, a true culinary sight.
And let us not forget the macaroons, so sweet,
A treat most wondrous, that doth our senses greet.
We shall return, aye, again and again,
For more of this place's culinary charm and gain."

"Lucky Me Pet Care? Top-notch. Used 'em last time I left town. Dogs were happy, got notes keepin' me updated. Heather and her crew, real pros. Took 'em on walks, gave 'em attention they needed. Better than boardin', they're home, comfy. And cheaper, too."
"Chocolate shaved snow, not what I expected. But good. Friendly employees, spotless store. Even on a busy Saturday night. Fun addition to Centennial Hills."
"Convenient spot, just a stone's throw from work. Friendly staff, eager to lend a hand. Recommended."
"Indian grub, that's my jam. Buffet's where it's at, no decisions needed. Curry chicken, that's my top pick."
"Brows wild, needed taming. Yelped, found joint. Two ahead, wait under ten. Threaded brows and lip, five bucks off. Great service, will return."

"Hark! In the north valley, there lies a place most fair,
Where pork on a fork doth reign supreme, with nary a care.
A BBQ joint, with Cornhuskers' emblem on display,
And pictures of windmills and farmers, doth catch mine eye.

Oh, how I do detest that wretched place, so dear,
Yet, Pork on a Fork, doth make my heart sing cheer.
Their brisket, pork, beans, and waffle fries, all hot and fresh,
Do fill mine belly with delight, and doth dispel my fears.

Their cornbread, too, doth please mine taste, so fine,
And portion sizes, large, do make mine afternoons divine.
Alas, their sauces, not so fantastic, yet still,
The spicy one, doth make mine mouth, with joy, doth thrill.

The dining hall, with flat screens, doth entertain,
And chairs and tables, picnic-like, doth not detain.
So, if thou find thyself in north valley's midst,
Do stop by Pork on a Fork, and give 'em a try, thou wilt not miss."

"Bass Pro Shops, a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Firearms, camping, knives, fishing, golfing, hiking, boating, hunting, ATV's, archery - they've got it all. Can't resist the urge to stop by whenever I'm in Vegas. Conveniently located near I-15 on Blue Diamond Road, it's my go-to spot for restocking ammo. Last time I visited, my wife and I marveled at the impressive aquariums and mermaid paintings at the Silverton Casino connection. She's a sucker for mermaids, I'm a sucker for crossbows. Fell hard for a Parker Compound Crossbow on the second floor. Might've found my new shooting partner. If you're in Vegas and share our passion for the outdoors, do yourself a favor and check out Bass Pro Shops."

"Place stands up, 5 stars no question. Survived past few years, good sign. Saturday night, 8:30, 40% full, not bad. Three restaurants, three bars, all good. Urban vibe, luxury feel. Had small supper before comedy show. Server nice, quick service. Single guy at bar, reading book, eating pasta, welcome. Carbonara still top-notch, like Queens joint. Grateful for place like this."
"Veggies, curry, winea buck a head. No corkage, BYOB. Family-style, friendly service. This place is a steal."
"Busy joint till midnight. Good chance of snagging a seat then."

"Hark! What wondrous eatery doth grace our fair Basset St? A place where service doth excel, and victuals doth impress! 'Tis locally owned, with prices most fair, and atmosphere most pleasant. They change their menu twice a season, thus the name, and what a delight it doth bring! Their entrees and breakfasts, oh how grand! Though portions not as large as some, still, a good value doth it bring. A fine selection of teas, and a bar that doth serve both coffee and spirits, for all to enjoy. Two brothers, with hearts so kind, do own this place, and their love for customers doth shine. Join their mailing list, and receive but one email per month, with special deals, and savings most generous!"

"Best mom and pops Korean joint I've been to. Treated us like family, spoiled us rotten. Small hole in the wall, needs more visitors. Chef/wife's cooking? To die for. Husband/host? Hilarious, genuine. Quality food, run by loving couple. They're a chemical engineer and ex-nurse, so they know their stuff. Gave us three free dishes, refused our tip 'cause we're students. Slipped one past the husband, still didn't feel like enough. Felt like we were at home, sitting around the dinner table with family. Highly recommend, give more than five stars if I could."
"Place is top-notch. Shepard's pie, best in the valley. Staff, friendly and prompt. Sunday jams, great for traditional music lovers."

"Gordon Ramsay Steak, a culinary symphony. Attentive staff, knowledgeable and friendly. Food, a masterpiece. Flavors harmonizing, creating an unforgettable experience. Best meal of my life, thanks to all involved."

"Genghis Grill, love it. Get what I want, every time. Flavorful, cooked just right, staff's top-notch. They got those chopstick helpers for the kid, makes her feel like a pro. Highly recommend for the little ones, they'll eat more veggies, try new things when they can see it before it's cooked, see others giving it a shot too."

"Friday night, two girls, Grill. Patio, golf course view. New furniture, bar, TVs. Gastropub menu, bottle of wine. Truffle deviled eggs, cheese plate, duck confit tacos, ahi tuna, duck fat grilled cheese, kiltlifter fish and chips. Everything delicious, shared. Wasabi crusted ahi, favorite. Friendly staff. Great menu, best patio Scottsdale."

"Pizzeria Bianco, best pie in Phoenix. Historic district, old homes now eateries and bars. Sat lunch, got there early, scored patio table in shade. Fill up quick, heard waits can be long. Split salad, had margarita pizza with fennel sausage. Simple, quality ingredients, unique flavors. Be back."

"Top-notch joint for threading in the valley. She's rigged up some nifty gadget that keeps the thread clean and out of your mouth. Necklace does the trick, real swell. Service is A-okay, quality's top-notch. A peach of a spot, tell ya."

"Best BBQ I've had in Arizona. Tender brisket, incredible corn souffl, and decent slaw. Friendly service, too. Lynn knew her stuff. Left feeling full, but not physically. Had to loosen my pants. Not the fanciest joint, but the grub and hospitality make it a hidden gem."

"Good joint for shoppin', bakery's got great pastries, cheaper than Starbucks too. Outside patio's a nice spot for readin' the paper in the mornin'. Staff's real friendly, they care 'bout their customers, not like some other places in town. Sushi bar's good for a quick bite, so's the salad bar, and the deli's got some tasty options too. Can't really complain 'bout anythin' here, 'cept maybe the prices if you're doin' all your grocery shoppin' here."
"Haircut of a lifetime, today. Cute joint, friendly folk. Hair's looking sharp, message was a sweet surprise."

"Hark, fair Rubio's, a cantina of old Mexico,
Where simple dishes, fresh and tasty, do flow.
I've visited oft, and each time, I do swear,
My heart doth crave their Atlantic salmon burrito dear.
'Tis a feast for the senses, a treat for the tongue,
With seafood so fresh, it doth make my heart sing.
Their salsas, a selection most fine and grand,
Do complement the meal, with flavors so bland.
Roasted chipotle, my favorite, doth reign,
A spicy delight, that doth bring me joy and cheer.
A place most meet, for a midday repast,
Rubio's, thou art a treasure, forever to be savored and enjoyed at last."
"Brats and Burgers, you say? I gave it a go. Damn good thing I did. Their curry sauce, it's top-notch. I'll be back for more, that's a fact."

"Methought, fair friends, that I wouldst not hasten to the new establishment, ere its grand debut. But lo, my doubts were laid to rest, forsooth, upon mine eyes feasting on the delectable victuals served within those hallowed walls. Verily, a few wrinkles yet to iron out, and yon brick oven doth remain unfinished, but fear not, for the truncated bill of fare hath proven a wondrous upgrade, by my troth. They shall boast twenty-four brews upon the tap, come opening day, yet already they proffer a baker's dozen, inclusive of that rarest of draughts, Four Peaks Callabru Up N Runnin! By my halidom, I say, most impressive indeed, and eagerly do I anticipate the grand unveiling!"
"Rushed visit, but damn good grub. Black & blue burger, pulled pork sandwich, blue brisket salad - all winners. Close to the office too. Sorry, gotta bounce."

"Great meal here. Server helped us navigate the menu, recommending the signature pizza and garlic olive oil for the bread. Wish they sold that oil in a bottle. Only issue was the wait, but it was a wild Friday night with rowdy drunks causing a scene. Authentic Italian food, not far from downtown. This place delivers."
"Good joint, tasty drinks, local whiskey. Prices fair, selection vast. Lookin' forward to seein' their aged stuff down the line. Gonna bring me back for the tour next time 'round."

"NW's got a new spot for pet owners who know their shit. I'm talking premium grub like Orijens, Acana, Natural Balance - the works. They got a refrigerated dog section for them raw-feedin' folks too. Treats made in the USA, ya hear me? They got a table full of doggie desserts that look good enough for humans, ninety cents an ounce. Deer antlers, jerky, sausage - they got it all. Variety's the spice of life, right? And they got groomin' services, leashes, collars, dog bowls galore. The owners, Adrienne and Jim, they're solid folk. They support dog rescue, which is near and dear to my heart. I'm stoked to see how them deer antlers go over. Sometimes Momma needs a break, ya know?"

"Mexico City, on Smithfield by the bridge. Best authentic Mexican in Pittsburgh. Friendly staff. Tacos, awesome. Homemade corn tortillas, the key. Fresh, flavorful food. Like Sayulita, Nayarit. Close to the real deal."
"Good guy, the owner. Transferred a handgun at his shop. Even scored a Colt Python while we were at it. I'll be back for more."

"Diane's, a dive bar in Edinburgh, offers a unique experience. Knock-off DVDs and questionable drugs are available, and physical altercations are common. Despite this, I have a fondness for the place and its eclectic clientele, including shady characters and heavy drinkers."

"Fare thee well, good sir! Forsooth, thy dining experience didst surpass mine own expectations! Verily, the victuals, the atmosphere, and the attendance upon us didst stir within me a sense of wonder and delight. Hark! I do implore thee, dear reader, to partake of their fiery shrimp, a dish most wondrous and divine. And, pray tell, do not neglect to sample the grilled fowl, its flavor enhanced by the subtle tang of cilantro's essence. By my troth, we shall return anon, for this culinary paradise hath captured our hearts!"

We went there on a busy night, and it was packed. But the service and grub were top-notch. We were celebrating our anniversary, and we got the kind of meal we were hoping for. The sommelier was a bit full of himself, but our server was great. The wild mushroom risotto, squid ink rice, and albondigas were all standouts.

"Oishii's got a tight selection of small plates, like Japanese tapas. You'll find killer dishes like orange salmon canaps, lobster with strawberries and shrimp chips, and more. In a city with a rep for weak sushi, Oishii brings the heat. It's still affordable, too. Great spot for groups, with plenty of space and half-priced cocktails on Thursdays."

"Escape the city grind with a 30-minute hike at Exploration Park. The park offers a scenic trail for families and a playground for kids. At the midpoint, take in the stunning view of the Strip or let teens gossip without worrying about eavesdroppers. The summit features a circular terrace and another bench with an even more impressive view of the city. The trail is perfect for beginners and kids, but don't forget to work your way up to bigger challenges. The playground below boasts multiple swings and slides, including a miniature mountain replica for little ones to explore. Get some exercise, keep those New Year's resolutions, and let the kids have fun!"

"Cirque du Soleil, I love it all. But this? This is my favorite. MJ, they did him justice. Brought his world to life. I cried, real tears. Beautiful, fun, emotional. Dancers, gymnasts, all of it - perfection. Don't wanna spoil it, but you gotta see it. Must-see show."

"Lunch in Vegas lacks the power dynamic of other cities. Everyone's on holiday, so there's no need for fancy restaurants. But Milo's, that's a different story. It's my new go-to spot for a great meal and some scene. Their prefix menu is top-notch."

"Daniel G hooked us up, no cover. Security tight on what we could bring, so pack light. By the pool, VIP host invited us to join some guys in their cabana. Hell yeah, we said. Free mojitos, good company, sweet tunes, and no kiddie pool shenanigans. A+ day."
"Chow mein, beef, real good. Not like other places, bland. Orange chicken, A grade. Service, quick."

"Pizza joint had a swell vibe, plenty of options. Spicy sauce, jalapeos, double cheese, sausage, pepperoni, red bells. Real good. Don't need all the fixin's to make it great. Extra charge for wheat or gluten-free crust. Friendly folks."
"Pittsburgh, three weeks of bliss. First bite, knew it'd be tough to leave. Bacon, eggs, cheese, my heart longs for thee. Reunited we shall be, my dear sandwich, too soon."

"First time writing a review. Never been one for words. But this place? Best sushi I've had. Cheapest too. Came on Good Friday, left feeling full and satisfied. Service top-notch, food even better. Fast too. Coming back for sure."

"Vibes: 5 stars. Rad chicks running the show: 5 stars. Coyote Oatie ice cream sundae: 20 stars. 

Heaven in a bowl. Famed sundae lived up to the hype. Cookie crumbled into ice cream and caramel, pure bliss. Support local joints like this over corporate chains any day. 

Planning another visit already. MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!!"

"Not a car girl, but Lester made it easy. Needed an inspection, he fit me in same day. Evening hours, convenient. Straight shooter, fair price. Labor, $70 hour. Parts, cheaper than others. Replace brake light, $3. Happy with quick, honest service. Lester, the best."
"Give it another shot, friends. New management's brought this joint up a notch. Food's improved, service is top-notch, and happy hour's a real treat. Worth more than six stars, if I'm honest."

"Died and in heaven, I reckon. Place is off the charts, atmosphere-wise. Want to switch tables to take it all in. Staff's top-notch, too. Andrew and Priscilla, they're keepers. Friendly, happy, knowledgeable. Give 'em a raise. Husband had the beef tenderloin, I had the ribeye. Shared a bite or two. Finished with the chocolate bar dessert. Can't put into words how good it was. Want everyone to try it so we can chat about it later. Never wanted to live in Phoenix till now. Come, eat, drink, share, repeat."

"M Resort, one of my top picks in Vegas. Haven't stayed here yet, but they got plenty to offer. Mainly come for the eats. Their buffet, the best in town, no question. Always got my go-to dessert, Creme Brulee. And espresso drinks, too! Hash House, Baby Cakes, Vig Deli, Anthony's Steakhouse, and Burger Joint. Spotless joint, minimal smoke in the casino. Pool area, great. Plenty of seats, pool staff on point. Even the grub at the pool, top-notch. Ravello lounge, good entertainment. Wine and drink selection, solid choices for every taste."

"Aloha Kitchen, a hidden gem off the strip. Adobo fried rice omelette, a taste of home. Reminds me of my mother's cooking. Garlicky, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. Couldn't finish it all, saved some for later. Pork kahlua, tender and smoky. Spam musubi, standard fare. Affordable and delicious meals. A great escape from the casinos. Highly recommended."
"Neighbor referred me to Noble for carpet cleaning. They showed up on time, did a great job, and were polite. Will use them again."
"Waffles, French toast, corned beef - all top-notch grub. Hash browns stole the show, especially with that caramelized onion magic. Our crew of ten devoured it all. Good times."

"Hark, good sir or madam, art thou weary of attending mass, yet comprehending naught of the gospel? Fear not, for I have found a place of worship where such woes are naught but a distant memory. 'Tis a church where the priest doth strive to make the scripture relatable, using examples from everyday life to guide his flock. My own experience hath borne witness to this truth, for at my daughter's baptism, Father Nadim did conduct a private mass with such grace and wit, that tears did well nigh spring forth from mine eyes. His manner of delivery, with humor intertwined, did make the time pass swiftly, leaving my husband and me in full enjoyment of the service. Verily, I say unto thee, this church is a rare gem, where one may find solace and understanding in equal measure."

"Herb & Rye, I love it. Dark decor, Friday nights with a DJ. Aviation, my go-to drink, three rounds minimum. Food's great too - wings, hot and crispy, beef carpaccio, mussels, steak that's actually worth a damn. Happy hour, don't miss it."
"Parking, good. Paid a buck for thirty minutes, though. That's Scottsdale for you. Nothin's free, not even parkin'. Love the shops, but they need to update their map. Missin' some new spots."

"Back for round two at this joint. Great spot, top-notch service, friendly folks, and a cook who knows how to put on a show. First visit, I was hesitant 'bout the portion sizes, but let me tell you, I could barely polish off my share. That fried rice? Divine. We had a blast, both times."

"Annie, the event coordinator, is a real gem.  Spunky, beautiful, and friendly as hell.  Made me feel right at home.  Tommy's patio is something else.  Feels like you're on an island paradise.  Staff treated me like a regular, and the grub?  Off the charts.  Had the Saba Steak Salad and Island Goat Cheese.  Can't even describe 'em, I'm still drooling.  Steak was cooked to perfection, dressing had a kick from the garlic aioli, and the potato coins?  Nice touch.  Spring mix and romaine were fresh as could be.  Now, the goat cheese...  Whoa.  Just perfect.  Not too strong, just right.  Tortilla strips on the side?  Dangerous.  Mango salsa?  Yeah, I had a spoonful of that too.  Highly recommend Tommy Bahamas.  Get your tickets for the Original Taste this weekend and try 36 restaurants in one shot!"

"Hotel was top-notch. Stayed three nights with the missus. Room was swell, beds were comfy, and the waterfall shower was a real treat. Got free entry to Drai's night and beach club, which was a sweet perk. Breakfast was on the house too, and it was damn good. Can't wait to come back. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only downside was the thin walls, could hear the club's tunes all night, but it wasn't a big deal for us."
"Burgers are decent, prices too. But for a real experience, grab a stool at the bar. You'll strike up a conversation with whoever's next to you, no doubt. Unless you're the dull one, that is."

"Settebello, five stars ain't enough. Carmine, a Neapolitan artist, his pizzas a masterpiece. Passion, just the right toppings, cooked perfect. Even a sophisticated palate, delighted. Bravo, Carmine. See you soon."

"Great bar. Love the menu, always changing, but still got the classics for the regulars. Good drinks, chill atmosphere, 'cept on Saturdays, when it gets packed.  \n\nFew things to know:

Vegans, watch out. Some drinks got eggwhites, honey, dairy, or Campari, and it ain't always on the menu. Ask the bartender, they'll hook you up with a vegan version. 

First Monday of the month, it's Mixology Monday. Guest mixologist brings the heat with four special cocktails featuring the booze of the night. I went for Veev Acai, some other stuff, but it's always good. 

Weeknights, it's a good spot for a date or hangin' with friends. Not too crowded, music's not loud, ambiance is nice. 

Drinks run about ten bucks. They got a temperance menu too, non-alcoholic drinks, mixology style. Good for DD's, preggo's, or Mormons."

"Wings, fresh and unique. Atmosphere? Forget it. Food's the draw here. Brought my wing-lovin' gal to this dive in the sticks. She was wary till she tried 'em. Now we're regulars, Sundays for football. Great wings, that's the truth."
"Tacos, damn good. Ribs, fell off the bone. Lunch, not too busy. Service, top-notch."

"Boss took me here for lunch. Order and pay first. Hamburgers, to die for. Fries, flavorful. Fried Twinkie for dessert. Loved it. Bringing family and friends back. Next time, pictures. Not disappointed."

"Fabulous, every damn time. Doesn't matter who I'm with - mom, boyfriend, friends - this place is our first stop. Hash is top-notch, service is quick and friendly. Great spot, one of my go-to Vegas joints."

"First-time visit to this joint. Impressed by the red, white, and black decor. Food's pricey, around $20 for two burgers, fries, and a drink. Ate outside on a nice day, enjoyed the peanuts on the table while we waited. Clean bathrooms, clean overall. Food was great, bun could've been toasted though. Free refills on drinks, unique machine. Fries were enough for two, girl working said so. We'll be back."

"Been coming here on and off for years. Price was the only thing keeping me away. But they've changed that now. Many choices included. Means I'll be back more often. Spicy chicken breast bowl with brown rice and veggies. Damn good."

"Never had a bad experience here. Food's always good and the hostess is friendly. Went last night, no greeting, slow service due to three waiters. Still left satisfied. Alicia did a great job, kept our waters full, food came promptly. Great customer service keeps me coming back. Thumbs up for the new decor."
"Good joint. Pricey, but grub's top-notch. Desserts too."

"Hark, my friends, I tell thee of a tale,
Of flavors so divine, they doth prevail.
A croissant, fresh from Bellagio's oven,
Didst taste so sweet, 'twas like a dream from heaven.

Years passed, yet memories lingered strong,
Until this weekend, when chance didst prolong.
I savored each bite, oh so delight,
And found it just as delectable as in sight.

Regular croissant, paired with Dub Expresso,
A match made in culinary paradise, I do confess.
For those who seek a gustatory thrill,
Look no further, for this dish doth fulfill."
"Lindo MIchoacan, stacked with BEST OF LAS VEGAS awards, now has a Henderson spot, views of the city and all. Can't beat great Mexican grub with a view."

"Good grub, made by swell folks in Vegas. Don't let the mall location fool ya. Food's way better than some fancy joint. Fresh ingredients, homemade quality. Try the roasted chicken with paprika and caramelized onions, or the chicken skewers with rice. Greek salad, gyro platter, and baklava for dessert are also top-notch. Support small biz, not corporate chains that prioritize profits over quality. You won't regret it."

"New to town, needed a good salon. Heard raves about Sweet Salon, decided to give it a shot. Adorable joint, great stylist - Paige. Nailed it, knew what I wanted. Affordable too. Recommend it, definitely going back."

"Rented a Spot GPS from LowerGear for my hike through the Grand Canyon, Zion, and Sedona. They shipped it straight to SoCal, where I was staying, and walked me through the setup over the phone. When I was done, I packed it up and sent it back with the return label they provided. Got a thanks-for-your-business email, and that was that. Seamless experience. Helpful folks, too. Even gave me tips on where to find some specialty gear they didn't carry. Wish they had a store in Cali. Definitely using them again for any future GPS needs. Cheers, fellas!"

"Local dive bar, but decent grub. Went last night, had plenty to choose from on the menu. Even got hot green tea, unexpected. Opted for sandwiches, subbed without issue. Waiter was solid, food was hot. Daily menu specials, lots of TVs with different channels, comfy booths, clean bathrooms, ample parking. Not bad."
"Chinese grub in Tempe? This joint's got it. Fresh veggies, flavorful chicken, just-right rice. My top pick for delivery. Period."

"Paninis? Great. Brewed teas? Cheap. Not a bar, more like a coffee joint. Staff's attentive. Good spot for studying or unwinding with a drink and some video poker after a long double shift. Oh, and Mariana the Barista? Top-notch. Friendly as hell. That's why I keep coming back."

"Phoenix Metro Retro, run by Heidi and Douglas, is a haven for mid century modern and Scandinavian furniture enthusiasts. Their collection is impeccable, a testament to their dedication to quality and craftsmanship. Heidi's silver smithing studio, tucked away in the back, is a treasure trove of unique pieces. Her work is exceptional, a reflection of her passion for the craft. The store is a must-visit for anyone seeking a truly special addition to their home. You'll leave with a smile on your face, and perhaps a newfound appreciation for the beauty of Scandinavian design." (487 tokens)
"Good dentist. Good people. Found 'em in Vegas. Moved there, needed dentist. Went to a few. Not good. Then found this one. Friendly folk. Real dentist. Not in it for the cash. Highly recommend."

"I've been to this joint four or five times, and let me tell you, the grub's been top-notch every single visit. Service? Aces, my friend. They treat you like family, and the kiddos get a freebie on the weekends. Can't complain about a thing. This place is the real deal, especially if you're lookin' for a good meal without breakin' the bank."

"Verily, in Las Vegas, there be a gelato shop most divine,
Whose wares doth rival those of Italy, in taste and design.
Creamy and smooth, with flavors so rich and bold,
It doth astound, and maketh my heart sing with joy untold.

I have visited this place many times, and ne'er been disappointed,
Save for when 'twas closed, and my craving went unfulfilled.
But when open, oh how grand, the gelato doth flow,
And with each bite, my senses doth take flight, aglow.

My choice, each time, doth be stracciatella and hazelnut,
A pairing most wondrous, and utterly nutty, to boot.
And though the prices be not cheap, 'tis worth every penny,
For the quality doth shine through, and the seats, they be plenty."
"Donuts? Best damn thing I ever had. Ate one and a half before I knew it. Chocolate, of course. Buttermilk, too. Died and gone to heaven. Need to find one near me."
"Panera, a place I love. Ashley Love and Luke, they make my day. Friendly staff, great food, and good vibes. Been coming for years."

"Thai food here is top-notch. Get the Northern Thai menu, it's unlike the usual stuff. 

Service is great, location is convenient even if you need a cab. 

Worth a visit."

"Love this joint. Entrance makes a statement, grub's top-notch, taste is off the charts, staff's friendly, and desserts? Deadly. Hit up the food and dessert stations ten times, had to stop myself from going back for more. Stuffed, but worth it. Easily the best buffet in town." Must try: Chocolate crepe, Creme Brulee, Prime rib, Beef brisket.

You step into the theatre, enveloped in the performance's atmosphere. Not a bad seat in the house, speakers in each chair, immersing you in the spectacle. An employee shares tidbits, gives a tour, hospitable. Locals get a nice discount. Enjoy the Cirque show, like it a lot.
"Friendly bunch, the staff. Made me feel right at home, like I was one of the locals. Big ol' studio, too. Could fit a whole mess of folks in there, easy."

"Family affair, top-notch. Jose, Sergio, Luis, Francisco, all blood kin. Reliable, informative, hardworking bunch. Beautiful job on carpet, tile work too. Cost-effective, no scams. A real pleasure. Highly recommend 'em."

"Flying coast to coast, hunger gnawed at our bellies. In a familiar ritual, I sought out pho.  \n\nOrdered the works. Broth, rich and free of excess oil, sang with flavor. Noodles, cooked just so. Tripe and tendon, plentiful."
"Bought a Dodge Charger from Greenlight Auto. Bill and Cody gave me top-notch service. Happy with my purchase and the way they treated me. Recommend 'em to anyone."

"Eggs, benedict, salmon, trout, dragonfruit, gravy, biscuits, prime rib, steak, lyonais, melon, strawberries, oatmeal, peaches, pecans, jook, pork, waffle, bacon, sausage, cheese, bread, tart, cake. All in one breakfast at Bellagio's buffet. Five stars, no doubt."

"Red Rock Harley Davidson, best dealership I've seen. Want a Harley? See Jack V. No pressure, just good sales. Need service? Matt F's your man. Knowledgeable, informative. If I needed another bike or service, Red Rock's my choice."

"China Palace in Charlotte, best Chinese joint around. Classy vibe, casual too. R&B tunes, TVs for the game, can't go wrong. Food's top-notch, sesame chicken reigns supreme. Pepsi products, egg rolls, duck sauce, all good. Service is A+, attentive as hell. Free sweet tea, just for waiting? Yeah, they do that. No wonder it's a top spot."
"Bosa, I love 'em. Better than Dunkin', that's for sure. Friendly staff, killer donuts, and a damn good price. Their breakfast game is on point too. Give 'em a shot over Dunkin' any day."
"This joint's alright. Been comin' here for years. Cooks are a hoot, servers are swell. Grub's good, price is right. Give it a shot."

"Methinks I find myself in fair Las Vegas thrice or four times a year, be it for work or holiday. And thus, I seek new culinary delights to savor. In September last, my wife and I didst partake in a feast most wondrous at Jaleo's hallowed halls. 'Twas a costly venture, yet worth every penny. The fare, the service, the grand kitchen, the potions - all didst conspire to create an evening most divine. The victuals, prepared with utmost care and presented with flair, didst leave us both in awe. We didst vow to return, to sample further the delectable dishes that didst grace the menu."
"Amazing joint. Lunch buffet or order by plate, doesn't matter. Sticky rice with mango, that's the ticket."

"Sis and I hit up this joint after spotting their ad at LVAC. Got ourselves some gel mani-pedis. Prices were decent. A tad pricier than regular polish, sure, but gels last longer and don't chip easy. Erin, the gal who worked on my nails, was real friendly and did a swell job. All in all, a top-notch experience. I'll be back."

"Hark, the new proprietors of this establishment,
With zeal and passion, have poured their hearts and souls,
Into refurbishing this place, long closed,
And now, 'tis reborn, with luster and gleams.
They've scrubbed and painted, renewed and cleaned,
Till all is bright and shining, like a dream.
The din within, may be a tad loud,
But worth the visit, as thou shalt avow.
TVs abound, a central screen,
Friendly staff, with service most serene.
I chanced upon a wrap of turkey,
With dried cranberries, a curious blend,
Yet after one bite, my doubts did flee,
For 'twas most delectable, a true delight.
Their menu boasts of sliders, apps, salads,
Sandwiches, pizza, and more, in abundance.
A children's menu, for young ones, doth please,
And late-night fare, a rarity, in these parts.
So, do give this place a chance,
For 'tis a gem, in this rustic dance."

"Place doesn't look like much from the outside, but glad I went in. Used to hit it up every weekend when I lived nearby. Perry serves up one of the best burgers in town, gets his meat fresh from Willy St Co-op daily. Damn good. Stick around for cheap drinks, catch a game on one of their many TVs. They got pool, ping pong, darts too. Ideal spot for grub and a show."
"Galaxy Note 2's busted screen? No problem. These guys delivered. Fast, cheap, and friendly. They knew their stuff, too. Tested everything right in front of me before I left. Worth every penny."

"Books, I love 'em. Don't care about tech, books are where it's at. Hope they never die out. \n\nThis store, Changing Hands, it's great. Spent over an hour there, just browsin' and found some real gems. Three new books, had to have 'em. Great atmosphere, too. If you're a bookworm like me, you'll dig this place."

"Pha worked her magic on my feet. Friendly, patient, and thorough. Made me feel like royalty. Yen handled the polish, a true artist. Not a single streak or smudge. Best mani/pedi I've ever had. My expectations exceeded."

"Dogs look happy, not stressed. Our small ones fit in the sink, but our big one might need a pro grooming. We grab Fromm dog food for the kids once a month. They love it. There's a deal where you get a free bag after buying 12. Nice! We also snag peanut butter cookies from the bakery. The dogs go wild for 'em. Check out their Facebook page and sign up for emails to get deals and coupons. Special events too."

"Cars make me jittery. Don't know squat 'bout what's cookin' under the hood. Need experts I can rely on, fellas I can trust. Gene's one of 'em. Straight shooter, that guy. Tell me what I need, no BS. If not, he'll say so. No fluff, just honesty. That's what you want in a mechanic. Check out Gene, you'll thank me."
"Cornish Pasty, a joint I frequent, serves grub that's hard to beat. Their Reuben pasty, in particular, hits the spot. It's a taste sensation, I tell ya."
"Food and service, top-notch. Left feeling damn satisfied. Will be back for more sushi. Calamari, highly recommend."

"O, what a wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes!
A place of plenty, where prices be low,
And food, so fine, doth please my taste,
In truth, I find myself in awe.

Each visit, I do try a new dish,
And ne'er have I been let down,
For here, they serve the finest fare,
Fit for a king, or so it seemeth.

Verily, I say, this place doth hold
A special place within my heart,
For it doth bring me joy and cheer,
And feedeth me with savory art.

So, here I shall return again,
To partake in their culinary delight,
For in this place, I find my peace,
And a full belly, to boot, by day and night."

"Pomo, a swell spot for our five-year anniversary. Went on a Saturday night, no wait. Service top-notch, owner brought us a freebie treat. Pizza, delish. Bruschetta, different, not bad, just unique. Ambiance, charming. Had a blast."

"Arrived early, around 9 am, due to an early morning flight. Checked in quickly and efficiently, no waiting for elevators. Room was spacious, with a sitting area, work desk, and large entry. Bathroom was big, with an enclosed toilet and oversized shower and tub. Bed was a bit too soft, but comfortable. Loved the automatic shades and blackout feature, perfect for sleeping in."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, yonder Starbucks be mine oft-frequented haunt, nigh unto my place of work, a scant block away.  They know me well, indeed, and call me 'Dutchess.'  Methinks 'tis a quaint conceit.  \n\nVerily, 'tis a bustling establishment, yet the queue doth move with celerity.  The staff, in sooth, are courteous and kindly, taking pause to converse with customers who crave a brief colloquy.  Kudos, then, to James, Derek, and all who toil within these walls.  Alas, I hear that when the new City Scape store doth open, this one shall close, and thus, its employees dispersed.  Some to the new locale, some to diverse other places.  Fie upon it, say I!"
"This joint serves up a ton of grub for a fair price. Their teriyaki chicken is top-notch, and the macaroni salad is the best I've had in these parts. Don't miss the crab puffs either."

"Good joint for records, guitars, amps, and all things music. Fair prices, too. Owner's a decent bloke, happy to help with any queries. They got old and new records, something for everyone. You'll find some fun when you step inside."

"Nona's Sweets in Charlotte's worth seek- ing out. Great find, but they're mov- ing up the street. Old Hollywood Video spot. Still, gotta check 'em out. Sweet tooth? They got you covered. Cupcakes, cookies, you name it. Catch 'em on Platinum Weddings next year. January, I think."

In sooth, I must confess,
Their food cart doth impress,
With curries of squash and mango,
And pineapple, so sweet and luscious,
A few sides, to make it complete,
Their service fast, the prices fair,
My new favorite, in Madison's street,
For curries, they do compare.

"A fair and pleasant gym, where one doth not await,
For machines or weights, in idle contemplation.
The staff, most kind and helpful, doth attend,
To needs of patrons, of all fitness gradations.

A varied clientele, doth frequent this place,
From youthful beginners, to the ripe and mature.
My spouse, doth partake in classes, with grace,
And yoga too, which doth her soul enrich.

Membership prices, most reasonable, doth seem,
And trainers, skilled and knowledgeable, doth gleam.
Though costly, they doth earn their worthy pay,
For service rendered, in each passing day.

This gym, a gem, among others, doth shine bright,
Worthy of praise, and recommendation, with delight."
"Cafe, busy street, New Town. Patio outside, cute tables inside. No wait, prime lunch hour, Xmas/New Years. Excellent service, tasty lunch, reasonable prices. Returning, trying dinner or tea."

"In fair Toyama, there be two sushi chefs most excellent,
Their names, Mo and Giro, do they bear with pride.
They'll remember thee by name, and offer dishes of delight,
If thou dost ask, they'll grant thee chefs choice, a wondrous sight.

Their rolls and sushi, fresh and delectable,
Do make my mouth to water, and my soul to sing.
Their wait staff, attentive and kind,
Doth make thy visit, a joyous find.

So, if thou art in search of sushi, most divine,
And service, that doth rival the heavens, do make haste,
To Toyama, where thou shalt find,
A culinary experience, that shall forever last."
"Embers? Fantastic. Rates high as any celeb chef joint on the strip. Delicious comfort grub. Left wanting more."

"Listen up, folks! This team's got the heart of a champion, and the soul of a fan favorite. They're in it to win, and to make you happy. Affordable tix, friendly players, and a Prez who's on the Twitter - what more do ya need? It's a night out at the ballpark, and these boys bring the heat. Support 'em, they support you. That's the Arizona Diamondbacks way."

"Walkin' with pals, we stumbled upon this joint. Music thumpin', bartenders slingin' drinks like pros. Met the owner, danced with some great folks. Outdoor patio, perfect for chowin' down and takin' it easy. Definitely stoppin' back next time I'm in town."

"Friendly staff, good grub, and a welcoming atmosphere. Not too fussy, just how I like it. Perfect spot for a family breakfast, everyone's happy. I'm gluten-free, not by choice, but places like this make me feel like I'm not missing out. Been going here regularly since we moved to QC a month ago. Keep up the good work!"

"Saturday night, the missus and I hit up Ruby Tuesday for an early Mother's Day feast. Despite the joint being packed, we scored a table pronto thanks to our reservation. Service was top-notch, even with the hectic crowd. My better half went for the seafood trio, which she devoured with gusto. I opted for the freshly blackened Mahi Mahi. Damn, it was tasty. We're suckers for Ruby Tuesday's grub, atmosphere, and hospitality. We keep comin' back 'cause we know we'll get a solid meal, fair price, and friendly service."

"Napoletana, where the grub's top-notch and the service is snappy. Thin crust pizzas, pasta, gnocchi - everything's a winner. Don't mind sharing a table with strangers, it's all part of the fun. Menu's got something for everyone, can't go wrong with any choice. Had the Chef pizza, mozzarella, black olives, tomatoes - delicious. And the best part? It's BYOW, baby! (SAQ's just a short walk away, so no need to settle for a mediocre bottle.) Cash only, but hey, that's no problem."
"Birthday party, big group. Private dining room. Food, top-notch. Pricey, sure, but worth it. Prawn Tempura, Chicken Pad Thai. Well-cooked, well-presented."
"Warm welcome at this joint. Friendly folks, too. Worked with K, knew his stuff, fixed my drowned iPhone like a pro. Crazy to go anywhere else. Great price, great people, great service. 10/10."

"Step into this cozy joint, tucked behind Fox and Hound Pub & Grill, and treat yourself to a Ginger Cinnamon Latte. I added caramel sauce and soy milk, over ice, in a large 32oz size - pure delight! The combo of flavors was incredible. Worth driving out of your way for, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Even tried it with a drive-up convenience. A great alternative to *bucks, with a richer taste and no burnt espresso aftertaste. Give it a shot, you won't regret it."

"O, how I do adore this place, where lattes flow like nectar from the gods! 'Tis a haven, a sanctuary, where one can quench their thirst and savor the rich flavors of coffee, steeped to perfection. Ah, but alas! My time here was cut short, for I did graduate, and now I find myself in distant lands, where lattes are but a pale imitation of what I once knew. Yet still, I dream of those heady days, when hot or iced, macchiato, berry tart, and sfogliatelle were my heart's desire. Farewell, sweet latte, may our paths cross again someday!"

"Food's great. Service too. Atmosphere's top-notch. Ninety-nine percent of the time, that is. Bar gets rowdy, loud. Skip it when it's packed. Dining area's nice, though. Get yourself a cheese crisp, cold beer. They do Mexican comfort food justice."

"I only come here for massages nowadays. It's a bit unconventional, but I'll explain. Wear something comfy, like yoga pants and a T-shirt. They'll soak your feet and give you a full massage. The price is incredible. Best part? You can call and get an appointment within the hour. Never had a problem getting in. They've got multiple therapists ready to work. Love this place. -Janet"

"This joint's got game. Buffet's on point, especially the baklava. Gyro's cooked just right, but the hummus is a bit too smooth. Not a deal-breaker though. Good value for the buck, they don't skimp on portions. I'm a fan. It's not mobbed like some other spots, so that's a plus. Recommend it for lunch, takeout, or dinner. Can't wait to go back."

"This spot's a gem. Always somethin' new, never fully explored in one trip. Worth the membership, especially at $75. Private exhibition nights? Hell yeah, $200 level's the way to go. Lectures, events, always somethin' cookin'. Like visitin' an old buddy, the permanent collection's got new stories to tell each time. Rotatin' exhibits, top-notch. Arcadia Farms, a real treat. Healthy grub, just the way I like it. Yeah, the Met's got its Egyptian temple and Dutch masters, but we got our own secret weapon: that funky black plastic thing and them twinklin' LEDs. Phoenix got culture, more than that expired yogurt in your fridge."

"Sketchy joint. Dingy, crusty, smelly. But hey, cheap tables. And that's what it's all about, right? That glorious, behemoth of a hot dog. Worth every penny. Inspires the ladies to get frisky, too. Five stars."

"Tonight, I'll hit the hay early.  Thanks to the killer dinner I had last night at Basil 'N Lime, I woke up at the crack of dawn craving the leftovers in my fridge.  That place is huge on flavor.  The veggies were sauted to perfection, the meat was tender like cotton candy.  The appetizer platter was a trip to heaven.  Spice level?  I treat it like dressing up - easier to add than take away, just like Coco Chanel said.  I ordered three entrees, and the flavors weren't hidden in the heat.  Can't wait to go back for more.  No booze served there, which is a good thing.  You wouldn't want to miss out on the aroma, taste, and presentation.  Highly recommend the Thai Iced Tea.  And, their Garlic Beef is just a phone call away.  Big props to Chef Moo and the crew."

"Best food in Vegas, hands down. Japanese cuisine, fresh and flavorful. Daily specials, tofu, duck, foie gras, pork cheek, shishito peppers. Uni, my favorite. Cold dish, egg, roe, uni. Make reservations, avoid busy times. Will miss this place when I leave Vegas."

"This joint was top-notch. Real warm and inviting, like a cozy cabin in the woods. Don't know why some folks are griping about it. It's gonna be our new go-to for dates and grub. Our server, a swell guy, got a $20 tip from us. That's rare, but he earned it."

"Bulgarian grub, always a treat. These cooks, top-notch. Brought back memories of the old country. Left feeling full, like a king. Service, impeccable. Don't come here for a quick bite, they make it fresh, just for you. Great spot for sharing plates with pals."

"Laughed my ass off from start to finish. Don't expect Ka-level production, folks. It's a small, intimate show with charm. Go in with a positive attitude and you'll have a blast. The Twigglers, those hilarious dancers pretending to be short and singing like the Village People, had me in stitches. The host is top-notch, too, with some impressive tricks up his sleeve. Like when he juggled bowling balls and did a rope stunt over the audience. Damn entertaining. Get your local discount and enjoy the show. Not as raunchy as Absinthe, but still fun for adults and kids alike."

"Four years on campus, no place did eyebrow waxing right. Until today. Mary Kay listened, gave me a wax based on my face shape. Happy with the results, I'll be back. Prices fair for her services. Check it out."

"I'm not one to hand out five-star reviews to dentists like candy. In fact, I'd give most dentists negative stars if I could. But then I met Dr. Wyatt and his team. They're different. Friendly, helpful, and genuinely concerned about your well-being. No lectures, no anger, just a sincere desire to see you smile. And let's not forget the movie theme. It's a bit corny, but it's a nice touch. And who knows, maybe you'll even get to watch a flick while you're in the chair. Not bad for a dentist's office, eh? Oh, and ladies, you might find Dr. Wyatt's good looks to be an added bonus."

"This joint's a real love-it-or-hate-it spot. Me? I love it. It's tiny, so wherever you stand, you got a great view. Sound system's solid too. Drinks are fair game, strong and cheap. Grab a slice of that pre-show pizza, it's damn good for three bucks."

"Methinks this place doth hold a special place within my heart,
A haven for my taste buds, a culinary work of art.
In Montreal, there be none better, nay, not even a contest,
For Bangkok's Thai dishes, they do excel, and put all others to the test.

I've tried elsewhere, a veggie Pad Thai, I must confess,
But always find myself comparing it to Bangkok's finest,
And wishing I were seated in that humble food court,
Enjoying the authentic flavors, without a single thought.

So here I shall remain, and savor each delight,
For Bangkok's Thai cuisine, it doth take flight,
In Montreal, it reigns supreme, a true delight,
Bangkok's Thai, a culinary joy, a pure delight."

"Marry, what wondrous service doth this company provide!
Their knowledge and skill, a sight to behold, doth shine so bright.
I'd give them ten stars, anon, didst such a thing exist.
Highly recommend, good sirs and madams, do give them a try."

"A wondrous sight, this eatery fair,
My sister and I didst share a treat,
Two desserts, both sweet and rare,
Strawberry snow fluff, peanut butter toast, so neat.
The staff, kind and accommodating,
Didst grant our wish, with mango and lychee adding,
To the snow fluff, oh what a delight!
The dining room, a cozy space,
With board games, for a merry time and pace.
And lo, upon Yelp, a discount of fifteen percent,
A bonus, for our pleasure, most excellent!"

"In from Texas, stumbled on WhereUBean. Nice surprise. Clean joint, comfy, friendly staff. My picky buddy approved of the joe, and their chai's a winner. We'll be back if we're ever in Phoenix again."

"Tried the lengua taco today. Damn good. Don't know what Gabriel's talking about, no fried fish here. Just oysters and cocktails. Cashier speaks English, runs the drive-thru too. Not many white folks, but that's okay. Brought my 72-year-old mom for tacos and shrimp. Watermelon juice, tears, it was that good. Can't find any flaws."

"Been tracking Pinkberry for a bit. Been eager for their East coast move. Heard they opened up in Charlotte, near Southpark. Had to give it a shot. First time, great experience. Girls at the counter, peppy, friendly, helpful. Sampled a few, went with coconut yogurt, raspberry, pineapple, chocolate crisps, yogurt chips. Damn good. Can't wait to do it again."

"Vegas restaurants? Pretty damn good, all of 'em. But N9NE? It's on another level. Atmosphere's top-notch, menu's simple but focused on what they do best. Smores? Fresh seafood platter? You bet your ass they're serving up the good stuff. N9NE does it better, that's for sure."

"Xavier, a top-notch raw food chef, spreads the gospel of fresh, tasty grub. His joint's menu's online, so check it out before stopping by. If you're feeling spontaneous, grab something quick from the deli case. He's got a smoothie program too, perfect for those looking to boost their nutrition game. Try "The Works," a veggie-packed blend that's pure refreshment."

"When at my downtown office, I do frequent Simpatico,
For their prices be fair and service most courteous,
Inside the old Alcoa building, they may lack
The bustle of Starbucks or Crazy Mocha's attack,
But their brew be of high quality, a true delight,
A hidden gem amidst the city's busy throng,
And, as a bonus, free internet doth abound,
In the lobby, for all who wouldst connect and roam."

"Breakfast review: Verandah Vegas hits it outta the park. Superb setting, killer huevos rancheros. Relaxed, fresh atmosphere - a nice change from the usual Vegas chaos. Coffee? Perfect. Service? Good, not too pushy. Main event? Huevos rancheros that'll make your taste buds do the tango. Presentation on point, flavors mixed like a pro. I eat out a lot, but this dish stands out. Up there with the likes of The Modern's duck, Ryutenmon's cashew chicken, and Kaygetsu's sushi. Well done, Verandah Vegas. You've set the bar high."
"Clean, quiet hotel. Helpful staff. Perfect location - close to the strip, a mile from the convention center. Unbeatable price."

"Hark! To this place didst I repair for happy hour,
And in the cantina, straightway didst sit.
Chips and salsa, they didst bring with haste,
And were devoured with glee, I must confess.
Our server, kind and diligent, didst attend,
To our each need, with promptness and with care.
The meal I chose, a bit o'ercooked, didst seem,
But all else, most delectable, didst appear.
And happy hour prices, most fair and bright,
Didst make our evening, a true delight."

"Pizza joint's got game. Solid pies, good beer and wine selection. Chinedu, the man, helped me out with a bottle. Joe, the regional boss, gave me a nod. They know their stuff. Traditional, white, and pesto options - it's my new go-to spot. Close to work too. Two thumbs up."

"Airport grub's usually a crapshoot, but Beaudevin's the real deal. Don't know where it came from, but it's like the Airport Gods smiled upon us weary travelers. Fancy? Damn straight. Best I've had at any airport. Bagel with all the fixin's? Fresh as hell. Salmon? Top-notch. Mind blown. If you're passing through Charlotte, grab a bite. Heard they got joints in Chi-town and Miami too. Happy trails, folks."
"Five weekends straight, I've been here. Last weekend, I skipped town. But I'll be back, craving that hot bowl of tonkotsu-shoyu ramen, pork, egg, and seaweed. See you soon, Monta."

"Pedicures usually leave me underwhelmed. Not today. Mai delivered the most exceptional pedicure and massage I've ever had. Standard pedicure, but the massage was prolonged, firm yet gentle, and utterly relaxing. Fantastic establishment! A mere 25 minutes from my abode, with numerous alternatives in between, but I'll gladly make the trip regularly. Absolutely worth it."
"Pizza? Killer. Kale pizza, off-menu but worth asking. Turkey lasagna, my go-to. Flavored margaritas? Surprisingly good. Don't even like 'em, but they're aces here."

"Client raved about this joint, so I checked it out. Noah, our server, gave us top-notch service. Margaritas, guacamole, fish tacos - all top-shelf. Presentation was a work of art. Finished with pumpkin bread pudding and chocolate dessert. Unreal. If I lived closer, I'd be here every day for that bread pudding. Great spot for food, atmosphere, and service. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"Hark, what news is this? A breakfast spot most fair,
Whose portions grand, and prices most rare.
A feast for two, the chicken and waffles doth make,
And biscuits with gravy, a meal most hearty and fake.

A large party we were, yet service most fine,
Despite the crowd, our needs he did divine.
Scott, a young man with fiery locks so bright,
Didst attend to us with care and great might.
Even the next day, he didst check on our plight,
Though not in his section, his kindness didst take flight.

In Vegas, a must-visit place, this breakfast spot doth be,
So heed my words, and dine with glee."

"This joint's got some serious grub. Service is top-notch, food's even better. Simple, but damn good. 

I've had my fair share of the menu, and let me tell you, the pork tenderloins are the real deal. Level's usually a 5, and it's not too shabby. 

They've also got some nice specials and sides. Keep an eye out for 'em, they're worth trying."

"Sex On The Beach? Forget it, kid. This joint's the real deal. Classy drinks, quirky vibes, and a crew that knows their stuff. Been around long enough to know what they're doing, too. Tea cups are trendy, but these folks are no newbies. Order something off the menu, or keep it simple with a mojito or old fashioned. Just don't forget to pace yourself, or you'll be carried out the back door. It's a small spot, so grab a ledge and enjoy the ride."
"Best burger I ever had. Friendly service. Elegant joint. Reasonable prices."

"Methought this place didst charm mine eyes,
Our son, Andrew, and his love, Sara, didst guide us hither,
To partake of breakfast most divine, in Wisconson's heart.
Their victuals, oh so tasty, didst delight mine senses,
And I do pray, that fortune may smile upon me,
To revisit this fair place, ere my life doth cease.
Verily, 'twas worth the wait, to gain entrance hither,
For I didst savor strawberry pancakes, with marscapone cheese,
And now, in slumber, shall I dream of them, in sweet reverie."
"Fixed my eye, good as new. Staff's top-notch. You're free to go, compliments of Maricopa County Jail."

"Methinks 'twas a feast most wondrous and fair,
A group of six, with victuals most rare.
Four of us, with hearts full of cheer,
Didst savor the trio of Elk, Beef, and Bison, my dear.
I, myself, didst opt for the flat iron delight,
And found it to be quite fantastic, in truth and in sight.
But alack, the beet salad, so light and so sparse,
Didst leave me in want, for more beets, I didst not dispense.
The cabbage, a nondescript thing, didst not impress,
But the beets, oh the beets, they were truly divine, I must confess.

A bottle of wine, a gift for the birthday lad,
We didst bring, with hopes to make him glad.
But alas, the law, it doth prohibit,
Such drink, in such place, it doth not permit.
A curious rule, yet we didst abide,
For the meal, it was worth it, we didst decide.

So here's to the cook, and the feast we didst share,
A night to remember, beyond compare.
Highly recommended, this place doth be,
For a meal most excellent, and a time most merry."

"Vegas, always a good time. Got my gun on, feelin' fine. Hit up the Gun Store, best place in town. Hubby tried out an AK, few other pieces too. Prices are sweet, packages come with a free tee. Taxi from the strip'll cost ya, but it's worth it. Parking's easy, staff's on point. Give 'em a visit, won't regret it."

"Good prices, wide variety, and a clean store. My new go-to for international and Asian goods in Madison. Close to downtown and easily accessible, even for out-of-towners. The strip mall and library nearby have been spruced up too. Looks sharp."

"Verdun's got a new BBQ joint, Black Strap, and it's a real treat. It's informal, like BBQ should be, with big ol' picnic tables and friendly service. And the grub? It's the real deal, none of that sugary sauce or half-hearted attempts at faux BBQ. They got it right, from the smokin' to the rubbin'. Prices are fair too, and folks are lining up every night. Hope they stick around, for the love of God."
"Vegas, always leaving, but this place stays with me. Crepe craze, can't shake it. Search far and wide, never find better than here. My spot, my haven, my crepe paradise."
"Ticket line's long, but it moves quick. Like how they got different tickets for different things. Makes it faster. Fridays are wild. They got a TV too."

"Weekly, my wife and I hit this joint. Meatball Pho and BBQ pork Bahn Mi, that's our order. Good grub, cheap and fast. Staff's friendly, not over-the-top, but they get the job done. Da Vang's become a top spot for me in Phoenix."
I stumbled into the cafe at dawn, bleary-eyed and famished. Omar, my waiter, recommended the Lobster Eggs Benedict. I'm glad I listened. It was the best breakfast I've ever had. Period.
"Sliders, ham and cheese croquettes, stuffed dates - all good. Mojitos, too. Pitcher if you want. Fun, delicious joint. Prices, can't beat 'em. Everyone I've brought here, loved it. More than a few."

"We played eenie meenie minne mhhhoo and picked Butters for breakfast. It was a bit of a hike, but worth it. Rafael, our server, was cool and collected. He gave us the lowdown on the menu and took our order. Food arrived quick, within 10 minutes, and we dug in. I had the chorizo omelette, cheddar grits, and pancakes. First time having chorizo, it was a bit oily, but the veggies and eggs balanced it out. The grits were delicious, my boyfriend devoured them. The pancakes, fluffy and buttery, melted in my mouth - the best I've ever had. I cleaned my plate and felt sad we won't be back to Butters often since we don't live nearby."

"Treated the husband to a staycation this weekend. Staff was top-notch, from the golf cart driver who picked us up at the parking lot to the front desk crew who made check-in a breeze. Concierge was helpful, gave me the lowdown on transportation options into Old Town without needing to worry about drinks and driving. Their towncars will drop you off anywhere in Old Town for $21. Rooms were stylish, loved the modern and sleek vibe. Didn't get to hit the Release Pool Party due to rain, but it's free for hotel guests. Desert views from our room were nice too."

"Place is solid. Friendly staff, not just polite. Sitting in lobby, working, guy brings me cookies. Clean digs, good chow, safe, business center for printing, gym's decent, laundry's convenient. Even the kitty approves. House is busted, but this joint's making things better."

"Next time in Montreal, I knew I'd finally try Garde Manger. First visit, exceeded hopes. Reserved spot at the bar, perfect for two or three. Must-try: Lobster Poutine, maybe Chuck Hughes' best dish. Just enough fishiness in the gravy, curds, and frites. Also had Albacore Tuna and Crackling Pork, equally impressive. Service and ambiance, top-notch. Can't wait to return, try more."
"Good grub. Fair prices. Friendly folks. Needed a fast lunch joint, found it here. Be back."
"Good service, always. Got what I needed, five watches today. Usually go elsewhere for batteries, cheaper maybe, but they close early. This place, open late, weekends too. Great news."

My spouse and I, we've got a slip here,
Members we be, of this marina so dear.
The atmosphere, laid back it doth be,
A place where we find serenity.

The only flaw, a long walkway doth lie,
If shuttle service doth get busy, alas!
But fear not, call boxes there be, at hand,
For golf cart shuttles, quick and grand.

As members, private showers we doth have,
And bathrooms too, for our convenience, brave.
A BBQ area, shaded 'tis, with tables and chairs,
Washers and dryers, and power, with nary a care.
Two free bags of ice, daily we doth receive,
A kind gesture, from those who doth believe.

The staff, friendly and helpful they be,
Like family, welcoming us, so warm and free.
No theft or issues, we've encountered, not one,
A peaceful place, save for party weekends, when fun's begun.

Pleasant Harbor, we recommend, with glee,
Over Scorpion Bay, where tension doth be.
More relaxed, and personable, we doth find,
A haven, where our spirits doth entwine.

"Body Heat sparked my fitness journey like no other gym. I've taken up running, cross-training, and fallen hard for fitness. Their classes are top-notch, and yeah, they're hot. The place is spotless, but sometimes I wish they'd step up the sanitizing game. That's just me, though. \n\nNever thought I'd dig yoga, but now it's the highlight of my day. Also into the hot Pilates, kettlebells, and bootcamp sessions. Their candlelit class on Fridays is the perfect way to unwind after a rough week. Body Heat's become my haven."

"Cibo's got some swell reviews, so I'll keep mine brief. It's a hip joint with quality grub and a cool crowd. Their bruschetta's a real winner, check out the pic. Make sure to save room for their crepe desserts."

"A feast most wondrous, with mirth and glee,
Doth this establishment provide for thee.
The menu, diverse, doth cater to all,
With flavors rich, and savory to enthrall.
I have partaken of their offerings fair,
And found them good, beyond compare.
But chief among them, doth my heart adore,
The rice pudding sweet, with Turkish brew,
In the hookah lounge, a place to tarry,
With friends, and laughter, doth ensue, so merry."

"Hark, good sir or madam, seek thou for a dry cleaner of renown?
'Tis here, within this place, that thou shalt find the best,
Their work, a marvel of precision, doth surpass the rest.
A convenient pick-up service, they do provide,
And their representatives, in manner, are most kind.
I wouldst recommend them, to any who doth seek,
A dry cleaner of quality, with service meek."

"Been coming here for 15 years. Marjorie's the best, worth her weight in gold. Fussy about my stylist, like I am with my dentist or doc. Travel a lot, always get compliments. This is the only place for me."

"Best damn prosciutto sandwich I've had, hands down. Went for lunch, had a great meal. Their bread, light and crispy, worth every penny. Friendly staff, quick service. Valet for your car, nice touch. Clean as a whistle. Recommend it, no doubt. Might make it my regular Friday spot."
"Vegas newbie, picked spot for convenience. Great surprise! Pizza to-go, hot, fresh, perfect thin crust. Eat here again, definitely."

"Got my brows and lip done. Wow, what a place! Professional, modern. My eyebrows are weird, always a challenge. Esthetician (forgot her name) did 'em perfect. Showed me how to fill 'em in too. Good price for a great job."

"Arizona Charlie's buffet, a feast fit for kings. Stuffing, mashed potatoes, desserts - all top-notch. No cleanup, just pure indulgence. My gratitude to those who worked tirelessly to make this holiday meal possible."
"Food's great, homemade mostly. Friendly bartenders, rotating beers, happy hour deals. Good vibe. Recommend for grub and drinks."

"Hark, fair sir! In search of laminate flooring of high quality,  
I chanced upon TLC, where Ramin's expertise did shine so brightly.  
He showed me the ways of the wood, with honesty and knowledge true,  
And my mother, who wished for hardwood, he did gently dissuade anew.  
The dry climate of Las Vegas, he said, would not be kind  
To hardwood floors, and thus, we chose the laminate design.  
A goodly deal he gave us, 1.89 per square foot,  
For Shaw's fine laminate, with padding, a most generous thought.  
Chinese-made laminate, or Home Depot's wares, we did eschew,  
For TLC's quality products, at a price most fair and true.  
So here's to thee, good Ramin, for thy help most dear,  
My floors, they do delight, and bring joy to mine ear."

"Dined at Al Hamra with friends. Great meal and service. Mario, our waiter, knew his stuff and was friendly. Orders came quick and everything was top-notch. Had the samosas and onion paneer to start. For mains, we had the shrimp vindaloo, chicken with coconut, chicken curry, and eggplant. All were cooked to perfection and had just the right amount of spice. Even the aloo naan and mango chutney were on point. Been a while since we've been to Al Hamra, but we'll be back."

"Visited my 80yo friend at the rehab center for a month. Place is top-notch, better than TLC in Henderson. Staff's always friendly, asks about my friend's needs, and actually listens. They don't give up on the residents, helps 'em progress. Mike in P.T. and Jackie in nurse aides, they're standouts. Kudos to 'em. Rehab centers could learn from this place."

"I'm no golf pro, but I sure love the game. This course is great for both beginners and seasoned players. Wide open fairways, few houses in the way, unless you really mess up. Water hazards provide a good challenge. Greens were decent, not perfect, but for under 50 bucks a round, it's hard to beat. \n\nWhat sets this course apart is the staff and service. Friendly folks at the clubhouse, efficient food service, and starters doing their job, keeping things moving. My green fee came with draft beers and grub, didn't expect that. And unlimited range balls? Best Saturday of golf I've had in Vegas."

"Found my go-to groomer! Top-notch service, no complaints. Always book with Addie. She's got skill and passion. My Yorkies look better than ever. First-time perfect cut for my Yorkie-Poo. No comparison to my previous groomer. Highly recommend this local gem. Get in and out quick, even for a trim."

"I get my nails done here and there, when I feel like it. But this place has the newest acrylics - shimmer-sparkles-and colors, oh my! I keep in touch with my girl, she does my nails, and she makes them look like shiny jewels. The price is fair for the precision and neatness of the work. Around $35/40, depending. I usually go for a shimmer acrylic on the tips, then fill later. No second thoughts, it's worth the wait. I've recommended many friends here. Nails never pop off, I ask to soak or drill down to take off."
"Line? Don't fear it. Worth it, kid. Hot links, fantastic. Green beans, done right. Even a veggie-hater'll eat 'em."

"HTC, top-notch.  Anchor by Marilyn, swift and painless.  Two weeks pass, my paranoia grows.  Jon, superb, puts mind at ease.  Anthony, kind, informative, a pleasure.  All three, excellent.  Will not go elsewhere.  Safe, educated hands."
"Burgers, damn good. Fresh, like the morning dew. Barkeep, friendly as a mountain stream. Atmosphere, cozy as a hunting cabin. Managers, welcoming as a warm fire. Beer and burgers, worth the hike."

"Hired Skyler and the Myriad crew for their real estate advisory services. Best decision I ever made. They're young, smart, and all about results. Helped me make sense of the chaos that is real estate investing. Taught me how to read the numbers, understand the risks and rewards. Now I'm making passive income every month. Don't hesitate, use them today. You won't regret it."

"Pricey, but worth it. Scottsdale's top spot. Pool's great, service too. Mountain views? Tough luck. Closer to pool, better. Nice casitas, sliding doors. Pretty grounds. Use their car service for hikes. Worth it."

"We hit this joint after a round of golf and dug it big time. Phoenix folks, we wished it was closer to home. Service was top-notch, food was piping hot and tasty, prices were swell. We'll be back next time we're in town."

"Dinner buffet's price, $37 a head, Friday nights, 5 PM, no wait.  

Our waitress, top-notch! Brother liked the tea, she gave him the details, distributor, website, product name, a papaya tea by China Mist. They're testing it out, might not stick around, but folks love it. 

New faves at Wynn Buffet: Chilean seabass, spicy tuna hand rolls, buffalo salad, marinated mushrooms, key lime pie."

"A fortnight past, my friend and I didst visit this establishment,
After work, to partake in some refreshment.
Not a devotee of coffee, I didst opt for tea,
A chai latte, to be precise, hoping to see
A fancy design upon its surface, a work of art,
But alas, 'twas not to be, forsooth, my heart didst sink.
The barista, a kind soul, didst explain,
That chai lattes do not receive such embellishments,
A disappointment, indeed, yet still,
The ambiance, charming, and the cookies, divine,
A pricey venture, mayhap, but one worth taking,
For the pleasure of it all, my spirits didst lift."

"O, Hotel Chocolat, thou art a wondrous place,
Where chocolate dreams doth come to life, in grace.
I didst dream of thee, fair shop, last night,
And now, my heart doth sing with joy and delight.

Thy staff, so friendly, welcoming, and full of cheer,
Didst treat me to a feast of chocolate, my dear.
Their banter, merry and bright, didst make me smile,
As they showed me their wares, worth every mile.

Their cocoa-coffee shop, a haven of bliss,
Didst serve me a machiato, a drink divine.
And the cocoa meat rub, oh how grand,
Doth make my taste buds dance, hand in hand.

This place, a palace of chocolate, doth reign supreme,
A must-visit destination, for all to gleam.
So here's to thee, Hotel Chocolat, my sweet,
Forever in my heart, a chocolate treat."
"Red Lobster, no. That's why I go. Clean can, friendly gals, hot dudes, tasty BBQ, happy hour, top-notch. Live bands, meh. Still love it."
"Lettuce wraps, egg rolls - all amazing. Passion tea, a delight. Service, good. Food, good. Times, good. Not as busy as other locations, perfect for a Friday night."
