"Meg's been workin' her magic on me for near a year now. Lymphatic drainage, deep tissue - you name it, she's done it. And let me tell ya, every time I leave her table, I feel like a new man. She takes the time to get to know her clients, makes the experience personal. If you're lookin' for a real deal masseuse, someone who loves what they do, then Meg's your gal. I'd recommend her to anyone."

"This joint was top-notch. Found it through Yelp, brought the fam for dinner. Owner's pop welcomed us, served chips and salsa pronto. Food was off the charts - had the CC Sizzle sopaipilla style, devoured every bite, left me in a food coma, but worth it. Rest of the crew loved their meals too. Cook came out, gave us warm sopaipillas drenched in cinnamon, on the house. Class act. Waiter was cool, didn't even want a tip, but we insisted. He went the extra mile, made sure we were happy. This place is a gem. Don't miss it."
"Polished, never been. Waxing, not my thing. Hayley, fabulous. Quick, professional. Six years, loyal customer. Cash or check, tips only."

"No gripes here. Gourmet coffee and tea joint, Euro-style. Fresh brews or beans and loose leaves in bulk, starting at a quarter pound. Packed with coffee and tea fixings, sweets, and chocolates. Decent prices. Helpful, knowledgeable crew. 

Usually grab coffee, but last time I went for green tea and wanted to mix it up. Guy serving me didn't know much about tea, so he did something cool: found someone who did! 

Tip: Hit it on Thursday afternoons when Market Square's farmer's market swings into action. Snag some fresh produce and pierogies while you're at it."
"Paymon's, love it. Best cold cucumber soup in summer. Damn good chicken curry, hummus, dolmas, lentil soup too. Happy hour tomorrow, can't wait."

In this place, I find much mirth and cheer,
With Phong, the owner, and his dear.
Their hospitality doth know no bounds,
Their tales, a joy to hear, resound.
A fine selection of brews they keep,
And for us, Phong didst special seek.
The prices, fair and reasonable,
For all our needs, he doth provide, most able.

"Good Fellas Grill, eh? Healthy-ish, too. Owner splits the plate, hummus and baba ganoush - damn good. Better the next day, even. Lentil soup, meh. Potato soup, now that's the stuff. Wife had wraps, I had the 2 meat combo. Bam, pow, crunch! Meat, chicken, rice, onions, tomato - a real treat. Lives up to the hype. We'll be back."

"Oregano's, oh man, I can't get enough. Just a short drive from my place, it's a regular haunt of mine. Their grub? Top-notch. Salads, sandwiches, apps, pizzas - you name it, they nail it. And don't even get me started on the pizookie. It's like a party in your mouth. \n\nBut let's keep it real, the joint can get loud. Packed tight with tables, people, and knick-knacks, it's not the spot for a quiet night out. But hey, if you're feeling social, it's a blast. Just don't expect too much elbow room."

"Tourist trap, but worth it. Shops, bars, nightlife, art museums - something for everyone. Parking's a bitch, valet's your best bet. History buffs will love Old Town, plenty of museums and trolley rides. Foodies will have a field day, lots of options after a long day of shopping. Don't miss the Farmers Market on Saturdays, local vendors selling fresh produce and more."

"Vegas, last minute. Cut, based on reviews. Friendly service, top-notch. Decor, simple. Steak, excellent. Bread, plentiful. Porterhouse, best I've had. Mac and cheese, cauliflower, delicious. Chocolate souffl, huge and yummy. Great meal, great atmosphere, great service. Right choice, Cut."
"Flicks in a cozy joint, typical program cinema with the usual crowd. Sometimes you gotta watch movies with only 18 other folks in the room. That's what makes the Schauburg the perfect spot."
"Leavin' town? Need a spot for yer pup? Doolittle's Doghouse is top-notch. They got real homes, not cages or runs, where your furry friend'sll get all the love they need. Vet-approved, I reckon."

"Thou hast no need to utter many words, fair sir,
For yonder reviews, in multitude profuse,
Do sing thy praises loud and clear,
Average of four and half stars, doth declare.

Weary from a night of revelry,
I could not join my friends, in jollity,
But they, in kindness, didst bring me cheer,
An Earl's Club, fresh and warm, didst appear.

A steal, indeed, at six dollars, 'tis,
Compared to other costly dishes, in this town,
And open, too, through day and night,
This place, a true delight, doth shine so bright."

"Yesterday, I had the beach house burger. Best hamburger I've ever had. Came back today for lunch and had the br\u00fbl\u00e9e burger. New best burger. Didn't know a hamburger could do this to my taste buds."
"Anna nailed it. I'll just add that their floral arrangements are uniquely modern and bespoke. See for yourself."

"Meaghan's been doing my hair for damn near two decades. She's good. Real good. I've followed her around the city, never minding the distance. She's got an eye for detail, knows how to blend those highlights just right. And her cuts? Always perfect. You should give her a shot. I promise you'll be smitten. Plus, her prices are fair. I always look forward to seeing her."

"Hark, what bustling scene doth greet mine eyes!
A tavern full of life, where revelers rise.
In this fair city of Las Vegas, 'tis a place
Where merriment doth reign, and joy doth embrace.

At eleventh hour, or when night doth fall,
'Tis always thus, a throng that doth enthrall.
A sign, good sir, that here they serve the best,
For crowds do gather, as if by some spell's behest.

Two dishes, then, didst I order with haste:
Tacos al pastor, and carne asada, in taste.
Oh, how they didst delight mine appetite!
Their flavors, rich, like a sweet, sweet delight.

In sooth, my friend, this tavern doth excel,
With tacos, the best in all of Vegas, I'll tell.
So, if thou find thyself in this fair town,
Do step inside, and their tacos, do try, ere thou frown."
"Tucked away, this joint's a gem. Creamy broccoli soup, damn good. Mediterranean wrap, spot on. Adding it to my list, for sure."

"Advice for De Lucas: arrive early, especially on weekends. We showed up at 8 am on a Saturday, waited five minutes. Did some shopping, returned at 10, and the line was huge. Food was fresh, delicious. Mancini bread, freshly made toast and French toast. Great pancakes too. Fast, friendly service despite the crowd. Arrive early, make a morning of it, like we did."

"Real winner, this breakfast burrito. Godly, I tell ya. Special salsa, too. Mexican grandma in the kitchen, cookin' it up. Urban decor, indoor. Love it. Had to wait, but that's a good sign. They're cookin' from scratch. Chefs gotta take their time, put love into it. First bite, ahh, heavenly. So happy I found this place. Gonna buy their El Sol salsa. Traditional Mexican bakery, guaranteed authentic. Downtown Chandler, cute and historic. Other Mexican joints, delicious, no doubt. Lookin' forward to goin' back."

"Vegas is a food town, Aria's got game. Julian Serrano, best in the house, one of my faves in Vegas. Service? Top-notch, fast. Party of 14? No worries, they know what they're doing. Tapas, great for big groups. Pace of dishes, perfect. Waiter, cool, splits the bill. Food? Excellent! Calamari, best I've had. Salmon, risotto, croquetas, peppers, papas bravas. Can't go wrong here."

"Red curry, best I've had in ages. Spicy too, if you ask nice. Lunch special, $7.50, good deal. Soup, wontons, egg roll, entree, rice. Orange chicken, good too, but not as good as red curry. Sweet and sour sauce, not my cup of tea. Prefer sweet chili sauce."
"Good folks at this shop. Had a flat fixed today, no fuss, no muss. Budget-friendly options, no upselling. Staff's on the ball, knows their stuff. Recommend 'em to anyone in the area."

"Windsor, best restaurant in Phoenix. We loved Postinos, so we were stoked when Windsor opened. Everything we've ordered has been fantastic. Their cocktails are perfectly balanced. Great beer selection, always something new. Top-notch service. If you're looking for homestyle cooking and good service, Windsor's your place."

"Went to Rochelle's Salon once before. Hated the girl who did my hair. Took a year to get the guts to go back. Only went for a blowout and style. Kept going back like that for a bit. They referred me to Abel. He did a great job. Eventually, I started trusting him with my hair. Now I'm a loyal customer. Abel's great. Creative. Easy-going. Accommodating, especially since my appointments are always last-minute. He's also funny as hell. Gives terrible dating advice, but it's entertaining to hear his stories as a straight hairstylist. Scandalous. Liz at the front desk has a great memory, too."

"Dropped into this gym on a work trip. Staff was real friendly, like they wanted me there. Facilities were top-notch, lots of space. Workout was tough, just how I like it. Can't say enough good things 'bout this place. If you're thinkin' 'bout joinin' a cross-fit gym, this one's the way to go."
"Customer service, top-notch. Scheduled pick-up at the airport, pre-Thanksgiving. Driver ran late, they kept me updated, even refunded my fare in another cab."

"Food here? Top-notch. Been here thrice in recent weeks, and each visit, the grub's been on point. Salads with kale, not just lettuce, for a healthy twist. Chicken wings, fried to a golden crisp. Turkeygiving Burger, giving the Bobbie a run for its money. And don't even get me started on the Chicken N Waffles. Absolutely divine. We'll be back, and soon."
"Good work from Van's Cleaners. Friendly fella, too. Take our duds there for a scrub and a tweak. Never let us down."
"Sneaker shopping? This joint's got 'em. Funky, fresh, and fly. You'll find what you need, no doubt. I'll be back, that's for sure."

"Went there today, first time. Impressed. Real nice inside, lots of space. Couches, tables, side room with big tables for work. Decor's nice too. Menu's great. Friend had tea, panini, both good. I had side salad, excellent for $4.99. Free donuts with purchase, promoting opening. Menu's got salads, sandwiches, paninis, desserts, coffee, espresso. Definitely going back. Great location, nice inside, good food."
"We got a tip on this joint from a pal and it didn't let us down. Good chow, nice folks, and prices that won't break the bank. Been back three times and counting."

"Hark, good sir! For many a year, I've employed thy services,
And found thee to be most diligent and precise.
Thy crew, with haste, doth clean my carriage and steeds,
E'en at the eleventh hour, when time doth flee.
Their work, I must confess, doth leave me in awe,
For never have I seen such sparkling vehicles,
As those which thou and thine hath cleansed,
In such a timely manner, with nary a sieve.
So here's to thee, good sir, and all thy crew,
May Fortune smile upon thee, ever anew."
"Vegas, February. Three visits in one week. Great grub, top-notch service, and a lively atmosphere at The Avalon. Goat cheese, please. Don't miss the Berry Lemonade. Keep it up, and I'll be back."
"In, three minutes, new battery. Better than the mall."

"Rebel Auto, oh boy. Didn't know what good service was till I got here. Pro, kind, and that arcade? Legit. Price is right, too. Fast work on the oil change, and no pressure. Glad I found this place. Customer for life."

"Went to Sakana for lunch today, needed a break from work. Place was hopping, walked in, got a big hello and smile. Had the Savanna lunch special, $9.99, came with miso soup, nice salad, six pieces of fish, six rolls, and a smoked salmon tempura roll. Good stuff, plenty of food."

"Skoti's got the hookups in Vegas. No lines, no hassle. He's the man to know. I've used him before, and my friends have too. We all agree - best time of our lives. Can't imagine doing Vegas without him. He knows the best spots, the best tables. And his restaurant recs? On point. Highly recommend."

"Verily, most wondrous donuts, though somewhat hard to seek, yet worth the search. Taste their cronuts, and their apple fritters, I pray thee. Thy spouse doth love the chocolate chip rolls, methinks. And should's thou need a cake for celebration, they shall make it for thee. We have had them fashion birthday and anniversary cakes afore, and lo, they were most excellent!"

"Place is top-notch. Easy location, free valet, no fuss. Food's great. Had a Saturday brunch with some pals. Comfy couches for our group of seven. Server suggested a bottle of mimosas, good call. Prosciutto and Brie panini, outstanding. Sweet, savory, and all that jazz. Can't wait to return. Heard they got deals on Mondays and Tuesdays, wine and bruschetta."

"Upon a Saturday, my wife and I didst venture forth to seek a novel luncheon spot, as was our wont. She, with keen eyes, didst espy Hiromaru Fusion Ramen, and with great enthusiasm, didst cry: 'Behold! This shall be our haven!' 

The interior, though simple, was adorned with colors bright and fair, a pleasant respite from the dingy confines of some ramen houses I had visited ere. Our server, with haste, didst bring our draughts and expound upon certain dishes, at my wife's request. 

I, with great relish, didst order TATE-YAMA RAMEN, a veritable mountain of vegetables, sprouts, and delectable broth. My wife, with equal zeal, didst select TONKOTSU CURRY TSUKEMEN, whose appearance and scent didst stir within us great anticipation. Both dishes, in truth, were presented with artistry and care. 

Though we didst partake only of ramen, our gaze didst wander to other patrons, whose meals didst seem most intriguing. We shall return anon, to sample further the culinary delights that Hiromaru Fusion Ramen doth offer. Highly do I recommend this establishment, for a repast with a touch of whimsy."
"Fried chicken, best I've had. No expert, but damn good. Crunchy, juicy, full of flavor."

"Paper Skyscraper's got some swell gifts for the gays, but I was stumped when it came to gettin' somethin' for my ma's birthday. So, I checked out Boulevard. They got some nifty little trinkets - ceramic bird candles, bird houses, grapeseed beauty products. And they got some affordable baubles that'd make great surprises for pals or a treat for yerself. Homemade stuff too, at decent prices and top-notch service. It's a neat spot, and they got new things comin' in all the time, so it's worth stoppin' by."

"We had to check out the joint, see what the fuss was about. And damn, it lived up to the hype. Best sandwich I've ever had, and I ain't kiddin'. Went back a few times, and it was just as good. Hot dogs, they call 'em, but they're huge and cooked to perfection. The burger, a half-pounder, was juicy and flavorful, even though we asked for it well done. The cook knows his stuff. Might have to ditch the diet and go back tonight."
"Breakfast at a random joint. Damn good too. Julie, our server, did her job right."

"This joint's one of my favorites. Proves you don't gotta break the bank for a good meal. Had lunch, dinner, takeout, catering - you name it. Their traditional menu's got some heat, but it ain't too wild. Soups're top-notch, pad thai's on point, and the prices are right. Catering's a steal, too. Great spot for a date or a group hang. Decor's nice, drinks are solid. Thai ice tea's a must-try, even if you're not a drinker. Just watch out for the spice, unless you're into that sorta thing. Order mild if you're feeling timid."

"Wynn Buffet, best in town. Went last night, still full now. $37.95 + tax, worth every penny. Lamb chops, king crab legs, prime rib - all delicious. Meat fest. Don't waste time on fillers. Wait was long, but expected. Even had room for dessert. Definitely coming back."

"This joint's a real gem, tucked away in downtown Phoenix. My gal and I hit it up at least once a week. It's a swell spot, real hip. Food's top-notch, especially the Cash Money. Their dressing on the greens is killer. Staff's friendly too. Perfect date spot, nice and cozy with candles lit after dark. Old school hip hop blastin' away, just like I like it. I spread the word about this place to anyone who'll listen. Can't wait till they reopen after their short vacation."
"Fries, duck fat-fried, signal a good joint. Rib cap, best damn thing I've had."

"In N Out Burger, best fast food joint I've ever been to. Food's actually good, not like that processed crap other places serve. Burgers, fries, all made fresh daily. Love that. Only thing I don't like, everyone and their mom was at the Phoenix location I went to. Day after Christmas, near Paradise Valley Mall, no wonder. Couldn't find a table, ate in the car instead. Cold as hell, but worth it. In N Out, top burger spot in the States. Now they just need to come to the Great Lakes."

"Hark, good sir or madam, listen well,  
For I have tale to tell, a story swell,  
Of Lifetime Fitness, a gym most fine,  
Where weight loss goals, didst thou find thy shrine?  

A plateau, alas, didst thou find, despite  
Cardio twice a day, a feat most dire,  
But fear not, for help doth come, in guise  
Of Lifetime Fitness, with staff most wise.  

Their praises, I didst hear, from folk around,  
Who spoke of their kindness, with hearts profound,  
And so, I ventured forth, to give a try,  
And found, their words, didst not lie.  

The staff, so friendly, doth know me now,  
By name, and with aid, doth show me how,  
To reach my goals, with ease, and in short time,  
With personal trainers, of highest prime.  

A free class, on Saturdays, doth await,  
At 9 AM, with no risk, nor hesitation,  
So come, dear friend, and join the fray,  
For Lifetime Fitness, doth lead the way."
"Sushi House Goyemon, a hidden gem off the strip. AYCE, excellent. Pig bellies, pass. Friendly folk, great service."

We left after ten minutes, disappointed by the warm room and lack of a reserved table. But Bill, the manager, convinced us to stay and went all out to make us feel welcome. It was our best meal in Vegas. The pretzel bread was delicious, and the ginger and rum cocktail was a perfect start. The Gypsy and Martini dishes were prepared with care, and the creamed eggplant salad was a delight. The Cioppino was superb, with M enjoying the best FG - one seared, one mousse, and diverse scallops with pork belly. We finished with refreshing rum-pineapple-coconut upside-down and chocolate truffle desserts, paired with champagne and tawny port. The extra touches and attention to detail made us feel special.

"A hearty bowl of She Crab Soup didst start our feast,
Excellent indeed, and worth a second helping at the least.
Fish tacos followed, with flavors so bright,
A satisfying meal, that left us in good plight.
We shall return, to dine once more, anon,
For this fare, doth please our taste, and maketh us wanton."

"Vegas' finest steakhouse. My wife and I frequent this joint whenever we're in town, and it never disappoints. We've tried the others on the strip, but this place stands out for its perfect cooking and fair prices."

"In sooth, I didst venture into yonder store,
Where chaos reigned, a veritable warfare.
'Twas the day when Ashleys didst proffer credit,
Up to two thousand pieces of silver, they didst bear.

Many a customer didst grumble and complain,
Of waiting for five hours or more in vain.
But I, with patience, didst bide my time,
And waited but two hours, to mine own gain.

A friendly greeting didst I receive,
From employees who didst strive to please.
Their assistance was thorough, and with grace,
Even the manager didst lend a helping face.

No complaints had I, nor cause to frown,
For their kindness and care didst make my day crown.
I shall return, for future purchases made,
To Ashleys, where my experience was well-played."

"Sake, fresh as the morning dew. Rolls, crisp and plentiful. Option to halve or whole, like life's choices. Lychee sake, sweet as the fruit itself. Service, swift as the wind. A place to savor, indeed."

"Methinks 'twas fate that led me to this place,
Where kindness did abound and put my soul in grace.
A manager, named Aries, did my heart cheer,
With deeds most noble, he did my spirit clear.

In California, we didst set forth to roam,
To visit kin and friends, and celebrate at home.
But first, a movie, "Frozen," we didst wish to see,
The day before Thanksgiving, a time most fitting for thee.

I called the theatre, and a maiden fair didst say,
That $5 was the price, on Mon-Thurs, in a playful way.
But lo, the youth, who took my gold, didst say,
"Twas $29.90, a sum most vile, and made me frown and pray.

But then, Aries came, with grace most true,
And said, "My apologies, good sir, 'tis free for you."
He gave us tickets, without a single fee,
And made our family night, most joyful and carefree.

Oh, thank you, Aries, for your kindness so great,
You made our holiday, most memorable and elate.
May fortune smile upon you, and your days be bright,
For you, dear sir, didst make our night, most wondrous and delight."

"Wine secrets, my friend. Tucked away, hidden in plain sight. Department store's got a surprise within. Wine shop, tastings, classes, exclusive room for the finest vintages. Haven't explored fully, just a peek, but damn, it's promising. Give it a try."

"A feast fit for a king, they served, I swear,
But one dish, Kal-bi, lacked flavor, I fear.
A tofu house, indeed, it doth proclaim,
And all else, save Kal-bi, didst taste divine.
Bim bim bop, a dish of freshness and zest,
Didst please my palate, and banchan, at best.
In Las Vegas, seek this Korean place,
For a meal most wondrous, and worth thy grace."

"Went to this joint with a hole in the wall that served chicken wings. They had a bunch of different flavors, so I reckon I'll have to go back a few times to try 'em all. They got some beers, not the best selection, but it'll do. And they got TVs for watchin' sports."
"Anniversary spot, top-notch. Service, five-star. Fried calamari, spicy sauce, excellent. Fillet, superb. Wife's butterfish, loved it. Hawaiian martinis, delish. Recommend it."
"New joint near home. Yellow curry, good. Spicy, 1-10. Garlic chicken, crunchy. No outdoor seats. Returning."

"Authentic Chinese joint. Looks like Panda Express outside, but inside, it's a different story. Chinese waiters scurrying around. There's even a damn fishtank. Sat next to it, and the fish were eyeing me up. So, I ordered one, fried, with black bean and spicy garlic sauce. Teach that fish who's boss. But, really, you can get authentic Chinese grub here. Just learn what the cool Asians know, and order off the secret menu. Trust me, it's worth it. Update 6/2/08: Told ya, best Chinese ever!"

"Best Indian joint in Vegas, hands down. Been for lunch and dinner, and while the buffet's a steal, I prefer ordering exactly what I want. Garlic naan? Must-have. Pair it with some plain yogurt, please. Lamb or veggie korma and chicken tiki masala are my go-to mains. Medium heat, still packs a punch. Chicken tikka's alright, but I'm a sucker for a good sauce. Okra dish? Flavorful as hell. Slow service, sure, but the grub's worth it. Finish with a chai tea, feeling all warm and fuzzy inside. Comfort food, indeed."
"Amazing joint. Crafty cocktails, taste like a dream. Smash of your choice, fruit, triple sec - strawberries, lemon, vodka. Fresh and delish."

"Good eatery. Variety on the menu, not like that Hot N Juicy joint. Their Cajun sauce, now that's something special. Damn good. Service? Top-notch. Friendly, polite, and make sure you're enjoying your meal."

"I threw a last-minute MNF shindig at my pad. Chatted with a polite dude named Danny. Told him I needed the order done right. He assured me, no worries. When the grub arrived, I gave it the once-over. Damn, it was spot on! Pizza and wings, perfectly cooked. Wings had just the right amount of sauce. My guests were stoked, and those wings? A real hit! Thanks, Danny. You did good, buddy. We'll be back, and we'll bring our pals too. HH should give you a pat on the back."

"Fox Sports Grill, love it.  Beautiful people, sports, what's not to like?  Belly up to the bar, lots of TVs, don't miss a minute of the game.  Pool tables for halftime entertainment, private room for gettin' saucy.  DJs spinning tunes during commercial breaks, Fox Sports broadcasts live.  Prices are standard, food's upscale bar fare.  Shower up, wear your best jersey, you never know who you'll run into."

"Methinks I dwelt in Tucson for sixteen summers fair,
With mine own children three, and husband new, and two stepchildren dear.
In year of two thousand and two, to New York we did repair,
For wondrous sights and sounds, that city doth declare.
But alack, good friends, in New York, one thing doth lack,
Authentic Mexican fare, that doth my heart attack.
My kin doth crave it much, and so doth mine own self,
And thus, when to Arizona, I do make my wealth.
To Apache Junction, where parents and sister doth reside,
We seek out Los Tacos, where our hunger doth abide.
The place is cleanly kept, the staff doth show courtesy,
And though my Spanish be poor, their English doth suffice.
Their food, cooked to order, doth please mine appetite,
Tortillas homemade, a feast most delightful and bright.
A salsa bar doth offer, salsa fresca, hot peppers roasted,
Carrots spiced, salsa verde, and chipolte, all things toasted.
Coffee they may serve, but I, with my Vente from Starbucks,
Do bring each morn, and kindly, they doth allow the entre.
My son, who doth accompany me, doth walk two miles each day,
To Starbucks, and then, a few steps more, to Los Tacos, in play.
A wondrous way to start the day, with food most divine,
Los Tacos, I doth recommend, with highest praise, and most fine."
"Clean joint, friendly proprietor, fair prices. Good eats."
"Place was top-notch. Tech was pro, polite. I zoned out, felt like a new man when I woke. Highly recommend."

"Vogue Bistro, superb French cooking. Atmosphere, top-notch. For couples or groups, I've done both. Great cocktails, martinis too. Menu, nothing left to desire. Meatloaf, steaks, chef specials, all excellent. No disappointment, that's for sure."

"Hark, fair friends! Last week, we didst stay
At Wynn, where we didst dine in style and play.
One day, we hadst lunch, and on our last,
Didst break our fast, with feast most vast.

Lunch: Chicken Salad, with tea so sweet,
And vegan sliders, which didst please my mate.
Breakfast: Peach Bellini, yummy indeed,
Lobster Benedict, with lobster pieces heap'd.
Garden omelet, my love didst enjoy with glee,
Coffee and juice, both excellent, as could be.

Service and food, both great, we didst find,
Inside, 'twas beautiful, a sight most kind.
Outside, by pool, a table we didst obtain,
In weather fair, a scene most serene and bright.

Note for vegans: Steve Wynn, a vegan now,
His menus, do offer, options quite allow.
We tried a few, and found them most divine,
A true delight, for those who do decline.

Back again, we shall, to Wynn, anon,
For more of their delights, we have begun."

The new development's a real winner. Crowds flockin' in, spendin' their cash in what used to be a parkin' lot. Got all sorts of joints and shops, somethin' for everyone. Like the layout, the designs, and that big ol' eye-catchin' attraction, tallest on the west coast. I'll be back, whether it's for grub, people-watchin', or playin'. Goal was to keep folks close, and it worked like a charm. Kudos to the architects, developers, and whoever cooked up the idea. People hoppin' from the Linq to the Flamingo to Harrahs, keepin' their dough on this side of the strip. Smart thinkin'.

"Haven't been to the Linq enough. Lot of cool spots to hang out, like Blvd. Cocktail. Met a friend there Tuesday night, dead slow. Bartender, Mike, top-notch. Made me an Irish Mule, no ginger beer. Worked some magic with real ginger, ginger ale, and more. Drink was better than usual. Piano player asked for requests, played anything we wanted. JT, Foo Fighters, Kanye West. Cute spot, speakeasy vibe. Bartenders, talented mixologists. Beautiful patio, promenade. Be back."

"Methinks 'tis nigh on 97% of mine own kin's provisioning doth occur at this very place. Verily, the bakehouse herein doth please mine eyes and taste, forsooth! Aye, some of their ready-made victuals doth surpass others, as is wont to happen at any market. The Indies' fare, in sooth, doth satisfy mine hunger whene'er I am in haste. Their flesh and dairy array doth ever delight, and yonder staff doth prove most courteous and aidful."

"BurGR knocks it outta the park. Best burger I've had, period. Staff's top-notch, like Ramsey's steak. Ordered the Farm Burger, damn good. Wife had Hells Kitchen, equally impressive. Shared some "Just Fries", solid. But the real clincher? Their ketchups - chipotle and curry, both winners."

"Hark, my dearest husband doth speak highly of this eatery,
A humble abode, yet full of culinary delight.
He, with ribs of beef, didst feast and make merry,
Whilst I, a sandwich of pork, didst partake in joy.
But, oh, the cornbread, sweet as cake, didst steal my heart,
For I, a lover of confection, didst find it a work of art.
Indeed, a place to visit, if thou dost seek
A local haunt, with victuals most unique."

"Been comin' here two years now. Can't get my nails done anywhere else. Quality and selection top-notch. Only downside's the wait. Gotta book ahead, few weeks even. But worth it. Lil Kim's my girl. Takes her time, details matter, excellent work. Never goin' elsewhere, no matter the price or location."

"Polished, that's where I go for my nails. Fifteen miles away, but worth it. Hundreds of salons between here and there, but this one's the best. Color selection? Unbeatable. Busy place, but service is quick and top-notch. Tina's my girl, she knows her stuff. Arielle and Brianna run a tight ship, friendly too. When I've got visitors, Polished is where we go."
"Savored grub with pals at this joint. Dishes delighted all. Eager to chow down again in Sin City."

"Hark, what drinks we have here, my friends! Nostrovia martini, a refreshing draught for summer's heat, and Starry night martini, a beverage most divine, reminiscent of Van Gogh's celestial canvas. And at ICE bar, the ambiance doth transport me to Mother Russia, where vodka doth flow like a river. By Jove, 'tis a wondrous elixir indeed!"

"My two dogs, a cav King Charles spaniel and a Lhasa apso poodle mix, get groomed at this place. The spaniel's coat can be a pain to maintain, but the groomers always make her look and feel great. She struts out happy and refreshed, tail wagging. The Lhasa apso pup had her first haircut there, and despite being skittish, the groomers calmed her down and gave her a fantastic trim. Quick in and out, too."

"Chris and his crew, top-notch. Got us into every joint we wanted, comms were smooth, fast. My cuz and I, we had a blast at the Palms and Foundation Room. I'll be back in Vegas, you can bet your ass I'll give Chris a shout. Thanks, fellas."

"This joint was off the chain, gorgeous like a Candyland for grown-ups. I wanted to play with all the water toys, like that stripper pole that rains down on the ladies below. And that VIP pool with clear sides? Yeah, that was the bomb.com. It was a perfect Sunday, blue skies, 90 degrees in August, plenty of room to chill, shade, clean bathrooms, and beautiful people everywhere. I'm kicking myself for not getting a new swimsuit and heels."

"Score! Just met her today and, boy, did I hit the jackpot! Moved to AZ, and finding someone who knows their way around a Brazilian wax is no picnic. But, from the get-go, I felt at ease. She's a pro, been doing this for 12 years, and let me tell you, she's the best. My skin's super sensitive, and usually, I'm left feeling sore and tender after a wax. Not today. She worked quick, efficient, and I walked out without a single twinge. Got a facial too, part of her Yelp deal, and she knocked it out of the park. No need to look any further, I've found my go-to esthetician. Oh, and FYI, my nav took me to a field, so if yours does the same, just turn around, and it's in a strip mall on the left."

"Brueggers, my DC spot for a solid morning bite or post-lunch treat. Saw it in Biltmore, did a little jig. Everything's as good as the E Street joint, and their lunch sammies are decent if you're too lazy to stroll across the street. Oh, and their teas? Damn good."
"Sports bar, classic. Good grub, wingsthe bomb. Service, solid. Not fancy, just right. Great spot for drinks, games, and sports. Happy hour, fun. Check it out."

"Lived here 1.5 years, shocked by poor reviews. Great grounds, pools, apartments, location. Staff top-notch, 2nd to none. Leaned on 'em heavy, demanding at times. Always accommodating, professional, welcoming. Lookin' for a new spot? Team here's the best. Cheers."

"Pizzeria Bianco, a gem found through Yelp. Reviews raved, and for good reason. Thin crust, my preference, and theirs did not disappoint. Atmosphere, cozy, brick exterior, charming. Avoided the crowd, went after lunch rush, seated in ten. Service, excellent. Pizza, divine. Silence ensued, savoring each bite. Craving it still. Perfect ten. Margherita and Wiseguy, fresh toppings, smoky crust from the wood-fired oven. Worth the price."

"Stayed here for a night in Scottsdale before hitting up an Eagles game at Cardinal Stadium. Location was prime, rooms were spacious, breakfast was solid, and staff was friendly and helpful. Only gripe was the coffee, which was pretty damn weak - almost like dirty water."

"Sushi joint looks unassuming from the outside, but don't be fooled. Inside, it's a classy affair with top-notch grub and hospitable staff. Their all-you-can-eat deal is a steal, and the rolls are generously portioned. Get there early for optimal service. Word of advice: don't overdo it on the rolls, they're big."
"Drive-thru crew's always sweet and friendly.  Makes for a damn fine start to the day.  This Dunkin', it's a beauty.  Best joe in the land."

"Fresh. Yummy. Artful preps. Chef Jonny, a master. Sashimi, amazing. Cucumber wrap, halibut. Spring leaves, tuna. Micro French fries, yellow tail. Surf and turf, blue crab, NY steak. Ono, king crab, tuna. Salmon, truffle oil. A must for sushi fans. Hubby took me, will return."

"I had a great time at the salon. I walked in and the attendant said Vanessa would see me soon. She showed up on time and gave me a sweet haircut. I wanted a trim and some shine - and that's what I got. Then, I asked Vanessa if she could fit in my mom. She had colored her hair elsewhere but needed a cut. Lucky for us, Vanessa had time and hooked us both up with fresh, fabulous dos. We'll be back, thanks Canyon Falls and Vanessa."

"Barriques on Monroe, a spot I've long favored for remote work. Free parking nearby, ample outlets, strong WiFi, and a mean cup o' joe keep me coming back. Now, with its snazzy facelift, I'm smitten. A swanky bar area for sipping brews or vino, and roomier tablesthis place just gets better."

"The Old Children's Bookshelf, tucked away on Canongate, is a treasure trove for nostalgic adults. Shelves upon shelves of well-preserved children's fiction, picture books, short stories, and annuals from the 1950s onward. A veritable feast for the eyes. Original copies of The Moomins, Peter Pan, and Where The Wild Things Are brought back memories of my own childhood. They had a way of making me feel misty-eyed. If you're looking for something other than books, they also sell adorable prints and comic books. But, I'd recommend the illustrated editions of Alice in Wonderland or Wizard of Oz. They're a delight to read and are sprinkled with magic."

"Pamplemousse, a hidden gem in Vegas. Real French cuisine at half the price of Le Circ or Bouchon. Don't let the exterior fool you, step inside and you're in Paris. Fettucine ala George and lobster bisque, both superb. Fish dishes expertly prepared. Tournedos, incredible. Always our choice when in Vegas. Don't miss it."

"Upon my travels, fate didst lead me to a place most wondrous,
In Charlotte, where a culinary delight didst await.
A curry of such flavor, and hummus of such grace,
Didst leave me in awe, with a heart full of joy and praise.

Oh, how I wished for their food to be shipped to me,
In San Francisco, where I doth reside, you see.
For then, I could partake in their delicious fare,
And savor each bite, without a single care."

"Been thinkin' 'bout gettin' my tat removed for a while now. Finally decided to pull the trigger. Shoulda done it sooner, but oh well. Searched online, compared prices, and found a good deal on Groupon. Went with "Erased Laser Tattoo Removal." Great rates, even without the Groupon. Had a free consultation and started treatments the same day. Four sessions total, three more to go. Already seein' some progress, but it varies from person to person. Place is professional, straightforward, and clean. Feels safe, ya know? Glad I came here. Thought it'd cost an arm and a leg, but they saved me some cash. Will post before and after pics later. Get that tat removed, folks!"

"Zookz, found through Yelp's nearby feature. Small menu, great prices ($4.50-$4.75). Vegetarian breakfast sandwich (poached eggs, feta, parmesan, spinach) and a Nutella, peanut butter, banana, almond sandwich. Both delicious. Friendly service from Carol, the owner, and a young man. Unique feature: a sink at the beverage counter for cleaning up. Punch cards too. Will return for the 10th sandwich, free."
"AYCE sushi? Best in town. Service, grub, atmosphere - all top-notch. Can't beat it."

"Took my Dodge Ram in for a free eval. Other shop said I needed costly repairs - new rack and pinion, radiator, thermostat, and temp sensor. Not so, says Phil at Litchfield Auto Repair. Honest guy, gave me a fair price, fixed the real issues, and had my truck back to me same day. These folks get all my future business."

"Wednesday, 3 pm. Quiet. Reservations made. Tea time. \nLavender, jasmine, oolong. Mild, aromatic. Sandwiches, good. Scones, devonshire cream, lemon curd. Delicious. Yum. Mini desserts, good. Great service. Attentive. Everything tasted great."

"Cravin' a burger, big time. On Weight Watchers, so options were limited. In-N-Out, my go-to, had a secret weapon - a six-point burger, lettuce, tomato, onion, and ketchup. Hit the spot. Been a fan for years, and it's not too bad for you, comparatively. Fries, 9 points, but I skipped 'em this time. Baby loves their cheeseburgers, great for picky eaters. Hubby's into the animal style, but not my cup of tea."

"Landed late, grabbed my bags, and hopped on the shuttle. Driver was a gent, helped the elderly folks aboard. Check-in, a breeze. Security, present and accounted for. Room, clean and modern. Bed, comfy. Premium channels, free. Denny's, meh. Continental brekkie, surprisingly decent. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, waffles, muffins, toast, milk, OJ. No need for Denny's, thankfully. WiFi, top-notch. Price and location, can't complain. Good job, all."

"Great grub, artistic presentation, plenty of options. Service is top-notch. Don't schedule a show after dinner here. Can't fully appreciate the experience when rushed and don't want to miss the performance due to being stuffed from indulging in the delicious food."

"Dogs'll eat anything, I thought. Not Bear, though. My two-year-old German Shepherd's picky. People'd stop me, say, 'Your mom feedin' you?' Real helpful, those folks. I took Bear to 4 Paws Holistic, got more than I bargained for. She tried different grub, liked some, didn't like others. Their crew helped me sort it out, raw, dry, combo. Bear's eatin', gainin' weight. 4 Paws Holistic's my spot for Bear's chow, treats, bully sticks."

"Amazing. Went with the missus and some pals on Veterans Day weekend. Was hoping for a good time after a shitty experience at Gordon Ramsay Steak the day before. This place delivered. Didn't miss a thing, except maybe some fancy decorations. Had lobster, king crab, lamb chops, freshwater eel, lobster ravioli, and plenty of bubbly. Whole party loved it. Will be back."

"DD, I love thee. East Coaster livin' in CA, I yearned for my fix. LV, bless 'em, had a Dunkin' spot. Drive-thru, no less. Scored donuts, coffee, and a smile. Guy botched my iced coffee, but swapped it out, no fuss. Donuts, gone in a flash. Coffee, savored en route to CA."

"Vegas weekend with pals. One mentions a spot, we give it a shot. I get chorizo hash, damn good, spicy, delish. Bloody Mary's on point too. Friend's chicken and waffles, impressive presentation, tastes great. Other friend's artichoke hash, light but flavorful. Plates are heaping, will return."

"Blown your wad on gambling, huh? Not feeling peckish yet it's not club time. What now? 

Hit up Madame Tussaud's! 

Unlike other stuffy wax joints, this place doesn't take itself too seriously. Doesn't even call itself a museum, which is spot on since you're here for silly photos with wax figures of Depp and Elvis. They got props too, like bunny ears for your pic with Hefner."

"Hark! This store, my first visit, didst bring me cheer,
For healthy foods and treats, of quality so dear.
The staff, friendly and wise, didst aid my quest,
And location, most convenient, didst make me blest.

Last few times, Brittnea and Kelly, I didst see,
At this place, their warmth, didst make my heart sing.
Tatum and Shea, our usual haunt, doth be,
But here, my friends, doth Choice Pet Market shine so bright and free."

Hark! What wondrous delights doth this place hold?
Aye, 'tis a veritable cornucopia of sweet treats,
Ice cream, sorbet, gelato, and more,
To tickle thy taste buds and make them sing.

And lo, they do possess my heart's desire,
The cake batter flavor, a Cold Stone fire,
That doth ignite my passion, and doth bring
Joy to my soul, and maketh my heart take wing.

But wait, there's more! The prices here,
Are most reasonable, and the service dear,
Is swift and friendly, with a smile so bright,
It doth illuminate the night.

So come, my friends, and partake in this feast,
Of sweet indulgence, and let our cares be blessed.
For in this place, we shall find solace and cheer,
And our bellies, they shall be full and merry, I swear.

"Escape the heat and seek out Jump 'n' Jungle's shade,
Where pent-up energy can be freely played.
On your way home from school, with friends in tow,
Meet up at Jump 'n' Jungle, a place to show
Your playful side, and let loose with glee.
Two for Tuesdays, a budget-friendly spree!
But remember, pack clean socks for all to see,
A shoe-free space, where fun's the decree!"

"Classic joint, old-school vibes. Quality work, top-notch service, friendly bunch. Cash-only keeps costs down. My ride ain't looked this good in ages. Didn't expect the detailing, but glad they did. Refreshing to see places like this still around."

Last eve at The Painters Lounge, we three couples didst gather,
To partake in their painting class, with wine to slake our thirst.
Dina, the hostess, and her aid, didst tend to our needs,
And soon, our canvases didst bloom with colors, bright and bold.

With laughter and cheer, we didst create our masterworks,
Each one unique, yet all didst shine with skill and art.
Dina, a mistress of mirth, didst ensure we didst enjoy,
And we, in turn, didst praise her efforts, with hearts full of joy.

We shall return, to paint again, on a future date,
For The Painters Lounge doth offer, a most excellent fate.

"Manna's on Madison's North Side. Family-run, great grub, good veggie options. Pastries, bread, rolls - top-notch. Earthly Delights sandwich? Wow. Soups and salads, too. Coffee? Not so much. Thin, over-extracted. But hey, it's still the best on the North Side."

"Wednesdays, double flyer day. Old sales, new sales, both valid. Gluten-free, dairy-free options galore. Employees, friendly and available. Parking, easy. Bulk products, great sales. Sale items, never a shortage."

"Verily, this culinary experience didst leave us in awe,
So much so that we didst return four times in three days,
The flavors were so fresh and the menu so vast,
'Twas hard to choose, so we shared and kept trying new ways.
The plates, not mere salads, but creations of the chef,
Innovative and intriguing, a true gastronomic relief."

"Hark! If thou hast hair color woes, this be the place to go,
And Betsey, she be the one to see, thou knowest.
'Tis the third time in many years that I have sought her aid,
To mend a hue that doth not please, a true hair color maid.
I found her once again, at William Jon's salon on the square,
And this time, she didst cut my locks, with skill beyond compare.
She ne'er doth make me feel ashamed, for my DIY attempts,
But instead, doth offer help, with patience and good cheer.
Fifty years hath she been in this trade, a true veteran,
And her knowledge of chemistry, doth make her a master, indeed.
They say she doth work wonders, with African tresses too,
So, give her a visit, and see, what Betsey canst do."

"I ain't sure what to expect at Hooters. So far, so good, that's why the five stars. But gotta say, there's one thing that bugs me, not enough to knock 'em down a peg though. This place, it's like the seventies all over again. Wood paneling, that funny orange color, and a little bit of tacky thrown in. Eatin' here's been good so far. Girls are friendly, place is clean, service is quick and efficient. Only been here for lunch, that's my only experience. No happy hour, no dinner, no weekends. My only gripe's the carry-out service. Couple times, it's been slow as molasses. Waitin' forever for someone to take my order, waitin' just as long for the grub, feelin' like I'm less important than the folks eatin' in."

"Phoenix area? Stop here. Best southern grub I've had, hands down. Fried chicken, nice seasoning. Not too much batter, just right. Juicy, even the breast. House hot sauce, perfect. Biscuits and gravy, soft and fluffy. Legit. Good service. Be back."

"Fair prices for wondrous fare,
In quantity, quality doth share!
My heart doth sing with joy each time,
For flavors here do dance and rhyme.
Sweet treats, a feast for eyes and tongue,
Silence doth reign, a peaceful throng.
A place to visit, come what may,
For pleasure doth await thee still,
In this, thy culinary fray."

"Soul Gastrolounge, a place for adventurous dates. Fresh food, great ambiance, friendly staff, and reasonable prices. I've been there six times, and each meal has been excellent. Don't miss out, give it a try."
"Le's Nail Salon. Vegas' best. Affordable, top-notch. Le's a doll, does a swell job. Gel mani lasts three weeks, easy. Change it up when I get bored. No chips, no peels. Best price in town."
"Good grub, fair prices. Sushi's top-notch, never gotten a bad piece. Kids love it, too. Wish they had those little chopsticks though. Nice ambiance, outdoor seating with a view of the lake."

"Courier Cafe, a haven of delight,
Where one may find solace in savory bites,
A place of rest from trials and woe,
Where taste buds dance with joyful throes.

Their menu boasts classic treats,
Phosphates and malts, a sweet retreat,
Sandwiches fresh, burgers sturdy and true,
Vegetarian options, a feast for the few.

Pesto grilled Swiss, a delightful sight,
Ham melt on croissant, a morning's delight,
And for dessert, share a headliner,
A sundae grand, in hot fudge's embrace, a true winner.

The price, a bargain, fair and square,
For the quality, beyond compare,
Service, at times, may seem slow,
But patience, dear friend, will surely grow.

After tests, papers, and strife,
This cafe, a refuge, a haven of life."

"This joint was a real treat. My buddy and I stumbled in on a hunch, and boy am I glad we did. They got these fried pickles that're worth the trip alone. But the drinks, man, they're something else. Classy, unique, and a helluva lot better than the usual Fremont Street watering holes. Friendly staff, good grub, and a damn fine cocktail. Prices are fair, but the quality's top-notch. If you're gonna drop eight bucks on a drink, do it here instead of that frozen crap down the street. Had a few apps, a couple drinks, and some good chat with Chris, our waiter. Highly recommended. I'll be back next time I'm in town."

"Comin' back for sure. Service was top-notch, Marianne was aces. Made me feel at ease, even though it was my first time gettin' somethin' like that done. Quick and kept me chatty during the tiny bits of pain. Not too shabby, not too shabby at all. Definitely sendin' folks her way, especially if it's their first time too. (:\n\nStef)"

"Dr. C's been my man for years. Calm, quick, and a damn good dentist. Cleanings are top-notch. His staff's friendly as hell. You can't go wrong with him. He knows his stuff and'll take care of your mouth like it's his own."
"Fellas, they fixed my great-grandpa's money clip, fifty years old, like new. Price was right too. I'll be back for more."
"Greatest ballpark around. Folks who run the joint and those who play there, all like one big happy family. Cold beer on tap, perfect for a day out with pals. Best damn park I've ever been to."

"Walked into Brio, a joint near my digs. Place looked swell, so I plopped down at the bar. Barkeep was friendly, told me about their happy hour deals. I went for the shrimp and eggplant appetizer. Damn good. Not usually a veggie fan, but that dish was tasty. Bread was warm, fresh, and I used too much of it to clean up the sauce. Made myself full. Looking forward to coming back, trying more."

"Thou hast my gratitude, fair Jessy, for the tattoo thou hast wrought upon mine arm, which hath drawn forth many a compliment. Thou didst accommodate my schedule with an appointment, yet also didst welcome those who came unannounced. Thy skills in artistry extend beyond the needle, for thy fellow artists didst engage in sketching, painting, and drawing, awaiting their turn to weave their magic upon the skin. Thou didst create a custom design, carefully crafting it to fit mine arm, and I do anticipate future collaborations with thee, for I sense thy mind doth brim with creative ideas for me. Do visit their website, good sir, to peruse the portfolios of all the talented artists who dwell there, and note the reasonable prices for works of such quality."

"Love this joint! Got a season pass early on, cheap as hell. Ten bucks more than a day pass and free parking all season. Lines can be long, food's expensive, but that's why you plan ahead. Weekdays and Fridays are best, close at ten, beat the crowds. Bring a cooler, keep it in the car, save some cash. Don't get the complaints, folks here do their damn best."

"After a shoot in PHX, the crew jabbered on for an hour about The Bikini. Glad I went. Heard a lot about it, and it didn't disappoint. It's the spot for hipsters, art fags, freaks, and geeks. If your clothes never match, this is your joint. Just a dive bar with some cool local art, a bitchin' jukebox, and a pool table. Went to First Friday too. Those two go together like peanut butter and jelly. Love it when I can go. Not a regular spot for me, though. I'm in TempE and hate driving, especially after drinking."

"Hark! What light through yonder door doth break? A $5 lunch deal, by my troth! And lo, the people flock, for 'tis a feast most wondrous and fair. The bread, fresh-baked, doth please mine eyes, and all the sandwiches, by my tongue, doth taste most sweet. My comrades and I, we doth frequent this place, and ne'er have we been disappointed, by my honor! So, if thou seekest sustenance, and dost not wish to spend o'er much, then hie thee hence, and partake in this most excellent deal!"

"Hark, what cheer! A place most wondrous fair,
Where mixed groups, both veg and meat, may share
A feast most satisfying, twice now tried,
And found most excellent, by my troth, I've lied.

Their soup, a lemon grass delight, doth steal
My heart away, with flavors so divine,
And bring thy own wine, a merry sight,
To make our evening most jolly and bright.

In truth, I say, this place doth please me well,
And shall we come again? Ay, that we shall,
For here, good friends, we find a culinary spell."

"Love at first sip. Shake spot, LVAC Flamingo & 215. Fatty pleasures and healthy sips for all. Incredible Hulk, kale, pineapple, banana, protein powder. So damn good. Friendly folk, giving back to Three Square. Feeding hungry kids in Vegas. Good stuff, good people, good cause. I'll be back."
"Monday arvo, place was dead. No wait, just us. Food came quick, real good too. Family spot, ya know?"

"Went to Mon Ami Gabi. Great recs. New fav joint. Food's off the charts. Atmosphere, top-notch. Had the hanger steak, Merlot butter sauce. Melted in my mouth. Fiancee, salmon. Friend, escargot. Must-try. Can't say enough. Get there. Won't disappoint."

"Went to DMV solo, waited hours, they said I needed more info. Left, changed it, came back, waited again. Total waste of time. Thanks, Rob Young Insurance. Got insurance and reg in one spot. Made sense."
"Fabulous!  People fixate on location, but food's the real prize.  Mexican + seafood, can't go wrong."
"Terrific! Got seats fast, service sharp, atmosphere prime. Portions generous, shareable. Not for kids, but ideal for dates, families, or celebrations."
"Pancakes, damn good. Server brought some out for us this mornin', and they were spot on. Let him choose the spread, and boy, am I glad we did."

"Eric, a top-notch waiter, served us well at our wine pairing with MyVegas.com. He explained the pairings with ease and confidence, and when we had questions, he swiftly sought out answers. A job well done, and the grub? Excellent. Linguine with clam sauce and brick chicken, please."

"Lexi, a junior stylist at this top-notch salon, gives me a killer cut without breaking the bank. She's a pro, turning my vague instructions into a work of art on my head. My long, dirty blonde locks are now a thing of beauty, thanks to her skills. And, she's got some solid tips for styling my hair myself, upping my game big time."

"Verily, a culinary delight! Forsooth, I have sought such savory victuals for a spell, and yonder establishment didst catch mine eye. By Jove, I shall return anon! The Chicken Tikka Masala, a dish most wondrous fair, didst please mine taste, as didst the naan, a bread most divine! Mark my words, good sirs, 'tis a place most worthy of thy visit!"

"Hark, what a fine eatery doth this place be!
On my second visit, fair Robyn did join me,
And I didst recommend, for thy first time,
A Carne Asada Torta Nortea, with salad divine.
Forget the chips, and ceviche, a 99 cent delight,
Doth order, for a bit more, if thou dost wish to bite.

Here, all is excellent, the atmosphere clean,
Comfortable, the service, friendly, and keen.
Generous portions, fair prices, a feast for thee,
Leaving full, and in bliss, from the culinary spree.
Yum, indeed! Carne Asada Torta Nortea, a mere $7.49,
A price so fair, for such gastronomic joy to mine."
"New spot's a real humdinger, pal! Been takin' my mutts to Grand Paws for a couple years now. Sweet staff, good follow-up, in 'n' out appointments like clockwork."

"Wicked Spoon, my favorite buffet. Elegant, classy, upscale, and spacious. Friendly staff, polite and attentive. Luxurious experience. Drinks, fresh squeezed juices and high-end teas. Food, high quality at a low price. Chilean sea bass, roasted bone marrow, cooked to perfection. Dessert bar, gelato, apple pie, bread pudding. Must try, changes your view of buffets forever."

"I gotta tell ya, I ain't no desk jockey who writes restaurant reviews based on how good the service was or how full I felt when I left. It's all about the grub, baby! And let me tell ya, I got some serious cred when it comes to food. Ten years in the back of the house, six years as a fine wine distributor. I know my stuff. And let me tell ya, The Parlor never disappoints. I've had some amazing meals there, and I'm always raving about their seasonal menu items. Sure, every restaurant has an off day now and then, but I've never had a bad meal at The Parlor. And let me tell ya, their Caesar salad is the best in the valley. It's a simple dish, but most places screw it up. They try to deconstruct it or add their own twist, and it just doesn't work. But The Parlor gets it right. They keep it real. Crunchy croutons, creamy parmesan and anchovy emulsion, fresh romaine. That's how you do a Caesar salad. Other Phoenix restaurants, take note. Don't mess with perfection. Keep it simple, keep it real."

"Been here twice now. Had the lamb sandwich, baba ganouj, and shawarma chicken. All good. Gonna try the sleek next time, got kale in it. Looks real tasty. Servings are big too. Staff's friendly and helpful. Place is cozy. Can't wait to go back and try some more."
"Sales team worked with me, traded a clunker for my dream ride at a price I could swing. Jeff and Dom, top-notch dudes."

"Methinks 'twas a wondrous sight, my friend and I,
Didst stumble upon a place most divine.
The folk, they were cool and kind,
And service, swift and of the finest mind.
A feast for our bellies, a treat for our eyes,
A place to dine, with ambiance that doth rise.
Verily, a gem, this eatery doth be,
For those who seek a culinary spree."

"I joined Truliant years back for a sweet car loan. Process was smooth, no fuss. Credit wasn't great, but they gave me the loan, and another later on. Both helped my credit, big time. Folks here are top-notch, real friendly. Members own this place, not some far-off investor. Location's convenient, right off 77. Recently, they killed the need for deposit slips. Now, you can just walk in and take care of business. Other local credit unions can even use this joint. Nice touch. \n\nOnly gripe's the lack of a coin-counting machine. Most places got 'em. But hey, no biggie. Truliant's still solid."
"Five years of hopping from one dentist to another. Finally, found a place to stick."

"Hark, good sirs, I do declare, this establishment doth provide most excellent service, indeed. Thrice have I brought mine automobile hither, and each time, the staff hath proven themselves to be most courteous, helpful, and true of heart. They do not seek to deceive or swindle, but rather, they offer sound counsel and swift assistance. Their integrity shines bright, like the sun in the sky, and I do pronounce them worthy of highest praise. Well done, good sirs, well done! May your business flourish and prosper, as doth the verdant tree in springtime. BIG O TIRES, upon the Rainbow, doth merit three hearty cheers!"
"Theater's the only joint in this burg I'd bother with. Seats are comfy, parking's a breeze. Do yourself a favor, reserve 'em online beforehand. Makes life simpler."

"Food's damn good here. Service, too. Not too much grease, just right. New fave spot in Montreal. Had lunch, soup was solid, paired well with smoked mackerel. Poutine, a bit much, but not as bad as Au Pied's foie gras. Still, real good. 4.5 stars."

"Arrived at the joint, no wait in line. Friendly gent at the window, suggested the Vanilla/Honey Latte Iced. Damn good choice. Also had the breakfast burrito, their salsa on point. Didn't feel like crap after, unlike some other places. Service quick, gal brought order to my ride, real friendly. Prices fair too. Better than the long lines and overpriced swill at them corporate joints. They got a nice patio too, dogs welcome. Definitely coming back."
"Tater, top-notch mixologist. Downtown, stop by, don't miss it. Atmosphere, grub, service - all ace."

"Horseback ride in Cave Creek recreation area. Great experience. Healthy horses, beautiful trails, helpful crew. Jeff and Debbie run the operation during winter, providing boots, hats, and props. Small groups, saddlebags for gear, friendly service. Trails feel remote, clean operation. Got a discount coupon for next time. Perfect Arizona experience for visitors. Stop by Cave Creek and grab BBQ at Bryans after."
"Good shop. Can't understand why folks gripe 'bout the speed. Slow's better for mods. Ain't no Jiffy Lube."
"Amazing joint. Food's delicious, atmosphere's a blast. Salsa nights on Saturdays, tunes are great. Top 5, easy."

"Darlene's the real deal. Owner and champ of the alteration game. Friendly, dedicated, and skilled. Been taking my dress pants there for years, even when I was still in school. Wedding dress? Flawless. Now, I bring my stuff when I visit and have her ship it back. Reasonable prices, great service. Darlene and her team, top-notch. Never had a problem. Started small, now she's expanded. Must be doing something right. Best spot around. Take your business there. You won't regret it."
"Sunday, last minute, dog grooming. People, friendly. Like old pals."

"Verily, this place doth please me well,
In every aspect, it doth excel.
The victuals, ale, and merriment,
Do make it a place of great content.
And, by the stars, 'tis a haven,
For families with little ones to crave.
We shall return, again and again,
To partake in their joy and cheer,
Forsooth, this place doth reign supreme,
In all that doth make life serene."

"Tacos El Gordo, open late, cheap, and kick-ass. Does it right. First night in Vegas, 2 AM, walked over. Located end of strip, past Treasure Island. Packed, delicious smells, different meat stations. Adobada (Spicy Pork), so good, ordered more. Marinated spicy pork roasting on spit, pineapple top. Suadero (Beef Shoulder), fall apart tender, beef stewing away. Must eat, Tacos El Gordo, next time in Vegas."

"Hark, good sir or madam, seek thou out  
A restaurant that doth please thy taste?  
Look no further than Dragon Wok, no doubt,  
For there thou shalt find culinary grace.  

Their dishes, a delight, a symphony  
Of flavors, textures, colors, and scents,  
Orange Chicken, Combination Lo Mein,  
Sweet and Sour Chicken, Gourmet Beef, and more,  
Their War Wonton Soup, a true delight,  
Doth leave thee wanting more, day and night.  

A family favorite, this establishment,  
With food that doth impress, and never disappoint,  
In portion sizes, fit for a king,  
And customized, to suit thy whim, they do sing.  
Cleanliness, a virtue, they hold dear,  
In kitchen, table, floor, and bathroom, clear.  

So, hesitate not, give them a try,  
For at Dragon Wok, thou shalt not die,  
But live, and live well, in gastronomic bliss,  
With every dining experience, a pure delight, no less."
"Coffee, excellent. Roast their own beans, they do. Hooked, we are."
"Mediterranean grub's got us hooked. Found a joint that served up some tasty, fresh fare. We'll be back for more."

"Methinks we chanced upon Kickstand's door,
For burgers, we didst have a mighty crave.
The place, it didst impress us, clean and neat,
A booth with flat-screen TV, our seat.

Off it was, yet the hostess didst say,
"Shall I turn it on?" And we didst play.
But nay, we wished a non-TV feast,
And thus, our meal began in peace.

Oh, how the burgers didst delight,
Unique flavors, a wondrous sight.
My partner's Cycle Zydeco, spicy not,
Mardi Gras slaw, Root Beer glaze, a plot.

I, a lover of spice, didst choose the Greek,
Kalamata olive spread, tzatziki unique.
Feta, oh feta, a taste so fine,
Together, a burger divine.

Sides, there were many to select,
Combo tater tots, our hearts didst correct.
Regular tots, good, but sweet potato, oh!
Butter, brown sugar syrup, a treat to know.

Atmosphere, service, food, all grand,
Kickstand, a place to visit, hand in hand."

"Happy with the service? Hell yeah, I'm thrilled. Called Jerry, nice guy, came out same day, gave me a fair estimate. Scheduled for next day, Alex was great, introduced himself, made sure we were on the same page. Crew did a fantastic job, cleaned up after themselves, left it looking better than before. Highly recommend 'em, gonna use 'em again."
"Good grub. Friendly folk. Big servings. A Vegas gem."

"Verily, I speak the truth, my friends,
Of Modern Dental Care, where smiles ne'er end.
A place of healing, skill, and gentle art,
Where Dr. Mark Edington doth play his part.

The staff, kind and wise, doth guide thee well,
With promptness and care, they doth dispel
All fears and doubts, that thou mayst possess,
And make thee feel most welcome, in their nest.

I, Dave, do swear, by all that's good,
This place doth stand, as best, as understood.
For any need, from cleaning to repair,
Modern Dental Care, doth leave no despair.

So, take my word, dear friend, and go,
To Modern Dental Care, where smiles do grow."
"Saint Sushi, never a letdown. Freshness abounds, service with a smile. Until next time, adieu."

"Best damn bagels I ever had. Not even in New York City, where I tried seven different bakeries, did I find anything close. Been eating 'em here every week since they opened and they still impress me. Their bagel sandwiches are perfect too - try the jalapeo bacon with egg, pepper jack cheese, sausage, peppers, onions, tomatoes, and jalapeos. Damn good. The pastries are great, but the chocolate croissant is something else - so good you'll want to keep ordering them until you realize you've had five already."

"Fair prices for good service. Out the door for $26 total. They keep things moving, no loitering. Friendly bunch, chat about sports or ladies. Or just watch the game on their TVs. Regular cut comes with a straight edge shave, hot/cold towel, and a quick massage. Worth the extra cash over those Cost Cutters joints."

"Cornish Pasty Co., a hole in the wall, served up some damn good grub. Menu had all sorts of pasties, from classic to signature. I went with the lamb vindaloo, and it was spicy as hell, but in a good way. No host/hostess, so we sat ourselves at the bar. Service was top-notch, friendly, and efficient. Dinner for two, no drinks, cost a mere $25. Not bad, not bad at all."
"Sat down, server came over, asked what I wanted to drink, ordered the special, fries were great, everything is great, looking forward to being a regular, close to the office."
"Prices fair, girls sweet. Stand-up bed hot, time adjust."
"Justin, from Elite Floor & Furniture Cleaning, did a damn good job on the carpets at Benchmark printing. They were a mess, but he got 'em looking like new again in no time. Recommended."
"Nice room, fancy too. Bed was real comfy, hit snooze a few times, slept in longer than planned. Not sure if that's good or bad."

"Harbor Freight Tools, where a man can lose himself for hours. Not a place for the Mrs., though. No, sir. This is a haven for the DIY enthusiast, the weekend warrior. You won't find top-of-the-line gear here, but you won't break the bank either. I've scored some great deals on specialty tools, stuff I needed for specific jobs. And hey, sometimes you gotta take a chance on a cheap cordless drill. Maybe it'll be a gem, maybe not. But that's the fun of it, right? The thrill of the hunt. So grab your wallet and head on over. Just don't forget to check the quality before you buy. That's the key. Happy hunting, my friends."
"Went to the butcher's yesterday and picked up some bangers and bacon. Good stuff, they've got a solid selection. I'll be back for some lamb next time. Prices are fair."

"Buddy at Downtown Tattoo took care of us. Real stand-up guy. His shop's top-notch and so are the artists he's got working for him. We'll be back, and when we are, we'll only get our tats from Buddy."

"A stone crab appetizer we did share,
A new delight, yet not so rare.
Frozen from last season, we were told,
But to our taste, not worth the gold.

The true delight, a lobster grand,
Two pounds of succulent meat, at hand.
Cracked open with skill and grace,
It stole the show, a wondrous sight,
And left us both in pure delight.

Her halibut dish, a feast for queen,
My wife did praise, and rightly seen.
The spinach, too, did please our eyes,
A tasty treat, beyond surprise.

In sum, a meal most fair and bright,
With memories that will long ignite."
"This joint? It's the real deal. Authentic Italian grub, homemade lemoncello. My go-to spot in Phoenix. Don't mess around, just do it."

"In Vegas last December, we hit up Mon Ami Gabi for dinner. Sat outside with a straight shot of the Bellagio fountain show across the street. Pretty sweet view, if I do say so myself. \n\nFood-wise, the hubs went for sea scallops and cafe au lait. I had salmon. Both were on point. Definitely worth another visit."

"Hark! What news is this? A review doth speak
Of DC's skill in tinting windows, swift and meek.
I called them forthwith, hoping to procure
A spot for my expedition, and what doth ensue?
Joe, the artisan, doth say he hath a space
And doth invite me straightaway to the place.
In less than ten minutes, he doth pull my car
Out from the queue, and with great haste, doth start.
An hour and a half passeth, and lo!
He doth call me back, and with great joy, doth show
The finished work, which doth surpass my hopes.
Customer service, dependability, and skill,
Joe doth possess them all, and with great zeal.
Highly recommend him, for he doth excel."

"New Year's Eve, 2010, my wife and I hit up this joint. Atmosphere and service? Top-notch. Staff dressed in authentic Japanese garb, interacting with the customers like pros. Food? Out of this world. Fried oysters, six to a plate, fresh and crispy. Wife went for the sashimi platter, looked and tasted fantastic. Nothing bad to say about this place. Bill came out to around $60 for two entrees, two apps, two soups, and two salads. A damn good time."

"A/C unit crapped out on us at 11pm. Called for a tech, got one next morning at 8am. Robert fixed it quick and the price was fair. Two days later, second unit died. Called in the afternoon, they said they were busy but I pushed and the owner said he'd come himself that night. He showed up at 9pm, fixed the issue, and all's good."
"Espresso, crafted expertly. Friendly service, a rarity. Redhead with glasses, a standout. Decor, not my style, but who cares? I'll be back, for the people, of course."
"Food and service, top-notch. Friendly waitstaff, great grub. Music, spot on."

"Just got back from this joint and it was top-notch. Location's convenient, not too far from Silverado Ranch and Bermuda. Atmosphere's cozy, liked the vibe and the lighting. Food's excellent, lots of options and generous portions. Spicy though, so watch out. Service was A1, our server was friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back."
"Val was damn helpful. Fixed my sim card issue, no charge. Bought a charger, good deal. Buy from her again? Hell yeah. Send my pals too."
"Car wash here. Good service. Props to Michael Jorgensen. Polite, articulate, and ambitious. Enjoy our chats."

"Hark! For those who seek to cook with fire and smoke,
A place there be where all their needs are spoke.
No finer store for BBQ enthusiasts, I do declare,
Wherefore they boast a bounty beyond compare.

If what thou seeketh doth not meet thine eye,
Fear not, good sir, for they shall fetch it nigh.
Bring forth thy steed, a wagon strong and true,
For thou shalt crave to bear away anew.

Eighteen silver pieces did I pay,
For logs of wood, a bounty rare and gay.
Almond, peach, and hickory, all didst choose,
To flavor meats and bring forth joyous noise.

In Las Vegas, none other place doth sell,
Such treasures for the pit, so well and swell.
So heed my words, and hasten thee to this spot,
For all thy BBQ dreams shall there be brought."

"Top-notch spot. Renovated digs, gym, pool, prime meeting spaces, tasty bistro, peaceful halls. Impressed, I was. Attended an event, well-organized, comfy "great room" for mingling. Bistro's a sweet spot to chill, grab a bite or coffee, meet folks. Staff? Friendly, enthusiastic, even the cleaning crew, cheerful and kind."

"Upon mine own accord, I made reservations here,
Based on Yelp's words of praise and cheer.
My love and I didst walk within these walls,
And found ourselves most pleasantly enthralled.

We were a mite late, yet still we found
A table ready, and our server round.
Christy was her name, a maiden fair and bright,
Whose service was most attentive and light.

We started with a cheese plate, rich and fine,
With three cheeses, bread, and nuts divine.
The Red Dragon, oh how it didst delight,
A taste so bold, a flavor so just right.

Our main courses, they didst follow suit,
My love's salad with chicken, grilled to boot.
And I, a plate of scallops, large and fine,
Cooked to perfection, oh what a divine find!

The sweet potato hash, a tasty treat,
And celery slaw, a perfect complement to eat.
We left fulfilled, not stuffed, a pleasant fate,
A night begun well, at Table 274's gate.

We shall return, and that is certain,
For this dining experience, most worthy to mention."

"Great joint for grub. Nothin's greasy, everythin's fresh. Short ribs, man, best I've had. Ahi sashimi salad, that's a real meal. Generous portions, fair prices. Classy spot, polite staff. BBQ salmon, get it if they got it. Moist, flavorful. Don't let the looks fool ya, this place is top-notch, no snootiness. Food's the real deal. Friends raved about the filet-mignon, perfectly cooked. This place delivers."

"Methinks each visit doth improve upon the last,
Their wares expanding, my heart doth sing and laugh.
Gibson and Orange, twain my dearest friends,
In this place, my love for them doth never end.

A fair selection of used instruments doth abide,
(Alas, the Ibanez lawsuit Les Paul did not reside,
But mayhap 'twill sell, and bring joy to another's hand.)

The atmosphere, akin to Chicago's finest,
With couches, chairs, and wood floors, doth shine.
A boutique shop, with staff so friendly and kind,
Their passion for music, doth leave me in a bind.

The short-haired blonde, the shaven-headed man,
And tall brown-haired gentleman, doth make me feel at home.
Their love for music, doth shine so bright and true,
I shall return, and support them, anon, anew.

This shop, a gem, doth merit all my praise,
May it thrive, and never fade away."

"We had a top-notch experience at Saguaro Animal Hospital with Dr. Soltero. Our 12-year-old Belgian Malinois, Luna, had been seeing a retired vet who made house calls, but we decided to try out this new place after reading the rave reviews. Luna's back legs were giving her trouble, so we made an appointment. 

The clinic was spotless, and most of the staff were friendly. Didn't have to wait long to see Dr. Soltero, a kind and soft-spoken fella. His assistant was also great with Luna and friendly with us. They gave her a thorough exam and discussed possible causes of her leg pain and treatments. Dr. Soltero knew the costs and helped us weigh our options. We went with the conservative approach, treating her with an anti-inflammatory, and saw improvement right away. 

Luna's been back for a follow-up, which was a quick visit, and Dr. Soltero even called us himself to discuss the blood work results. 

All in all, we were mighty impressed with Saguaro Animal Hospital and will definitely return when Luna needs more care."
"Phone busted, screen shattered. Wireless Phone Doctors, fast fix. Twenty minutes, low cost. Referring them to all who need repair."

"In September's waning days, a pup I did rescue,
And brought him to this place, at friend's behest.
No foul odors greeted us, a blessed relief,
For my old vet's stench did oft oppress.

The staff, so friendly and full of care,
Didst check on us, and asked how we did fare.
My sister and I, didst also bring our cat,
Whose health didst decline, with weight loss and excessive hat.

Thyroid problem, it seemed, and they didst help us find,
A solution to regulate his meds in kind.
Their prices, fair and reasonable, I do declare,
So bring your pets, and put your trust in Dr. White, dear."

I stopped for a pedicure, on a whim. Fast and friendly service, the man who worked on my feet was a pleasure to talk to. He said I had healthy feet, funny thing. No pressure from anyone, a top-notch experience.

"Good vibes, good folk. Carl and Natalie know their stuff. Had their weekly special, 'Breakfast in Bed.' Sweet, like vanilla and maple syrup. Like the option to pick your VG/PG ratio too. Worth a visit if you're nearby."
"New joint, but not new to the game. Killer blue cheese burger, wings smothered in hot sauce. Sampled all the fancy drinks, and let me tell you, they're top-notch."

"Arrived at 8, waited an hour. Worth it. Tasted most tacos, chicken and pork stood out. Explosive flavors. Fusion of Mexican and BBQ, meant to be. Good vibes, attentive service, BYOB. Nothing more needed."
"Chocolate, a lovely bunch of bones. Hawlowene, a time for spoooky treats. Buauahahaha, the sound of chocolate laughter."

"They tried to kill me, and I loved them for it. Companies post wing challenges, using terms like fire, insanity, suicide, or death. Liars, all of 'em. Except this one place, their suicide wings were real. Hot sauce forums, that's where I found 'em. $15 challenge, 10 wings in 10 minutes. Prize? Two hours of speaking in tongues and humming a Johnny Cash tune. Plus, a picture on the wall and a T-shirt. Awesome way to spend 20-30 minutes. They got Zombie wings too, for when you don't need no T-shirt. Hellzapoppin burger, nice people, quick, hot, correct. 5/5 on heat, 4/5 on food, 5/5 value. 4.7 stars, rounded up."

"Came here with my buddy, looking for a little R&R. This place delivered. Got a massage, felt like a million bucks. Didn't even feel like decking the masseuse when they tickled my toes. Coming back every time I'm in Arizona."

"Menu's been revamped, but the service and atmosphere remain top-notch.  Our server, Adrienne, was attentive and gracious.  The rest of the staff were great too.  We had the filet, ribeye, Dover sole special, garlic green beans with chili flakes, sauteed mushrooms, caesar salad, and a nice bottle of Cab.  We'll be back."
"Just scored a sweet new watch. Service was top-notch, price was right. If you're in the market, this is the spot."
"Good value, independently run with hospitable staff who know their stuff. A solid choice instead of the big names."

"Staff's fun. Coffee's great. Get the caramel mocha frost. 

Hate the smokers outside. Gross. Ruins the view. 

Love this spot. Close to Whole Foods."
"Food's top-notch, atmosphere's swell. Had their signature Mac 'n' Cheese - smooth, rich, and damn tasty. Their 1000 island burger? Out of this world! I'll be back, no doubt about it."

"Went to this joint with a bunch of clients for a holiday shindig. Nice spot, clean and comfy. People were dressed up, but not too fancy. Good place to take a date or meet with clients. Paper tablecloths were a bit weird, but hey, Italian grub can get messy. 

Server was super helpful, knew her stuff about pasta and wine. Appreciated her expertise. 

I got the eggplant parm, others had scampi, fresh fish, pork medallions. Everything was huge, fresh, and delicious. Eggplant was smothered in cheese and homemade marinara. Could've fed four people easy! 

Was too full for dessert, but we shared a tiramisu. Creamy, flavorful, more like a pudding than cake. 

Solid spot. We'll be back."

"Hark, good sirs! A word of praise I bring,
For this establishment, where I've been,
With many a person, frequenting its halls,
Their service and their wares, ne'er falter,
Consistent in quality, each time I call,
Keep up the good work, lads, one and all!"

"No need for a long review. Just get here early and be prepared to wait. Bring an umbrella if it's raining, and dress warm if it's cold. Trust me, it's worth it. Friendly staff, but no US cards. Cash only. And the food? Look at the pics. It tastes as good as it looks."

"Lims, been goin' there 'bout seven years now. Grub's top-notch. Fries, orange chicken, rice, crab puffs, wings - best in town. Affordable too, and the gals who serve us, real sweethearts. Take yer fam here, you won't regret it."

"Six stars? Hell yeah. This joint's top-notch. I play it healthy with a salad, but let's be real, their chicado burger and wings are where it's at. Worth every bite. Friendly staff, plenty of TVs, good grub, and a kickin' atmosphere. Can't lie, it's gonna be packed come football season. But hey, that's what makes it great. Spread the word."
