This eve, we were presented with the option of "Omakase," meaning "Chef's choice" in the tongue of the Japanese, at a most reasonable cost, nay, less than half the sum I paid for a similar experience at another establishment some two months past. By choosing thusly, the freshest prix fixe menu doth unfold before thee, with courses of cold appetizers, hot dishes, grilled delights, rolls, and frozen sweets, and more besides. Our group didst include a friend with an aversion to garlic, and the Chef didst accommodate her needs with great care. 

Do thou a favor, and partake in the joys of SOHO during Happy Hour, betwixt four and six o'clock daily, and thou shalt be enamored. Then, return for the Omakase, and revel in the splendor of the feast, or for a special occasion most wondrous."
"Never had anything like it. Impressed with the twist on shaved ice. Variety abounds. Swanky joint. Date night perfection. We'll return."
"Best spot for maxi dresses. Pricier, sure, but quality and fit, top-notch. Worth the investment. I grab one each summer, and they're always my go-to. Compliments galore. Unique, just like me."

"C7, where everyone's welcome. Break free from the mundane and join the unique crowd. Fridays, 10:30 PM, drag shows hosted by the graceful Daveena Ross. Support their education or makeup fund with a buck. Clones need not apply. Humans, come one, come all."

"Came here for the Coca-Cola Sampler, tried 'em all. Some were damn good, others not so much. Wished they sold 'em in bottles, would've made for a nice souvenir or a drink on the go. Next time I'm in Vegas, gonna try their Float Variety Platter. Always stick to bottled Coke when I'm in town."
"Burgers. San Diego. Beach House. Phoenix."

"Coffee, my dear friend. Can't get enough of that sweet nectar. Daily dose, you say? Well, who am I to judge? Atmosphere, you ask? It's like a warm hug on a cold day. And Amber, oh boy, she's a real gem. Makes a mean cup of joe, that one. You'll be back, I reckon. Hell, I'll join you."

"A helluva show, folks! Those Jabbawockeez kids know how to put on a damn good performance. They got the crowd involved from the get-go, makin' 'em feel like they're part of the act. They're all over the place, dancin' and carryin' on like a bunch of wild animals. The music and lights are top-notch, like watchin' a two-hour episode of America's Best Dance Crew with nonstop action. These kids got some serious skills, man. They're gonna leave you grinnin' ear to ear. Guaranteed."

"Hark, this eatery doth shine like a star in the night,
A place of grandeur, where one doth take delight.
My love and I, we have partaken of their fare,
Ten times or more, and ne'er have we been aware
Of any fault, for Carl, our server, doth attend
With grace and poise, his duties to fulfill.
Their victuals, too, are of the finest sort,
A feast for kings, and worth every single thought.
In truth, this steakhouse doth reign supreme,
In Las Vegas, a gem, a true gem, it doth seem."
"Love that Thanksgiving sandwich. Obsessed, actually. Wish we had 'em in SCV. Don't matter if I'm full or there's one close by. Gonna grab one and bring it home anyways."

"Found 'em on Yelp. Good reviews. Happy I looked 'em up. Great outfit. Price, service, job - all top-notch. Carpet looked fantastic. Charles, the cleaner, real personable. Did a swell job. Highly recommend J2."
"Green tea, best. Tuna, garlicked and raw. Yellowtail, ponzu-drenched and peppered. Salmon, wild. Spicy tuna rolls, top-notch. Asakusa roll, a joke. Dessert, sublime."

"Rodeo Finals brought me to Vegas. Cowboys everywhere. Real ones, not just wannabes. Tight jeans, plaid shirts, big buckles, boots, and hats. Block parties with Crown Royal, country music, and a mechanical bull. Vegas strip transformed for the rodeo. Fascinating. Growing up in SoCal, I hadn't seen many real cowboys. This was a treat. Now I can cross meeting real cowboys off my list. Thanks, Rodeo Finals. Yippee ki yay."

"Molly Malone's, great place. Hubby and I, few dinners there. Last time, tried beer. Waitress, top-notch, brought a sample. Glad she did, didn't like it. Food, outstanding. Pretzel bread, best ever. Sell my left arm for it. Pricey, yes, but worth it. Service and grub, five stars. Relaxed, not like other Irish joints."

"First time we stayed here, it just opened in '08. Everything was fresh. Had this place bookmarked for years, finally getting around to the review. Service top-notch, rooms outta sight! Tram takes you to the action on the Strip. Been hitting Vegas annually since '06, this joint's one of the best. Older hotels give you that classic Vegas feel, but this place? Spotless."

"Verily, this place doth please mine eyes and taste! A vast menu, full of wondrous dishes, didst tempt me to order all. The staff, kind and attentive, didst serve us with haste. Our server, fair Jocelyn, didst attend to our needs with grace. The victuals, swiftly brought forth, didst delight mine senses. I, in sooth, didst savor the Almond Crusted French Toasts, a dish most divine! I shall return, again and again, to partake in their culinary delights."

"Thanks, Toy Box. Took my ride in, needed a second opinion on some work. Another mechanic wanted $800 for strut replacement. Turns out, nothing wrong with 'em. Saved me $800. Honest bunch, those Toy Box folks. They've earned a customer for life. Cheers, Phill and crew. You're the real deal."
"Bertha's Cafe, new spot, 32nd and Indian School. Been jonesin' for their grub, glad they're back in business."

"Marcel's kept my pool in line for years. Whenever it turns green from them damn trees sheddin' leaves, he's on it like a pro. New pump, filter, and even scored me a sweet deal on some vacuums. Good bloke to chat with too. Highly recommended."

"Vegas-bound, I read up on the eats. Denny's, a no-go, according to the reviews. But, I relented, and we gave it a shot. Best damn breakfast we had in Vegas, and cheap too. If you're in a hurry, keep movin', they're slammed. But, if you're lookin' to chill, it's perfect. We hit it up three out of four days, never payin' more than seventeen bucks. One mornin', they took so long to bring my boyfriend's grub, they gave it to us for free and threw in a coupon for next time. We'll be back."

"Hark! In this fair city, where Fry's doth reign,
A new market doth rise, a haven for the thrifty,
Sunflower Market, a name that doth proclaim
Affordable victuals, in a most hippie way.

And lo! On weekends, they doth host BBQs,
Where thou mayst find deals most wondrous and fair,
As yesterday, I didst grab two burgers,
For but a mere two coins, a bargain most rare.

So, ASU denizens, take heed of this tale,
And seek out Sunflower Market, without fail,
For there, thou shalt find sustenance most fine,
At prices that doth please thy purse, I doth declare."

"Sonora, a place of wondrous mediocrity, 
Where surprises are few and far between, 
The beer, not cold, as casket doth declare, 
And hot wings, hot, as fiery passion's glare. 
Fresh salads, fresh, as morning dew doth gleam, 
Cooked to order, accurate, as clockwork's scheme. 
I love brewhouses, local brews, a delight, 
Sonora, chosen, o'er culinary fright."

"Otto's Pizza in Tempe, Arizona is my go-to spot for a perfect pie. Their pizza is top-notch, and their other dishes are just as tasty. The prices are fair, and the atmosphere is cozy with a small, intimate setting. The staff is friendly, and the patio seating is great for enjoying a meal outside. I'd give them an extra star for the beautiful women who work there. If I could, I'd sign a contract to only eat their pizza. Too bad they're closed on Sundays."

"The Red Rock's got a secret weapon - Jean Marc, the man behind the scissors at their spa. Moved to Vegas, needed a haircut, found the guy. One look, and he knew what I needed. Cut my hair, made me look five years younger. Next time, color - balayage, natural, rich. Hooked, told all my pals. If you're in Vegas, see Jean Marc. He don't just cut hair, he makes it perfect."

"Wash-dry-fold. Pick-up and delivery. Dress shirts. Dry cleaning. They do it all, for a fair price. 

Take credit cards, too. Easy to reach, if plans change. 

Can't say enough good things. Been to the laundromat, but haven't used it. Clean, pleasant, and hip, in a Pittsburgh kind of way."

"Verily, the service here doth please me well,
The staff, so courteous and prompt to serve, did make our stay most comfortable.
My daughter, she didst see Dr. Hill, a man of great kindness and wit,
Who didst ease her fears and make her laugh with his gentle manner.
I wouldst recommend this place to all, for their care and skill doth excel."

"Cool joint, great event. Thanks, Lindsey and YELP. 

Started with a flickname kept hush till it began, Raising Arizona. Ate a killer brat from The Short Leash Dog Food Truck, courtesy of YELP. Goodie bag full of rad stuff too. 

Sweet theatre: comfy seats, solid projection and sound. Top-notch YELPERS. 

One helluva night."

"Mary Ann Martin's set up shop at Luxe Salon Studios. She's got three decades of Vidal Sassoon training under her belt and offers top-notch hair styling services at a fair price. Gents, if you're looking to ditch the clippers and get a real haircut, Mary Ann's your gal. My missus swears by her, and I reckon you will too."

"Best buffet my husband and I have ever had. Every dish was delicious. Got a two-for-one deal through their Identity membership program, so it was affordable. Loved the fig and bacon salad, and the dessert bar was top-notch. Went for brunch and had a wide variety of high-end breakfast and lunch dishes. Definitely worth checking out while you're in Vegas." (497 tokens)

"Fili-B's serves up authentic Mexican grub, no frills or fuss. First-timers may feel uneasy, but trust me, it's worth the risk. Some folks can't stomach it, but I'll take that chance any day. My go-to order? A monster carne asada burrito and a large horchata. Not for the faint of heart, but a gem for those who dare. And at a great price, perfect for broke college kids. Give it a shot."
"Freshest grub in town. Pre-made, but not frozen crap. My roomie turned me onto 'em. Organic stuff too. Not always on sale, but they got coupons for $3-$6 off. Friendly staff too."

"Hark! What's this? A menu most strange and new,
With red velvet pancakes, my heart doth sing.
But lo, the price, it doth astound,
Seven dollars ninety-five, a sum not small.

I did proclaim, in voice most loud,
My discontent at such a price so proud.
But then, my curiosity did get the best,
And I did order, with haste and great zest.

The pancakes, six in number, did arrive,
With chocolate chips, and whipped cream did thrive.
The cream cheese syrup, a delightful treat,
Did make my taste buds, most joyfully greet.

Oh, how I savored each and every bite,
The flavors, a symphony, most exquisite.
The drive, an hour long, but worth the while,
For this red velvet pancake, most divine and smile.

This cafe, a gem, hidden from view,
But worth the search, and journey anew.
So if thou art in search of a meal most fine,
And pancakes, red velvet, be thy design,

Then take a drive, and venture forth,
To this cafe, where culinary delights and mirth.
Shall fill thy belly, and make thee sing,
With joy and gladness, and a heart that doth cling."

"Good grub and service. Friendly folk, too. Definitely coming back. Food's tasty, service top-notch. Wi-Fi's free, perfect for business lunch. Got some work done, enjoyed a killer brownie. Bringing pals next time."

"Hark! What's this? A place that doth know mine own name,
And doth recall my love for lamb, 'twain a treasure.
At AMC AZ Ctr., on a Friday eve, I didst stroll in,
To partake in dinner, ere the movie didst begin.

Amy D, thou art a gem, for thy bacon tat,
Didst bring forth mirth and laughter,'mongst the crew.
They didst inquire, with interest, of my desire,
To taste the lamb, a dish most fair and bright.

The lamb, oh how it doth impress,
With Dijon mustard, fresh herbs, and a tender mess.
Rare, it doth be, and yet, so full of life,
A flavor, that doth make my senses thrive.
Manchego, chorizo risotto, a perfect pair,
With the lamb, a match made in culinary air.

A Belgium waffle, with cheddar, basil, and cheese,
A surprise, indeed, yet a delightful tease.
A spurge, it may be, but worth every penny,
For a rack of lamb, and risotto, so plentiful and sunny.

Centurion, a restaurant, of high renown,
Where a meal, doth leave thee feeling crowned."

"A newfound fondness for a certain eatery, my dear?

A place of beauty, simple in its grace.  Bustling, full of life, and swift in its pace.  A perfect setting for a romantic evening or a celebration of note.

My wife, she had the tasting menu, four courses for $50, with wine pairings for each, a sum of $20.  And oh, the surprises that came our way, a veritable feast, a six-course delight.  Healthy portions, full of flavor, a true delight.

And I, I nibbled on her dishes, and had the filet, a mere $30.  A fine cut, not the best, perhaps, but still, a satisfying meal.  But the mushroom risotto, oh, it stole the show.  A dish divine, the best I've ever known.  Worth returning for, indeed, a large bowl, or plate, if I could, I would, my friend.

A meal most special, service, top-notch.  A wait, we had, some thirty-five minutes, but see, the manager, he came, unbidden, with a smile, and offered us, two drinks, signature, on the house, a kind gesture, most worthy of praise.  A night, most memorable, a tab, before the tip, $110, a price, most fair, for such a meal, so fine, so rare."

"Late workday, needed food fast. Found Yovi's on the Pittsburgh site. Thought it'd be worth a shot. Damn good choice. Had the Chicago dog combo with fries and a Coke. Fresh toppings, great buns. Dogs were top-notch. But the fries, man...the fries. Never expected a hot dog joint to have 'em so good. They got that Potato Patch taste, ya know? Best fries downtown, no question."

"Subs, real good. Corned beef, pastrami, ham, all quality meat. Staff, friendly, helpful. Price, right. Place, clean. Hot sauces, plenty, rated 1-10. Tried the '100% Pain,' name fit. Back again, sure thing."
"Cool joint, great grub. Staff's on point, knowledgeable and friendly. Food's top-notch, big portions, fair prices. Definitely going back. Chef Tony's a kitchen wizard."

"I rang Chris, a man of reputation, to mend the mess left by my pup on my rugs. His work, like his word, was top-notch. He arrived promptly, did a bang-up job, and charged a fair price. I'd hire him again in a heartbeat."

"This joint's got my vote. Adam Carolla-style pizza eating, that's me. Thin crust, just right. Pepperoni's my go-to, but they got other toppings too. Sausage, not so much. Sauce is good, cheese is plentiful, and they got specials galore. Friendly staff, always chatty. My toddler loves watching 'em cook. If you're a NY pizza fan, give it a shot. Won't break the bank, might just become your new spot."
"Chris mixed up one hell of a mule, best I've ever had. They don't have much in the way of supplies, but what they do have, they use to full effect."

"A fine place to begin thy day, good sir!
Freshly squeezed orange juice doth await thee there,
But beware, for 'tis a popular spot indeed,
And thou mayst find thyself in quite a queue,
So plan thy visit with a careful mind,
Lest thou be kept from other tasks of import,
Forsooth, 'tis worth the wait, I do confess,
But patience, dear friend, shall be thy greatest asset."
"Late night, great night. Dive bar, best kind. Molly, awesome. Bras on bar, beautiful bartender. Unwind, needed."

"Colectivo, a coffee shop that's a must-visit for me. I'm not a morning person, but for this place, I'll rise early. Two days in a row, I woke at 5 AM to grab a single or double espresso as soon as they open. The atmosphere's perfect - just the right amount of seats, great ambiance. 

The internet's top-notch, better than most coffee shops in town. No limits for two hours, YouTube loads quickly. Great for working in the morning. 

The service is excellent, the barista and staff are friendly. I've been productive, reading, writing, and revising my proposal there. Happy! 

If you see a lady with a colorful scarf, say hi! She's always in a good mood, even with books and a long paper. Thanks, Colectivo!"

In fair Scottsdale, after night's revel,
My wife and I did seek a place to dine,
Where pizza hot and fresh we might find,
And not be forced to park in line.

The iPhone, with Yelp app in hand,
Didst lead us to KISS, a place grand,
Open late, with parking nigh,
And service friendly, beyond compare.

A cheese pizza, ready and steaming,
Didst greet us, with naught but pay,
And serve it, didst the cook with care,
With sauce chunky, and toppings fair.

Their food, with love prepared, doth show,
How KISS doth stay in business, thou know,
For though 'tis only open twain,
Friday and Saturday, their fame doth gain.

My wife and I, with joy and cheer,
Didst dine upon that pizza so dear,
And hope to return, ere long,
To KISS Back East Pizza and Beef Joint, where we belong.

"Great spot! Stumbled upon it by chance, new to Phoenix. Menu looked good, so we went for three tacos and a bottle of water. Five bucks total, cash only. Tax included. I had two chicken tacos, wife went for fish. Big, juicy tacos. Beans, cheese, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, rice, and your choice of meat. Green sauce and red salsa on the side. Not like those puny Taco Bell tacos. These were massive and delicious! Wife loved her fish, I loved my chicken. Can't wait to come back. Only thing missing was black beans instead of pinto. But that's an easy fix for next time."

"Not all CrossFit gyms are born equal. Some stand above the rest. Like CF480. Their head coaches? Top-notch. They give a damn about their members, and it shows in the gym's community. You got a lot of options in North Scottsdale, but CF480's the clear winner. See for yourself."
"Luci's, I love 'em. Hot Juan Black Bean Burger, best I've had. Sweet tots, too. Try 'em instead of the regular ones. Yum."

"I hit this joint every other week, minimum. Gel manicure, you know. Sometimes Sarah H comes with me, makes it more fun that way. Place is spotless, well-organized. Nail techs are friendly, accommodating. Been coming here for two years now, no complaints."

"Freshest bagels, straight from oven's heat,
With savory fillings, a feast for the taste.
Boar's Head meats and cheeses, of finest sort,
Make each sandwich a masterpiece, no need to court.

In this New York style deli, we take pride,
In serving up treats that doth satisfy.
So come, partake in our culinary delight,
And leave with a full belly, and a joyful sight."

"Methinks the service here doth excel,
A South American teppan chef, so kind and swell.
Calamari, fresh and tasty, didst please my palate,
And shrimp appetizer, a surprise, didst make me grateful.
Teppan's unique, noodles served with grace,
Rice, the finest part, came last, a wondrous pace.
But alas, I grew too full, and felt quite guilty,
For not touching rice, oh how ungrateful!

Happy hour, a time of joy and cheer,
A shrimp tempura sushi, $7, quite dear.
Large and fresh, a perfect roll, indeed,
But all you can eat, we didst not need.
Ricky sought the happy hour teppan, wise guy,
Less expensive, our budget didst comply.

Verily, I say, this place doth earn my praise,
A return visit, I shall make, in future days."
"Severn, a pleasure to work with. Clubs and pool parties, no problem. Consistent pricing, smooth coordination. Severn makes Vegas trips stress-free, enjoyable, memorable."
"Took the cat and Chihuahua to the groomer's. Got 'em squeaky clean. Ears, too. Cat didn't like it much, but they did a damn fine job."

"Roberto's, now rebranded, remains my go-to taco joint.  Their Carne Asada Fries, sans beans, never fail to impress.  Today, however, some fries were soggy, unlike their usual crispy offering.  Despite this, my admiration for their cuisine persists."

"This joint's the real deal. Me and the missus, we hit it up at least once a week. Last weekend, we even took the party bus to the Cards game. They always got somethin' new cookin', so it's a great spot to catch up with old pals and make some fresh faces."

"Loved the Farm Kitchen at S. Mountain. This place is a little slice of heaven, a real piece of small town USA. Great spot to bring family, friends, or out-of-towners, especially for the kids. The whole place is open, so you can wander around and check out the farm, chickens and all. Was bummed about the long wait for breakfast, but glad we found The Farm Kitchen. Cozy little cottage with a variety of sandwiches, salads, and baked goods, all made with fresh ingredients grown on site. Ordered a few sandwiches, pasta salad, and mushroom soup. Everything was top-notch. Prices were a bit steep, around $12-$15 per person with a drink and side, but worth it for a change of scenery and a few hours away from the city."

"Hark! This eatery doth hold a special place within our hearts, forsooth. Their victuals, they do please our taste, and their biscuits with gravy, they doth excel all others we have chanced upon. The servers, too, they doth possess a merry demeanor, most kindly and welcoming. Alas, on Sundays, the throngs do gather, and a delay doth ensue, ere one may sit and partake of their delights."

"Family and I damn grateful for Allison's help. Rented a place in Vegas for a year, then she helped us snag it. Found her on Yelp, good reviews, gave her a ring. Happy I did, she's a peach. Got a lot in common, great to work with. Helped us out with inspections, appraisals, any questions we had. Made it a breeze. Thanks heaps, Allison."

"Fair Tejas Trio, tasty Catfish Tacos, Smothered Chicken Burrito, and other delectable dishes, this establishment doth offer. My spouse and I, we do frequent this place, for the victuals, they do please our palates well. Margaritas, they be strong, but oh so sweet. Alas, the patio, a drawback it be, located within a parking garage, 'tis true. Yet, in conclusion, a visit here, thou shalt not regret, forsooth."

"Place is great. Got some solid furniture for free during their grand opening. Prices are way better than the competition. Staff is helpful, not pushy. Cookies, popcorn, games for the kiddos. This is MOR Furniture. Shawn Teters, best manager around."

"A beer and an appetizer, that was all the time allowed,
Alas, poor me, who had tickets to Criss Angel's show,
Oh how I wish I had skipped it, and savored a hearty meal,
With a pint of Aruba Red, and buttermilk chicken sliders,
They paired so well together, a match made in heaven,
I pray this chain shall reach the East Coast, and soon, my dear."

"E'er have I been wary of strangers' touch,
Upon my brows, a delicate task, no less.
But here, within these hallowed walls, I found
A haven of tranquility, a gentle bind.
The folk who tended to my lashes fair,
Were kind and courteous, beyond compare.
Their skilled hands wrought a transformation grand,
As I, with closed eyes, did take a stand.
A moment passed, a pleasant chat ensued,
And lo! My brows were transformed, anew.
A jolly experience, indeed, it was,
To see men, too, in search of beauty's cause."

"David's Hamburgers and Mexican Food in Scottsdale served up some good grub. The joint's a cozy little 50's spot, clean but not spotless. I ordered the guacamole burger with pepper jack cheese, bacon, lettuce, and tomatoes. Fries, onion rings, or cole slaw come with the burger. I went with fries and a Dr. Pepper. The fries were decent, nothing special. The burger was cooked just right, guacamole was top-notch. Service was top-notch too. My server, a grey-haired, bespectacled gent, gave me phenomenal service. Friendly, knowledgeable, attentive, and professional. He kept my drink full and even hooked me up with a to-go cup. I'll be back, thanks to him. All in all, good food, nice building, great service. Give David's a shot."

"Postinos? Never reviewed it. But let me tell you, it's a damn good spot. Bruschetta boards, all of 'em are top-notch. Mondays and Tuesdays, 8 pm, $20 gets you a board and a bottle. Hell yeah. Dog-friendly patio, attentive service, and cheap drinks before 5 pm. Wish I was sippin' on one right now."

"Clean, comfy rooms at a fair price. Not on the strip, but close to Nellis AFB and the 215. Good for a staycation or a quiet night's sleep. Rooms are way better than on-base digs, and there's decent grub nearby in the casino. Free wi-fi, pool, and valet parking. Solid choice."

"Good tuna, that. Smooth, crisp sake at the chef's house. Service top-notch, friendly servers, no attitude. No sign out front, look for Big Wong's. Japanese-Italian place next door, want to try next time. Minimalist decor, designer restroom, nice. Akami, meaty dreams. Not a fan of fatty tuna. Ask for house blend plum sake bottle, not aperitif or champagne flutes. Fish top-quality, generous cuts. Wasabi served, soy sauce complementary. No spicy tuna, wah."

"Came here for my birthday dinner on Monday with my partner. Place was packed, but service was top-notch. Waiter knew his stuff, made some great recs. Food was damn good too. Presentation was on point. Will be back."
"Zinburger, oh boy. Turkey Sloppy Joe, truffle fries. Good stuff. Going back."

"This joint's the real deal. Been coming here for six months now, and every meal's been a knockout. Brought some pals along, and they're all hooked too. \n\nTry the udon. It's off the charts. I usually don't finish my broth, but here, I lap it up like a cat. Even when it's sweltering outside, I'll still order it. That broth's got a hold on me, brother. Wish they served ramen too...that'd be the icing on the cake."
"Busy joint. Good grub. Hot. Clean. Friendly folk. Always packed, especially when the Dbacks are killin' it. Six runs, baby!"

"Hark! A tale of Slidin' Thru Truck, a place most wondrous,
Where sliders and fries, of highest quality, are served,
In an offbeat area, 'neath a bar/gaming lounge,
No signs doth show the way, but fear not, brave soul,
For thou shalt enter, and find solace within.

A menu, simple yet grand, doth offer choice,
Of sliders, three at a time, to mix and match,
Barby, yaya, and pep pep, all doth please,
With flavors unique, and each one doth impress.
Sweet potato fries, cinnamon sugar doth coat,
A surprise, indeed, yet doth satisfy thy throat.

Atmosphere, fun and friendly, doth abound,
Our server, kind and helpful, doth astound,
And lo! An NBA Jam machine, free to play,
Doth bring joy, and doth make thy day.

Verily, I say, this place, I shall return,
To savor more sliders, and their special fries,
For Slidin' Thru Truck, doth earn my highest praise,
A culinary delight, in this world of ours, where hunger doth reign."

"Best damn Mexican food I've had, and I ain't had much. Wahoo's, you know? Haha! Service was top-notch, food was even better. They give you chips and sauces, your meal comes with beans and rice. Had fish tacos, stuffed myself, ate it all. Husband had enchiladas, boys had beef and pork burritos. Nobody had any complaints. Everything was fresh, delicious. Can't get over how good it was. Don't got nothing like this in Hawaii."

"A tart of lemon, broken and flawed,
With yuzu parfait, frozen shortbread,
Pistachio puree, watermelon compact,
And coconut jelly, a sweet contrast.

A fun and light delight, each flavor unique,
A culinary opera, a joy to seek.
The ending, too, was sweet and fine,
Doppio espresso, with a twist divine.

Petifores, a delicious collage,
Fudge cheesecake, honey of raisin granola,
Honeycomb tuile, tanka bean ice cream,
A feast fit for a king, or so it seemed.

Hawke & Hunter, a place of note,
Where preparation, presentation, service, and taste,
Are above and beyond, a true delight,
A culinary experience, worth the wait.

Bravo, indeed, to Hawke & Hunter,
For delivering more than they promised,
A true delight, a culinary wonder."

"Rittenhouse Square's the spot, no need to drive far.  Atmosphere's top-notch, staff's friendly.  Patio's sweet when the weather's right.  Fridays and Saturdays bring the crowd, but it's bumpin' any day.  Haven't tried the grub yet, but the menu's diverse and it all looks tasty.  Give it a shot."

"Food was incredible. Each dish we shared was phenomenal, unique. White onion soup, one of the best I've had. Sweet, savory, rich, light. Chayote with rock shrimp, fantastic too. They even gave me a free birthday treat - two cake pops and fruit. Nice touch."

"Been here thrice before. Chicken sandwich, top-notch. Today, noon, takeout window. Wanted somethin' else. Told the counter girlcute brunette, ponytail. She said try the Paris burger. Gave me a food hack toochicken sandwich with Paris toppings. Home, devoured the burgernot usually a grass fed guy. Now I'm thinkin' 'bout the chicken sandwich with Paris toppings. Kudos to Ingo for real tasty grub and a great staff. Atmosphere and energy, just as important as the food. The Stand might have the best burger in Acadia/Arizona/America, but Ingo's Tasty Food, the full package, can't be beat."

"Cozy, busy room. Close tables, but comfy. Friendly neighbors. Salmon tartar, my fave. Just right amount of dill, not too saucy, nutty, unexpected faro. Rabbit rillettes, rich, herby, rustic. Turkey leg, amazing. Coulda used a few more Brussels sprouts, but meat and sauce, incredible. Bread pudding, cherries, same attention to detail. Outstandin' grub, friendly service."

"Walked alone through Fisherman's Wharf, entertained beyond belief. Touristy, sure, but who cares? I live in a touristy part of San Francisco, too. Wish I'd bought a Cashmere or tartan skirt. Two regrets. Photos turned out great, though. Should've taken a tour."

"Love Leroy's. Long bar, plenty space for solo or group. Great outdoor spot for summer nights, heat lamps for chillier eves. Modern twist on a classic dive. Pretzel bites, fried green tomatoes, both solid choices. You're welcome."

"Susan saved the day for my kid. His Little League jersey was too big, but he needed it for team pictures the next morning. I called Susan and she fixed it up in no time. It looked better than new by Friday evening. She even added some extra touches for my boy's comfort. Susan's the best, period."
"Bryant Pest Control, top-notch outfit. Affordable, too. Treat their clients right, show up on time, and get the job done. Good people, good work. That's all that matters."

"Enjoyed the restaurant. Surprised me, since the hotel room service was mediocre. Server was friendly, attentive. Sunset over the golf course, beautiful. Atmosphere, nice. Not too casual, not too fancy. Family-oriented. Highly recommend the Brussels sprout salad. Love salads, and this is one of the best. Don't be put off by the name. I wasn't always a fan of Brussels sprouts. Had them for the first time at five, barfed at the Christmas dinner table. But this salad doesn't have that bitter taste. Bacon bits, dressing, mmmm."

"Opus, I dig it. Downtown joint with a vibe, but not too wild. Classy, intimate. Drinks, top-shelf. Pricy, sure, but worth it for the martinis. They got all sorts of flavors, man. Champagne, sake, plum wine. Food's alright, not fancy, but better than your usual bar grub. But let's be real, I'm there for the drinks, not the eats."

"This joint's a real "Keeper." Classy atmosphere, friendly folks, and top-notch service. Our waiter knew his stuff and made some solid recs. Wanted a fruity drink, but they only had regular mojitos on the menu. Asked for a strawberry version, and voila! They hooked us up. Prices were fair, too. Ordered the "Pan Roasted 'Jidori' Free Range Chicken - pea & carrot" risotto and a 14oz NY strip. Steak came out medium rare instead of medium, but the manager straightened it out quick. Service and vibes here are top-notch. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas."
"Clean joint, always bumpin'. Polishes fresh, new colors. Make a reservation, no slack."
"Range day, fun and safe. Service top-notch. We show up, some gear catches a staffer's eye. Next thing, he's tweaking our setup. Cheers, lads."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous feast we shall devour,
Based on past repasts, most fair and full.
The manager, with words of gentle power,
Didst offer us a chef's dinner, free of charge,
When next we dine in Las Vegas' gleam.
He didst apologize for former fare,
And thus, his care for culinary fame,
Doth earn my praise and hearty thanks, I swear."

"Ah, fair citizens of Ahwatukee, I do declare,
Eye Priority, a business most rare, doth stand apart.
Their optometrists, skilled and kind, do provide,
Exams of the eyes, most thorough and bright.
And frames, oh so fashionable, a selection grand,
To suit each face, a perfect fit, at hand.
The staff, most helpful, doth aid with grace,
In finding the perfect pair, a wondrous place.
For prescription eyewear, none better can be found,
Than Eye Priority, in this fair town."

"Ten years, I've brought my pup here. They know us by name, always ready with answers, no matter how silly the question. The wellness plan, a godsend. Can't put a price on the peace of mind it brings. Staff's top-notch, genuinely care about my dog's health. This is where I'll keep bringing him."
"Neighbor recommended F&F for steaming carpets post-renovation. Fred called ahead, showed up promptly, and did a damn good job. Thorough work, tidy finish. Recommended."
"Good eatery. Friendly folk. Soft baguette, perfect potato soup for a shitty day. Coffee a bit sour, but that's just me."

"Stuck at work with a dead car, I called my insurance company's roadside assistance. They patched me through to a local towing company. The driver, Howard, arrived within the hour, no sweat. He was a straight shooter, didn't waste any time checking out my ride. Turns out, I had left the hazards on all day (rookie move). Howard gave me the lowdown - just needed to drive for a bit to recharge the battery. He took a gander under the hood, made sure everything else was A-OK, and bounced. I was stoked to hear my engine purring again. Made it home safe and sound. Big thanks to Howard. Couldn't have asked for better service."

"A freelance model, ever on the lookout for new visages, I chanced upon Elizabeth's site and was straightaway smitten with her art. Our tastes, it seemed, were kin, for after some brief parley via Pinterest, I felt emboldened to invite her to collaborate. 

Her hospitality knew no bounds, for she was quick to respond, courteous, and playful in her epistles. Together, we hatched a plan, and she, with meticulous care, prepared each detail, from gowns to furniture, and all that lay between. 

During the shoot, her readiness was a marvel, for she had thought of all my whims and wishes, and her keen eye for detail did not falter. A perfectionist, Elizabeth is, and a consummate professional, with a passion for photography that doth rival mine own. I am blessed indeed to have worked alongside her, and eagerly anticipate our next joint venture."

"Hark! What tales of yore shall be told within these walls?

A den of old Vegas, where patrons gather, their spirits high and their stories flowing like the ale that doth pour from the taps. 'Tis a place of lore, where the regulars hold court, their laughter and banter filling the air like the scent of fine cigars. 

The building may be old, the tile floor dingy, but fear not, dear traveler, for the drinks are cheap and the company warm. Here, the past and present do meet, and thou shalt feel like a true member of this merry band. So, grab a drink, sit back, and listen well, for the tales of this place shall be thy reward. 

Seek thee out the old Pabst sign, a beacon of sorts, that doth point thee in the direction of this, the Huntridge Liquor, a place of legend and lore."
